children.name: Abnormality of the integument
Abnormality of the skin
Generalized abnormality of skin
Poor wound healing
children.defn: "A reduced ability to heal cutaneous wounds." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cutaneous photosensitivity
Severe photosensitivity
children.defn: "A severe degree of photosensitivity of the skin." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Early cutaneous photosensitivity
children.defn: "Photosensitivity of the skin occurring early in life." [HPO:probinson]

"An increased sensitivity of the skin to light. Photosensitivity may result in a rash upon exposure to the sun (which is known as photodermatosis). Photosensitivity can be diagnosed by phototests in which light is shone on small areas of skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Dilated superficial abdominal veins
children.defn: "Increase in diameter of the veins located underneath the skin of the abdomen." [pmid:5897968]

children.name: Prominent veins on trunk
children.defn: "Prominent thoracic and abdominal veins." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lateral venous anomaly
children.defn: "Persistence of the embryonic dorsal or sciatic vein system that normally should have involuted around the tenth to twelfth week of intrauterine life." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Non-pruritic urticaria
children.defn: "Pale reddish slightly elevated papules and plaques of 0.5-3 cm in diameter and not accompanied by pruritus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Angioedema
children.defn: "Rapid swelling (edema) of the dermis, subcutaneous tissue, mucosa and submucosal tissues of the skin of the face, normally around the mouth, and the mucosa of the mouth and/or throat, as well as the tongue during a period of minutes to several hours. The swelling can also occur elsewhere, typically in the hands. Angioedema is similar to urticaria, but the swelling is subcutaneous rather than on the epidermis." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Erythema
Facial erythema
children.defn: "Redness of the skin of the face, caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin." [HPO:probinson]
"Redness of the skin, caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Urticaria
Dermatographic urticaria
children.defn: "An exaggerated wealing tendency when the skin is stroked, that is, formation of red, itchy bumps and lines on the skin as a result of pressure on the skin (for instance, stroking the skin with a pen or tongue depressor)." [HPO:probinson]
"Raised, well-circumscribed areas of erythema and edema involving the dermis and epidermis. Urticaria is intensely pruritic, and blanches completely with pressure." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Telangiectasia
Retinal telangiectasia
is_a_string: HP:0008046 ! Abnormality of the retinal vasculature
children.defn: "Dilatation of small blood vessels of the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Diffuse telangiectasia
children.defn: "Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) with a diffuse localization." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Mucosal telangiectasiae
Oral cavity teleangiectasia
Telangiectasia of the oral mucosa
children.defn: "Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the oral mucosa." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tongue telangiectasia
children.defn: "Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the tongue." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Palate telangiectasia
children.defn: "The presence of small (ca. 0.5-1.0 mm) dilated blood vessels near the surface of the mucous membranes of the palate." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Lip telangiectasia
children.defn: "Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the lips." [HPO:probinson]
"Presence of teleangiectases in the oral cavity." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Conjunctival telangiectasia
is_a_string: HP:0008054 ! Abnormality of the vasculature of the conjunctiva
children.defn: "The presence of small (ca. 0.5-1.0 mm) dilated blood vessels near the surface of the mucous membranes of the conjunctiva." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Gastrointestinal telangiectasia
children.defn: "Telangiectasia affecting thegastrointestinal tract." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nasal mucosa telangiectasia
is_a_string: HP:0000433 ! Abnormality of the nasal mucosa
children.defn: "Telangiectasia of the nasal mucosa." [HPO:probinson]
"Telangiectasia of the mucosa, the mucous membranes which are involved in absorption and secretion that line cavities that are exposed to the external environment and internal organs." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Teleangiectasia of the skin
Fingerpad telangiectases
children.defn: "Telangiectasia (small dilated blood vessels) located in the fingerpads at the tips of the fingers." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Telangiectases in sun-exposed and nonexposed skin
Facial telangiectasia
Telangiectases of the cheeks
children.defn: "Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin of the cheeks." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Facial telangiectasia in butterfly midface distribution
children.defn: "Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin in a butterfly midface distribution." [HPO:curators]
"Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin of the face." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Spider hemangioma
children.defn: "A form of telangiectasis characterized by a central elevated red dot the size of a pinhead, representing an arteriole, with numerous small blood vessels that radiate out thereby resembling the legs of a spider. Characteristically, compression of the central arteriole causes the entire lesion to blanch, and the lesion quickly refills once the compression is released." [HPO:probinson, pmid:22356347]

children.name: Telangiectasia of the ear
is_a_string: HP:0000356 ! Abnormality of the outer ear
children.defn: "The presence of telangiectasia of the ear." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Plantar telangiectasia
is_a_string: HP:0100872 ! Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
children.defn: "Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located on the skin of sole of foot." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Palmar telangiectasia
children.defn: "The presence of telangiectases on the skin of palm of hand." [HPO:probinson]
"Presence of small, permanently dilated blood vessels near the surface of the skin, visible as small focal red lesions." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nail bed telangiectasia
children.defn: "Telangiectases in the area of the nails." [HPO:probinson]

"Telangiectasias refer to small dilated blood vessels located near the surface of the skin or mucous membranes, measuring between 0.5 and 1 millimeter in diameter. Telangiectasia are located especially on the tongue, lips, palate, fingers, face, conjunctiva, trunk, nail beds, and fingertips." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Subcutaneous hemorrhage
Spontaneous hematomas
children.defn: "Spontaneous development of hematomas (hematoma) or bruises without significant trauma." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Bruising susceptibility
children.defn: "An ecchymosis (bruise) refers to the skin discoloration caused by the escape of blood into the tissues from ruptured blood vessels. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising. The corresponding phenotypic abnormality is generally elicited on medical history as a report of frequent ecchymoses or bruising without adequate trauma." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Purpura
children.defn: "Purpura (from Latin: purpura, meaning \"purple\") is the appearance of red or purple discolorations on the skin that do not blanch on applying pressure. They are caused by bleeding underneath the skin. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing purpura. Purpura are larger than petechiae." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Petechiae
children.defn: "Petechiae are pinpoint-sized reddish/purple spots, resembling a rash, that appear just under the skin or a mucous membrane when capillaries have ruptured and some superficial bleeding into the skin has happened. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing petechiae." [HPO:probinson]
"This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising (purpura, petechiae, or ecchymoses)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cutis marmorata
children.defn: "A reticular discoloration of the skin with cyanotic (reddish-blue appearing) areas surrounding pale central areas due to dilation of capillary blood vessels and stagnation of blood within the vessels. Cutis marmorata, also called livedo reticularis, generally occurs on the legs, arms and trunk and is often more severe in cold weather." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Angiokeratoma
children.defn: "A vascular lesion defined histologically as one or more dilated blood vessels lying directly subepidermal and showing an epidermal proliferative reaction. Clinically, angiokeratoma presents as a small, raised, dark-red spot." [HPO:probinson, pmid:8993949]

children.name: Desquamation of skin soon after birth
Increased subcutaneous truncal adipose tissue
is_a_string: HP:0001001 ! Abnormality of subcutaneous fat tissue
children.defn: "The presence of an abnormally increased amount of subcutaneous adipose tissue in the trunk of the body." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Decreased subcutaneous fat
is_a_string: HP:0001001 ! Abnormality of subcutaneous fat tissue

children.name: Yellow subcutaneous tissue covered by thin, scaly skin
is_a_string: HP:0001001 ! Abnormality of subcutaneous fat tissue

children.name: Reduced subcutaneous adipose tissue
is_a_string: HP:0001001 ! Abnormality of subcutaneous fat tissue

children.name: Absence of subcutaneous fat over entire body except buttocks, hips, and thighs
Decreased adipose tissue around neck
children.defn: "Reduced amount of adipose tissue in the region of the neck." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of an abnormally reduced amount of subcutaneous adipose tissue." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Subcutaneous lipoma
is_a_string: HP:0001001 ! Abnormality of subcutaneous fat tissue

children.name: Painful subcutaneous lipomas
children.defn: "The presence of multiple subcutaneous lipoma that cause pain." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of subcutaneous lipoma." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal subcutaneous fat tissue distribution
is_a_string: HP:0001001 ! Abnormality of subcutaneous fat tissue

children.name: Plethora
is_a_string: HP:0001005 ! Dermatological manifestations of systemic disorders

children.name: Jaundice
is_a_string: HP:0001005 ! Dermatological manifestations of systemic disorders

children.name: Prolonged neonatal jaundice
children.defn: "Neonatal jaundice refers to a yellowing of the skin and other tissues of a newborn infant as a result of increased concentrations of bilirubin in the blood. Neonatal jaundice affects over half of all newborns to some extent in the first week of life. Prolonged neonatal jaundice is said to be present if the jaundice persists for longer than 14 days in term infants and 21 days in preterm infants." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Intermittent jaundice
children.defn: "Jaundice that is sometimes present, sometimes not." [HPO:curators]
"Yellow pigmentation of the skin or sclera due to bilirubin, which in turn is the result of increased bilirubin concentration in the bloodstream." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Discoid lupus erythematosus
is_a_string: HP:0001005 ! Dermatological manifestations of systemic disorders

children.name: Cyanosis
is_a_string: HP:0001005 ! Dermatological manifestations of systemic disorders
children.defn: "A bluish or purplish discoloration of the skin and mucous membranes due to an increase in the amount of deoxygenated hemoglobin in the blood or a structural defect in the hemoglobin molecule." [MeSH:D003490]

children.name: Facial flushing after alcohol intake
is_a_string: HP:0001005 ! Dermatological manifestations of systemic disorders

children.name: Warfarin-induced skin necrosis
is_a_string: HP:0001005 ! Dermatological manifestations of systemic disorders

children.name: Diaphoresis (with pheochromocytoma)
is_a_string: HP:0001005 ! Dermatological manifestations of systemic disorders

children.name: Abnormality of skin morphology
Abnormal elasticity of skin
Soft skin
children.defn: "Subjective impression of increased softness upon palpitation of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Striae distensae
children.defn: "Thinned, erythematous, depressed bands of atrophic skin. Initially, striae appear as flattened and thinned, pinkish linear regions of the skin. Striae tend to enlarge in length and become reddish or purplish. Later, striae tend to appear as white, depressed bands that are parallel to the lines of skin tension. Striae distensae occur most often in areas that have been subject to distension such as the lower back, buttocks, thighs, breast, abdomen, and shoulders." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Excessive wrinkled skin
is_a_string: HP:0008067 ! Abnormally lax or hyperextensible skin

children.name: Excessive skin wrinkling on dorsum of hands and fingers
Palmoplantar cutis laxa
is_a_string: HP:0007605 ! Excessive wrinkling of palmar skin
HP:0100872 ! Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
children.defn: "Loose, wrinkled skin of hands and feet." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hyperextensible skin
is_a_string: HP:0008067 ! Abnormally lax or hyperextensible skin
children.defn: "A condition in which the skin can be stretched beyond normal, and then returns to its initial position." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Cutis laxa
is_a_string: HP:0008067 ! Abnormally lax or hyperextensible skin

children.name: Redundant skin
Redundant skin on fingers
children.defn: "Loose and sagging skin of the fingers." [HPO:probinson]
"Loose and sagging skin often associated with loss of skin elasticity." [HPO:probinson]
"Wrinkled, redundant, inelastic and sagging skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Increased number of skin folds
is_a_string: HP:0008067 ! Abnormally lax or hyperextensible skin

children.defn: "Any abnormal increase or reduction in skin elasticity." [DDD:cmoss]

children.name: Premature skin wrinkling
Periorbital wrinkles
is_a_string: HP:0000606 ! Abnormality of the periorbital region

children.name: Neonatal wrinkled skin of hands and feet
Facial wrinkling
children.defn: "Excessive wrinkling of the skin of the face." [HPO:curators]
"The presence of an increased degree of wrinkling (irregular folds and indentations) of the skin as compared with age-related norms." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Dry skin
children.defn: "Skin characterized by the lack of natural or normal moisture." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of epidermal morphology
Acantholysis
children.defn: "The loss of intercellular connections, such as desmosomes, resulting in loss of cohesion between keratinocytes." [HPO:sdoelken]
"An abnormality of the morphology of the epidermis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lichenification
Flexural lichenification
children.defn: "Lichenification affecting primarily flexural areas of the skin." [HPO:probinson]
"Thickening and hardening of the epidermis seen with exaggeration of normal skin lines." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Poikiloderma
children.defn: "Poikiloderma refers to a patch of skin with (1) reticulated hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation, (2) wrinkling secondary to epidermal atrophy, and (3) telangiectasias." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of skin pigmentation
Melanocytic nevus
Congenital giant melanocytic nevus
children.defn: "The giant congenital nevus is greater than 8 cm in size, pigmented and often hairy. A giant congenital nevus is smaller in infants and children, but it usually continues to grow with the child." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21139903]

"A oval and round, colored (usually medium-to dark brown, reddish brown, or flesh colored) lesion. Typically, a melanocytic nevus is less than 6 mm in diameter, but may be much smaller or larger." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Periorbital hyperpigmentation
is_a_string: HP:0000606 ! Abnormality of the periorbital region
children.defn: "Increased pigmentation of the skin in the region surrounding the orbit of the eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of dermal melanosomes
Giant melanosomes in melanocytes
children.defn: "The presence of large spherical melanosomes (1 to 6 micrometer in diameter) in the cytoplasm of melanocytes." [HPO:probinson]

"An abnormality of the melanosomes, i.e., of the cellular organelles in which melanin pigments are synthesized and stored within melanocytes (the cells that produce pigment in the dermis)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Perioral hyperpigmentation
children.defn: "Increased pigmentation, either focal or generalized, of the skin surrounding the vermilion of the lips." [pmid:19125428]

children.name: Hyperpigmentation of the skin
Reticular hyperpigmentation
children.defn: "Increased pigmentation of the skin with a netlike (reticular) pattern." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Increased groin pigmentation with raindrop depigmentation
is_a_string: HP:0009123 ! Mixed hypo- and hyperpigmentation of the skin

children.name: Hypermelanotic macule
Mongolian blue spot
children.defn: "Congenital deep dermal melanosis in the sacral area." [DDD:cmoss]

children.name: Large cafe-au-lait macules with irregular margins
children.defn: "Large hypermelanotic macules with jagged borders." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nevus of Ota
children.defn: "A macular lesion on the side of the face, involving the conjunctiva and eyelids, as well as the adjacent facial skin, sclera, oculomotor muscles, and perisoteum. Histological features vary from those of a Mongoloian spot to those of a blue nevus." [MeSH:D009507]

children.name: Multiple lentigines
children.defn: "Presence of an unusually high number of lentigines (singular: lentigo), which are flat, tan to brown oval spots." [HPO:probinson]
"A hyperpigmented circumscribed area of change in normal skin color without elevation or depression of any size." [DDD:cmoss]

children.name: Mixed hypo- and hyperpigmentation of the skin
Areas of hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation that do not follow Blaschko lines
is_a_string: HP:0009123 ! Mixed hypo- and hyperpigmentation of the skin

children.name: Hyperpigmented/hypopigmented macules
is_a_string: HP:0009123 ! Mixed hypo- and hyperpigmentation of the skin

children.name: Discrete 2 to 5-mm hyper- and hypopigmented macules
Patchy hypo- and hyperpigmentation
is_a_string: HP:0009123 ! Mixed hypo- and hyperpigmentation of the skin

children.name: Axillary and groin hyperpigmentation and hypopigmentation
is_a_string: HP:0009123 ! Mixed hypo- and hyperpigmentation of the skin

children.defn: "A darkening of the skin related to an increase in melanin production and deposition." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypopigmentation of the skin
Macular hypopigmented whorls, streaks, and patches
Albinism
children.defn: "An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation (reduced or absent) of skin, hair and eye (iris and retina)." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Partial albinism
children.defn: "Absence of melanin pigment in various areas, which is found at birth and is permanent. The lesions are known as leucoderma and are often found on the face, trunk, or limbs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypomelanotic macules
children.defn: "Hypomelanotic macules (\"ash leaf spots\") are white or lighter patches of skin that may appear anywhere on the body and are caused by a lack of melanin. White ash leaf-shaped macules are considered to be characteristic of tuberous sclerosis." [HPO:probinson, pmid:10695583]

children.name: Piebaldism
children.defn: "Piebaldism is characterized by stable and persistent, well-circumscribed depigmented patches present at birth affecting the skin of the face, trunk, and extremities in a symmetrical distribution." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absent skin pigmentation
Absent pigmentation of the abdomen
children.defn: "Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the abdomen." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absent pigmentation of the limbs
children.defn: "Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the arms and legs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absent pigmentation of chest
Absent pigmentation of the ventral chest
children.defn: "Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the anterior chest." [HPO:probinson]
"Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the chest." [HPO:skoehler]
"Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Confetti hypopigmentation pattern of lower leg skin

children.defn: "A reduction of skin color related to a decrease in melanin production and deposition." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Freckling
Axillary freckling
children.defn: "The presence in the axillary region (armpit) of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin." [pmid:12186179]

children.name: Inguinal freckling
children.defn: "The presence in the inguinal region (groin) of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin." []
"The presence of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin." []

children.name: Mottled pigmentation
Mottled pigmentation of the trunk and proximal extremities

children.defn: "Patchy and irregular skin pigmentation." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the pigmentation of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Stiff skin
children.defn: "An induration (hardening) of the skin" []

children.name: Dermal translucency
children.defn: "An abnormally increased ability of the skin to permit light to pass through (translucency) such that subcutaneous structures such as veins display an increased degree of visibility." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pallor
Anemic pallor
children.defn: "A type of pallor that is secondary to the presence of anemia." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormally pale skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal blistering of the skin
Junctional split
is_a_string: HP:0008066 ! Abnormal blistering of the skin
children.defn: "The formation of bullae (blisters) with cleavage in the lamina lucida layer of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Oral mucusa blisters
is_a_string: HP:0008066 ! Abnormal blistering of the skin

children.defn: "The presence of one or more bullae on the skin, defined as fluid-filled blisters more than 5 mm in diameter with thin walls." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thickened skin
Epidermal thickening
Acanthosis nigricans
children.defn: "A dermatosis characterized by thickened, hyperpigmented plaques, typically on the intertriginous surfaces and neck." [DDD:cmoss, pmid:19061584]

children.name: Acrokeratosis
children.defn: "Overgrowth of the stratum corneum characterized by nodular configurations of the backs of the toes and fingers." [HPO:skoehler]

children.name: Hyperkeratosis
Subungual hyperkeratosis
is_a_string: HP:0009723 ! Abnormality of the subungual region
children.defn: "A thickening of the stratum corneum in the region beneath the nails." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Circumungual hyperkeratosis
is_a_string: HP:0100803 ! Abnormality of the periungual region
children.defn: "A thickening of the stratum corneum, the outer layer of the skin, in the region surrounding the nails." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Gingival hyperkeratosis
children.defn: "Hyperkeratosis of the gingiva." [HPO:ibailleulforestier]

children.name: Palmar hyperkeratosis
Palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
is_a_string: HP:0100872 ! Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot

children.name: Palmoplantar keratosis with erythema and scale
Spinous keratoses of palms and soles
Focal friction-related palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
children.defn: "Hyperkeratosis affecting the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot in areas exposed to friction." [HPO:probinson]
"Hyperkeratosis affecting the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot." [HPO:probinson]
"Hyperkeratosis affecting the palm of the hand." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Streaks of hyperkeratosis along each finger onto the palm
Follicular hyperkeratosis
children.defn: "A skin condition characterized by excessive development of keratin in hair follicles, resulting in rough, cone-shaped, elevated papules resulting from closure of hair follicles with a white plug of sebum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Palmoplantar keratoderma
Patchy palmoplantar keratoderma
children.defn: "A focal type of palmoplantar keratoderma in whichonly certain areas of the palms and soles are affected." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormal thickening of the skin of the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Linear arrays of macular hyperkeratoses in flexural areas
Subungual hyperkeratotic fragments
is_a_string: HP:0009723 ! Abnormality of the subungual region

children.name: Hyperkeratosis lenticularis perstans
children.defn: "Hyperkeratosis lenticularis perstans (HLP), also known as Flegel disease, is a keratinization abnormality characterized by small, asymptomatic erythematous papules that leave characteristic punctate bleeding when they become detached. The lesions generally occur symmetrically along the top of the foot and on the legs, appearing more rarely on the arms, forearms, palms, and soles, and even on the oral mucosa." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Plantar hyperkeratosis
children.defn: "Hyperkeratosis affecting the sole of the foot." [HPO:probinson]

"Hyperkeratosis is thickening of the outer layer of the skin, the stratum corneum, which is composed of large, polyhedral, plate-like envelopes filled with keratin which are the dead cells that have migrated up from the stratum granulosum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Porokeratosis
children.defn: "A clonal disorder of keratinization with one or multiple atrophic patches surrounded by a clinically and histologically distinctive hyperkeratotic ridgelike border called the cornoid lamella." [HPO:skoehler]

children.name: Parakeratosis
children.defn: "Abnormal formation of the keratinocytes of the epidermis characterized by persistence of nuclei, incomplete formation of keratin, and moistness and swelling of the keratinocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ichthyosis
Postnatal-onset ichthyosiform erythroderma
children.defn: "A type of ichthyosiform erythroderma with postnatal onset." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital ichthyosiform erythroderma
Congenital nonbullous ichthyosiform erythroderma
children.defn: "The term collodion baby applies to newborns who appear to have an extra layer of skin (known as a collodion membrane) that has a collodion-like quality. It is a descriptive term, not a specific diagnosis or disorder (as such, it is a syndrome). Affected babies are born in a collodion membrane, a shiny waxy outer layer to the skin. This is shed 10-14 days after birth, revealing the main symptom of the disease, extensive scaling of the skin caused by hyperkeratosis. With increasing age, the scaling tends to be concentrated around joints in areas such as the groin, the armpits, the inside of the elbow and the neck. The scales often tile the skin and may resemble fish scales." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Congenital bullous ichthyosiform erythroderma
children.defn: "An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin that presents at birth or shortly thereafter with generalized, erythema, blistering, erosions, and peeling. In the subsequent months, erythema and blistering improves but patients go on to develop hyperkeratotic scaling that is especially prominent along the joint flexures, neck, hands and feet." [HPO:probinson]
"An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin with congenital onset." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the skin characterized the presence of excessive amounts of dry surface scales on the skin resulting from an abnormality of keratinization." [HPO:probinson]
"Thickening of the epidermal layer of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Sclerodactyly
children.defn: "Localized thickening and tightness of the skin of the fingers or toes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Morphea
children.defn: "Isolated patches of hardened skin (scleroderma)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Scleroderma
children.defn: "A chronic autoimmune phenomenon characterized by fibrosis (or hardening) and vascular alterations of the skin." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Laminar thickening of skin." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Any morphological abnormality of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Atypical scarring of skin
Atrophodermia vermiculata
is_a_string: HP:0011799 ! Abnormality of facial soft tissue
children.defn: "Symmetrical vermiform facial atrophy that affects mainly the forehead, the chin, the ear lobes and helices. Atrophodermia vermiculata is characterized by erythema and follicular plugs on the cheeks, developing into painless reticular impressions." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Keloids
children.defn: "Presence of one or more keloids. A keloid is a sharply elevated, irregularly shaped, progressively enlarging scar resulting from formation of excessive amounts of collagen in the dermis during connective tissue repair." [MeSH:D007627]
"Atypically scarred skin ." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Progeroid facial appearance
children.defn: "A degree of wrinkling of the facial skin that is more than expected for the age of the individual, leading to a prematurely aged appearance." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Premature graying of hair
children.defn: "Development of gray hair at a younger than normal age." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ectodermal dysplasia
children.defn: "Ectodermal dysplasia is a group of conditions in which there is abnormal development of the skin, hair, nails, teeth, or sweat glands." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of skin physiology
Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
Erysipelas
is_a_string: HP:0011123 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
children.defn: "Increased susceptibility to erysipelas, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of erysipelas, which is a superficial infection of the skin, typically involving the lymphatic system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Psoriasis
is_a_string: HP:0011123 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
children.defn: "A skin abnormality characterized by  redness and irritation, with thick, red skin that displays flaky, silver-white patches (scales)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Erythema nodosum
is_a_string: HP:0011123 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
children.defn: "An erythematous eruption commonly associated with drug reactions or infection and characterized by inflammatory nodules that are usually tender, multiple, and bilateral." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Perifolliculitis
is_a_string: HP:0011123 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
children.defn: "Inflammation surrounding hair follicles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Acne
is_a_string: HP:0011123 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
children.defn: "A skin condition in which there is an increase in sebum secretion by the pilosebaceous apparatus associated with  open comedones (blackheads), closed comedones (whiteheads), and pustular nodules (papules, pustules, and cysts)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Atopic dermatitis
is_a_string: HP:0011123 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
children.defn: "A chronic inflammatory genetically determined disease of the skin manifested by lichenification, excoriation, and crusting, mainly on the flexural surfaces of the elbow and knee." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Recurrent skin infections
is_a_string: HP:0011123 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the skin

children.name: Recurrent bacterial skin infections
Chronic furunculosis
children.defn: "A furuncle (boil) is a skin infection involving an entire hair follicle and nearby skin tissue. Chronic furunculosis refers to recurrent episodes of furuncles, often caused by recurrent staphylococcus infection." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pyoderma
children.defn: "Any manifestation of a skin disease associated with the production of pus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Recurrent cutaneous abscess formation
Pilonidal abscess
children.defn: "A hair-containing cyst or sinus usually in the coccygeal region." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Perianal abscess
children.defn: "The presence of an abscess located around the anus." [HPO:curators]
"An increased susceptibility to cutaneous abscess formation, as manifested by a medical history of recurrent cutaneous abscesses." [HPO:probinson]
"Increased susceptibility to bacterial infections of the skin, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infectious dermatitis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis
Chronic intestinal candidiasis
children.defn: "Persistent overgrowth of Candida albicans in the gastrointestinal tract." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Recurrent vulvovaginal candidiasis
children.defn: "Recurrent infection involving the vulva, vagina, and adjacent crural areas, whereby the causative agent belongs to the genus Candida." [HPO:probinson]
"Recurrent or persistent superficial Candida infections of the skin, mucous membranes, and nails." [HPO:probinson, pmid:20859203]
"Infections of the skin that happen multiple times." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Pustule
is_a_string: HP:0011123 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
children.defn: "A small elevation of the skin containing cloudy or purulent material usually consisting of necrotic inflammatory cells." [HPO:skoehler]

children.name: Skin rash
is_a_string: HP:0011123 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the skin

children.name: Morbilliform rash
children.defn: "An exanthema consisting of widespread pink-to-red macules (flat spots of 2-10 mm in diameter) or papules (red bumps) that blanch with pressure. The macules and papules may cluster and merge to form sheets over several days." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Crusting erythematous dermatitis
is_a_string: HP:0011123 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the skin

children.name: Eczema
is_a_string: HP:0011123 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the skin

children.name: Seborrheic dermatitis
children.defn: "Seborrheic dermatitis is a form of eczema which is closely related to dandruff. It causes dry or greasy peeling of the scalp, eyebrows, and face, and sometimes trunk." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Perioral eczema
children.defn: "A type of eczema that occurs in the lips and perioral area." [HPO:probinson]

"Eczema is a form of dermatitis. The term eczema is broadly applied to a range of persistent skin conditions and can be related to a number of underlying conditions. Manifestations of eczema can include dryness and recurring skin rashes with redness, skin edema, itching and dryness, crusting, flaking, blistering, cracking, oozing, or bleeding." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Erythroderma
is_a_string: HP:0011123 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
children.defn: "An inflammatory exfoliative dermatosis involving nearly all of the surface of the skin. Erythroderma develops suddenly. A patchy erythema may generalize and spread to affect most of the skin. Scaling may appear in 2-6 days and be accompanied by hot, red, dry skin, malaise, and fever." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of inflammation of the skin. That is, an abnormality of the skin resulting from the local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pruritus
children.defn: "Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased disposition to experience pruritus." [HPO:probinson]
"Any abnormality of the physiological function of the skin." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the skin that is not localized to any one particular region." [DDD:cmoss]

children.name: Localized skin lesion
Milia
children.defn: "Presence of multiple small cysts containing keratin (skin protein) and presenting as tiny pearly-white bumps just under the surface of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nevus
Nevus flammeus
Nevus flammeus of the forehead
children.defn: "Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the forehead." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Nevus flammeus nuchae
children.defn: "Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the neck. This is one of the most common birthmarks and present in approximately 25% of all newborns." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Naevus flammeus of the eyelid
children.defn: "Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the eyelid." [HPO:sdoelken]
"A congenital vascular malformation consisting of superficial and deep dilated capillaries in the skin which produce a reddish to purplish discolouration of the skin." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Atypical nevi (>5mm with irregular edge and pigmentation)
Connective tissue nevi
Shagreen patch
children.defn: "A plaque representing a connective-tissue nevus. Connective tissue naevi are uncommon skin lesions that occur when the deeper layers of the skin do not develop correctly or the components of these layers occur in the wrong proportion. Shagreen patches are oval-shaped and nevoid, skin-colored or occasionally pigmented, smooth or crinkled, The word shagreen refers to a type of roughened untanned leather." [HPO:curators, pmid:10695583]
"Connective tissue nevi are hamartomas in which one or several components of the dermis is altered." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Epidermal nevus
Nevus sebaceous
Linear nevus sebaceous
children.defn: "A type of nevus sebaceous with a linear form, raised borders and yellowish color." [HPO:probinson]

"A congenital, hairless plaque consisting of overgrown epidermis, sebaceous glands, hair follicles, apocrine glands and connective tissue. They are a variant of epidermal naevi. Sebaceous naevi most often appear on the scalp, but they may also arise on the face, neck or forehead. At birth, a sevaceous nevus typically appears as a solitary, smooth, yellow-orange hairless patch. Sebaceous naevi become more pronounced around adolescence, often appearing bumpy, warty or scaly." [HPO:probinson]
"Epidermal naevi are due to an overgrowth of the epidermis and may be present at birth (50%) or develop during childhood." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Atypical nevi in non-sun exposed areas

children.defn: "A nevus is a type of hamartoma that is a circumscribed stable malformation of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Skin dimples
Shoulder dimples
children.defn: "A subtype of skin dimples occurring in the shoulder region." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Skin dimple over apex of long bone angulation
Sacral dimple
children.defn: "A subtype of skin dimples presenting as an indentation in the skin of the intergluteal cleft ." [HPO:probinson]
"Skin dimples are cutaneous indentations that are the result of tethering of the skin to underlying structures (bone) causing an indentation." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Molluscoid pseudotumors
children.defn: "Bluish-grey, spongy nodules associated with scars over pressure points and easily traumatized areas like the elbows and knees." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Xanthomatosis
Tendon xanthomatosis
children.defn: "The presence of xanthomas (intra-and extra-cellular accumulations of cholesterol) extensor tendons (typically over knuckles, Achilles tendon, knee, and elbows)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Xanthelasma
children.defn: "The presence of xanthomata in the skin of the eyelid." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Eruptive xanthomas
children.defn: "Eruptive xanthomas are yellow-orange-to-red-brown papules that are often surrounded by an erythematous halo. They appear in crops on the buttocks, extensor surfaces of the extremities, and flexural creases. Acutely, variable amounts of pruritus and pain occur." [pmid:12165227, pmid:22375975]
"The presence of multiple xanthomas (xanthomata) in the skin. Xanthomas are yellowish, firm, lipid-laden nodules in the skin." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Cafe-au-lait spot
Few cafe-au-lait spots
children.defn: "The presence of two to five cafe-au-lait macules." [DDD:cmoss]

children.name: Multiple cafe-au-lait spots
children.defn: "The presence of six or more cafe-au-lait spots." [DDD:cmoss]

"Cafe-au-lait spots are hyperpigmented lesions that can vary in color from light brown to dark brown with smooth borders and having a size of 1.5 cm or more in adults and 0.5 cm or more in children." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Skin erosion
children.defn: "A discontinuity of the skin exhibiting incomplete loss of the epidermis, a lesion that is moist, circumscribed, and usually depressed." [HPO:skoehler]

children.name: Epidermoid cyst
Cyst of the eyelid
is_a_string: HP:0010732 ! Nodular changes affecting the eyelids

children.name: Chalazion
children.defn: "A chronic epithelioid cell granulomatous inflammation of the meibomian gland caused by inflammation of a blocked meibomian gland. A chalazion or meibomian cyst appears as a painless tuberous swelling in the upper lid without loss of eyelashes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hordeolum
Hordeolum internum
children.defn: "Hordeola interna are acute purulent infections affecting the meibomian sebacious glands, often caused by staphylococcus infections. In contrast to chalazia (chronic epithelioid cell granulomatous inflammation of the meibomian gland caused by inflammation of a blocked meibomian gland), hordeola are extremely painfull and can cause extreme local swelling." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Hordeolum externum
children.defn: "Hordeola externa are acute purulent infections affecting the sebaceous glands of Zeis or the apocrine sweat glands of Moll, often caused by staphylococcus infections. In contrast to chalazia, hordeola are extremely painfull and can cause extreme local swelling." [HPO:curators]

"An acute purulent infection of the sebaceous glands of Zeis at the base of the eyelashes, of the apocrine sweat glands of Moll or the meibomian sebacious glands often caused by staphylococcus infections. Hordeola can either occur as Hordeola externa affecting the sebaceous glands of Zeis or the apocrine sweat glands of Moll or as Hordeola interna affecting the meibomian sebacious glands. In contrast to chalazia, hordeola are extremely painful and can cause extreme local swelling." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Axillary epidermoid cyst
children.defn: "An epidermoid cyst in the armpit." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]
"The presence of one or more cysts of the skin." [HPO:skoehler]

children.name: Papule
Verrucous papule
children.defn: "A wartlike (with multiple small elevated projections) papule." [HPO:probinson]
"A circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid, varying in size from a pinhead to less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point." [HPO:skoehler]

children.name: skin vesicle
children.defn: "A circumscribed, fluid-containing, epidermal elevation generally considered less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point." [HPO:SKOEHLER]

children.name: Skin nodule
Nodular changes affecting the eyelids
children.defn: "Nodular changes affecting the eyelids may have many different causes such as cystic lesions (chalaziae, hordeolae), lipogranulomas, melanomas, infectious diseases (Molluscum contagiosum) and many more." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Subcutaneous nodule
Periarticular subcutaneous nodules
children.defn: "Subcutaneous nodules that are located in the vicinity of joints." [HPO:probinson]
"Slightly elevated lesions on or in the skin with a diameter of over 5 mm." [HPO:probinson]
"Morphologically similar to a papule, but greater than either 10mm in both width and depth, and most frequently centered in the dermis or subcutaneous fat." [HPO:skoehler]

children.name: Skin plaque
children.defn: "A plaque is a solid, raised, plateau-like (flat-topped) lesion greater than 1 cm in diameter." [HPO:skoehler]

children.name: Plantar pits
is_a_string: HP:0100872 ! Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
children.defn: "The presence of multiple pits (small, pinpoint-large indentations on the surface of the skin) located on the skin of sole of foot." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Periauricular skin pits
Supraauricular pit
children.defn: "Benign congenital lesion of the supraauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Preauricular pit
children.defn: "Small indentation anterior to the insertion of the ear." [HPO:sdoelken, pmid:19152421]

children.name: Postauricular pit
children.defn: "Benign congenital lesion of the postauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Benign congenital lesions of the periauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Lip pit
Commissural lip pit
children.defn: "A depression located at an oral commissure." [HPO:sdoelken, pmid:19125428]

children.name: Paramedian lip pit
Lower lip pit
children.defn: "Depression located on the vermilion of the lower lip, usually paramedian." [HPO:sdoelken, pmid:19125428]

children.name: Upper lip pit
children.defn: "Depression located on the vermilion of the upper lip, usually paramedian." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Depression located paramedially on the vermilion of a lip." [HPO:sdoelken]
"A depression located on a lip." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Perifollicular fibrosis
children.defn: "Presence of excess fibrous connective tissue surrounding hair follicules." []

children.name: Macule
children.defn: "A flat, distinct, discolored area of skin less than 1 cm wide that does not involve any change in the thickness or texture of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Skin tags
Preauricular skin tag
children.defn: "A rudimentary tag of ear tissue often containing a core of cartilage and located just in front of the auricle (outer part of the ear)." [HPO:probinson]

"Cutaneous skin tags also known as acrochorda or fibroepithelial polyps are small benign tumours that may either form secondarily over time primarily in areas where the skin forms creases, such as the neck, armpit or groin or may also be present at birth, in which case they usually occur in the periauricular region." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Skin ulcer
Pressure ulcer
children.defn: "A type of ulcer that is caused when an area of skin is subject to pressure over a prolonged period of time, ranging in range in severity from patches of discolored skin to open wounds that expose the underlying bone or muscle. The most common sites are the sacrum, coccyx, heels and the hips." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Acral ulceration leading to autoamputation of digits
Acral ulceration and osteomyelitis leading to autoamputation of the digits (feet)
Acral ulceration and osteomyelitis leading to autoamputation of digits
children.defn: "Ulceration and osteomyelitis of the distal parts of the limbs associated with necrosis and spontaneous detachment of digits or parts of digits." [HPO:probinson]
"A discontinuity of the skin exhibiting complete loss of the epidermis and often portions of the dermis and even subcutaneous fat." [HPO:skoehler]

children.name: Aplasia cutis congenita
Aplasia cutis congenita on trunk or limbs
children.defn: "A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the trunk or the limbs." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Aplasia cutis congenita of scalp
Aplasia cutis congenita over parietal area
is_a_string: HP:0007385 ! Aplasia cutis congenita of scalp

children.name: Aplasia cutis congenita over posterior parietal area
is_a_string: HP:0004476 ! Aplasia cutis congenita over parietal area

children.defn: "A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp in the parietal area." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Aplasia cutis congenita over the scalp vertex
is_a_string: HP:0007385 ! Aplasia cutis congenita of scalp

children.name: Aplasia cutis congenita of midline scalp vertex
is_a_string: HP:0004471 ! Aplasia cutis congenita over the scalp vertex

children.defn: "A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp vertex, often just lateral to the midline." [HPO:curators]
"A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp." [HPO:probinson]

"A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin in multiple or solitary non-inflammatory, well-demarcated, oval or circular ulcers with a diameter of about 1 to 2 cm. Aplasia cutis congenita most commonly occurs on the scalp, but may present in the face, trunk, or limbs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital absence of skin of limbs
is_a_string: HP:0007383 ! Congenital localized absence of skin

children.name: Dermal atrophy
children.defn: "Partial or complete wasting (atrophy) of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thin skin
children.defn: "Reduction in thickness of the skin, generally associated with a loss of suppleness and elasticity of the skin." [HPO:probinson]
"A lesion of the skin that is located in a specific region rather than being generalized." [DDD:cmoss]

children.name: Regional abnormality of skin
Pterygium
Neck pterygia
children.defn: "Pterygia affecting the neck." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Intercrural pterygium
children.defn: "A pterygium (or pterygia) in the intercrural (groin) region." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Popliteal pterygium
children.defn: "A pterygium (or pterygia) occuring in the popliteal region (the back of the knee)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Antecubital pterygium
children.defn: "Pterygium affecting the elbow. This is a cutaneous web that can lead to severe flexion contracture of the elbow joint. Antecubital pterygium can be unilateral, bilateral, symmetric, or asysmmetric." [HPO:probinson]
"Pterygia are 'winglike' triangular membranes occurring in the neck, eyes, knees, elbows, ankles or digits." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Prominent digit pad
Prominent fingertip pads
children.defn: "A soft tissue prominence of the ventral aspects of the fingertips. The term \"persistent fetal fingertip pads\" is often used as a synonym, but should better not be used because it implies knowledge of history of the patient which often does not exist." [HPO:probinson]
"A soft tissue prominence of the ventral aspects of the fingertips or toe tips." [pmid:19125433]

children.name: Palmoplantar blistering
is_a_string: HP:0100872 ! Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
children.defn: "A type of blistering that affects the skin of the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cutis gyrata of scalp
children.defn: "The presence of convoluted folds and furrows formed from thickened skin of the scalp, resembling cerebriform pattern. The scalp has convoluted and elevated folds, 1 to 2 cm in thickness. The convolutions generally cannot be flattened by traction." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pretibial blistering
children.defn: "A type of blistering that affects the skin of the tibial region." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15265795]

children.name: Abnormality of the periungual region
Ungual fibroma
is_a_string: HP:0100803 ! Abnormality of the periungual region
children.defn: "Flesh-colored papule in or around the nail bed. Ungual fibromas may be periungual (arising under the proximal nail fold ) or subungual (originating under the nail plate)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:18815399]

children.name: Paronychia
is_a_string: HP:0100803 ! Abnormality of the periungual region
children.defn: "The nail disease paronychia is an often-tender bacterial or fungal hand infection or foot infection where the nail and skin meet at the side or the base of a finger or toenail. The infection can start suddenly (acute paronychia) or gradually (chronic paronychia)." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the region around the nails of the fingers or toes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal dermatoglyphics
Palmoplantar cutis gyrata
is_a_string: HP:0100872 ! Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
children.defn: "Cutis gyrata of palms and soles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal plantar dermatoglyphics
is_a_string: HP:0100872 ! Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
children.defn: "An abnormality of dermatoglyphs on the toes and soles, i.e., an abnormality of the patterns of ridges of the skin of sole of foot." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal palmar dermatoglyphics
Abnormality of the palmar creases
Single transverse palmar crease
is_a_string: HP:0010490 ! Abnormality of the palmar creases

children.name: Bilateral single transverse palmar creases
children.defn: "The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease on both hands." [HPO:probinson]
"The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125433]

children.name: Multiple palmar creases
is_a_string: HP:0010490 ! Abnormality of the palmar creases
children.defn: "The presence of multiple creases on the palm of the hand (more than the normal three major creases (distal transverse crease, proximal transverse crease, and thenar crease)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bridged palmar crease
is_a_string: HP:0010490 ! Abnormality of the palmar creases
children.defn: "A crease that connects the proximal and distal transverse palmar creases." [pmid:19125433]

children.name: Sydney crease
is_a_string: HP:0010490 ! Abnormality of the palmar creases
children.defn: "Extension of the proximal transverse crease (five finger crease) to the ulnar edge of the palm." [pmid:19125433]

children.name: Prominent palmar flexion creases
is_a_string: HP:0010490 ! Abnormality of the palmar creases

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the palmar creases
is_a_string: HP:0010490 ! Abnormality of the palmar creases

children.name: Decreased palmar creases
is_a_string: HP:0010488 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the palmar creases
children.defn: "Poorly defined or shallow palmar creases." [pmid:19125433]

children.name: Absent palmar crease
is_a_string: HP:0010488 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the palmar creases
children.defn: "The absence of the major creases of the palm (distal transverse crease, proximal transverse crease, or thenar crease)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125433]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the palmar creases." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Deep palmar crease
is_a_string: HP:0010490 ! Abnormality of the palmar creases
children.defn: "Excessively deep creases of the palm." [pmid:19125433]
"An abnormality of the creases of the skin of palm of hand." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the dermatoglyphs, i.e., an abnormality of the patterns of ridges of the skin of palm of hand." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of dermatoglyphs (fingerprints), which are present on fingers, palms, toes, and soles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pretibial myxedema
children.defn: "A diffuse, non-pitting edema and thickening of the skin usually on the anterior aspect of the lower legs spreading to the dorsum of the feet." [HPO:skoehler]

children.name: Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
Convex contour of sole
is_a_string: HP:0100872 ! Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
children.defn: "The contour of the foot in lateral profile has a convex shape." [pmid:19125433]

children.name: Hypertrophy of skin of soles
is_a_string: HP:0100872 ! Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot

children.name: Deep plantar creases
is_a_string: HP:0100872 ! Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot

children.name: Plantar crease between first and second toes
children.defn: "The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot located between the first and second toe." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Deep longitudinal plantar crease
children.defn: "Narrow, paramedian longitudinal depressions in the plantar skin of the forefoot." [pmid:19125433]
"The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Multiple plantar creases
is_a_string: HP:0100872 ! Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot

children.name: Palmoplantar hyperhidrosis
is_a_string: HP:0100872 ! Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
children.defn: "An abnormally increased perspiration on palms and soles." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the plantar part of foot, that is of the soles of the feet." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the skin that is restricted to a particular body region." [DDD:cmoss]

children.name: Neoplasm of the skin
Peripheral Schwannoma
children.defn: "The presence of a peripheral schwannoma." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Papilloma
Verrucae
children.defn: "Warts, benign growths on the skin or mucous membranes that cause cosmetic problems as well as pain and discomfort. Warts most often occur on the hands, feet, and genital areas." [HPO:skoehler]
"A tumor of the skin or mucous membrane with finger-like projections." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Basal cell carcinoma
Basalioma of the outer ear
is_a_string: HP:0040095 ! Neoplasm of the outer ear

Squamous cell carcinoma of the skin
children.defn: "Squamous cell carcinoma of the skin is a malignant tumor of squamous epithelium." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma

"The presence of squamous cell carcinoma of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cutaneous melanoma
Superficial spreading melanoma
children.defn: "A type of melanoma that is flat and irregular in shape and color, with different shades of black and brown." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nodular melanoma
children.defn: "A type of melanoma that starts as a raised area that is usually dark blackish-blue or bluish-red but may not have any color." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lentigo maligna melanoma
children.defn: "A subtype of melanoma in situ that typically develops on sun-damaged skin. The lesion is typically a large, irregularly pigmented macule that has developed from an ordinary lentigo (a small pigmented spot on the skin with a clearly-defined edge). Change to a malignant lentigo typically takes place over 20 years or more, and many patients accept the change as a consequence of aging." [HPO:7734995, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Acral lentiginous melanoma
children.defn: "A type of cutaneous melanoma localized to the palm, sole, or beneath the nail (subungual melanoma). Acral lentiginous melanoma starts as a slowly-enlarging flat patch of discoloured skin and usually displays a size above 6 mm and often several centimetres or more in diameter upon diagnosis and variable pigmentation with a mixutre of colors including brown, and blue-grey, black and red. The surface of the lesion is initially smooth but later in the course may become thicker and irregular, and may ulcerate or bleed." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a melanoma of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cutaneous leiomyoma
children.defn: "The presence of leiomyoma of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Steatocystoma multiplex
children.defn: "Multiple, localized or widespread, asymptomatic or inflammatory dermal cysts involving the pilosebaceous units. Lesions can appear anywhere on the body, but steatocystoma multiplex is more commonly involved with those areas of the skin with a high density of developed pilosebaceous units (e.g., the axilla, groin, neck, and proximal extremities)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:20631281]

children.name: Cutaneous leiomyosarcoma
children.defn: "The presence of leiomyosarcoma of the skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Kaposi's sarcoma
children.defn: "A systemic disease which can present with cutaneous lesions with or without internal involvement. Tumors are caused by Human herpesvirus 8 (HHV8), also known as Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpesvirus (KSHV)." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Hemangioma
Cardiac hemangioma
children.defn: "Abnormal proliferation of blood vessels within the cardiac cavities attached to the endocardium." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Capillary hemangiomas
children.defn: "The presence of a capillary hemangiomas, which are hemangiomas with small endothelial spaces." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Choroidal hemangiomata
children.defn: "The presence of multiple hemangiomas in the choroid. These are generally reddish or orange or can have increased pigmentation maiking them difficult to distinguish from choroidal melanomas." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Retinal hemangioblastoma
children.defn: "Retinal hemangioblastoma is a benign vascular tumor of the retina without any neoplastic characteristics. They have been called \"retinal angiomas\" and \"retinal hemangiomas\" but hemangioblastoma is the preferred term since they are histologically identical to lesions found in the CNS." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tufted angioma
children.defn: "A vascular tumor of the skin and subcutaneous tissues and characterized by slow angiomatous proliferation." [HPO:probinson, pmid:2644316]

children.name: Cavernous hemangioma
children.defn: "The presence of a cavernous hemangioma. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Facial hemangioma

children.name: Plaque-like facial hemangioma

children.name: Facial midline hemangioma

children.defn: "Nails that easily break." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nail dystrophy
Dystrophic fingernails
children.defn: "The presence of misshapen or partially destroyed nail plates, often with accumulation of soft, yellow keratin between the dystrophic nail plate and nail bed, resulting in elevation of the nail plate." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Dystrophic toenail
children.defn: "Toenail changes apart from changes of the color of the toenail (nail dyschromia) that involve partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate." [HPO:probinson]

"Onychodystrophy (nail dystrophy) refers to nail changes apart from changes of the color (nail dyschromia) and involves partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate." [pmid:19675700]

children.name: Recurrent loss of toenails and fingernails
children.defn: "Recurrent loss, or shedding, of the nails of the fingers and toes." [DDD:cmoss]

children.name: Chronic monilial nail infection
children.defn: "Chronic infection of the nails by Candida species." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pyramidal skinfold extending from the base to the top of the nails
children.defn: "Pyramidal skinfold extending from the base to the top of the nails is a rare and distinctive anomaly seen in popliteal pterygia syndrome." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormality of nail color
Yellow nails
children.defn: "Yellowish discoloration of the nails." [DDD:cmoss]

children.name: Leukonychia
children.defn: "White discoloration  of the nails." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Melanonychia

"An anomaly of the color of the nail." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thin nail
Thin toenail
children.defn: "Toenail that appears thin when viewed on end." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125433]

children.name: Thin fingernail

"Abnormality of the nail." [HPO:probinson]

Night sweats
children.defn: "Occurence of excessive sweating during sleep." [HPO:probinson, pmid:23136329]

children.name: Episodic hyperhidrosis
children.defn: "Intermittent episodes of abnormally increased perspiration." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormal excessive perspiration (sweating)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypohidrosis
Decreased sweating due to autonomic dysfunction

children.defn: "Abnormally diminished capacity to sweat." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the sweat gland." [HPO:probinson]

"An abnormality of the skin adnexa (skin appendages), which are specialized skin structures located within the dermis and focally within the subcutaneous fatty tissue, comprising three histologically distinct structures: (1) the pilosebaceous unit (hair follicle and sebaceous glands); (2) the eccrine sweat glands; and (3) the apocrine glands." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the integument, which consists of the skin and the superficial fascia." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the genitourinary system
Cloacal abnormality
is_a_string: HP:0000119 ! Abnormality of the genitourinary system

children.name: Persistent cloaca
children.defn: "Developmental anomaly in which the vagina, bladder, and rectum fuse resulting in a common channel." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cloacal exstrophy
children.defn: "Cloacal exstrophy is a severe anterior abdominal wall defect in which the two hemibladders are visible and are separated by a midline intestinal plate, an omphalocele, and an imperforate anus." [HPO:probinson]
"A developmental anomaly associated with the failure of rectum, vagina, and bladder to separate." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Neoplasm of the genitourinary tract
is_a_string: HP:0000119 ! Abnormality of the genitourinary system

children.name: Urinary tract neoplasm
is_a_string: HP:0007379 ! Neoplasm of the genitourinary tract

children.name: Neoplasm of the urethra
children.defn: "The presence of a neoplasm of the urethra." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Neoplasm of the ureter
children.defn: "The presence of a neoplasm of the ureter." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Renal neoplasm
Renal hamartoma
Renal angiomyolipoma
children.defn: "A benign renal neoplasm composed of fat, vascular, and smooth muscle elements." [HPO:probinson]
"A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that are native to the kidneys." [DDD:rscott, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Renal cortical adenoma
children.defn: "The presence of an adenoma in the cortex of the kidney." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Renal cell carcinoma
Clear cell renal cell carcinoma
children.defn: "A subtype of renal cell carcinoma thought to originate from mature renal tubular cells in the proximal tubule of the nehpron." [DDD:rscott]

children.name: Papillary renal cell carcinoma
Papillary renal cell carcinoma type 2
children.defn: "A type of papillary renal cell carcinoma in which the papillae are covered by large eosinophilic cells with pleomorphic nuclei, prominent nucleoli, and nuclear pseudostratification." [DDD:rscott, pmid:12429790]

children.name: Papillary renal cell carcinoma type 1
children.defn: "A type of papillary renal cell carcinoma that is characterized by small cuboidal cells covering thin papillae with a single line of uniform nuclei and small nucleoli." [DDD:rscott, pmid:12429790]
"The presence of renal cell carcinoma in the renal papilla." [HPO:probinson]
"A type of carcinoma of the kidney with origin in the epithelium of the proximal convoluted renal tubule." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Embryonal renal neoplasm
Nephroblastomatosis
Perilobar nephroblastomatosis
children.defn: "Abnormally persistent foci of embryonal immature blastema located in the superficial cortical region (perilobar)." [DDD:rscott]

children.name: Intralobar nephroblastomatosis
children.defn: "Presence of persistent islands of renal blastema in the postnatal kidney, anywhere within a renal lobe (a portion of a kidney consisting of a renal pyramid and the renal cortex above it)." [DDD:rscott]

"Presence of persistent islands of renal blastema in the postnatal kidney. Nephroblastomatosis represents a complex abnormality of nephrogenesis and has been defined as the persistence of metanephricblastema into infancy and childhood." [HPO:probinson, pmid:10707720]

children.name: Nephroblastoma (Wilms tumor)
children.defn: "The presence of a nephroblastoma, which is a neoplasm of the kidney that primarily affects children." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital mesoblastic nephroma
children.defn: "Congenital mesoblastic nephroma is a type of kidney tumor that is usually found before birth by ultrasound or within the first 3 months of life. It contains fibroblastic cells (connective tissue cells), and may spread to the other kidney or to nearby tissue." [HPO:sdoelken]
"The presence of an embryonal neoplasm of the kidney that primarily affects children." [DDD:rscott]

children.name: Renal oncocytoma
children.defn: "A renal tumor originating from an oncocyte, which  is an epithelial cell characterized by an excessive amount of mitochondria, resulting in an abundant acidophilic, granular cytoplasm." [DDD:rscott]

children.name: Renal pelvic carcinoma
children.defn: "The presence of a carcinoma in the renal pelvis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Renal sarcoma
children.defn: "A sarcoma of the kidney." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a neoplasm of the kidney." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bladder neoplasm
Bladder carcinoma
Transitional cell carcinoma of the bladder
children.defn: "The presence of a carcinoma of the urinary bladder with origin in a transitional epithelial cell." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a carcinoma of the urinary bladder." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a neoplasm of the urinary bladder." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a neoplasm of the urinary system." [HPO:probinson]

Endometrial carcinoma

children.name: Uterine leiomyosarcoma
children.defn: "The presence of a leiomyosarcoma of the uterus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Uterine leiomyoma

children.name: Gonadal neoplasm
Gonadoblastoma
Testicular gonadoblastoma
children.defn: "The presence of a gonadoblastoma of the testis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ovarian gonadoblastoma
children.defn: "The presence of a gonadoblastoma of the ovary." [eMedicine:986581, HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a gonadoblastoma, a neoplasm of a gonad that consists of aggregates of germ cells and sex cord elements." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Germinoma
Cerebral germinoma
is_a_string: HP:0100835 ! Benign neoplasm of the central nervous system
HP:0100836 ! Malignant neoplasm of the central nervous system
children.defn: "The presence of a germ cell tumor of the cerebrum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Dysgerminoma
children.defn: "The presence of a dysgerminoma, i.e., an undifferentiated germ cell tumor of the ovary." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Testicular seminoma
children.defn: "The presence of a seminoma, an undifferentiated germ cell tumor of the testis." [HPO:sdoelken]
"A type of undifferentiated germ cell tumor that may be benign or malignant." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Choriocarcinoma
children.defn: "A malignant, trophoblastic and aggressive cancer, usually of the placenta. It is characterized by early hematogenous spread to the lungs and belongs to the far end of the spectrum of gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD), a subset of germ cell tumors." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Teratoma
Presacral teratoma
children.defn: "Presence of a teratoma anterior to the sacrum." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Testicular teratoma
children.defn: "The presence of a teratoma of the testis." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Ovarian teratoma
children.defn: "The presence of a teratoma in the ovary." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cardiac teratoma
children.defn: "A teratoma within the heart. Most commonly, these tumors are detected in the pericardial cavity attached to the pulmonary artery and aorta. The tumour size within the heart varies from 2 to 9 cm in diameter, and intrapericardial tumors as large as 15 cm have been reported. Intracardiac tumors arise from the atrial or ventricular wall as nodular masses protruding into the cardiac chambers. Cardiac and pericardial teratomas are easily detected in the fetus and neonate by two-dimensional echocardiography as heterogeneous and encapsulated cystic masses. Histologically, cardiac teratomas contain multiple immature elements including epithelium, neuroglial tissue, thyroid, pancreas, smooth and skeletal muscle, cartilage and bone." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17331235]
"The presence of a teratoma." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Testicular neoplasm
Testicular mesothelioma
children.defn: "A Malignant mesothelioma of the testis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Leydig cell neoplasia
is_a_string: HP:0010789 ! Abnormality of the Leydig cells
children.defn: "The presence of a neoplasm of the testis with origin in a Leydig cell." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Sertoli cell neoplasm
Precocious puberty with Sertoli cell tumor

children.defn: "The presence of a neoplasm of the testis with origin in a  Sertoli cell." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a neoplasm of the testis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ovarian neoplasm
Ovarian papillary adenocarcinoma
children.defn: "The presence of a papillary adenocarcinoma of the ovary." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ovarian fibroma
children.defn: "The presence of a fibroma of the ovary." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a neoplasm the ovary." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a neoplasm of a gonad." [HPO:probinson]

"The presence of a neoplasm of the genitourinary system." [HPO:probinson]
