children.name: Isothenuria
children.defn: "Inability of the kidneys to produce either concentrated or dilute urine." []

children.name: Abnormal glomerular filtration rate
Increased glomerular filtration rate
children.defn: "An abnormal rise in the volume of water filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time." [HP:probinson]

children.name: Decreased glomerular filtration rate
children.defn: "An abnormal reduction in the volume of water filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time." [HP:probinson]
"An anomaly in the volume of water filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time." [HP:probinson, MP:0002847]

children.name: Hematuria
Microscopic hematuria
children.defn: "Microscopic hematuria detected by dipstick or microscopic examination of the urine." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Macroscopic hematuria
children.defn: "Hematuria that is visible upon inspection of the urine." [HPO:sdoelken]

"The presence of blood in the urine. Hematuria may be gross hematuria (visible to the naked eye) or microscopic hematuria (detected by dipstick or microscopic examination of the urine)." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Elevated alkaline phosphatase of renal origin
is_a_string: HP:0010679 ! Elevated tissue non-specific alkaline phosphatase
children.defn: "An abnormally increased level of kidney isoforms of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Low alkaline phosphatase of renal origin
is_a_string: HP:0010683 ! Low tissue non-specific alkaline phosphatase
children.defn: "An abnormally reduced level of kidney isoforms of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nephropathy
children.defn: "A nonspecific term referring to disease or damage of the kidneys." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Renal insufficiency
Reversible renal failure
children.defn: "Acute renal failure with resolution of manifestations." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Chronic kidney disease
Stage 1 chronic kidney disease
children.defn: "A type of chronic kidney disease with normal or increased glomerular filtration rate (GFR at least 90 mL/min/1.73 m2)." [Eurenomics:fschaefer]

children.name: Stage 4 chronic kidney disease
children.defn: "A type of chronic kidney disease with severely reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 15-29 mL/min/1.73 m2)." [Eurenomics:fschaefer]

children.name: Stage 3 chronic kidney disease
children.defn: "A type of chronic kidney disease with moderately reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 30-59 mL/min/1.73 m2)." [Eurenomics:fschaefer]

children.name: Stage 2 chronic kidney disease
children.defn: "A type of chronic kidney disease with mildly reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 60-89 mL/min/1.73 m2)." [Eurenomics:fschaefer]

children.name: Stage 5 chronic kidney disease
children.defn: "A degree of kidney failure severe enough to require dialysis or kidney transplantation for survival characterized by a severe reduction in glomerular filtration rate (less than 15 ml/min/1.73 m2) and other manifestations including increased serum creatinine." [HPO:probinson]
"Functional anomaly of the kidney persisting for at least three months." [Eurenomics:ewuehl]

children.name: Acute kidney injury
children.defn: "Sudden loss of renal function, as manifested by decreased urine production, and a rise in serum creatinine or blood urea nitrogen concentration (azotemia)." [HPO:probinson]

"A reduction in the level of performance of the kidneys in areas of function comprising the concentration of urine, removal of wastes, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, homeostasis of blood pressure, and calcium metabolism." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nephrotic syndrome
Congenital nephrotic syndrome
children.defn: "Nephrotic syndrome with onset within the first three months of life." [Eurenomics:fschaefer]

children.name: Steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome
children.defn: "A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to treatment with steroid medication." [Eurenomics:ewuehl]

children.name: Multidrug-resistant nephrotic syndrome
children.defn: "A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to any immunosuppresive treatment." [Eurenomics:ewuehl]

"Nephrotic syndrome is a collection of findings resulting from glomerular dysfunction with an increase in glomerular capillary wall permeability associated with pronounced proteinuria. Nephrotic syndrome refers to the constellation of clinical findings that result from severe renal loss of protein, with Proteinuria and hypoalbuminemia, edema, and hyperlipidemia." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nephritis
Glomerulonephritis
Dense deposit disease
children.defn: "A type of membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis characterized by electron dense deposits at the glomerular basement membrane." [Eurenomics:ewuehl, pmid:20301598]

children.name: Minimal change glomerulonephritis
children.defn: "The presence of minimal changes visible by light microscopy but flattened and fused podocyte foot processes on electron microscopy in a person with nephrotic range proteinuria." [Eurenomics:fschaefer]

children.name: Membranous nephropathy
children.defn: "A type of glomerulonephropathy characterized by thickening of the basement membrane and deposition of immune complexes in the subepithelial space." [Eurenomics:fschaefer]

children.name: Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis
children.defn: "Proliferation of mesangial cells, increase in the mesangial extracellular matrix, and a thickening of the glomerular capillary walls." [Eurenomics:fschaefer, MeSH:D015432]

children.name: Crescentic glomerulonephritis
children.defn: "A type of extracapillary glomerulonephritis characterized by the formation of crescent-like cellular proliferation." [Eurenomics:ewuehl]
"Inflammation of the renal glomeruli." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Perinephritis
children.defn: "Inflammation of the connective and adipose tissues surrounding the kidney." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pyelonephritis
Recurrent pyelonephritis
children.defn: "Repeated episodes of pyelonephritis." [HPO:probinson]
"An inflammation of the  kidney involving the parenchyma of kidney, the renal pelvis (FMA:15575) and the kidney calices." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of inflammation affecting the kidney." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Renovascular hypertension
children.defn: "The presence of hypertension related to stenosis of the renal artery." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Renal tubular acidosis
Distal renal tubular acidosis
children.defn: "A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of acid secretion by the alpha intercalated cells of the cortical collecting duct of the distal nephron. The urine cannot be acidified below a pH of 5.3, associated with acidemia and hypokalemia." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Proximal renal tubular acidosis
children.defn: "A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a  failure of the proximal tubular cells to reabsorb bicarbonate, leading to urinary bicarbonate wasting and subsequent acidemia." [HPO:probinson]

"Acidosis owing to malfunction of the kidney tubules with accumulation of metabolic acids and hyperchloremia, potentially leading to complications including hypokalemia, hypercalcinuria, nephrolithiasis and nephrocalcinosis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of renal resorption
Impaired renal concentrating ability
children.defn: "A defect in the ability to concentrate the urine." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Renal Fanconi syndrome
children.defn: "An inability of the tubules in the kidney to reabsorb small molecules, causing increased urinary loss of electrolytes (sodium, potassium, bicarbonate), minerals, glucose, amino acids, and water." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of renal absorption." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of renal excretion
Abnormal urine output
Polyuria
children.defn: "An increased rate of urine production." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Decreased urine output
Anuria
children.defn: "Absence of urine, clinically classified as below 50ml/day." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Oliguria
children.defn: "Low output of urine, clinically classified as an output below 300-500ml/day." [HPO:sdoelken]
"A decreased rate of urine production." [HPO:probinson]
"Ab abnormal amount of urine production." [Eurenomics:ewuehl]

children.name: Impaired renal uric acid clearance
children.defn: "A reduction in the ability of the kidneys to remove uric acid from the serum." [HPO:probinson]
"An altered ability of the kidneys to void urine and/or specific substances." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormal functionality of the kidney." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of urine homeostasis
is_a_string: HP:0011277 ! Abnormality of the urinary system physiology

children.name: Proteinuria
Mild proteinuria
children.defn: "Mildly increased levels of protein in the urine (150-500 mg per day in adults)." [Eurenomics:eweuehl]

children.name: Heavy proteinuria
children.defn: "Severely increased levels of protein in the urine (1000-3000 mg per day in adults)." [Eurenomics:ewuehl]

children.name: Moderate proteinuria
children.defn: "Moderately increased levels of protein in the urine (500-1000 mg per day in adults)." [Eurenomics:fschaefer]

children.name: Low-molecular-weight proteinuria
children.defn: "Excretion in urine of proteins of a size smaller than albumin (molecular weight 69 kD)." [pmid:95574]

children.name: Nephrotic range proteinuria
children.defn: "Severely increased amount of excretion of protein in the urine, defined as 3.5 grams per day or more in adults and 40 mg per meter-squared body surface area per hour in children." [Eurenomics:ewuehl]

children.name: Albuminuria
Microalbuminuria
children.defn: "The presence of mildly increased concentrations of albumin in the urine (in adults, 30-150 mg per day)." [Eurenomics:fschaefer]
"Increased concentration of albumin in the urine." [Eurenomics:fschaefer]

children.name: Bence Jones Proteinuria
children.defn: "The presence of free monoclonal immunoglobulin light chains in the urine." [HPO:probinson, pmid:7876381]
"Increased levels of protein in the urine." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hyposthenuria
children.defn: "An abnormally low urinary specific gravity, i.e., reduced concentration of solutes in the urine." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aciduria

is_a_string: HP:0009119 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the frontal sinuses
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of frontal sinus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absent frontal sinuses
is_a_string: HP:0009119 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the frontal sinuses
children.defn: "Aplasia of frontal sinus." [HPO:probinson]
"Absence or underdevelopment of frontal sinus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absent/hypoplastic paranasal sinuses
Absent paranasal sinuses
Absent ethmoidal sinuses
children.defn: "Lack (aplasia) of the ethmoidal sinus." [HPO:probinson]
"Aplasia of the paranasal sinuses." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Paranasal sinus hypoplasia
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the paranasal sinuses." [HPO:probinson]
"Aplasia or hypoplasia of the paranasal sinuses." [HPO:probinson]
"Absence or underdevelopment of a cranial sinus or sinuses." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Obliteration of frontal sinuses
is_a_string: HP:0002687 ! Abnormality of the frontal sinuses

children.name: Prominent frontal sinuses
is_a_string: HP:0002687 ! Abnormality of the frontal sinuses

children.name: Advanced pneumatization of cranial sinuses
children.defn: "A degree of pneumatization that is increased compared to age-related norms." [HPO:probinson]

"Abnormality of the paranasal (cranial) sinuses, which are air-filled spaces that are located within the bones of the skull and face and communicate with the nasal cavity. They comprise the maxillary sinuses, the frontal sinuses, the ethmoid sinuses, and the sphenoid sinuses." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Craniofacial hyperostosis
Facial hyperostosis
Mandibular hyperostosis
children.defn: "Hyperostosis (bony overgrowth) of the  mandible." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Facial palsy secondary to cranial hyperostosis
children.defn: "Paralysis of the facial nerves on the basis of overgrowth of the cranial bones causing impingement upon the seventh cranial nerve." [HPO:probinson]
"Excessive growth (overgrowth) of the facial bones, that is of the facial skeleton." [HPO:probinson]
"Excessive growth of the craniofacial bones." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the palatine bone
children.defn: "An abnormality of the palatine bone." [GOC:MG]

children.name: Abnormality of the lacrimal bone
children.defn: "An abnormality of the lacrimal bone." [GOC:MG]

children.name: Abnormality of the frontal bone
children.defn: "An abnormality of the frontal bone." [GOC:MG]

children.name: Abnormality of vomer
children.defn: "An abnormality of the vomer." [GOC:NV]

children.name: Aplasia of the maxilla
children.defn: "A congenital defect characterized by absence of the Maxilla." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia of the premaxilla
children.defn: "Absence of the Premaxilla, which is the embryonic structure that forms the anterior part of the maxilla." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the maxilla
Midface prominence
children.defn: "Anterior positioning of the infraorbital and perialar regions, or increased convexity of the face, or increased nasolabial angle." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the maxilla
is_a_string: HP:0009116 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the skull

children.name: Hypoplasia of the maxilla
Hypoplasia of the anterior nasal spine
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the anterior nasal spine of maxilla." [HPO:probinson]
"Underdevelopment of the Maxilla." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the premaxilla
children.defn: "Absence or underdevelopment of the premaxilla." [HPO:probinson]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the Maxilla." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Asymmetry of the maxilla
children.defn: "Asymmetry between the left and right portions of the maxilla." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the premaxilla
Premaxillary Prominence
children.defn: "Prominent aspect of the premaxilla." [HPO:sdoelken, pmid:19125436]
"An abnormality of the premaxilla." [HPO:sdoelken]
"An abnormality of the Maxilla (upper jaw bone)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Craniofacial asymmetry
children.defn: "Asymmetry of the bones of the skull and the face." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormality of the mandible
Jaw hyporeflexia
children.defn: "Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in jaw." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Obtuse angle of mandible
children.defn: "Abnormally flat (obtuse) angle of the mandible. The angle of the mandibular, located at the junction between the body and the ramus of the mandible, is normally close to being a right angle. This terms describes an abnormal increase of this angle such that the mandible appears flatter than normal." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Asymmetry of the mandible
children.defn: "Lack of symmetry between the left and right mandible." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Fibrous syngnathia
is_a_string: HP:0006477 ! Abnormality of the alveolar ridges
children.defn: "Complete or nearly complete soft tissue fusion of the alveolar ridges." [pmid:19125428]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the mandible
is_a_string: HP:0009116 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the skull

children.name: Micrognathia
Microretrognathia
children.defn: "A form of developmental hypoplasia of the mandible in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly." [HPO:probinson]
"Developmental hypoplasia of the mandible." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Mandibular aplasia
children.defn: "Absence of the mandible." [HPO:curators]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the mandible." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Recurrent mandibular subluxations
children.defn: "Recurrent partial dislocations of the mandible." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Mandibular prognathia
children.defn: "Abnormal prominence of the chin related to increased length of the mandible." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Broad jaw
children.defn: "Bigonial distance (lower facial width) more than 2 SD above the mean (objective); or an apparently increased width of the lower jaw (mandible) when viewed from the front (subjective)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Narrow jaw
children.defn: "Bigonial distance (lower facial width) more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or an apparently decreased width of the lower jaw (mandible) when viewed from the front (subjective)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Mandibular pain
children.defn: "An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the mandible." []

children.name: Retrognathia
children.defn: "An abnormality in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the temporomandibular joint
Temporomandibular joint crepitus
is_a_string: HP:0010754 ! Abnormality of the temporomandibular joint
children.defn: "Noises from the temporomandibular joint during mandibular movement (e.g., chewing). Temporomandibular joint crepitus is often described as a clicking,  popping, grating sound." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Temporomandibular joint ankylosis
is_a_string: HP:0010754 ! Abnormality of the temporomandibular joint
children.defn: "Fusion of the mandibular condyle to the base of the skull, resulting in limitation of jaw opening." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]
"An anomaly of the temporomandibular joint." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cleft mandible
children.defn: "Midline deficiency of the mandible and some or all overlying tissues." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Trismus
children.defn: "Limitation in the ability to open the mouth." [HPO:curators]
"Any abnormality of the mandible, the bone of the lower jaw." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of one or more of the set of bones that make up the facial skeleton." [DDD:awilkie]

children.name: Abnormality of the sella turcica
Large sella turcica
is_a_string: HP:0002679 ! Abnormality of the sella turcica
children.defn: "An abnormal enlargement of the sella turcica." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Small sella turcica
is_a_string: HP:0002679 ! Abnormality of the sella turcica
children.defn: "An abnormally small sella turcica." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Deformed sella turcica
is_a_string: HP:0002679 ! Abnormality of the sella turcica

children.name: Flat sella turcica
children.defn: "An abnormally flat sella turcica." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: J-shaped sella turcica
children.defn: "A deformity of the sella turcica whereby the sella extends further anterior than normal such that the anterior clinoid process appears to overhang it, giving the appearance of the letter J on imaging of the skull." [HPO:pnrobinson]
"Abnormality of the sella turcica, a saddle-shaped depression in the sphenoid bone at the base of the human skull." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cephalocele
Atretic occipital cephalocele
children.defn: "A congenital defect in the occipital region of the skull, covered by skin of the scalp and containing meninges or remnants of glial or neural tissues." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Encephalocele
is_a_string: HP:0002011 ! Morphological abnormality of the central nervous system

children.name: Basal encephalocele
children.defn: "Basal encephalocele is an encephalocele that occurs along the cribriform plate or through the sphenoid bone. The mass may appear in the nasal cavity, nasopharynx, epipharynx, sphenoid sinus, posterior orbit, or pterygopalatine fossa. The important distinction from other types is that no external tumor is visible except in those rare instances of herniations so large that they protrude through the mouth or nares." [HPO:probinson, pmid:4966739]

children.name: Parietal encephalocele
children.defn: "An encephalocele located between bregma and lambda." [DDD:awilkie, pmid:2773494]

children.name: Occipital encephalocele
children.defn: "A type of encephalocele (that is, a a protrusion of part of the cranial contents including brain tissue through a congenital opening in the cranium, typically covered with skin or mucous membrane) in the occipital region of the skull. Occipital encephalocele presents as a midline swelling over the occipital bone.   It is usually covered with normal full-thickness scalp." [DDD:awilkie, HPO:probinson]
"A neural tube defect characterized by sac-like protrusions of the brain and the membranes that cover it through openings in the skull." [HPO:probinson]

"A congenital defect in the skull, whereby there is a protrusion of part of the cranial contents through a congenital defect in the cranium, usually covered with skin or mucous membrane. The term encephalocele refers to a subclass of these lesions in which brain tissue protrudes through the defect." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the foramen magnum
Small foramen magnum
is_a_string: HP:0002699 ! Abnormality of the foramen magnum
children.defn: "An abnormal narrowing of the foramen magnum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Large foramen magnum
is_a_string: HP:0002699 ! Abnormality of the foramen magnum
children.defn: "An abnormal increase in the size of the foramen magnum." [HPO:curators]
"Any abnormality of the foramen magnum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the skull base
Sclerosis of skull base
is_a_string: HP:0002693 ! Abnormality of the skull base

children.name: Progressive sclerosis of skull base
children.defn: "Progressively increasing bone density of the skull base without significant changes in bony contour." [HPO:probinson]
"Increased bone density of the skull base without significant changes in bony contour." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cleft in skull base
is_a_string: HP:0002693 ! Abnormality of the skull base
children.defn: "A bony defect in the skull base." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Thick skull base
is_a_string: HP:0002693 ! Abnormality of the skull base

children.name: Elevated imprint of the transverse sinuses
is_a_string: HP:0002693 ! Abnormality of the skull base

children.name: Abnormality of the posterior cranial fossa
is_a_string: HP:0002693 ! Abnormality of the skull base

children.name: Flat posterior fossa
is_a_string: HP:0000932 ! Abnormality of the posterior cranial fossa

children.name: Small flat posterior fossa
children.defn: "An abnormally small and flat configuration of the posterior cranial fossa." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Small posterior fossa
is_a_string: HP:0000932 ! Abnormality of the posterior cranial fossa

children.name: Basilar impression
is_a_string: HP:0000932 ! Abnormality of the posterior cranial fossa
children.defn: "Abnormal elevation of the floor of the posterior fossa including occipital condyles and foramen magnum." [HPO:probinson, pmid:10084535]

children.name: Basilar invagination
is_a_string: HP:0000932 ! Abnormality of the posterior cranial fossa
children.defn: "Projection of the tip of the dens more than 5 mm above a line joining the hard palate to the posterior lip of the foramen magnum (Chamberlain's line) or the tip of the dens is greater than 7 mm above McGregor's line (the back of the hard palate to the lowest point of the occipital squama)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:10084535]

children.name: Posterior fossa cyst
is_a_string: HP:0000932 ! Abnormality of the posterior cranial fossa

children.name: Posterior fossa cyst at the fourth ventricle

children.defn: "A discrete posterior fossa cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) collection that does not communicate directly with the fourth ventricle." [HPO:probinson, pmid:2816648]

children.name: Abnormality of the clivus
is_a_string: HP:0000932 ! Abnormality of the posterior cranial fossa

children.name: Vertical clivus
children.defn: "An abnormal vertical orientation of the clivus (which normally forms a kind of slope from the sella turcica down to the region of the foramen magnum)." [HPO:curators]
"An abnormality of the clivus, which is the inclined bony region of the posterior cranial fossa located between the sella turcica and the foramen magnum." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Thinning and bulging of the posterior fossa bones
is_a_string: HP:0000932 ! Abnormality of the posterior cranial fossa

children.name: Widened posterior fossa
is_a_string: HP:0000932 ! Abnormality of the posterior cranial fossa

children.name: Dandy-Walker malformation
children.defn: "A congenital brain malformation typically characterized by incomplete formation of the cerebellar vermis, dilation of the fourth ventricle, and enlargement of the posterior fossa. In layman's terms, Dandy Walker malformation is a cyst in the cerebellum (typically symmetrical) that is involved with the fourth ventricle. This may interfere with the ability to drain cerebrospinal fluid from the brain, resulting in hydrocephalus. Dandy Walker cysts are formed during early embryonic development, while the brain forms. The cyst in the cerebellum typically has several blood vessels running through it connecting to the brain, thereby prohibiting surgical removal." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the fossa cranii posterior (the posterior fossa), which is made up primarily of the occipital bone and which surrounds to the foramen magnum." [HPO:curators]

"An abnormality of the base of the skull, which forms the floor of the cranial cavity and separates the brain from other facial structures. The skull base is made up of five bones: the ethmoid, sphenoid, occipital, paired frontal, and paired parietal bones, and is subdivided into 3 regions: the anterior, middle, and posterior cranial fossae. The petro-occipital fissure subdivides the middle cranial fossa into 1 central component and 2 lateral components." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Craniofacial dysostosis
Mandibulofacial dysostosis
children.defn: "A type of craniofacial dysostosis associated with abnormalities of the external ears, mirognathia, macrostomia, coloboma of the lower eyelid, and cleft palate. This is a bundled term that is left in the HPO now for convenience with legacy annotations but should not be used for new annotations." [HPO:probinson]
"A characteristic appearance resulting from defective ossification of craniofacial bones." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the occipital bone
children.defn: "Abnormality of the occipital bone of the skull." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the skull
is_a_string: HP:0009122 ! Aplasia/hypoplasia affecting bones of the axial skeleton

children.name: Abnormality of skull size
Microcephaly
Congenital microcephaly
children.defn: "Microcephaly (HP:0000252) that is present already at the time of birth." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Postnatal microcephaly
Cessation of head growth
children.defn: "Stagnation of head growth seen as flattening of the head circumference curve." [HPO:probinson]
"Microcephaly (HP:0000252) with onset in the postnatal period, that is, the head circumference is in the normal range at birth but falls behind normal values later in development." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Progressive microcephaly
children.defn: "Progressive microcephaly is diagnosed when the head circumference falls progressively behind age- and gender-dependent norms." [HPO:probinson]

"Occipito-frontal (head) circumference (OFC) less than -3 standard deviations compared to appropriate, age matched, normal standards (Ross JJ, Frias JL 1977,  PMID:9683597). Alternatively, decreased size of the cranium." [pmid:19125436, pmid:9683597]

children.name: Macrocephaly
Postnatal macrocephaly
children.defn: "The postnatal development of an abnormally large skull (macrocephaly)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Overgrowth
children.defn: "Excessive postnatal growth which may comprise increased weight, increased length, and/or increased head circumference." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Progressive macrocephaly
children.defn: "The progressive development of an abnormally large skull." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Relative macrocephaly
children.defn: "A relatively mild degree of macrocephaly in which the head circumference is not above two standard deviations from the mean, but appears dysproportionately large when other factors such as body stature are taken into account." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Macrocephaly at birth
children.defn: "The presence of an abnormally large skull with onset at birth." [HPO:probinson]

"Occipitofrontal (head) circumference greater than 97th centile compared to appropriate, age matched, sex-matched normal standards. Alternatively, a apparently increased size of the cranium." [pmid:19125436]
"Any abnormality of the size of the skull." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormality of the mastoid
Absent mastoid
children.defn: "A developmental anomaly in which the mastoid process fails to form and is thus found to be congenitally absent." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Delayed pneumatization of the mastoid process
children.defn: "An abnormally reduced degree of pneumatization (i.e., formation of air cells) in the mastoid process with respect to age-dependent norms." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Advanced pneumatization of the mastoid process
children.defn: "An abnormally advanced degree of pneumatization (i.e., formation of air cells) in the mastoid process with respect to age-dependent norms." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the mastoid process, which is the conical prominence projecting from the undersurface of the mastoid portion of the temporal bone." [HPO:pnrobinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the calvaria
Abnormality of the fontanelles or cranial sutures
Abnormality of fontanelles
is_a_string: HP:0000235 ! Abnormality of the fontanelles or cranial sutures

children.name: Large fontanelles
Widely patent fontanelles and sutures
children.defn: "An abnormally increased width of the cranial fontanelles and sutures." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Large posterior fontanelle
children.defn: "An enlargement of the posterior fontanelle relative to age-dependent norms." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Wide anterior fontanel
is_a_string: HP:0000236 ! Abnormality of the anterior fontanelle
children.defn: "Enlargement of the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms." [HPO:curators]

"In newborns, the two frontal bones, two parietal bones, and one occipital bone are joined by fibrous sutures, which form a small posterior fontanelle, and a larger, diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle. These regions allow for the skull to pass the birth canal and for later growth. The fontanelles gradually ossify, whereby the posterior fontanelle usually closes by eight weeks and the anterior fontanelle by the 9th to 16th month of age. Large fontanelles are diagnosed if the fontanelles are larger than age-dependent norms." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Premature closure of fontanelles
children.defn: "Normally, the posterior and lateral fontanelles are obliterated by about six months after birth, the anterior fontanelle closes by about the middle of the second year. This term refers to the situation in which the fontanelles close at an inappropriately early time point." [DDD:awilkie, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the anterior fontanelle
Midline skin dimples over anterior/posterior fontanelles
is_a_string: HP:0000236 ! Abnormality of the anterior fontanelle

children.name: Small anterior fontanelle
is_a_string: HP:0000236 ! Abnormality of the anterior fontanelle
children.defn: "Abnormally decreased size of  the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Delayed closure of the anterior fontanelle
is_a_string: HP:0000236 ! Abnormality of the anterior fontanelle

children.name: Persistent open anterior fontanelle
is_a_string: HP:0001476 ! Delayed closure of the anterior fontanelle
children.defn: "The anterior fontanelle generally ossifies by around the 18th month of life. A persistent open anterior fontanelle is diagnosed if closure is delayed beyond this age." [HPO:probinson]
"A delay in closure (ossification) of the anterior fontanelle, which generally undergoes closure around the 18th month of life." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Premature anterior fontanel closure
is_a_string: HP:0000236 ! Abnormality of the anterior fontanelle
children.defn: "Early closure (ossification) of the anterior fontanelle, which generally undergoes closure around the 18th month of life." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the anterior fontanelle, i.e., the cranial fontanelle that is located at the intersection of the coronal and sagittal sutures." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Extra fontanelles
children.defn: "Bony defects situated along the cranial suture lines or at the junction of the bone plates of the skull." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Small fontanelle
children.defn: "A fontanelle that is small for age." [HPO:probinson, pmid:12825844]
"An abnormality of the fontanelle." [HPO:probinson, pmid:12825844]

children.name: Abnormality of cranial sutures
is_a_string: HP:0000235 ! Abnormality of the fontanelles or cranial sutures

children.name: Widely patent sagittal suture
children.defn: "The presence of a sagittal suture (the cranial suture that separates the left and right parietal bones) that is not ossified but rather wide open at an age when it is normally closed." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Wide cranial sutures
children.defn: "An abnormally increased width of the cranial sutures for age-related norms (generally resulting from delayed closure)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ridged cranial sutures
children.defn: "An overlap of the bony plates of the skull in an infant, with or without early closure." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Craniosynostosis
Lambdoidal craniosynostosis
Unilambdoid synostosis
Right unilambdoid synostosis
children.defn: "Premature synostosis of only the right lambdoid suture." [DDD:awilkie]

children.name: Left unilambdoid synostosis
children.defn: "Premature synostosis of only the left lambdoid suture." [DDD:awilkie]
"Premature synostosis of only one lambdoid suture." [DDD:awilkie]

children.name: Bilambdoid synostosis
children.defn: "Premature synostosis of both lambdoid sutures." [DDD:awilkie]
"A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the lambdoidal suture." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Multiple suture craniosynostosis
Pansynostosis
children.defn: "Craniosynostosis of all calvarial sutures." [DDD:awilkie]
"Craniosynostosis involving at least 2 cranial sutures, where the exact pattern of sutures fused has not been precisely specified." [DDD:awilkie]

children.name: Coronal craniosynostosis
Bicoronal synostosis
children.defn: "Synostosis affecting the right and the left coronal suture." [DDD:awilkie]

children.name: Unicoronal synostosis
Left unicoronal synostosis
children.defn: "Synostosis affecting only the left coronal suture." [DDD:awilkie]

children.name: Right unicoronal synostosis
children.defn: "Unicoronal synostosis affecting only the right coronal suture." [DDD:awilkie]
"Synostosis affecting only one of the coronal sutures." [DDD:awilkie]
"Premature closure of the coronal suture of skull." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Sagittal craniosynostosis
children.defn: "A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the sagittal suture." [HPO:probinson]

"Craniosynostosis refers to the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Primary craniosynostosis refers to the closure of one or more sutures due to abnormalities in skull development, and secondary craniosynostosis results from failure of brain growth." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Wormian bones
children.defn: "The presence of extra bones within a cranial suture. Wormian bones are irregular isolated bones which appear in addition to the usual centers of ossification of the cranium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Widely patent coronal suture
children.defn: "The presence of a coronal suture (the cranial suture that separates the frontal and parietal bones) that is not ossified but rather wide open at an age when it is normally closed." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Sclerotic cranial sutures
children.defn: "An increased density in the cranial sutures following obliteration." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormality of the metopic suture
Metopic suture patent to nasal root
is_a_string: HP:0005556 ! Abnormality of the metopic suture
children.defn: "The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone in infants and usually fuses by the age of six years. The suture runs from the bregma (the point on the skull at which the coronal suture is intersected perpendicularly by the sagittal suture) to the nasion or nasal root. This term applies if the suture is widely patent from bregma to nasal root." [HPO:probinson, pmid:11711818]

children.name: Metopic synostosis
is_a_string: HP:0005556 ! Abnormality of the metopic suture
children.defn: "Premature fusion of the metopic suture." [DDD:awilkie]

children.name: Prominent metopic ridge
is_a_string: HP:0005556 ! Abnormality of the metopic suture
children.defn: "Vertical bony ridge positioned in the midline of the forehead." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Metopic depression
is_a_string: HP:0005556 ! Abnormality of the metopic suture
children.defn: "Linear vertical groove in the midline of the forehead, extending from hairline to glabella." [pmid:19125436]

"The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone of the skull in infants and children and generally undergoes fusion by the age of six. A persistent frontal suture is referred to as a \"metopic suture\"." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Accessory cranial suture
children.defn: "A cranial suture that is in addition to canonical membrane-covered openings in the incompletely ossified skull of the fetus or newborn infant." [HPO:probinson, pmid:20496093]

children.name: Delayed cranial suture closure
children.defn: "Infants normally have two fontanels at birth, the diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle at the junction of the coronal and sagittal sutures, and the posterior fontanelle at the intersection of the occipital and parietal bones. The posterior fontanelle usually closes by the 8th week of life, and the anterior fontanel closes by the 18th month of life on average. This term applies if there is delay of closure of the fontanelles beyond the normal age." [HPO:probinson]
"Any anomaly of a cranial suture, that is one of the six membrane-covered openings in the incompletely ossified skull of the fetus or newborn infant." [HPO:probinson]

"Any abnormality of the fontanelles (the regions covered by a thick membrane that normally ossify in the first two years of life) or the cranial sutures (the fibrous joints in which the articulating bones or cartilages of the skull are connected by sutural ligaments )." [HPO:probinson, pmid:12825844]

children.name: Thin calvarium

children.name: Calvarial hyperostosis

"Excessive growth of the bones of cranium, i.e., of the skull." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Decreased calvarial ossification

children.name: Parietal bossing

children.name: Cranial asymmetry

children.name: Turricephaly

children.name: Dolichocephaly

Alternatively, an apparently increased antero-posterior length of the head compared to width. Often due to premature closure of the sagittal suture." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Broad skull

children.name: Thickened calvaria

"Abnormality of the calvaria, which is the roof of the skull formed by the frontal bone, parietal bones, and occipital bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the temporal bone

"Cleft of the soft palate (also known as the velum, or muscular palate) as a result of a developmental defect occurring between the 7th and 12th week of pregnancy. Cleft soft palate can cause functional abnormalities of the Eustachian tube with resulting middle ear anomalies and hearing difficulties, as well as speech problems associated with hypernasal speech due to velopharyngeal insufficiency." [HPO:curators]

"The presence of a cleft in the oral cavity, the two main types of which are cleft lip and cleft palate. In cleft lip, there is the congenital failure of the maxillary and median nasal processes to fuse, forming a groove or fissure in the lip. In cleft palate, there is a congenital failure of the palate to fuse properly, forming a grooved depression or fissure in the roof of the mouth. Clefts of the lip and palate can occur individually or together. It is preferable to code each defect separately." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Dental malocclusion

"Abnormal alignment, positioning, or spacing of the teeth, i.e., misaligned teeth." [HPO:ibailleulforestier]

children.name: Abnormality of dental structure

children.name: Narrow mouth

children.name: Palpebral edema

children.name: Blepharochalasis
children.defn: "Blepharochalasis is characterized by recurrent, non-painful, nonerythematous episodes of eyelid edema. It has been divided into hypertrophic and atrophic forms. In the hypertrophic form recurrent edema results in orbital fat herniation through a weakened orbital septum. Most patients who have blepharochalasis present in an atrophic condition with atrophy of redundant eyelid skin and superior nasal fat pads." [PMID:3207663]

children.name: Lower eyelid edema

"Edema in the region of the eyelids." [HPO:probinson]

"A fold of skin starting above the medial aspect of the upper eyelid and arching downward to cover, pass in front of and lateral to the medial canthus." [HPO:probinson]

children.defn: "Partial fusion of the upper and lower eyelid margins by single or multiple bands of tissue." [pmid:18125427]

children.name: Accessory eyelid
children.defn: "The presence of more than the normal number of eyelids." [GOC:MG]

children.name: Symblepharon
children.defn: "A partial or complete adhesion of the palpebral conjunctiva of the eyelid to the bulbar conjunctiva of the eyeball." [GOC:MG, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symblepharon]

children.name: Slanting of the palpebral fissure
is_a_string: HP:0008050 ! Abnormality of the palpebral fissures

children.name: Downslanted palpebral fissures
is_a_string: HP:0200006 ! Slanting of the palpebral fissure
children.defn: "The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations below the mean." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Upslanted palpebral fissure
is_a_string: HP:0200006 ! Slanting of the palpebral fissure
children.defn: "The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, the inclination of the palpebral fissure is greater than typical for age." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Abnormal size of the palpebral fissures
is_a_string: HP:0008050 ! Abnormality of the palpebral fissures

children.name: Small palpebral fissure
is_a_string: HP:0200007 ! Abnormal size of the palpebral fissures

children.name: Short palpebral fissure
is_a_string: HP:0200007 ! Abnormal size of the palpebral fissures
children.defn: "Distance between the medial and lateral canthi is more than 2 SD below the mean for age (objective); or, apparently reduced length of the palpebral fissures." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Blepharophimosis
is_a_string: HP:0200007 ! Abnormal size of the palpebral fissures

children.name: Unilateral narrow palpebral fissure
children.defn: "A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures on one side only." [HPO:probinson]
"A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Long palpebral fissure
is_a_string: HP:0200007 ! Abnormal size of the palpebral fissures
children.defn: "Distance between medial and lateral canthi is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, apparently increased length of the palpebral fissures." [pmid:19125427]
"An abnormal size of the palpebral fissures for example unusually long or short palpebral fissures." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure
is_a_string: HP:0008050 ! Abnormality of the palpebral fissures

children.name: Almond-shaped palpebral fissure
is_a_string: HP:0200005 ! Abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure
children.defn: "A shape created by an acute downward arching of the upper eyelid and upward arching of the lower eyelid, toward the medial canthus, which gives the outline of the palpebral fissures the configuration of an almond. Thus, the maximum distance between the fissures is offset from, and medial to, the center point." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: S-shaped palpebral fissures
is_a_string: HP:0200005 ! Abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure

children.defn: "The presence of an abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Euryblepharon
children.defn: "Euryblepharon is a congenital eyelid anomaly characterized by horizontal enlargement of the palpebral fissure. The eyelid is shortened vertically compared with the horizontal dimension, with associated lateral canthal malpositioning and lateral ectropion abnormally wide lid opening." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15249382, pmid:15530943, pmid:24719364]

children.name: Cleft eyelid
Upper eyelid coloboma
children.defn: "A short discontinuity of the margin of the upper eyelid." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lower eyelid coloboma
children.defn: "A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower eyelid." [HPO:probinson]
"A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower or upper eyelid." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Entropion
children.defn: "An inward turning (inversion) of the eyelid margin." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Blepharospasm
children.defn: "A focal dystonia that affects the muscles of the eyelids and brow, associated with involuntary recurrent spasm of both eyelids." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Blepharitis
is_a_string: HP:0100533 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the eye
children.defn: "Inflammation of the eyelids." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lagopthalmos
Cicatricial lagophthalmos
children.defn: "A type of lagophthalmos that occurs following trauma or surgery." []

children.name: Paralytic lagophthalmos
children.defn: "A type of lagophthalmos that occurs in association with facial nerve palsy." []

children.name: Nocturnal lagophthalmos
children.defn: "The inability to close the eyelids during sleep." []
"A condition in which the eyelids do not close to cover the eye completely. " []

children.name: Epiblepharon
children.defn: "Redundant eyelid skin pressing the eyelashes against the cornea and/or conjunctiva." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the eyelid
Hypoplasia of the lower eyelids
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the lower eyelid." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ablepharon

"Absence or underdevelopment of the eyelid." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the eyelids." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of globe size
is_a_string: HP:0000284 ! Abnormality of the ocular region
HP:0000315 ! Abnormality of the orbital region

children.name: Cryptophthalmos
children.defn: "Cryptophthalmos is a condition of total absence of eyelids and the skin of forehead is continuous with that of cheek, in which the eyeball is completely concealed by the skin, which is stretched over the orbital cavity." [HPO:curators, pmid:19125427]

children.name: Anophthalmia
True anophthalmia
children.defn: "Absence of globe, optic nerve, chiasm and optic tracts.  No evidence of ocular tissue on MRI scan or examination." [DDD:ncarter]
"Absence of the globe or eyeball." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Microphthalmos

children.defn: "A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of both eyes." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Unilateral microphthalmos

"A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of one or both eyes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Large eyes
children.defn: "Increased size of the  ocular globe (eyeball)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Increased axial globe length
children.defn: "Abnormal largeness of the eye with an axial length > 2.5 standard deviations from population mean." [DDD:ncarter]
"An abnormality in the size of the ocular globe (eyeball)." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormality of globe location
is_a_string: HP:0000284 ! Abnormality of the ocular region
HP:0000315 ! Abnormality of the orbital region

children.name: Hypertelorism
children.defn: "Interpupillary distance more than 2 SD above the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an increased interpupillary distance or widely spaced eyes)." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Proptosis

children.name: Hypotelorism
children.defn: "Interpupillary distance less than 2 SD below the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an decreased interpupillary distance or closely spaced eyes)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125427]

children.name: Cyclopia
children.defn: "Cyclopia is a congenital abnormality in which there is only one eye. That eye is centrally placed in the area normally occupied by the root of the nose." [DDD:ncarter]
"An abnormality in the placement of the ocular globe (eyeball)." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Ocular pain
is_a_string: HP:0000284 ! Abnormality of the ocular region
children.defn: "An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the eye." []

children.name: Decreased facial expression

children.name: Myopathic facies
children.defn: "A facial appearance characteristic of myopathic conditions. The face appears expressionless with sunken cheeks, bilateral ptosis, and inability to elevate the corners of the mouth, due to muscle weakness." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Mask-like facies
children.defn: "A lack of facial expression often with staring eyes and a slightly open mouth." [HPO:probinson]
"A reduced degree of voluntary and involuntary facial movements involved in responded to others or expressing emotions." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Disturbance of facial expression

children.defn: "Sudden, repetitive, nonrhythmic motor movements (spasms), involving the eyes and muscles of the face." [DDD:cwright]
"An abnormality of the gestures or movements executed with the facial muscles with which emotions such as fear, joy, sadness, surprise, and disgust can be expressed." [DDD:cwright]

This is a general term describing inability to smell arising in any part of the process of smelling from absorption of odorants into the nasal mucous overlying the olfactory epithelium, diffusion to the cilia, binding to olfactory receptor sites, generation of action potentials in olfactory neurons, and perception of a smell." [HPO:probinson]

children.defn: "Increased distance between the attachments of the alae nasi to the face." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19152422]

children.name: Narrow nasal base
children.defn: "Decreased distance between the attachments of the alae nasi to the face." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19152422]

"An anomaly of the nasal base, which can be conceived of as an imaginary line between the most lateral points of the external inferior attachments of the alae nasi to the face." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19152422]

children.name: Abnormality of the nasal bridge
Short nasal bridge
is_a_string: HP:0000422 ! Abnormality of the nasal bridge

children.name: Wide nasal bridge
is_a_string: HP:0000422 ! Abnormality of the nasal bridge
children.defn: "Increased breadth of the nasal bridge (and with it, the nasal root)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19152422]

children.name: Absent nasal bridge
is_a_string: HP:0000422 ! Abnormality of the nasal bridge

children.name: Hypoplastic nasal bridge
is_a_string: HP:0000422 ! Abnormality of the nasal bridge

children.name: Depressed nasal bridge
is_a_string: HP:0000422 ! Abnormality of the nasal bridge
children.defn: "Posterior positioning of the nasal root in relation to the overall facial profile for age." [pmid:19152422]

children.name: Narrow nasal bridge
is_a_string: HP:0000422 ! Abnormality of the nasal bridge
children.defn: "Decreased width of the bony bridge of the nose." [pmid:19152422]

children.name: Prominent nasal bridge
is_a_string: HP:0000422 ! Abnormality of the nasal bridge
children.defn: "Anterior positioning of the nasal root in comparison to the usual positioning for age." [pmid:19152422]

"Abnormality of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose. It lies between the glabella and the inferior boundary of the nasal bone, and extends laterally to the inner canthi." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19152422]

children.name: Epistaxis
children.defn: "Epistaxis, or nosebleed, refers to a hemorrhage localized in thenose." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the nose." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal facial shape
Round face
children.defn: "The facial appearance is more circular than usual as viewed from the front." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Coarse facial features
Pugilistic facies
children.defn: "Coarse facial features reminiscent of those of a boxer." [HPO:probinson]

"Absence of fine and sharp appearance of brows, nose, lips, mouth, and chin, usually because of rounded and heavy features or thickened skin with or without thickening of subcutaneous and bony tissues." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Potter facies
children.defn: "A facial appearance characteristic of a fetus or neonate due to oligohydramnios experienced in the womb, comprising ocular hypertelorism, low-set ears, receding chin, and flattening of the nose." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Flat face
children.defn: "Absence of concavity or convexity of the face when viewed in profile." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Triangular face
children.defn: "Facial contour, as viewed from the front, triangular in shape, with breadth at the temples and tapering to a narrow chin." [DDD:jclayton-smith, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Facial asymmetry
Hemifacial atrophy
children.defn: "Unilateral atrophy of facial tissues, including muscles, bones and skin." [DDD:awilkie]

children.name: Hemifacial hypoplasia
children.defn: "Unilateral underdevelopment of the  facial tissues, including muscles and bones." [DDD:awilkie]

children.name: Asymmetric crying face
children.defn: "Asymmetry observed in the face of a neonate or infant whose face appears symmetric at rest and asymmetric during crying as the mouth is pulled downward on one side while not moving on the other side." [HPO:cwright]

children.name: Hemifacial hypertrophy
children.defn: "Unilateral overgrowth of facial tissues, including muscles, bones and skin." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormal difference between the left and right sides of the face." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Square face
children.defn: "Facial contours, as viewed from the front, show a broad upper face/cranium and lower face/mandible, creating a square appearance." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Oval face
children.defn: "A face with a rounded and slightly elongated outline." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Elfin facies
children.defn: "This is a description previously used to describe a facial form characterized by a short, upturned nose, wide mouth, widely spaced eyes, and full cheeks. Because of the imprecision in this definition it is preferable to describe these features precisely. This term is retained because it was often used in the past, but it should not be used for new annotations." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Doll-like facies
children.defn: "A characteristic facial appearance with a round facial form, full cheeks, a short nose, and a relatively small chin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Long face
children.defn: "Facial height (length) is more than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, an apparent increase in the height (length) of the face (subjective)." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Broad face
children.defn: "Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width greater than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or an apparent increase in the width of the face (subjective)." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Small face
Short face
children.defn: "Facial height (length) is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or an apparent decrease in the height (length) of the face (subjective)." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Narrow face
children.defn: "Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width are both more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or, an apparent reduction in the width of the upper and lower face (subjective)." [pmid:19125436]
"A face that is short (HP:0011219) and narrow (HP:0000275)." [HP:probinson]
"An abnormal morphology (form) of the face or its components." [DDD:jclayton-smith]

children.name: Infra-orbital fold
is_a_string: HP:0000315 ! Abnormality of the orbital region
children.defn: "Elevated ridge(s) of skin starting well below the medial aspect of the lower lid that curves gradually upward toward and/or across the nasal bridge." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Orbital cyst
is_a_string: HP:0000315 ! Abnormality of the orbital region
children.defn: "Presence of a cyst in the region of the orbita. Orbital cysts can be derived from epithelial or glandular tissue within or surrounding the orbit (lacrimal glands, salivary glands, conjunctival, oral, nasal, or sinus epithelium)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Infra-orbital crease
is_a_string: HP:0000315 ! Abnormality of the orbital region
children.defn: "Skin crease extending from below the inner canthus laterally along the malar process of the maxilla and zygoma." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Abnormality of the supraorbital ridges
is_a_string: HP:0000315 ! Abnormality of the orbital region

children.name: Prominent supraorbital ridges
is_a_string: HP:0100538 ! Abnormality of the supraorbital ridges
children.defn: "Greater than average forward and/or lateral protrusion of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Underdeveloped supraorbital ridges
is_a_string: HP:0100538 ! Abnormality of the supraorbital ridges
children.defn: "Flatness of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones." [HPO:curators, pmid:19125436]
"An anomaly of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the chin
Cleft of chin
children.defn: "Incomplete fusion of the chin, resulting from a developmental defect and manifesting as a midline cleft or fissure of the chin." [DDD:jclayton-smith]

children.name: Broad chin
children.defn: "Increased width of the midpoint of the mandible (mental protuberance) and overlying soft tissue." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Chin with horizontal crease
children.defn: "Horizontal crease or fold situated below the vermilion border of the lower lip and above the fatty pad of the chin, with the face at rest." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Chin with H-shaped crease
children.defn: "H-shaped crease in the fat pad of the chin." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Short chin
children.defn: "Decreased vertical distance from the vermilion border of the lower lip to the inferior-most point of the chin." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Tall chin
children.defn: "Increased vertical distance from the vermillion border of the lower lip to the inferior-most point of the chin." [eom:96d8ca16a3c80216, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Chin with vertical crease
children.defn: "Vertical crease fold situated below the vermilion border of the lower lip and above the fatty pad of the chin with the face at rest." [eom:8a5493c72e0dd13c, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Pointed chin
children.defn: "A marked tapering of the lower face to the chin." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Chin dimple
children.defn: "A persistent midline depression of the skin over the fat pad of the chin." [pmid:19125436]
"An abnormality of the chin, i.e., of the inferior portion of the face lying inferior to the lower lip and including the central prominence of the lower jaw." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Abnormality of the midface
Sunken cheeks
children.defn: "Lack or loss of the soft tissues between the zygomata and mandible." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Full cheeks
children.defn: "Increased prominence or roundness of soft tissues between zygomata and mandible." [DDD:awilkie]

children.name: Malar anomaly
is_a_string: HP:0005557 ! Abnormality of the zygomatic arch

children.name: Malar prominence
children.defn: "Prominence of the malar process of the maxilla and infraorbital area appreciated in profile and from in front of the face." [DDD:jclayton-smith]
"An anomaly of frontal process of maxilla." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Midface retrusion
children.defn: "Posterior positions and/or vertical shortening of the infraorbital and perialar regions, or increased concavity of the face and/or reduced nasolabial angle." [DDD:jclayton-smith, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Abnormality of the zygomatic arch
Abnormality of the zygomatic bone
is_a_string: HP:0005557 ! Abnormality of the zygomatic arch

children.name: Cheekbone prominence
is_a_string: HP:0010668 ! Abnormality of the zygomatic bone
children.defn: "Enlargement of the zygomatic process of the temporal bone of the skull, which forms the middle and lateral inferior orbital margin." [pmid:19125436]
"An abnormality of the zygomatic bone." [HPO:curators]
"An abnormality of the zygomatic arch, also known as the cheek bone." [HPO:probinson]

"An anomaly of the midface, which is a region and not an anatomical term. It extends, superiorly, from the inferior orbital margin to, inferiorly, the level of nasal base. It is formed by the maxilla (upper jaw) and zygoma. Traditionally, the nose and premaxilla are not included in the midface." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Facial cleft
Midline facial cleft
children.defn: "A congenital malformation with a cleft (gap or opening) in the midline of the face." [HPO:probinson]
"A congenital malformation with a cleft (gap or opening) in the face." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Facial edema
is_a_string: HP:0011799 ! Abnormality of facial soft tissue

children.name: Abnormality of facial musculature
is_a_string: HP:0011799 ! Abnormality of facial soft tissue

children.name: Facial muscle hypertrophy
children.defn: "Muscle hypertrophy affecting the facial muscles." [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Facial myokymia
children.defn: "Facial myokymia is a fine fibrillary activity of the facial muscles." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Facial palsy
is_a_string: HP:0010827 ! Abnormality of the seventh cranial nerve

children.name: Facial diplegia
Congenital facial diplegia
children.defn: "Facial diplegia (that is, bilateral facial palsy) with congenital onset)." [HPO:curators]
"Facial diplegia refers to bilateral facial palsy (bilateral facial palsy is much rarer than unilateral facial palsy)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Unilateral facial palsy
children.defn: "One-sided weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Frontalis muscle weakness
children.defn: "Reduced strength of the frontalis muscle (which is located on the forehead)." [HPO:curators]

"Facial nerve palsy is a dysfunction of cranial nerve VII (the facial nerve) that results in inability to control facial muscles on the affected side with weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure. This can either be present in unilateral or bilateral form." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Facial paralysis
children.defn: "Complete loss of ability to move facial muscles innervated by the facial nerve (i.e., the seventh cranial nerve)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Weakness of orbicularis oculi muscle
children.defn: "Reduced strength of the orbicularis oculi, the circumorbital muscle in the face that closes the eyelid." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of facial adipose tissue
is_a_string: HP:0011799 ! Abnormality of facial soft tissue

children.name: Increased facial adipose tissue
is_a_string: HP:0000291 ! Abnormality of facial adipose tissue
children.defn: "An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue in the face." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Loss of facial adipose tissue
is_a_string: HP:0000291 ! Abnormality of facial adipose tissue

children.name: Progressive loss of facial adipose tissue
is_a_string: HP:0000292 ! Loss of facial adipose tissue

children.defn: "Loss of normal subcutaneous fat tissue in the face." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormality of the forehead
Small forehead
children.defn: "The presence of a forehead that is abnormally small." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Broad forehead
children.defn: "Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently increased distance between the two sides of the forehead." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Abnormality of the glabella
Prominent glabella
children.defn: "Forward protrusion of the glabella." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125436]

children.name: Depressed glabella
children.defn: "Posterior positioning of the glabella, i.e., of the midline forehead between the supraorbital ridges." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125436]
"An abnormality of the glabella." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: High forehead
children.defn: "An abnormally increased height of the forehead." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Narrow forehead
children.defn: "Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or apparently narrow intertemporal region (subjective)." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Sloping forehead
children.defn: "Inclination of the anterior surface of the forehead from the vertical more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently excessive posterior sloping of the forehead in a lateral view." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Flat forehead
children.defn: "A forehead with abnormal flatness." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Vertical forehead creases
children.defn: "Vertical soft tissue creases in the midline of the forehead, often extending from the hairline to the brow, and seen with facial expression or when the face is at rest." [pmid:19125436]

children.name: Prominent forehead
children.defn: "Forward prominence of the entire forehead, due to protrusion of the frontal bone." [pmid:19125436]
"An anomalyof the forehead." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the face." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the head." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the neck
is_a_string: HP:0000152 ! Abnormality of head or neck

children.name: Abnormality of the musculature of the neck
Congenital muscular torticollis
is_a_string: HP:0011006 ! Abnormality of the musculature of the neck
children.defn: "A congenital form of torticollis resulting from shortening of the sternocleidomastoid muscle and leading to a limited range of motion in both rotation and lateral bending." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Torticollis
is_a_string: HP:0011006 ! Abnormality of the musculature of the neck
HP:0011442 ! Abnormality of central motor function

children.name: Retrocollis
children.defn: "A form of torticollis in which the head is drawn back, either due to a permanent contractures of neck extensor muscles, or to a spasmodic contracture." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17917462]
"Involuntary contractions of the neck musculature resulting in an abnormal posture of or abnormal movements of the head." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Neck muscle hypertrophy
is_a_string: HP:0011006 ! Abnormality of the musculature of the neck
children.defn: "Muscle hypertrophy affecting the muscles of the neck." [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Neck muscle weakness
is_a_string: HP:0011006 ! Abnormality of the musculature of the neck

children.name: Neck flexor weakness
children.defn: "Weakness of the muscles involved in neck flexion (sternocleidomastoid, longus capitus, longus colli, and scalenus anterior)." [HPO:curators]
"Decreased strength of the neck musculature." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the neck musculature." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Restricted neck movement due to contractures
Short neck
is_a_string: HP:0003319 ! Abnormality of the cervical spine
children.defn: "Diminished length of the neck." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Long neck
children.defn: "Increased inferior-superior length of the neck." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Broad neck
children.defn: "Increased side-to-side width of the neck." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thickened nuchal skin fold
children.defn: "A thickening of the skin thickness in the posterior aspect of the fetal neck. A nuchal fold measurement is obtained in a transverse section of the fetal head at the level of the cavum septum pellucidum and thalami, angled posteriorly to include the cerebellum. The measurement is taken from the outer edge of the occiput bone to the outer skin limit directly in the midline. A measurement 6 mm or more is considered significant between 18 and 24 weeks and a measurement of 5 mm or more is considered significant at 16 to 18 weeks (pmid:16100637)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16100637]

children.name: Cystic hygroma
Fetal cystic hygroma
children.defn: "The presence during the prenatal period of a cystic mass with multiple septa with multiple, asymmetric, thin-walled cysts near the posterior aspect of the neck. Fetal cystic hygroma can be defined as nuchal translucency with or without septations measuring greater than 3.0 mm." [emedicine:402757, HPO:probinson]
"A cystic lymphatic lesion of the neck." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Branchial anomaly
Branchial sinus
children.defn: "A congenital branchial sinus is a remnant of the embryonic branchial arches and their intervening clefts and pouches that has failed to regress completely. Sinuses typically have their external orifice inferior to the ramus of the mandible. They may traverse the parotid gland, and run in close vicinity to the facial nerve in the external auditory canal." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Branchial cyst
children.defn: "A branchial cyst is a remnant of embryonic development resulting from a failure of obliteration of a branchial cleft and consists of a subcutaneous cystic mass. Cysts are located anterior or posterior to the ear or in the submandibular region." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Branchial fistula
children.defn: "A congenital fistula in the neck resulting from incomplete closure of a branchial cleft." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Congenital developmental defect arising from the primitive branchial apparatus." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Neck muscle hypoplasia
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of muscles of the neck." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Increased adipose tissue around the neck
children.defn: "An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue around the neck." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the neck." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of head and neck." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the endocrine system
Puberty and gonadal disorders
is_a_string: HP:0000818 ! Abnormality of the endocrine system

children.name: Absence of secondary sex characteristics
children.defn: "No secondary sexual characteristics are present at puberty." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Dysmenorrhea
children.defn: " Pain during menstruation that interferes with daily activities." [ISBN:0-7216-0179-0]

children.name: Androgen insufficiency
children.defn: "Insufficient amount of androgenic activity." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Early onset of sexual maturation
Premature adrenarche
is_a_string: HP:0100000 ! Early onset of sexual maturation
children.defn: "Onset of adrenarche at an earlier age than usual." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Precocious puberty
is_a_string: HP:0100000 ! Early onset of sexual maturation

children.name: Precocious puberty in males
children.defn: "The onset of puberty before the age of 9 years in boys." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Premature thelarche
children.defn: "Premature development of the breasts." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Premature pubarche
children.defn: "The onset of growth of pubic hair at an earlier age than normal." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Precocious puberty in females
children.defn: "The onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls." [HPO:probinson]

"The onset of secondary sexual characteristics before a normal age. Although it is difficult to define normal age ranges because of the marked variation with which puberty begins in normal children, precocious puberty can be defined as the onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls or 9 years in boys." [HPO:probinson]
"An early onset of puberty, in this case early does not refer to precocious." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Delayed puberty
children.defn: "Passing the age when puberty normally occurs with no physical or hormonal signs of the onset of puberty." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Adrenogenital syndrome
children.defn: "Adrenogenital syndrome is also known as congenital adrenal hyperplasia, which results from disorders of steroid hormone production in the adrenal glands leading to a deficiency of cortisol. The pituitary gland reacts by increased secretion of corticotropin, which in turn causes the adrenal glands to overproduce certain intermediary hormones which have testosterone-like effects." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal testosterone level
Increased testosterone
children.defn: "An elevated circulating testosterone level in the blood." []
"An anomalous concentration of testosterone in the blood." []

children.name: Neoplasm of the endocrine system
is_a_string: HP:0000818 ! Abnormality of the endocrine system

children.name: Pancreatic islet cell adenoma
is_a_string: HP:0006476 ! Abnormality of the pancreatic islet cells
HP:0100568 ! Neoplasm of the endocrine system

children.name: Multiple pancreatic beta-cell adenomas
children.defn: "The presence of multiple pancreatic islet cell adenomas." [HPO:probinsojn]

children.name: Insulinoma
children.defn: "A type of tumor of the pancreatic beta cells that secretes excess insulin and can result in hypoglycemia." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of an adenoma of the pancreas with origin in a pancreatic B cell." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Neoplasm of the adrenal gland
is_a_string: HP:0100568 ! Neoplasm of the endocrine system

children.name: Neoplasm of the adrenal cortex
is_a_string: HP:0100631 ! Neoplasm of the adrenal gland

children.name: Adrenocortical carcinoma
is_a_string: HP:0100641 ! Neoplasm of the adrenal cortex
children.defn: "A malignant neoplasm of the adrenal cortex that may produce hormones such as cortisol, aldosterone, estrogen, or testosterone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Adrenocortical adenoma
is_a_string: HP:0100641 ! Neoplasm of the adrenal cortex

children.name: Non-secretory adrenocortical adenoma
children.defn: "An hormonally inactive adrenocortical adenoma, that is, an adenoma that does not secrete excessive amounts of adrenal hormones." [DDD:spark]

children.name: Secretory adrenocortical adenoma
children.defn: "An hormonally active adrenocortical adenoma, that is, an adenoma that secretes excessive amounts of adrenal hormones." [DDD:spark]
"Adrenocortical adenomas are benign tumors of the adrenal cortex." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17287480]
"The presence of a neoplasm of the adrenal cortex." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Neoplasm of the adrenal medulla
is_a_string: HP:0100631 ! Neoplasm of the adrenal gland

children.name: Adrenal pheochromocytoma
is_a_string: HP:0100642 ! Neoplasm of the adrenal medulla
children.defn: "Pheochromocytoma originating from the adrenal medulla." [HPO:curators]
"The presence of a neoplasm of the adrenal medulla." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a neoplasm of the adrenal gland." [DDD:rscott]

children.name: Pinealoma
is_a_string: HP:0100568 ! Neoplasm of the endocrine system
HP:0100835 ! Benign neoplasm of the central nervous system
HP:0100836 ! Malignant neoplasm of the central nervous system
children.defn: "A neoplasm of the pineal gland." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Neoplasm of the parathyroid gland
is_a_string: HP:0011766 ! Abnormality of the parathyroid morphology
HP:0100568 ! Neoplasm of the endocrine system

children.name: Parathyroid adenoma
is_a_string: HP:0100733 ! Neoplasm of the parathyroid gland
children.defn: "A benign tumor of the parathyroid gland that can cause hyperparathyroidism." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Parathyroid carcinoma
is_a_string: HP:0100733 ! Neoplasm of the parathyroid gland
children.defn: "A malignancy of the parathyroid glands. Parathyroid carcinoma usually secretes parathyroid hormone, leading to hyperparathyroidism." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a neoplasm (tumour) in the parathyroid gland." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Carcinoid
is_a_string: HP:0100568 ! Neoplasm of the endocrine system

children.name: Intestinal carcinoid
is_a_string: HP:0007378 ! Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract

children.name: Small intestine carcinoid
is_a_string: HP:0100833 ! Neoplasm of the small intestine

children.defn: "A tumor formed from the endocrine (argentaffin) cells of the mucosal lining of a variety of organs including the stomach and intestine. These cells are from neuroectodermal origin." [HPO:sdoelkens]

children.name: Neoplasm of the thyroid gland
is_a_string: HP:0100568 ! Neoplasm of the endocrine system

children.name: Thyroid adenoma
is_a_string: HP:0100031 ! Neoplasm of the thyroid gland

children.name: Hurthle cell thyroid adenoma
children.defn: "A kind of thyroid adenoma characterized by the presence of oxyphil cells." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a adenoma of the thyroid gland." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thyroid carcinoma
is_a_string: HP:0100031 ! Neoplasm of the thyroid gland

children.name: Medullary thyroid carcinoma
children.defn: "The presence of a medullary carcinoma of the thyroid gland." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Follicular thyroid carcinoma
children.defn: "The presence of an follicular adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Papillary thyroid carcinoma
children.defn: "The presence of a papillary adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a carcinoma of the thyroid gland." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a neoplasm of the thyroid gland." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Neoplasm of the anterior pituitary
is_a_string: HP:0011747 ! Abnormality of the anterior pituitary
HP:0100568 ! Neoplasm of the endocrine system

children.name: Pituitary carcinoma
is_a_string: HP:0011750 ! Neoplasm of the anterior pituitary
children.defn: "A pituitary tumor with subarachnoid, brain, or systemic metastasis. The diagnosis of a pituitary carcinoma requires evidence of metastatic disease, either outside the central nervous system (CNS) or as separate noncontiguous foci within the CNS." [DDD:spark, pmid:15741248]

children.name: Pituitary adenoma

children.name: Pituitary corticotropic cell adenoma

children.name: Pituitary null cell adenoma
children.defn: "A type of pituitary adenoma that is of unknown cellular origin and that lacks immunocytochemical or fine structural markers.  Null cell adenomas are not associated with hormone excess." [DDD:spark]

children.name: Pituitary growth hormone cell adenoma

children.name: Pituitary thyrotropic cell adenoma

children.name: Macroprolactinoma
