"A type of pituitary adenoma originating in prolactin secreting cells. This kind of adenoma is characterized by overproduction of prolactin, and may cause loss of menstrual periods and breast milk production in women." [DDD:spark]
"A benign epithelial tumor derived from intrinsic cells of the adenohypophysis." [DDD:spark]

children.name: Pituitary spindle cell oncocytoma

Pituitary spindle cell oncocytomas are firm, fibrous, and adherent to surrounding structures and are highly vascular." [DDD:spark, pmid:21886889]
"The presence of a neoplasm (tumour) in the adenohypophysis, which is also known as the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland." [DDD:spark]

children.name: Pheochromocytoma

"Pheochromocytomas (also known as chromaffin tumors) produce, store, and secrete catecholamines. Pheochromocytomas usually originate from the adrenal medulla but may also develop from chromaffin cells in or about sympathetic ganglia. A common symptom of pheochromocytoma is hypertension owing to release of catecholamines." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypercortisolism

children.defn: "Hypercortisolemia associated with a primary defect of the adrenal gland leading to overproduction of cortisol." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Secondary hypercorticolism
children.defn: "Hypercortisolemia associated with a overproduction of ACTH (often from a tumor), leading secondarily to overproduction of cortisol." [HPO:probinson]

"Overproduction of the hormone of cortisol by the adrenal cortex, resulting in a characteristic combination of clinical symptoms termed Cushing syndrome, with truncal obesity, a round, full face, striae atrophicae and acne, muscle weakness, and other features." [DDD:spark, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hyperaldosteronism
Secondary hyperaldosteronism

children.name: Primary hyperaldosteronism

children.name: Dexamethasone-suppresible primary hyperaldosteronism

children.name: Central adrenal insufficiency

children.name: Diabetes mellitus
is_a_string: HP:0000818 ! Abnormality of the endocrine system

children.name: Maternal diabetes
children.defn: "Maternal diabetes can either be a gestational, mostly type 2 diabetes, or a type 1 diabetes. Essential is the resulting maternal hyperglycemia as a non-specific teratogen, imposing the same risk of congenital malformations to pregnant women with both type 1 and type2 diabetes." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Diabetic ketoacidosis
children.defn: "A type of diabetic metabolic abnormality with an accumulation of ketone bodies." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Maturity-onset diabetes of the young
children.defn: "The term Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) was initially used for patients diagnosed with fasting hyperglycemia that could be treated without insulin for more than two years, where the initial diagnosis was made at a young age (under 25 years). Thus, MODY combines characteristics of type 1 diabetes (young age at diagnosis) and type 2 diabetes (less insulin dependence than type 1 diabetes). The term MODY is now most often used to refer to a group of monogenic diseases with these characteristics. Here, the term is used to describe hyperglycemia diagnosed at a young age with no or minor insulin dependency, no evidence of insulin resistence, and lack of evidence of autoimmune destruction of the beta cells." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Type II diabetes mellitus
Insulin-dependent but ketosis-resistant diabetes
children.defn: "Ketosis-resistant diabetes is a synonym for type II diabetes. This term thus refers to a form of type II diabetes in which patients are dependent on insulin." [HPO:probinson]
"A type of diabetes mellitus initially characterized by insulin resistance and hyperinsulinemia and subsequently by glucose interolerance and hyperglycemia." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Insulin-resistant diabetes mellitus
children.defn: "A type of diabetes mellitus related not to lack of insulin but rather to lack of response to insulin on the part of the target tissues of insulin such as muscle, fat, and liver cells. This type of diabetes is typically associated with increases both in blood glucose concentrations as will as in fasting and postprandial serum insulin levels." [HPO:probinson, pmid:7706500]

children.name: Type I diabetes mellitus
children.defn: "A chronic condition in which the pancreas produces little or no insulin. Type I diabetes mellitus is manifested by the sudden onset of severe hyperglycemia with rapid progression to diabetic ketoacidosis unless treated with insulin." [HPO:probinson]
"A group of abnormalities characterized by hyperglycemia and glucose intolerance." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced pancreatic beta cells

children.name: Pancreatic islet-cell hyperplasia
is_a_string: HP:0006476 ! Abnormality of the pancreatic islet cells
children.defn: "Hyperplasia of the islets of Langerhans, i.e., of the regions of the pancreas that contain its endocrine cells." [HPO:probinson]

"An abnormality of the islet of Langerhans, i.e., of the regions of the pancreas that contain its endocrine cells. These are the alpha cells, which produce glucagon, the beta cells, which produce insulin and amylin, the delta cells, which produce somatostatin, the PP cells, which produce pancreatic polypeptide, and the epsilon cells, which produce ghrelin." [HPO:probinson]
"A function abnormality of the endocrine pancreas." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Diabetes insipidus

children.name: Nephrogenic diabetes insipidus

children.name: Central diabetes insipidus
is_a_string: HP:0011751 ! Abnormality of the posterior pituitary
children.defn: "A form of diabetes insipidus related to a failure of vasopressin (AVP) release from the hypothalamus." [HPO:curators]

"A state of excessive water intake and hypotonic (dilute) polyuria. Diabetes insipidus may be due to failure of vasopressin (AVP) release (central or neurogenic diabetes insipidus) or to a failure of the kidney to respond to AVP (nephrogenic diabetes insipidus)." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Hyperthyroidism
Graves disease
children.defn: "An autoimmune disease where the thyroid is overactive, producing an excessive amount of thyroid hormones (a serious metabolic imbalance known as hyperthyroidism and thyrotoxicosis). This is caused by autoantibodies to the TSH-receptor (TSHR-Ab) that activate that TSH-receptor (TSHR), thereby stimulating thyroid hormone synthesis and secretion, and thyroid growth (causing a diffusely enlarged goiter). The resulting state of hyperthyroidism can cause a dramatic constellation of neuropsychological and physical signs and symptoms, which can severely compromise the patients." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Thyrotoxicosis with toxic single thyroid nodule

children.defn: "An abnormality of thyroid physiology characterized by excessive secretion of the thyroid hormones thyroxine (i.e., T4) and/or 3,3',5-triiodo-L-thyronine zwitterion (i.e., triiodothyronine or T3)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Activating thyroid-stimulating hormone receptor (TSHR) defect

Although kidney transplantation leads to a normalization of serum calcium and parathyroid hormone in most patients. The state of persistent hypercalcemia and hyperparathyroidism is referred to as tertiary hyperparathyroidism." [DDD:spark]

children.name: Primary hyperparathyroidism

children.name: Prolactin excess
children.defn: "The presence of abnormally increased levels of prolactin in the blood. Prolactin is a peptide hormone produced by the anterior pituitary gland that plays a role in breast development and lactation during pregnancy." [DDD:spark, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thyroid-stimulating hormone excess
children.defn: "Overproduction of thyroid-stimulating hormone  (TSH) by the anterior pituitary gland." [DDD:spark]

children.name: Growth hormone excess
children.defn: "Acromegaly is a condition resulting from overproduction of growth hormone by the pituitary gland in persons with closed epiphyses, and consists chiefly in the enlargement of the distal parts of the body. The circumference of the skull increases, the nose becomes broad, the tongue becomes enlarged, the facial features become coarsened, the mandible grows excessively, and the teeth become separated. The fingers and toes grow chiefly in thickness." [DDD:spark, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Gonadotropin excess

"Overproduction of gonadotropins (FSH, LH) by the anterior pituitary gland." [DDD:spark]

"Hypersecretion of one or more pituitary hormones. This can occur in conditions in which deficiency in the target organ leads to decreased hormonal feedback, or as a primary condition most usually in connection with a pituitary adenoma." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pituitary calcification

children.name: Hypopituitarism
is_a_string: HP:0011747 ! Abnormality of the anterior pituitary

children.name: Anterior hypopituitarism
Panhypopituitarism
children.defn: "A pituitary functional deficit affecting all the anterior pituitary hormones (growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, follicle-stimulating hormone, luteinizing hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, and prolactin)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:12466332]

children.name: Growth hormone deficiency
is_a_string: HP:0003117 ! Abnormality of circulating hormone level

children.name: Pituitary dwarfism
children.defn: "A type of reduced stature with normal proportions related to dysfunction of the pituitary gland related to either an isolated defect in the secretion of growth hormone or to panhypopituitarism, i.e., a deficit of all the anterior pituitary hormones." [HPO:probinson]
"Insufficient production of growth hormone, which is produced by the anterior pituitary gland. Growth hormone is a major participant in control of growth and metabolism." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Prolactin deficiency
children.defn: "A reduced ability to secrete prolactin, a protein hormone that is secreted by lactotrophs in the anterior pituitary and that stimulates mammary gland development and milk production." [DDD:spark, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Adrenocorticotropic hormone deficiency
children.defn: "A reduced ability to secrete adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), a hormone that stimulates the adrenal cortex to secrete of glucocorticoids such as cortisol." [DDD:spark]

children.name: Gonadotropin deficiency
children.defn: "A reduced ability to secrete gonadotropins, which are re protein hormones secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary gland, including the hormones follitropin (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH)." [DDD:spark]

"A condition of reduced function of the pituitary gland characterized by decreased secretion of one or more of the pituitary hormones growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, prolactin, luteinizing hormone, and follicle-stimulating hormone." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the adenohypophysis, which is also known as the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland." [DDD:spark]

children.name: Abnormality of the posterior pituitary

children.name: Posterior pituitary dysgenesis

children.name: Posterior pituitary agenesis

children.name: Posterior pituitary hypoplasia
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the neurohypophysis." [DDD:spark]

children.name: Ectopic posterior pituitary
children.defn: "An abnormal anatomical location of the posterior lobe of the hypophysis, also known as the neurohypophysis. The posterior pituitary is normally present in the dorsal portion of the sella turcica, but when ectopic is usually near the median eminence. This defect is likely to be due to abnormal migration during embryogenesis." [DDD:spark, HPO:probinson]
"Abnormal development of the neurohypophysis during embryonic growth and development." [DDD:spark]

children.name: Neoplasm of the posterior pituitary
is_a_string: HP:0011751 ! Abnormality of the posterior pituitary

children.name: Pituicytoma
is_a_string: HP:0011752 ! Neoplasm of the posterior pituitary
children.defn: "A solid, low grade, spindle cell, glial neoplasm of adults that originates in the neurohypophysis or infundibulum. Clinical signs and symptoms include visual disturbance, headache and features of hypopituitarism. Pituicytomas are well-circumscribed, solid masses that can measure up to several centimeters. Histologically, they show a compact architecture consisting of elongate, bipolar spindle cells arranged in interlacing fascicles or assuming a storiform pattern." [DDD:spark, pmid:17618441, pmid:19109577]
"The presence of a neoplasm (tumour) in the neurohypophysis, which is also known as the posterior lobe of the hypophysis." [DDD:spark]
"An abnormality of the neurohypophysis, which is also known as the posterior lobe of the hypophysis." [DDD:spark, HPO:probinson]

"Abnormality of the pituitary gland (also known as hypophysis), which is an endocrine gland that protrudes from the bottom of the hypothalamus at the base of the brain. The pituitary gland secretes the hormones ACTH, TSH, PRL, GH, endorphins, FSH, LH, oxytocin, and antidiuretic hormone. The secretion of hormones from the anterior pituitary is under the strict control of hypothalamic hormones, and the posterior pituitary is essentially an extension of the hypothalamus, so that  hypothalamus and pituitary gland may be regarded as a functional unit." [DDD:spark]

children.name: Ectopic thymus tissue
children.defn: "The presence of ectopic thymus tissue. Normally, cells of the ventral bud of the third pharyngeal pouch detach and migrate in the eighth gestational week caudally and medially towards the location of the mature thyroid. They migrate further retrosternally into the superior mediastinum. There are two main ways ectopic thymus tissue can develop. Either cells detach along the descensus path and proliferate, thereby forming accessory thymus tissue, or the entire gland fails to descend." [HPO:curators]

"Abnormality of the thymus, an organ located in the upper anterior portion of the chest cavity just behind the sternum and whose main function is to provide an environment for T lymphocyte maturation." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Acute lymphatic leukemia

A CLL is always a B-cell lymphocytic leukemia as there are no reports of cases of T-cell lymphocytic leukemias." [HPO:curators]

Hepatic failure is defined as fulminant if there is onset of encephalopathy within 4 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver." [HPO:curators]

children.defn: "Cholangiocarcinoma is a primary cancer originating in the biliary epithelium i.e., the cholangiocytes, of the extrahepatic and intrahepatic biliary ducts. It is extremely invasive, develops rapidly, often metastasizes, and has a very poor prognosis. They are slow growing tumors which spread longitudinally along the bile ducts with neural, perineural and subepithelial extension." [HPO:probinson, pmid:18536057, pmid:8268770]

children.name: Acute colitis

children.name: Chronic colitis
Crohn's disease
children.defn: "A chronic granulomatous inflammatory disease of the intestines that may affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract from mouth to anus, causing a wide variety of symptoms. It primarily causes abdominal pain, diarrhea which may be bloody, vomiting, or weight loss, but may also cause complications outside of the gastrointestinal tract such as skin rashes, arthritis, inflammation of the eye, tiredness, and lack of concentration. Crohn's disease is thought to be an autoimmune disease, in which the body's immune system attacks the gastrointestinal tract, causing inflammation." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Ulcerative colitis
children.defn: "A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that includes characteristic ulcers, or open sores, in the colon. The main symptom of active disease is usually constant diarrhea mixed with blood, of gradual onset and intermittent periods of exacerbated symptoms contrasting with periods that are relatively symptom-free. In contrast to Crohn's disease this special form of colitis begins in the distal parts of the rectum, spreads continually upwards and affects only mucose and submucose tissue of the colon." [HPO:sdoelken]
"A chronic inflammatory disease of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum)." [HPO:sdoelken]

"Colitis refers to an inflammation of the colon and is often used to describe an inflammation of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum). Colitides may be acute and self-limited or chronic, and broadly fit into the category of digestive diseases." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Melena
children.defn: "The passage of blackish, tarry feces associated with gastrointestinal hemorrhage. Melena occurs if the blood remains in the colon long enough for it to be broken down by colonic bacteria. One degradation product, hematin, imbues the stool with a blackish color. Thus, melena generally occurs with bleeding from the upper gastrointestinal tract (e.g., sotmach ulcers or duodenal ulcers), since the blood usually remains in the gut for a longer period of time than with lower gastrointestinal bleeding." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Gastric varix
children.defn: "Extreme dilation of the submucusoal veins in the stomach." [HPO:probinson, pmid:24891929]

children.name: Abnormality of the gastric mucosa
Gastritis
is_a_string: HP:0004295 ! Abnormality of the gastric mucosa

children.name: Chronic gastritis
Chronic atrophic gastritis
children.defn: "A form of chronic gastritis associated with atrophic gastric mucous membrane." [HPO:probinson]
"A chronic form of gastritis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Giant hypertrophic gastritis
children.defn: "A type of gastritis characterized by excessive proliferation of the gastric mucosa and diffuse thickening of the gastric mucosal folds." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of inflammation of the gastric mucous membrane." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the gastric mucous membrane." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the pylorus
Pyloric stenosis
children.defn: "An abnormal narrowing of the pylorus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital pyloric atresia
children.defn: "Congenital atresia of the pylorus." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the pylorus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Gastroesophageal reflux
children.defn: "A condition in which the stomach contents leak backwards from the stomach into the esophagus through the lower esophageal sphincter." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absence of intrinsic factor
children.defn: "Absence of gastric intrinsic factor, which is normally produced by the parietal cells of the stomach, and is required for the absorption of vitamin B12." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the stomach." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the esophagus
is_a_string: HP:0012718 ! Morphological abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract

children.name: Esophageal stenosis
Esophageal stricture
children.defn: "A pathological narrowing of the esophagus that is caused by the development of a ring of scar tissue that constricts the esophageal lumen." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormal narrowing of the lumen of the esophagus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Esophageal neoplasm
is_a_string: HP:0007378 ! Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract
HP:0012288 ! Neoplasm of head and neck

children.name: Esophageal carcinoma
children.defn: "The presence of a carcinoma of the esophagus." [DDD:hfirth]

children.name: Barrett esophagus
children.defn: "An abnormal change (metaplasia) in the cells of the inferior portion of the esophagus. The normal squamous epithelium lining of the esophagus is replaced by metaplastic columnar epithelium. Columnar epithelium refers to a cell type that is typically found in more distal parts of the gastrointestinal system." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Esophageal diverticulum
children.defn: "The presence of a diverticulum of the esophagus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Esophageal leukoplakia
children.defn: "A white patch or plaque occurring on the surface of the esophageal mucous membranes that cannot be rubbed off and cannot be characterized clinically as any other disease." [pmid:23765246, UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Dysphagia
is_a_string: HP:0012638 ! Abnormality of nervous system physiology

children.name: Pseudobulbar paralysis
children.defn: "Bilateral impairment of the function of the cranial nerves 9-12, which control musculature involved in eating, swallowing, and speech. Pseudobulbar paralysis is characterized clinically by dysarthria, dysphonia, and dysphagia with bifacial paralysis, and may be accompanied by Pseudobulbar behavioral symptoms such as enforced crying and laughing." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Difficulty in swallowing." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tracheoesophageal fistula
children.defn: "An abnormal connection (fistula) between the esophagus and the trachea." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Esophageal atresia
children.defn: "A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the esophagus such that the esophagus ends in a blind pouch rather than connecting to the stomach." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Spontaneous esophageal perforation
children.defn: "The occurrence of the full-thickness tear (perforation) of the wall of the esophagus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Esophageal ulceration
children.defn: "Defect in the epithelium of the esophagus, essentially an open sore in the lining of the esophagus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Esophageal web
children.defn: "Thin (2-3mm) membranes of normal esophageal tissue consisting of mucosa and submucosa that can be congenital or acquired. Congenital webs commonly appear in the middle and inferior third of the esophagus, and they are more likely to be circumferential with a central or eccentric orifice. Acquired webs are much more common than congenital webs and typically appear in the cervical area (postcricoid). Clinical symptoms of this condition are selective (solid more than liquids) dysphagia, thoracic pain, nasopharyngeal reflux, aspiration, perforation and food impaction (the last two are very rare)." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Acute esophageal necrosis
children.defn: "A condition characterized by necrosis of the mucosal and submucosal layers of the esophagus not related to ingestion of caustic or other injurious agents. Endoscopically, there is a dark lesion ('black esophagus') distributed in a circumferential manner in the distal one-third of the esophagus with or without exudates. There is involvement of the distal esophagus ending sharply at the gastroesophageal junction." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17322991]

children.name: Esophageal duplication
children.defn: "A developmental disorder in which there is a duplication of a portion of the muscle and submucosa of the esophagus without epithelial duplication." [HPO:probinson, pmid:10464795]

children.name: Esophageal varix
children.defn: "Extreme dilation of the submucusoal veins in the lower portion of the esophagus." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the esophagus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of gastrointestinal vasculature
is_a_string: HP:0012718 ! Morphological abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract

children.name: Gastrointestinal angiodysplasia
children.defn: "Dysplasia affecting the vasculature of the gastrointestinal tract." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anorectal anomaly
is_a_string: HP:0012718 ! Morphological abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract

children.name: Abnormality of the anus
Perianal rash
children.defn: "The presence of a rash (change of color and texture) of the perianal skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anal fissure
children.defn: "A small tear in the thin, moist tissue (mucosa) that lines the anus. It appears as a crack or slit in the mucous membrane of the anus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anal stenosis
children.defn: "Abnormal narrowing of the anal opening." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anal atresia
children.defn: "Congenital absence of the anus, i.e., the opening at the bottom end of the intestinal tract." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ectopic anus
Anteriorly placed anus
children.defn: "Anterior malposition of the anus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Posteriorly placed anus
children.defn: "Posterior malposition of the anus." [UToronto:htrang]
"Abnormal displacement or malposition of the anus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anal mucosal leukoplakia
children.defn: "Leukoplakia is a precancerous dermatosis of mucous membranes analogous Leukoplakia is basically a chronic inflammatory hypertrophy in which anaplasia and malignant dyskeratosis may develop and subsequently advance to an invasive squamous cell cancer. The clinical diagnosis of primary anal leukoplakia is indicated by single or multiple slightly raised,irregular, marginated, grayish-white keratinized' patches in the anal canal. Tissue biopsy is necessary for confirmation." [HPO:probinson, pmid:13316552]
"Abnormality of the anal canal." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the anus or rectum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Gastrointestinal duplication
is_a_string: HP:0012718 ! Morphological abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract
children.defn: "A spherical hollow structure with a smooth muscle coat, lined by a mucous membrane, and attached to any part of the gastrointestinal tract, from the base of the tongue to the anus." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21218094]

children.name: Gastrointestinal atresia
is_a_string: HP:0012718 ! Morphological abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract

children.defn: "Abnormal structure of the gastrointestinal tract." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract
is_a_string: HP:0011024 ! Abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract

children.name: Benign gastrointestinal tract tumors
is_a_string: HP:0007378 ! Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract

children.name: Neoplasm of the small intestine
is_a_string: HP:0007378 ! Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract

children.name: Duodenal carcinoma
is_a_string: HP:0100833 ! Neoplasm of the small intestine

children.defn: "The presence of a neoplasm of the small intestine." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Zollinger-Ellison syndrome
is_a_string: HP:0007378 ! Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract
children.defn: "A condition in which there is increased production of gastrin by a gastrin-secreting tumor (usually located in the pancreas, duodenum, or abdominal lymph nodes) that stimulates the gastric mucosa to maximal activity, with consequent gastrointestinal mucosal ulceration." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Malignant gastrointestinal tract tumors
is_a_string: HP:0007378 ! Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract

children.name: Desmoid tumors
is_a_string: HP:0007378 ! Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract
children.defn: "Benign, slow-growing tumors without any metastatic potential. Despite their benign nature, they can damage nearby structures causing organ dysfunction. Histologically they resemble low-grade fibrosarcomas, but they are very locally aggressive and tend to recur even after complete resection. There is a tendency for recurrence in the setting of prior surgery and the most common localisation of these tumors is intraabdominal from smooth muscle cells of the instestine." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Gastrointestinal stroma tumor
is_a_string: HP:0007378 ! Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract

children.defn: "The presence of a neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ascites
is_a_string: HP:0002012 ! Abnormality of the abdominal organs

children.name: Fetal ascites
is_a_string: HP:0001197 ! Abnormality of prenatal development or birth
children.defn: "Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity during the fetal period." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Chylous ascites
children.defn: "Extravasation of chyle into the peritoneal cavity." [HPO:probinson]
"Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the pancreas
is_a_string: HP:0002012 ! Abnormality of the abdominal organs

children.name: Ectopic pancreatic tissue
children.defn: "The presence of pancreatic tissue outside the normal pancreas, in many cases along the foregut and proximal midgut." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Pancreatic lymphangiectasis
children.defn: "The presence of lymphangiectasis in the pancreas." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal pancreas size
Pancreatic hyperplasia
children.defn: "Hyperplasia of the pancreas." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the pancreas
Pancreatic hypoplasia
children.defn: "Hypoplasia of the pancreas." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pancreatic aplasia
children.defn: "Aplasia of the pancreas." [HPO:sdoelken]
"A congential underdevelopment (aplasia or hypoplasia) of the pancreas." [HPO:sdoelken]
"A deviation from the normal size of the pancreas." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pancreatic cysts
children.defn: "A cyst of the pancreas that possess a lining of mucous epithelium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pancreatic pseudocyst
children.defn: "Cyst-like space not lined by epithelium and contained within the pancreas. Pancreatic pseudocysts are often associated with pancreatitis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Annular pancreas
children.defn: "A congenital anomaly in which the pancreas completely (or sometimes incompletely) encircles the second portion of duodenum and occasionally obstructs the more proximal duodenum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pancreatic calcification
children.defn: "The presence of abnormal calcium deposition lesions in the pancreas." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pancreatic dysplasia
children.defn: "The presence of developmental dysplasia of the pancreas." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of pancreas physiology
Abnormality of exocrine pancreas physiology
Exocrine pancreatic insufficiency
is_a_string: HP:0012092 ! Abnormality of exocrine pancreas physiology
children.defn: "Impaired function of the exocrine pancreas associated with a reduced ability to digest foods because of lack of digestive enzymes." [HPO:probinson]
"A functional anomaly of the acinar gland portion of the pancreas that secretes digestive enzymes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pancreatitis
Acute pancreatitis
children.defn: "A acute form of pancreatitis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Chronic pancreatitis
children.defn: "A chronic form of pancreatitis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Recurrent pancreatitis
children.defn: "A recurrent form of pancreatitis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Chronic calcifying pancreatitis
children.defn: "A form of chronic pancreatitis that is characterized by calcification." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of inflammation in the pancreas." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly of the function of the pancreas." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Neoplasm of the pancreas
Pancreatoblastoma
children.defn: "A rare pediatric carcinoma of the pancreas." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Pancreatic squamous cell carcinoma
children.defn: "A subtype of ductal pancreatic carcinoma that is thought to  originate from squamous metaplasia of pancreatic ductal epithelium." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19079631]

children.name: Pancreatic adenocarcinoma
children.defn: "The presence of an adenocarcinoma of the pancreas." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a neoplasm of the pancreas." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the pancreas." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the peritoneum
is_a_string: HP:0002012 ! Abnormality of the abdominal organs

children.name: Peritoneal mesothelioma
children.defn: "A Malignant mesothelioma originating from cells of the peritoneum (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the abdomen). Peritoneal mesothelioma is the second most common form of mesothelioma after pleural mesothelioma." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Peritoneal abscess
children.defn: "The presence of an abscess of the peritoneum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hemoperitoneum
children.defn: "Accumulation of blood in the peritoneal cavity owing to internal hemorrhage." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Peritonitis
children.defn: "Inflammation of the peritoneum." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the peritoneum." [HPO:probinson]

"An abnormality of the viscera of the abdomen." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the diaphragm
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the diaphragm
Agenesis of the diaphragm
children.defn: "Congenital lack, i.e., aplasia of the diaphragm." [HPO:probinson]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the diaphragm." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Denervation of the diaphragm
children.defn: "Interruption of the innervation of the diaphragm." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia of the left hemidiaphragm
is_a_string: HP:0040046 ! Abnormality of the left hemidiaphragm

children.name: Absent left hemidiaphragm
is_a_string: HP:0040048 ! Aplasia of the left hemidiaphragm
children.defn: "Congenital absence of the left half of the diaphragm." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Diaphragmatic eventration
children.defn: "A congenital failure of muscular development of part or all of one or both hemidiaphragms, resulting in superior displacement of abdominal viscera and altered lung development." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Diaphragmatic weakness
Diaphragmatic paralysis
children.defn: "The presence of a paralyzed diaphragm." [HPO:probinson, pmid:3612666]
"A decrease in the strength of the diaphragm." [HPO:probinson, pmid:2509822]

children.name: Recurrent singultus
children.defn: "A contraction of the diaphragm that repeats several times per minute. In humans, the abrupt rush of air into the lungs causes the epiglottis to close, creating a hic sound. Also known as synchronous diaphragmatic flutter (SDF), or singultus, from the Latin singult, the act of catching one's breath while sobbing. The hiccup is an involuntary action involving a reflex arc." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Any abnormality of the diaphragm." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of abdominal situs
Abdominal situs inversus
children.defn: "A left-right reversal (or \"mirror reflection\") of the anatomical location of the viscera of the abdomen." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the abdominal situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the abdomin and its organs." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Constipation
Acute constipation
children.defn: "Constipation of sudden onset and lasting for less than three months." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]

children.name: Chronic constipation
children.defn: "Constipation for longer than three months with fewer than 3 bowel movements per week, straining, lumpy or hard stools, and a sensation of anorectal obstruction or incomplete defecation." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]
"Infrequent or difficult evacuation of feces." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Diarrhea
Secretory diarrhea
children.defn: "Watery voluminous diarrhea resulting from an imbalance between  ion and water secretion and absorption." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Chronic diarrhea
children.defn: "The presence of chronic diarrhea, which is usually taken to mean diarrhea that has persisted for over 4 weeks." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormally increased frequency of loose or watery bowel movements." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nausea
children.defn: "A sensation of unease in the stomach together with an urge to vomit." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Vomiting
Episodic vomiting
children.defn: "Paroxysmal, recurrent episodes of vomiting." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Projectile vomiting
children.defn: "Vomiting that ejects the gastric contents with great force." [HPO:probinson]
"Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth by means of a series of involuntary spasmic contractions." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anorexia
children.defn: "A lack or loss of appetite for food (as a medical condition)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal bowel sounds
Hyperactive bowel sounds
children.defn: "An increased amount of bowel sounds." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypoactive bowel sounds
children.defn: "An decreased amount of bowel sounds." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lack of bowel sounds
children.defn: "Complete lack of abdominal sounds as assayed by examination of the abdomen with a stethoscope." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly of the amount or nature of abdominal sounds. Abdominal sounds (bowel sounds) are made by the movement of the intestines as they promote passage of abdominal contents by peristalsis." []

children.name: Feeding difficulties
Delayed self-feeding during toddler years
children.defn: "A delay in the development of skills required to feed oneself in the toddler period (between one and three years of age)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Feeding difficulties in infancy
Nasal regurgitation
children.defn: "Regurgitation of milk through the nose." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Poor suck
children.defn: "An inadequate sucking reflex, resulting in the difficult of newborns to be breast-fed." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Gastrostomy tube feeding in infancy
children.defn: "Feeding problem necessitating gastrostomy tube feeding." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Nasogastric tube feeding in infancy
children.defn: "Feeding problem necessitating nasogastric tube feeding." [DDD:ncarter]

"Impaired feeding performance of an infant as manifested by difficulties such as weak and ineffective sucking, brief bursts of sucking, and falling asleep during sucking. There may be difficulties with chewing or maintaining attention." [HPO:probinson]
"Impaired ability to eat related to problems gathering food and getting ready to suck, chew, or swallow it." [ISCA:eriggs]

children.name: Abdominal pain
Episodic abdominal pain
children.defn: "An intermittent form of abdominal pain." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Flank pain
children.defn: "An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) and perceived to originate in the flank." []
"An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) and perceived to originate in the abdomen." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abdominal distention
Protuberant abdomen
children.defn: "A thrusting or bulging out of the abdomen." [HPO:probinson]
"Distention of the abdomen." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the abdominal wall
Exstrophy
is_a_string: HP:0004298 ! Abnormality of the abdominal wall
children.defn: "Eversion of a hollow organ and exposure, inside out, and protruded through the abdominal wall." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the umbilicus
is_a_string: HP:0004298 ! Abnormality of the abdominal wall

children.name: Prominent umbilicus
children.defn: "Abnormally prominent umbilicus (belly button)." [HPO:curators]
"Abnormality of the umbilicus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abdominal wall defect
is_a_string: HP:0004298 ! Abnormality of the abdominal wall

children.name: Gastroschisis
children.defn: "A type of congenital ventral incomplete closure of the abdominal wall in which the intestines and sometimes other organs to extend freely into the amniotic fluid space through a small opening in the abdomen, usually to the right of the umbilicus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Celosomia
children.defn: "Congenital protrusion of the abdominal or thoracic viscera, usually with a defect of the sternum and ribs as well as of the abdominal walls." [HPO:sdoelken]
"An incomplete closure of the abdominal wall." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the abdominal musculature

children.name: Abdominal wall muscle weakness
is_a_string: HP:0010991 ! Abnormality of the abdominal musculature
children.defn: "Decreased strength of the abdominal musculature." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Diastasis recti
is_a_string: HP:0010991 ! Abnormality of the abdominal musculature
children.defn: "A separation of the rectus abdominis muscle into right and left halves (which are normally joined at the midline at the linea alba)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
is_a_string: HP:0010991 ! Abnormality of the abdominal musculature

children.name: Partial abdominal muscle agenesis
is_a_string: HP:0010318 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
children.defn: "Failure to form of portions  of the abdominal musculature." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
is_a_string: HP:0010318 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
children.defn: "Absence of the abdominal musculature." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypoplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
is_a_string: HP:0010318 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the abdominal musculature." [HPO:probinson]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the abdominal musculature." [HPO:curators]
"An abnormality of the abdominal musculature." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Prune belly
is_a_string: HP:0004298 ! Abnormality of the abdominal wall
children.defn: "A kind of congenital defect of the anterior abdominal wall in which the intestines are evident through the thin, lax, and protruding abdominal wall in affected infants." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of any abnormality affecting the abdominal wall." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the mesentery
children.defn: "Folds of membranous tissue (peritoneum, mesothelium) attached to the wall of the abdomen and enclosing viscera. Examples include the mesentery for the small intestine; the transverse mesocolon, which attaches the transverse portion of the colon to the back wall of the abdomen; and the mesosigmoid, which enfolds the sigmoid portion of the colon. Cells of the same embryologic origin also surround the other organs of the body such as the lungs (pleura) or the heart (pericardium)." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Abnormality of the abdomen ('belly'), that is, the part of the body between the pelvis and the thorax." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the voice
Speech articulation difficulties
children.defn: "Impairment in the physical production of speech sounds." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hoarse voice
children.defn: "Hoarseness refers to a change in the pitch or quality of the voice, with the voice sounding weak, very breathy, scratchy, or husky." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Weak voice
children.defn: "Reduced intensity (volume) of speech." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: High pitched voice
children.defn: "An abnormal increase in the pitch (frequency) of the voice." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hyponasal speech
children.defn: "Hyponasal speech is when there is an abnormally reduced nasal airflow during speech often in a setting of nasal obstruction or congestion." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormally low-pitched voice
children.defn: "An abnormally low-pitched voice." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Dysphonia
Laryngeal dystonia
children.defn: "A form of focal dystonia that affects the vocal cords, associated with involuntary contractions of the vocal cords causing interruptions of speech and affecting the voice quality and often leading to patterned, repeated breaks in speech." [HPO:probinson]
"An impairment in the ability to produce voice sounds." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nasal speech
children.defn: "A type of speech characterized by the presence of an abnormally increased nasal airflow during speech, associated with incomplete or weak closure of the velum." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Cat cry
children.defn: "The presence of a characteristic high-pitched cry that sounds similar to the meowing of a kitten." [HPO:probinson]
"Any abnormality of the voice." [HPO:probinson, MeSH:D014831]

children.name: Abnormality of the musculature

is_a_string: HP:0009127 ! Abnormality of the musculature of the limbs

children.name: Limb-girdle muscle weakness
is_a_string: HP:0009127 ! Abnormality of the musculature of the limbs

children.name: Shoulder girdle muscle weakness
is_a_string: HP:0001435 ! Abnormality of the shoulder girdle musculature
children.defn: "The shoulder, or pectoral, girdle is composed of the clavicles and the scapulae. Shoulder-girdle weakness refers to lack of strength of the muscles attaching to these bones, that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Pelvic girdle muscle weakness
is_a_string: HP:0001445 ! Abnormality of the hip-girdle musculature

children.name: Hip flexor weakness
children.defn: "Reduced ability to flex the femur, that is, to pull the knee upward." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]
"Weakness of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as the hip girdle), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the pelvis." [HPO:probinson]
"Weakness of the limb-girdle muscles (also known as the pelvic and shoulder girdles), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders and the pelvis." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormality of the musculature of the lower limbs
is_a_string: HP:0002814 ! Abnormality of the lower limb
HP:0009127 ! Abnormality of the musculature of the limbs

children.name: Proximal muscle weakness in lower limbs

children.name: Foot dorsiflexor weakness
is_a_string: HP:0001436 ! Abnormality of the foot musculature
HP:0008994 ! Proximal muscle weakness in lower limbs
children.defn: "Weakness of the muscles responsible for dorsiflexion of the foot, that is, of the movement of the toes towards the shin. The foot dorsiflexors include the tibialis anterior, the extensor hallucis longus, the extensor digitorum longus, and the peroneus tertius muscles." [HPO:probinson]

Decreased activity of cytochrome C oxidase in muscle tissue

children.name: Mitochondrial myopathy
is_a_string: HP:0003800 ! Muscle abnormality related to mitochondrial dysfunction

children.name: Depletion of mitochondrial DNA in muscle tissue
