children.name: Abnormality of muscle physiology
Myalgia
Exercise-induced myalgia
children.defn: "The occurrence of an unusually high amount of muscle pain following exercise." [HPO:probinson]
"A tendency to experience muscle pain." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Tetany
children.defn: "A disorder characterized by muscle twitches, cramps, and carpopedal spasm, and when severe, laryngospasm and seizures. This condition is associated with unstable depolarization of axonal membranes, primarily in the peripheral nervous system." [MeSH:D013746]

children.name: Increased muscle fatiguability
Exercise-induced muscle fatigue
children.defn: "An abnormally increased tendency towards muscle fatigue induced by physical exercise." [HPO:curators]
"An abnormal, increased fatiguability of the musculature." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Myotonia
Percussion myotonia
children.defn: "A localized myotonic contraction in a muscle in reaction to percussion (tapping with the examiner's finger, a rubber percussion hammer, or a similar object)." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Cold-sensitive myotonia
children.defn: "An involuntary and painless delay in the relaxation of skeletal muscle following contraction or electrical stimulation that is  induced by exposure to cold." [pmid:14617673, UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Myotonia of the lower limb
children.defn: "Slowed relaxation of muscles in the leg." [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Myotonia of the upper limb
children.defn: "Slowed relaxation of muscles in the arm." [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Myotonia of the face
children.defn: "Slowed relaxation of muscles in the face." [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Myotonia of the jaw
children.defn: "Slowed relaxation of muscles in the jaw." [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: EMG: myotonic runs
children.defn: "Spontaneous, repetitive electrical activity demonstrated by electromyography (EMG)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Handgrip myotonia
children.defn: "Difficulty releasing one's grip associated with prolonged first handgrip relaxation times." [pmid:22987687, UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Paradoxical myotonia
children.defn: "A type of myotonia that worsens with repeated muscle contractions." [HPO:probinson, pmid:7678441]

children.name: Myotonia with warm-up phenomenon
children.defn: "Myotonia that occurs after a period of rest and decreases with continuing exercise." [HPO:probinson, pmid:7678441]
"An involuntary and painless delay in the relaxation of skeletal muscle following contraction or electrical stimulation." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Central hypotonia
is_a_string: HP:0011442 ! Abnormality of central motor function
children.defn: "Reduced muscle tone secondary to an abnormality of the central nervous system." [DDD:fmuntoni]

children.name: Muscular hypotonia
Oral motor hypotonia
children.defn: "Reduced muscle tone of oral musculature. In infants, this feature may be associated with difficulties in breast feeding, and may affetc the latch, jaw motions, tongue placement, lip seal, suck/swallow/breathe pattern and overall feeding behavior." []

children.name: Neonatal hypotonia
Generalized neonatal hypotonia
children.defn: "Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in the neonatal period and affecting the entire musculature." [HPO:probinson]
"Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in the neonatal period." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Appendicular hypotonia
children.defn: "Muscular hypotonia of one or more limbs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Infantile muscular hypotonia
Infantile axial hypotonia
is_a_string: HP:0008936 ! Muscular hypotonia of the trunk
children.defn: "Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) affecting the musculature of the trunk and with onset in infancy." [HPO:curators]
"Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in infancy." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Muscular hypotonia of the trunk
children.defn: "Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) affecting the musculature of the trunk." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Severe muscular hypotonia
children.defn: "A severe degree of muscular hypotonia characterized by markedly reduced muscle tone." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Generalized hypotonia
Episodic generalized hypotonia
children.defn: "The occurrence of repeated episodes of generalized muscular hypotonia." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Generalized hypotonia due to defect at the neuromuscular junction
is_a_string: HP:0003398 ! Abnormal synaptic transmission at the neuromuscular junction

children.defn: "Generalized muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone)." [HPO:curators]

"Muscular hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle), often involving reduced muscle strength. Hypotonia is characterized by a diminished resistance to passive stretching." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Hypertonia
Spasticity
Spastic hemiparesis
children.defn: "Unilateral paresis (weakness) with spasticity of the affected muscles and increased tendon reflexes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Spastic tetraplegia
children.defn: "Spastic paralysis affecting all four limbs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Spastic diplegia
children.defn: "Spasticity (neuromuscular hypertonia) primarily in the muscles of the legs, hips, and pelvis." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Spastic tetraparesis
children.defn: "Spastic weakness affecting all four limbs." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Progressive spasticity
children.defn: "Spasticity that increases in degree with time." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Spastic dysarthria
children.defn: "A type of dysarthria related to bilateral damage of the upper motor neuron tracts of the pyramidal and extra- pyramidal tracts. Speech of affected individuals is slow, effortful, and has a harsh vocal quality." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lower limb spasticity
Spastic paraplegia
children.defn: "Spasticity and weakness of the leg and hip muscles." [HPO:probinson]

"Spasticity (velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone and hyperexcitable tendon reflexes) in the muscles of the lower limbs, hips, and pelvis" [HPO:probinson, UKT:rschuele]
"A motor disorder characterized by a velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone, exaggerated (hyperexcitable) tendon reflexes." [HPO:probinson]
"A condition in which there is increased muscle tone so that arms or legs, for example, are stiff and difficult to move.  " [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Muscle stiffness
Exercise-induced muscle stiffness
children.defn: "A type of muscle stiffness that occurs following physical exertion." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Axial muscle stiffness
children.defn: "Stiffness (a condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm) of the axial musculature." [HPO:probinson]
"A condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: EMG abnormality
EMG: axonal abnormality
EMG: Positive sharp waves
children.defn: "These are spontaneous firing action potentials stimulated by needle movement of an injured muscle fiber. There is propagation to, but not past, the needle tip. This inhibits the display of the negative deflection of the waveform." []

"Electromyographic (EMG) findings characteristic of axonal neuropathy, with normal or slightly decreased nerve conduction velocities,  normal or slightly prolonged distal latencies, but significantly reduced motor potentials and sensory amplitudes. There may be spontaneous activity upon needle EMG studies, such as increased insertional activity, positive sharp waves, and fibrillation potentials." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Single fiber EMG abnormality
Increased jitter at single fibre EMG
children.defn: "The variation in the time interval between the two action potentials of the same motor unit is called jitter. This term therefore applies to increased variability in the interval between successive action potentials of the same motor unit, which is measured by electromyography (EMG). " [pmid:21654930, UK:rheller]
"Abnormality in single fiber EMG recording, a technique that allows identification of action potentials (APs) from individual muscle fibers." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21654930]

children.name: EMG: neuropathic changes
EMG: chronic denervation signs
children.defn: "Evidence of chronic denervation on electromyography." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of characteristic findings of denervation on electromyography (fibrillations, positive sharp waves, and giant motor unit potentials)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: EMG: slow motor conduction
children.defn: "The presence of reduced conduction velocity of motor nerves on electromyography." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: EMG: myokymic discharges
children.defn: "The presence of spontaneous bursts of rapidly firing potentials that recur at regular intervals of 2-10 per second and are unaffected by voluntary effort. This is an electromyographic (EMG) finding." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: EMG: myotonic discharges
children.defn: "High frequency discharges in electromyography (EMG) that vary in amplitude and frequency, waxing and waning continuously with firing frequencies ranging from 150/second down to 20/second and producing a sound that has been referred to as a dive bomber sound." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: EMG: impaired neuromuscular transmission
EMG: incremental response of compound muscle action potential to repetitive nerve stimulation
children.defn: "A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to an abnormal increase in the amplitude during the course of the investigation." [pmid:23970984, UK:rheller]

children.name: EMG: decremental response of compound muscle action potential to repetitive nerve stimulation
children.defn: "A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to a greater than normal decrease in the amplitude during the course of the investigation." [HPO:probinson]
"An electromyographic finding associated with erratic or absent neuromuscular transmission with erratic, moment-to-moment changes in the shape of the motor unit potential (MUP)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: EMG: myopathic abnormalities
children.defn: "The presence of abnormal electromyographic patterns indicative of myopathy, such as small-short polyphasic motor unit potentials." [HPO:curators]

children.name: EMG: Repetitive nerve stimulation abnormality
children.defn: "Abnormality observed upon electromyography when nerve studied is electrically stimulated six to ten times at 2 or 3 Hertz." [UToronto:HTrang]

children.name: EMG: continuous motor unit activity at rest
children.defn: "Continuous electromyographic activity of motor units at rest, i.e., without voluntary movement of the muscles." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormal results of investigations using electromyography (EMG)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:18751841]

children.name: Muscle weakness
Proximal muscle weakness
Progressive proximal muscle weakness
children.defn: "Lack of strength of the proximal muscles that becomes progressively more severe." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Late-onset proximal muscle weakness
children.defn: "Lack of strength of the proximal musculature occuring late in the clinical course." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Gowers sign
children.defn: "A phenomenon whereby patients are not able to stand up without the use of the hands owing to weakness of the proximal muscles of the lower limbs." [HPO:probinson]
"A lack of strength of the proximal muscles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Intercostal muscle weakness
children.defn: "Lack of strength of the intercostal muscles, i.e., of the muscle groups running along the ribs that create and move the chest wall." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Generalized muscle weakness
children.defn: "Generalized weakness or decreased strength of the muscles, affecting both distal and proximal musculature." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Axial muscle weakness
children.defn: "Reduced strength of the axial musculature (i.e., of the muscles of the head and neck, spine, and ribs)." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Poor head control
children.defn: "Difficulty to maintain correct position of the head while standing or sitting." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Weakness of muscles of respiration
Respiratory paralysis
is_a_string: HP:0004347 ! Weakness of muscles of respiration
children.defn: "Inability to move the muscles of respiration." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced maximal expiratory pressure
is_a_string: HP:0004347 ! Weakness of muscles of respiration
children.defn: "A decrease in the maximum amount of pressure of expired air achieved by a person after a full inspiration." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]

children.name: Respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness
is_a_string: HP:0004347 ! Weakness of muscles of respiration

children.name: Intermittent episodes of respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness
is_a_string: HP:0002747 ! Respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness

children.name: Reduced maximal inspiratory pressure
is_a_string: HP:0004347 ! Weakness of muscles of respiration
children.defn: "A decrease in the maximum amount of negative pressure a person can generate during an inhalation." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]

"Reduced function of the muscles required to generate subatmospheric pressure in the thoracic cavity during breathing: the diaphragm, the external intercostal and the interchondral part of the internal intercostal muscles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Muscle flaccidity
Episodic flaccid weakness
children.defn: "Recurrent episodes of muscle flaccidity, a type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching." [HPO:probinson]

"A type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching, which results from loss of all or practically all peripheral motor nerves that innervated the muscle. Muscle tone is reduced and the affected muscles undergo extreme atrophy within months of the loss of innervation." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Bulbar palsy
is_a_string: HP:0012638 ! Abnormality of nervous system physiology
children.defn: "Bulbar weakness (or bulbar palsy) refers to bilateral impairment of function of the lower cranial nerves IX, X, XI and XII, which occurs due to lower motor neuron lesion either at nuclear or fascicular level in the medulla or from bilateral lesions of the lower cranial nerves outside the brain-stem. Bulbar weakness is often associated with difficulty in chewing, weakness of the facial muscles, dysarthria, palatal weakness and regurgitation of fluids, dysphagia, and dysphonia." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Distal muscle weakness
Distal upper limb muscle weakness
is_a_string: HP:0002817 ! Abnormality of the upper limb
children.defn: "Reduced strength of the distal musculature of the arms." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Distal lower limb muscle weakness
is_a_string: HP:0002814 ! Abnormality of the lower limb

children.name: Peroneal muscle weakness
is_a_string: HP:0009053 ! Distal lower limb muscle weakness
children.defn: "Weakness of the peroneal muscles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tibialis muscle weakness
is_a_string: HP:0009053 ! Distal lower limb muscle weakness
children.defn: "Muscle weakness affecting the tibialis anterior muscle." [HPO:probinson]
"Reduced strength of the distal musculature of the legs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Paresis of extensor muscles of the big toe
Progressive distal muscle weakness
children.defn: "Progressively reduced strength of the distal musculature." [HPO:curators]
"Reduced strength of the musculature of the distal extremities." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Fatigable weakness
is_a_string: HP:0003398 ! Abnormal synaptic transmission at the neuromuscular junction

children.name: Fatigable weakness of skeletal muscles
Fatigable weakness of neck muscles
is_a_string: HP:0030197 ! Fatigable weakness of skeletal muscles
children.defn: "A type of weakness of a skeletal muscle in the neck that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions." [UK:rheller]

children.name: Fatigable weakness of distal limb muscles
is_a_string: HP:0030197 ! Fatigable weakness of skeletal muscles
children.defn: "A type of weakness of a skeletal muscle of distal part of a limb that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions." [UK:rheller]

children.name: Fatiguable weakness of proximal limb muscles
is_a_string: HP:0030197 ! Fatigable weakness of skeletal muscles
children.defn: "A type of weakness of a skeletal muscle of proximal part of a limb that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions." [UK:rheller]

"A type of weakness of skeletal muscle that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions." []

children.name: Fatigable weakness of respiratory muscles
children.defn: "A type of weakness of the muscles involved in breathing (respiration) that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions." [UNCL:mbertoli]

children.name: Fatigable weakness of bulbar muscles
Fatigable weakness of swallowing muscles
is_a_string: HP:0030192 ! Fatigable weakness of bulbar muscles
children.defn: "A type of weakness of the muscles involved in swallowing that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions." [pmid:17986328, UK:rheller]

children.name: Fatigable weakness of speech muscles
is_a_string: HP:0030192 ! Fatigable weakness of bulbar muscles
children.defn: "A type of weakness of the muscles involved in speech that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions." [pmid:17986328, UNCL:hlochmueller]

children.name: Fatigable weakness of chewing muscles
is_a_string: HP:0030192 ! Fatigable weakness of bulbar muscles
children.defn: "A type of weakness of the muscles involved in chewing that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions." [pmid:17986328, UNCL:tevangelista]

"A type of weakness of the bulbar muscles (muscles of the mouth and throat responsible for speech and swallowing) that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17986328, UNCL:mbertoli]
"A type of weakness that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions." [HPO:probinson]
"Reduced strength of muscles." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15832536]

children.name: Muscle cramps
Exercise-induced muscle cramps
Exercise-induced leg cramps
children.defn: "Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles of the leg brought on by physical exertion." [HPO:probinson]
"Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by physical exertion." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cold-induced muscle cramps
children.defn: "Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by exposure to cold temperatures." [HPO:probinson]
"Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Difficulty running
children.defn: "Reduced ability to run." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Easy fatigability
is_a_string: HP:0012638 ! Abnormality of nervous system physiology
children.defn: "Increased susceptibility to fatigue." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Difficulty climbing stairs
children.defn: "Reduced ability to climb stairs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Difficulty walking
children.defn: "Reduced ability to walk (ambulate)." [HPO:probinson]
"A functional abnormality of a skeletal muscle." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of muscle morphology
Muscular dystrophy
children.defn: "The term dystrophy means abnormal growth. However, muscular dystrophy is used to describe primary myopathies with a genetic basis and a progressive course characterized by progressive skeletal muscle weakness and wasting, defects in muscle proteins, and histological features of muscle fiber degeneration (necrosis) and regeneration. If possible, it is preferred to use other HPO terms to describe the precise phenotypic abnormalities." [HPO:probinson, Neuromics:vstraub]

children.name: Calcinosis
children.defn: "Formation of calcium deposits in any soft tissue." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Intramuscular hematoma
children.defn: "Blood clot formed within muscle tissue following leakage of blood into the tissue." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Myopathy
Myofibrillar myopathy
children.defn: "Myofibrillar structural changes characterized by abnormal intracellular accumulation of the intermediate filament desmin and other proteins." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Minicore (multicore) myopathy
Type 1 and type 2 muscle fiber minicore regions
children.defn: "Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in type 1 and type 2 muscle fibers." [HPO:probinson]
"Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in muscle fibers." [HPO:probinson]
"A disorder of muscle unrelated to impairment of innervation or neuromuscular junction." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Rhabdomyolysis
Exercise-induced rhabdomyolysis
children.defn: "Rhabdomyolysis induced by exercise." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Viral infection-induced rhabdomyolysis
children.defn: "Rhabdomyolysis induced by a viral infection." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Acute rhabdomyolysis
children.defn: "An acute form of rhabdomyolysis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Alcohol-induced rhabdomyolysis
children.defn: "Rhabdomyolysis induced by intake of alcohol." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anesthetic-induced rhabdomylosis
children.defn: "Rhabdomyolysis induced by anesthesia." [HPO:probinson]
"Breakdown of muscle fibers that leads to the release of muscle fiber contents (myoglobin) into the bloodstream." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Myositis
children.defn: "A general term for inflammation of the muscles without respect to the underlying cause." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormality of muscle size
Skeletal muscle atrophy
Proximal amyotrophy
children.defn: "Amyotrophy (muscular atrophy) affecting the proximal musculature." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Generalized amyotrophy
Generalized limb muscle atrophy
children.defn: "Generalized (unlocalized) atrophy affecting muscles of the limbs in both proximal and distal locations." [HPO:probinson]
"Generalized (diffuse, unlocalized) amyotrophy (muscle atrophy) affecting multiple muscles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lower limb amyotrophy
Distal lower limb amyotrophy
Tibialis atrophy
children.defn: "Atrophy of the tibialis muscle." [HPO:probinson]
"Muscular atrophy of distal leg muscles." [HPO:probinson]
"Muscular atrophy affecting the lower limb." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Sternocleidomastoid amyotrophy
children.defn: "Wasting of the sternocleidomastoid muscle, the muscle in the anterior part of the neck that acts to flex and rotate the head." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pectoralis amyotrophy
is_a_string: HP:0011957 ! Abnormality of the pectoral muscle
children.defn: "Wasting of the pectoral muscles, i.e., of the pectoralis major and  pectoralis minor." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nonprogressive muscular atrophy
children.defn: "Muscular atrophy that does not display a progression in severity with time." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Spinal muscular atrophy
Proximal spinal muscular atrophy
children.defn: "Proximal spinal muscular atrophy, i.e., muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Progressive spinal muscular atrophy
children.defn: "Progressive spinal muscular atrophy, i.e., muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem." [HPO:curators]
"Muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Distal amyotrophy
Progressive distal muscular atrophy
children.defn: "Progressive muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Interosseus muscle atrophy
children.defn: "Atrophy of the interosseus muscles (including the palmar interossei that lie on the anterior aspect of the metacarpals, the dorsal interosseus muscles of the hand, which lie between the intercarpals, the plantar interosseus muscles, which lie underneath the metatarsal bones, and the dorsal interossei, which are located between the metatarsal bones." [HPO:curators]
"Muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Scapuloperoneal amyotrophy
children.defn: "Muscular atrophy in the distribution of shoulder girdle and peroneal muscles." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of skeletal muscular atrophy (which is also known as amyotrophy)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Skeletal muscle hypertrophy
Marked muscular hypertrophy
children.defn: "Severe hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle cells." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Generalized muscle hypertrophy
children.defn: "Hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle cells in a generalized (not localized) distribution." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Scapular muscle hypertrophy
children.defn: "Muscle hypertrophy affecting the scapular muscles." [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Paraspinal muscle hypertrophy
children.defn: "Muscle hypertrophy affecting the paraspinal muscles." [UToronto:htrang]
"Hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle cells (as opposed to hyperplasia, which refers to an increase in the number of muscle cells)." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the skeletal musculature
Aplasia of the musculature
is_a_string: HP:0001460 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the skeletal musculature

children.name: Amyoplasia
children.defn: "Congenital lack of development of the muscles, which are then replaced by a mixture of dense fat and fibrous tissue." [HPO:probinson, Neuromics:vstraub]
"Absence of the musculature." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Hypoplasia of the musculature
is_a_string: HP:0001460 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the skeletal musculature
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the musculature." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the musculature." [HPO:curators]
"Abnormalities of the overall muscle bulk based on clinical observation." [Neuromics:vstraub]

children.name: Fatty replacement of skeletal muscle
children.defn: "Muscle fibers degeneration resulting in fatty replacement of skeletal muscle fibers" [HPO:probinson, Neuromics:vstraub]

children.name: Abnormality of muscle fibers
Ring fibers
children.defn: "Ring fibers are formed by a bundle of peripheral myofibrils which are circumferentially oriented such that they encircle the internal portion of the sarcoplasm which is normal in structure and orientation." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Centrally nucleated skeletal muscle fibers
children.defn: "An abnormality in which the nuclei of sarcomeres take on an abnormally central localization (or in which this feature is found in an increased proportion of muscle cells)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Muscle fiber splitting
children.defn: "Fiber splitting or branching is a common finding in human and rat skeletal muscle pathology. Fiber splitting refers to longitudinal halving of the complete fiber, while branching originates from a regenerating end of a necrotic fiber as invaginations of the sarcolemma. In fiber branching, one end of the fiber remains intact as a single entity, while the other end has several branches." [pmid:6123177]

children.name: Ragged-red muscle fibers
children.defn: "An abnormal appearance of muscle fibers observed on muscle biopsy. Ragged red fibers can be visualized with Gomori trichrome staining as irregular and intensely red subsarcolemmal zones, whereas the normal myofibrils are green. The margins of affect fibers appear red and ragged. The ragged-red  is due to the accumulation of abnormal mitochondria below the plasma membrane of the muscle fiber, leading to the appearance of a red rim and speckled sarcoplasm." [HPO:probinson, pmid:12075011, pmid:16537564]

children.name: Increased muscle lipid content
Increased intramyocellular lipid droplets
children.defn: "An abnormal increase in intracellular lipid droplets In a muscle. The number and size of these drops can increase with somd disorders of lipid metabolism affecting muscle. See pmid 20691590 for histological images." [HPO:probinson, pmid:20691590]
"An abnormal accumulation of lipids in skeletal muscle." [HPO:probinson, pmid:20691590]

children.name: Rimmed vacuoles
children.defn: "Presence of abnormal vacuoles (membrane-bound organelles) in the sarcolemma. On histological staining with hematoxylin and eosin, rimmed vacuoles are popcorn-like clear vacuoles with a densely blue rim. The vacuoles are often associated with cytoplasmic and occasionally intranuclear eosinophilic inclusions." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Muscle fiber necrosis
children.defn: "Abnormal cell death involving muscle fibers usually associated with break in, or absence of, muscle surface fiber membrane and resulting in irreversible damage to muscle fibers." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Type 2 muscle fiber predominance
children.defn: "An abnormal predominance of type II muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Central core regions in muscle fibers
children.defn: "The presence of disorganized areas called cores in the center of muscle fibers. There is a typical appearance of the biopsy on light microscopy, where the muscle cells have cores that are devoid of mitochondria and specific enzymes. Cores are typically well demarcated and centrally located, but may occasionally be multiple and of eccentric." [Neuromics:vstraub, pmid:17504518]

children.name: Muscle fiber cytoplasmatic inclusion bodies
Desmin bodies
is_a_string: HP:0100303 ! Muscle fiber cytoplasmatic inclusion bodies

children.name: Muscle fiber hyaline bodies
is_a_string: HP:0100303 ! Muscle fiber cytoplasmatic inclusion bodies

children.name: Nemaline bodies
is_a_string: HP:0100303 ! Muscle fiber cytoplasmatic inclusion bodies
children.defn: "Nemaline rods are abnormal bodies that can occur in skeletal muscle fibers. The rods can be observed on histological analysis of muscle biopsy tissue or upon electron microscopy, where they appear either as extensions of sarcomeric Z-lines, in random array without obvious attachment to Z-lines (often in areas devoid of sarcomeres) or in large clusters localized at the sarcolemma or intermyofibrillar spaces." [HPO:curators, PMID:11333380]

children.name: Muscle fiber tubular inclusions
is_a_string: HP:0100303 ! Muscle fiber cytoplasmatic inclusion bodies
children.defn: "Unusual regions of densely packed membranous tubules known as tubular aggregates which present as membranous inclusions, derived from membranes of sarcoplasmic reticulum and mitochondria, containing miscellaneous proteins with a variety of enzymatic activities." [HPO:sdoelken, PMID:15113116]

children.name: Muscle fiber tubuloreticular inclusions
is_a_string: HP:0100303 ! Muscle fiber cytoplasmatic inclusion bodies

children.defn: "The presence of inclusion bodies within the cytoplasm of muscle cells. Inclusion bodies are aggregates (deposits) or stainable material, usually misfolded proteins." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Muscle fiber intranuclear inclusion bodies
children.defn: "The presence of inclusion bodies within the nucleus of muscle cells. Inclusion bodies are aggregates (deposits) or stainable material, usually misfolded proteins." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Type 2 muscle fiber atrophy
children.defn: "Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 2 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Type 1 muscle fiber atrophy
children.defn: "Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 1 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of skeletal muscle fiber size
Type 1 fibers relatively smaller than type 2 fibers
is_a_string: HP:0012084 ! Abnormality of skeletal muscle fiber size
children.defn: "The presence of abnormal muscle fiber size such that type 1 fibers are smaller than type 2 fibers." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Increased variability in muscle fiber diameter
is_a_string: HP:0012084 ! Abnormality of skeletal muscle fiber size
children.defn: "An abnormally high degree of muscle fiber size variation. This phenotypic feature can be observed upon muscle biopsy." [HPO:curators]
"Any abnormality of the size of the skeletal muscle cell." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal muscle glycogen content
Decreased muscle glycogen content
children.defn: "A decreased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Increased muscle glycogen content
Glycogen accumulation in muscle fiber lysosomes
children.defn: "An increased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue found specifically in lysosomes." [Neuromics:vstraub]

children.name: Increased sarcoplasmic glycogen
children.defn: "Elevated glycogen content in the sarcoplasm (cytoplasm) of muscle fibers." [HPO:probinson]
"An increased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue." [HPO:probinson]
"Any anomaly in the amount of glycogen in muscle tissue." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Autophagic vacuoles
children.defn: "The lysosomal-vacuolar pathway has a role in the controlled intracellular digestion of macromolecules such as protein complexes and organelles. This feature refers to the presence of an abnormally increased number of autophagic vacuoles in muscle tissue." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17027858]

children.name: Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression
Abnormal muscle fiber valosin-containing protein
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression

children.name: Accumulation of muscle fiber valosin-containing protein
is_a_string: HP:0030228 ! Abnormal muscle fiber valosin-containing protein
children.defn: "Immunohistochemistry shows accumulation  of valosin-containing protein in the muscle biopsy." [Neuromics:vstraub]

"A deviation from normal in the expression of valosin-containing protein in muscle tissue. Valosin-containing protein an ubiquitously expressed multifunctional 100-kD protein that is a member of the AAA+ (ATPase associated with various activities) protein family." [Neuromics:vstraub]

children.name: Abnormal muscle fiber myotilin
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression

children.name: Accumulation of muscle fiber myotilin
children.defn: "Immunohistochemistry shows accumulation  of myotilin protein in the muscle biopsy." [Neuromics:vstraub]
"A deviation from normal in the expression of myotilin in muscle tissue. Myotilin is a 57kD cytoskeletal protein." [Neuromics:vstraub]

children.name: Abnormal muscle fiber desmin
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression

children.name: Accumulation of muscle fiber desmin
children.defn: "Immunohistochemistry shows accumulation  of desmin protein in the muscle biopsy." [Neuromics:vstraub]
"A deviation from normal in the expression of desmin in muscle tissue. Desmin is an  53-KDa  protein." [Neuromics:vstraub]

children.name: Abnormal muscle fiber merosin expression
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression

children.name: Absent muscle fiber merosin
is_a_string: HP:0030090 ! Abnormal muscle fiber merosin expression
children.defn: "Lack of merosin protein in the muscle biopsy." []

children.name: Reduced muscle fiber merosin
is_a_string: HP:0030090 ! Abnormal muscle fiber merosin expression
children.defn: "A reduced amount of merosin in muscle fibers. This feature is usually assessed by immunohistochemical examination of muscle biopsy tissue." [HPO:Probinson]
"An anomalous amount of merosin in muscle fibers. Merosin is a basement membrane-associated protein found in placenta, striated muscle, and peripheral nerve." [HPO:probinson, pmid:2185464]

children.name: Abnormal muscle fiber laminin beta 1
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression

children.name: Reduced muscle fiber laminin beta 1
is_a_string: HP:0030093 ! Abnormal muscle fiber laminin beta 1
children.defn: "A reduced amount of laminin beta 1 in muscle fiber tissue. Laminin 2 is a major component of the basal lamina of skeletal muscle cells. It is a heterotrimer composed of 3 chains: merosin (laminin alpha 2 chain), beta 1, and gamma 1." []

"A deviation from normal of the amount of laminin beta 1 in muscle fiber tissue. Laminin 2 is a major component of the basal lamina of skeletal muscle cells. It is a heterotrimer composed of 3 chains: merosin (laminin alpha 2 chain), beta 1, and gamma 1." [HPO:probinson, pmid:9400354, UToronto:HTrang]

children.name: Reduced muscle collagen VI
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression
children.defn: "A decreased amount of collagen VI in muscle tissue. Collagen VI is a primarily associated with the extracellular matrix of skeletal muscle." [UToronto:HTrang]

children.name: Abnormal muscle fiber dystrophin expression
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression

children.name: Reduced muscle dystrophin expression
is_a_string: HP:0030096 ! Abnormal muscle fiber dystrophin expression
children.defn: "A decreased amount of dystrophin in muscle fiber tissue." [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Absent muscle dystrophin expression
is_a_string: HP:0030096 ! Abnormal muscle fiber dystrophin expression
children.defn: "Lack of dystrophin in muscle tissue. Immunohistochemistry reveals absent dystrophin protein in the muscle biopsy. " [pmid:11917091, UToronto:htrang]

"A deviation from normal in the amount of dystrophin in muscle fiber tissue. Dystrophin is located at the muscle sarcolemma in a membrane-spanning protein complex that connects the cytoskeleton to the basal lamina. " [pmid:11917091, UToronto:HTrang]

children.name: Abnormal muscle fiber gamma sarcoglycan
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression

children.name: Absent muscle fiber gamma sarcoglycan
is_a_string: HP:0030104 ! Abnormal muscle fiber gamma sarcoglycan
children.defn: "Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of gamma sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy. " [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Reduced muscle fiber gamma sarcoglycan
is_a_string: HP:0030104 ! Abnormal muscle fiber gamma sarcoglycan
children.defn: "Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced gamma sarcoglyan protein in the muscle biopsy." [UToronto:htrang]

"Deviation from normal in the amount of gamma sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines." [HPO:probinson, pmid:24843229, UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Abnormal muscle fiber beta sarcoglycan
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression

children.name: Absent muscle fiber beta sarcoglyan
is_a_string: HP:0030103 ! Abnormal muscle fiber beta sarcoglycan
children.defn: "Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of beta sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy. " [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Reduced muscle fiber beta sarcoglycan
is_a_string: HP:0030103 ! Abnormal muscle fiber beta sarcoglycan
children.defn: "Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced beta sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy." [UToronto:htrang]

"Deviation from normal in the amount of beta sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines." [HPO:probinson, pmid:24843229, UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Reduced muscle fiber perlecan
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression
children.defn: "Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced perlecan protein in the muscle biopsy. Perlecan is a basement membrane-specific heparan sulfate proteoglycan core protein (HSPG) also known as heparan sulfate proteoglycan 2 (HSPG2)." [HPO:probinson, UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Abnormal muscle fiber lamin A/C
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression

children.name: Reduced muscle fiber lamin A/C
is_a_string: HP:0030123 ! Abnormal muscle fiber lamin A/C
children.defn: "A decreased amount of lamin A/C in muscle tissue. This feature can be shown by immunohistochemistry of Western blotting of muscle tissue." [HPO:probinson, UToronto:htrang]

"A deviation from the normal amount of lamin A/C in muscle tissue. The LMNA gene gives rise to at least three splicing isoforms including the two main isoforms, lamin A and lamin C. These are constitutive components of the fibrous nuclear lamina and have different roles, ranging from mechanical nuclear membrane maintenance to gene regulation. " [HPO:probinson, pmid:24843229]

children.name: Abnormal muscle fiber calpain-3
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression

children.name: Absent muscle fiber calpain-3
children.defn: "Western blot shows complete lack of calpain-3 protein in the muscle biopsy tissue. " [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Reduced muscle fiber calpain-3
children.defn: "Western blot reveals reduced calpain-3 protein in the muscle biopsy tissue." [UToronto:htrang]

"A deviation from normal in the amount of calpain-3 in muscle tissue. Calpains are intracellular nonlysosomal cysteine proteases modulated by calcium ions. A typical calpain is a heterodimer composed of two distinct subunits, one large (over 80 kDa) and the other small (30 kDa). While only one gene encoding the small subunit has been demonstrated, there are many genes for the large one. CAPN3 is similar to ubiquitous Calpain 1 and 2 (m-calpain and micro-calpain), but contains specific insertion sequences (NS, IS1 and IS2). Calpains cleave target proteins to modify their properties, rather than breaking down the substrates." [HPO:probinson, pmid:24843229]

children.name: Abnormal muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan
is_a_string: HP:0030089 ! Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression

children.name: Reduced muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan
is_a_string: HP:0030105 ! Abnormal muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan

children.name: Absent muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan
is_a_string: HP:0030105 ! Abnormal muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan
children.defn: "Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of delta sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy. " [UToronto:htrang]

"Deviation from normal in the amount of delta sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines." [HPO:probinson, pmid:24843229, UToronto:htrang]

"Deviation from normal in the amount of alpha sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines." [HPO:probinson, pmid:24843229, UToronto:htrang]

[HPO:probinson, pmid:11592034, UToronto:htrang]

"Any abnormality of the skeletal muscle cell. Muscle fibers are subdivided into two types. Type I fibers are fatigue-resistant and rich in oxidative enzymes (they stain light with the myosin ATPase reaction), and type II fibers are fast-contracting, fatigue-prone, and rich in glycolytic enzymes (these fibers stain darkly). Normal muscle tissue has a random distribution of type I and type II fibers." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absent right superior vena cava
is_a_string: HP:0005301 ! Persistent left superior vena cava
children.defn: "Absence of the right superior vena cava (RSVC). An absent RSVC is always associated with a persistent left superior vena cava (PLSVC). During normal fetal development, the left-sided anterior venous cardinal system regresses, leaving the coronary sinus (CS) and the ligament of Marshall. Failure of the closure of the left anterior cardinal vein results in PLSVC. In general, PLSVC is associated with the right superior vena cava (RSVC) and drains into the RA via a dilated CS. When developmental arrest occurs at an earlier stage, the CS is absent and the PLSVC drains into the left atrium." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:17578953, pmid:19808620, pmid:20532458]

children.name: Overriding aorta
children.defn: "An overriding aorta is a congenital heart defect where the aorta is positioned directly over a ventricular septal defect, instead of over the left ventricle. The result is that the aorta receives some blood from the right ventricle, which reduces the amount of oxygen in the blood. It is one of the four conditions of the Tetralogy of Fallot. The aortic root can be displaced toward the front (anteriorly) or directly above the septal defect, but it is always abnormally located to the right of the root of the pulmonary artery. The degree of override is quite variable, with 5-95% of the valve being connected to the right ventricle." [HPO:curators]

This dilated terminal vein penetrates the cortex to drain either (a) superficially to cortical veins or sinuses, (b) deeply to subependymal veins of the lateral ventricle and then into the galenic system, (c) to the fourth ventricle and then to the pontomesencephalic vein, or (d) to the precentral cerebellar vein and into the galenic system." is_a_string: HP:0011545 ! Abnormal connection of the cardiac segments

children.name: Transposition of the great arteries
is_a_string: HP:0011603 ! Congenital malformation of the great arteries

children.name: Transposition of the great arteries with intact ventricular septum
is_a_string: HP:0001669 ! Transposition of the great arteries

children.name: Transposition of the great arteries with ventricular septal defect
is_a_string: HP:0001669 ! Transposition of the great arteries

children.defn: "A complex congenital heart defect in which the aorta arises from the morphologic right ventricle and the pulmonary artery arises from the morphologic left ventricle." [eMedicine:900574, HPO:probinson, pmid:10798431]

children.name: Abnormal atrioventricular connection
is_a_string: HP:0011545 ! Abnormal connection of the cardiac segments

children.name: Overriding atrioventricular valve
children.defn: "An atrioventricular valve that empties into both ventricles. The valve overrides the interventricular septum above a ventricular septum defect." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Mitral atresia
is_a_string: HP:0001633 ! Abnormality of the mitral valve
children.defn: "A congenital defect with failure to open of the mitral valve orifice." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Straddling atrioventricular valve
children.defn: "Anomalous insertion of the chordae tendinae or papillary muscles into the contralateral ventricle in the presence of a ventricular septum defect." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Double inlet atrioventricular connection
Double inlet left ventricle
children.defn: "The condition in which both atria are joined to the left ventricle each by its own atrioventricular valve. Usually there is a hypoplastic right ventricle, which may be on the opposite side of the heart as usual." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Double inlet right ventricle
children.defn: "The condition in which both atria are joined to the right ventricle each by its own atrioventricular valve. Usually, the left ventricle is hypoplastic." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Double inlet to single ventricle of indeterminate morphology
Double inlet to single ventricle with common atrioventricular orifice
is_a_string: HP:0011557 ! Double inlet to single ventricle of indeterminate morphology

children.name: Double inlet to single ventricle with two atrioventricular valves
is_a_string: HP:0011557 ! Double inlet to single ventricle of indeterminate morphology

children.defn: "The condition in which both atria are joined to a single ventricle each by its own atrioventricular valve. The morphology of this ventricle does not allow one to determine if it corresponds to the left or right ventricle." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]
"The condition in which both atria are joined to a single ventricle each by its own atrioventricular valve." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Univentricular heart with absent left sided atrioventricular connection
is_a_string: HP:0011547 ! Absent left sided atrioventricular connection

children.name: Biventricular heart with straddling right sided atrioventricular valve and absent left sided atrioventricular connection
is_a_string: HP:0011547 ! Absent left sided atrioventricular connection

children.name: Right sided atrium to left ventricle and absent left sided atrioventricular connection
is_a_string: HP:0011547 ! Absent left sided atrioventricular connection

children.name: Ambiguous atrioventricular connection
children.defn: "With left or right cardiac isomerism in a biventricular, the atrioventricular connections are perforce ambiguous, in that one of the connections is concordant (e.g., right-sided morphologic right atrium connected to a morphologic right ventricle) and one of the connections is discordant (e.g., left-sided morphologic right atrium connected to a  morphologic left ventricle)." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Discordant atrioventricular connection
children.defn: "Connection of the right atrium to the left ventricle and of the left atrium to the right ventricle in a biventricular heart." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the circulatory connection between atria and ventricles." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Congenital malformation of the great arteries
is_a_string: HP:0002564 ! Malformation of the heart and great vessels

children.name: Congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries
is_a_string: HP:0011534 ! Abnormal spatial orientation of the cardiac segments
HP:0011603 ! Congenital malformation of the great arteries

children.name: Congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries with ventricular septal defect
is_a_string: HP:0011540 ! Congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries

children.defn: "The essence of the lesion is the combination of discordant atrioventricular and ventriculo-arterial connections. Thus, the morphologically right atrium is connected to a morphologically left ventricle across the mitral valve, with the left ventricle then connected to the pulmonary trunk. The morphologically left atrium is connected to the morphologically right ventricle across the tricuspid valve, with the morphologically right ventricle connected to the aorta." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:21569592]

children.name: Truncus arteriosus
is_a_string: HP:0011603 ! Congenital malformation of the great arteries

children.name: Type I truncus arteriosus
children.defn: "Truncus arteriosus (single great artery leaving the base of the heart, giving rise to the coronary, pulmonary, and systemic arteries) with a short pulmonary trunk arises from the truncus arteriosus, giving rise to both pulmonary arteries." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Type II truncus arteriosus
children.defn: "Truncus arteriosus (single great artery leaving the base of the heart, giving rise to the coronary, pulmonary, and systemic arteries) with each pulmonary artery arising separate from each other on the posterior or lateral aspect of the truncus." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Type III truncus arteriosus
children.defn: "Truncus arteriosus (single great artery leaving the base of the heart, giving rise to the coronary, pulmonary, and systemic arteries) whereby one of the two pulmonary artery branched does not arise from the common pulmonary trunk, but instead from the ductus arteriosus or directly from the aorta." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Type IV truncus arteriosus
children.defn: "Truncus arteriosus (single great artery leaving the base of the heart, giving rise to the coronary, pulmonary, and systemic arteries) whereby the aortic arch is hypoplastic or interrupted, and a large patent ductus arteriosus is present." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

"A single arterial trunk arises from the cardiac mass. The pulmonary arteries, aorta and coronary arteries arise from this single trunk with no evidence of another outflow tract." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Patent ductus arteriosus
is_a_string: HP:0011603 ! Congenital malformation of the great arteries

children.name: Patent ductus arteriosus after birth at term
children.defn: "Abnormal persistent patency of the ductus arteriosus in postnatal life when birth was at 37 completed weeks of gestation or greater." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Patent ductus arteriosus after premature birth
children.defn: "Abnormal persistent patency of the ductus arteriosus when birth was at less than 37 weeks completed gestation." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Bilateral ductus arteriosus
children.defn: "The presence of both a left and a right ductus arteriosus." [DDD:dbrown]

"In utero, the ductus arteriosus (DA) serves to divert ventricular output away from the lungs and toward the placenta by connecting the main pulmonary artery to the descending aorta. A patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) in the first 3 days of life is a physiologic shunt in healthy term and preterm newborn infants, and normally is substantially closed within about 24 hours after bith and completely closed after about three weeks. Failure of physiologcal closure is referred to a persistent or patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). Depending on the degree of left-to-right shunting, PDA can have clinical consequences." [HPO:probinson, pmid:20421261]

children.name: Aortopulmonary window
is_a_string: HP:0011603 ! Congenital malformation of the great arteries
children.defn: "A congenital anomaly with an abnormal connection between the aorta and the main pulmonary artery resulting in an aortopulmonary shunt." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital malformation of the left heart
is_a_string: HP:0002564 ! Malformation of the heart and great vessels

children.name: Abnormality of cardiac ventricle
is_a_string: HP:0002564 ! Malformation of the heart and great vessels

children.name: Abnormality of the ventricular septum
is_a_string: HP:0001671 ! Abnormality of the cardiac septa

children.name: Left ventricular septal hypertrophy
is_a_string: HP:0010438 ! Abnormality of the ventricular septum

children.name: Ventricular septal defect
is_a_string: HP:0010438 ! Abnormality of the ventricular septum

children.name: Perimembranous ventricular septal defect
children.defn: "A ventricular septal defect that is confluent with and involves the membranous septum and is bordered by an atrioventricular valve, not including the type 3 VSDs." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:10798413]

children.name: Restrictive ventricular septal defect
children.defn: "Any ventricular septal defect (VSD) that is small enough to restrict flow across it such that a pressure gradient exists between the two sides of the VSD." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:10798413]

children.name: Non-restrictive ventricular septal defect
children.defn: "Any ventricular septal defect (VSD) that does not restrict flow across it sufficiently to generate a pressure gradient between the two sides of the VSD." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Inlet ventricular septal defect
children.defn: ".A ventricular septal defect that involves the inlet of the right ventricular septum immediately inferior to the AV valve apparatus." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:17101870]

children.name: Muscular ventricular septal defect
Apical muscular ventricular septal defect
children.defn: "A muscular ventricular septal defect located at the apex of the heart." [DDD:dbrown]

"The trabecular septum is the largest part of the interventricular septum. It extends from the membranous septum to the apex and superiorly to the infundibular septum. A defect in the trabecular septum is called muscular VSD if the defect is completely rimmed by muscle." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:17101870]

children.name: Gerbode ventricular septal defect
children.defn: "A type of ventricular septal defect communicating directly between the left ventricle and right atrium. This is anatomically possible because the normal tricuspid valve is more apically displaced than the mitral valve." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:19561249]

children.name: Subarterial ventricular septal defect
children.defn: "A ventricular septal defect that lies beneath the semilunar valve(s) in the conal or outlet septum." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:10798413]
"A hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart. The defect is centered around the most superior aspect of the ventricular septum." [HPO:curators]
"An abnormality of the interventricular septum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the right ventricle
Right ventricular outlet obstruction
is_a_string: HP:0001707 ! Abnormality of the right ventricle

children.name: Right ventricular failure
is_a_string: HP:0001707 ! Abnormality of the right ventricle
children.defn: "Reduced ability of the right ventricle to perform its function (to receive blood from the right atrium and to eject blood into the pulmonary artery), often leading top pitting peripheral edema, ascites, and hepatomegaly." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cor pulmonale
is_a_string: HP:0001707 ! Abnormality of the right ventricle
children.defn: "Right-sided heart failure resulting from chronic hypertension in the pulmonary arteries and right ventricle." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Right ventricular hypertrophy
is_a_string: HP:0001707 ! Abnormality of the right ventricle
children.defn: "In this case the right ventricle is more muscular than normal, causing a characteristic boot-shaped (coeur-en-sabot) appearance as seen on anterior- posterior chest x-rays. Right ventricular hypertrophy is commonly associated with any form of right ventricular outflow obstruction or pulmonary hypertension, which may in turn owe its origin to left-sided disease. The echocardiographic signs are thickening of the anterior right ventricular wall and the septum. Cavity size is usually normal, or slightly enlarged. In many cases there is associated volume overload present due to tricuspid regurgitation, in the absence of this, septal motion is normal." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Right ventricular dilatation
is_a_string: HP:0001707 ! Abnormality of the right ventricle
children.defn: "Enlargement of the chamber of the right ventricle." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17715105]

children.name: Hypoplasia of right ventricle
is_a_string: HP:0001707 ! Abnormality of the right ventricle

children.defn: "An abnormality of the right ventricle of the heart." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cardiac diverticulum
children.defn: "A cardiac diverticulum is a rare congential malformation which is either fibrous or muscular." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormality of the left ventricle
Double outlet left ventricle
is_a_string: HP:0001711 ! Abnormality of the left ventricle
children.defn: "A congenital defect of heart development characterized by origin of both pulmonary artery and aorta from the morphological left ventricle." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Impaired left ventricular function
is_a_string: HP:0001711 ! Abnormality of the left ventricle

children.name: Left ventricular hypertrophy
is_a_string: HP:0001711 ! Abnormality of the left ventricle

children.name: Abnormality of the left ventricular outflow tract
is_a_string: HP:0001711 ! Abnormality of the left ventricle

children.name: Subaortic stenosis
is_a_string: HP:0011103 ! Abnormality of the left ventricular outflow tract

children.name: Membranous subvalvular aortic stenosis
children.defn: "Subvalvular stenosis is caused by a diaphragm-like membrane. The stenosis is clinically manifested like any other form of aortic stenosis but is often associated with some aortic insufficiency." [HPO:probinson, pmid:5817839]

children.name: Muscular subvalvular aortic stenosis
children.defn: "A type of subvalvular aortic stenosis resulting from thickening of the musculature of the interventricular septum, which results in obstruction to blood flow though the left-ventricular outflow tract." [HPO:probinson]
"A fixed form of obstruction to blood flow across the left-ventricular outflow tract related to stenosis (narrowing) below the level of the aortic valve." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the outflow tract of the left ventricle." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the left ventricle of the heart." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ventricular hypertrophy
children.defn: "Enlargement of the cardiac ventricular muscle tissue with increase in the width of the wall of the ventricle and loss of elasticity. Ventricular hypertrophy is clinically differentiated into left and right ventricular hypertrophy." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Myocardial steatosis
children.defn: "Steatosis in the myocardium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal ventricular filling
children.defn: "An abnormality of filling of a ventricle with blood during diastole." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of a cardiac ventricle." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Conotruncal defect
is_a_string: HP:0002564 ! Malformation of the heart and great vessels

children.name: Tetralogy of Fallot
Tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary stenosis
children.defn: "The commonest form of tetralogy of Fallot characterized by pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy, without pulmonary atresia, absent pulmonary valve, atrioventricular canal defect or absent subarterial conus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary atresia
Tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary atresia and major aortopulmonary collateral arteries
is_a_string: HP:0012516 ! Tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary atresia
children.defn: "A type of tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary atresia in which all pulmonary blood flow is derived from major aortopulmonary collateral arteries (MAPCA)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:22368654]
"An extreme form of tetralogy of Fallot characterized by absence of flow from the right ventricle to the pulmonary arteries." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432, pmid:22368654]

children.name: Tetralogy of Fallot with atrioventricular canal defect
Tetralogy of Fallot with absent subarterial conus
Tetralogy of Fallot with absent pulmonary valve
is_a_string: HP:0005134 ! Absence of the pulmonary valve
children.defn: "Features of tetralogy of Fallot with either rudimentary ridges or the complete absence of pulmonic valve tissue." [DDD:dbrown]

"A congenital cardiac malformation comprising pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy. The diagnosis of TOF is made if at least three of the four above mentioned features are present." [HPO:probinson]

"A congenital malformation of the outflow tract of the heart. Conotruncal defects are thought to result from a disturbance of the outflow tract of the embryonic heart, and comprise truncus arteriosus, tetralogy of Fallot, interrupted aortic arch, transposition of the great arteries, and double outlet right ventricle." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the pericardium
is_a_string: HP:0002564 ! Malformation of the heart and great vessels

children.name: Pericarditis
Constrictive pericarditis
children.defn: "Presence of a thickened, fibrotic pericardium that forms a non-compliant shell around the heart, and resulting from chronic inflammation of the pericardium." [HPO:probinson]
"Inflammation of the sac-like covering around the heart (pericardium)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital defect of the pericardium
Total absence of the pericardium
is_a_string: HP:0011628 ! Congenital defect of the pericardium
children.defn: "No pericardium around the heart, occurring as a congenital defect, not the result of a surgical pericardectomy." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Partial diaphragmatic absence of pericardium
is_a_string: HP:0011628 ! Congenital defect of the pericardium
children.defn: "Lack of a part of the pericardium over the diaphragmatic surface of the heart. It is a congenital defect, not the result of a pericardectomy. Pericardium is present on other parts of the heart." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Partial left sided absence of pericardium
is_a_string: HP:0011628 ! Congenital defect of the pericardium
children.defn: "A congenital anomaly with lack of part of the pericardium on the lefthand side of the heart." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Complete right sided absence of pericardium
is_a_string: HP:0011628 ! Congenital defect of the pericardium
children.defn: "No pericardium is present on the righthand side of the heart. It is a congenital absence of pericardium rather than the result of a pericardectomy." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Complete diaphragmatic absence of pericardium
is_a_string: HP:0011628 ! Congenital defect of the pericardium
children.defn: "No pericardium over the diaphragmatic surface of the heart. It is a congenital defect, not the result of a pericardectomy. Pericardium is present on other parts of the heart." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Complete left sided absence of pericardium
is_a_string: HP:0011628 ! Congenital defect of the pericardium
children.defn: "A congenital anomaly with complete lack of the pericardium on the lefthand side of the heart." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Partial right sided absence of pericardium
is_a_string: HP:0011628 ! Congenital defect of the pericardium
children.defn: "A congenital anomaly with lack of part of the pericardium on the righthand side of the heart." [DDD:dbrown]
"A developmental defect of the pericardium with congenital onset." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Pericardial mesothelioma
children.defn: "A Malignant mesothelioma originating from cells of the pericardium (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the heart)." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Pericardial effusion
Hemopericardium
children.defn: "Accumulation of blood within the pericardial sac." [HPO:probinson, pmid:10882282]

children.name: Serous pericardial effusion
children.defn: "Accumulation of serous fluid (pale yellow and transparent fluid) in the pericardial sac." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Chylopericardium
children.defn: "Accumulation of chyle (the whitish fluid taken up by the lacteals in the intestine, consisting of an emulsion of lymph and triglyceride fat thatpasses into the veins by the thoracic duct) in the pericardium. Chylopericardium is generally caused by obstruction of or trauma to the thoracic duct." [HPO:probinson]
"Accumulation of fluid within the pericardium." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the pericardium, i.e., of the  fluid filled sac that surrounds the heart and the proximal ends of the aorta, vena cava, and the pulmonary artery." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal spatial orientation of the cardiac segments
is_a_string: HP:0002564 ! Malformation of the heart and great vessels

children.name: L-looping of the right ventricle
is_a_string: HP:0011534 ! Abnormal spatial orientation of the cardiac segments

children.name: Superior-inferior ventricles without criss-cross atrioventricular valves
is_a_string: HP:0011534 ! Abnormal spatial orientation of the cardiac segments

children.name: Abnormal atrial arrangement
is_a_string: HP:0011534 ! Abnormal spatial orientation of the cardiac segments

children.name: Right atrial isomerism
children.defn: "Right atrial isomerism is characterized by bilateral triangular, morphologically right atrial, appendages, both joining the atrial chamber along a broad front with internal terminal crest." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:3408620]

children.name: Left atrial isomerism
children.defn: "In left atrial isomerism there is a bilateral small finger-shaped morphologically left atrial appendage joining the atrial chamber along a narrow front without an internal terminal crest." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:3408620]

children.name: Atrial situs inversus
children.defn: "Mirror image atrial arrangement, with morphologic right atrium on the left hand side and morphologic left atrium on the right hand side." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Atrial situs ambiguous
children.defn: "Common atrium without defining morphologic features." [DDD:dbrown]
"Abnormality of the spatial relationship of the atria to other components of the heart." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Situs inversus totalis
is_a_string: HP:0011534 ! Abnormal spatial orientation of the cardiac segments
children.defn: "A left-right reversal (or \"mirror reflection\") of the anatomical location of the major thoracic and abdominal organs." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Criss-cross atrioventricular valves
is_a_string: HP:0011534 ! Abnormal spatial orientation of the cardiac segments

children.name: Criss-cross atrioventricular valves with superior-inferior ventricles

children.defn: "Crossing of the inflow streams of the two ventricles, due to an apparent twisting of the heart about its long axis." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the heart valves
is_a_string: HP:0002564 ! Malformation of the heart and great vessels

children.name: Increased prevalence of valvular disease
is_a_string: HP:0001654 ! Abnormality of the heart valves

children.name: Abnormality of the pulmonary valve
is_a_string: HP:0001654 ! Abnormality of the heart valves

children.name: Pulmonary valve defects
is_a_string: HP:0001641 ! Abnormality of the pulmonary valve

children.name: Pulmonic stenosis
is_a_string: HP:0001641 ! Abnormality of the pulmonary valve
children.defn: "A narrowing of the right ventricular outflow tract that can occur at the pulmonary valve (valvular stenosis) or just below the pulmonary valve (infundibular stenosis)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Dysplastic pulmonary valve
is_a_string: HP:0001641 ! Abnormality of the pulmonary valve

children.name: Pulmonary valve atresia
is_a_string: HP:0001641 ! Abnormality of the pulmonary valve
children.defn: "A congenital disorder of the pulmonary valve in which the orifice of the valve fails to develop." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pulmonic valve myxoma
is_a_string: HP:0001641 ! Abnormality of the pulmonary valve

children.name: Pulmonary insufficiency
is_a_string: HP:0001641 ! Abnormality of the pulmonary valve
children.defn: "The retrograde (backwards) flow of blood through the pulmonary valve into the right ventricle during diastole." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Bicuspid pulmonary valve
is_a_string: HP:0001641 ! Abnormality of the pulmonary valve
children.defn: "The presence of a bicuspid pulmonary valve." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absence of the pulmonary valve
is_a_string: HP:0001641 ! Abnormality of the pulmonary valve
children.defn: "Refers to the specific combination of defects with a severely dysplastic pulmonary valve and massively dilated branch pulmonary arteries." [DDD:dbrown]
"An abnormality of the pulmonary valve." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the aortic valve
is_a_string: HP:0001654 ! Abnormality of the heart valves

children.name: Aortic valve stenosis
is_a_string: HP:0001646 ! Abnormality of the aortic valve

children.name: Supravalvular aortic stenosis
children.defn: "A pathological narrowing in the region above the aortic valve associated with restricted left ventricular outflow." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Calcific aortic valve stenosis
children.defn: "A type of aortic valve stenosis associated with calcification of the aortic heart valve." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of a stenosis (narrowing) of the aortic valve." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bicuspid aortic valve
is_a_string: HP:0001646 ! Abnormality of the aortic valve
children.defn: "The presence of an aortic valve with two instead of the normal three cusps (flaps)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aortic valve atresia
is_a_string: HP:0001646 ! Abnormality of the aortic valve
children.defn: "A congenital disorder of the aortic valve in which the orifice of the valve fails to develop." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nodular calcific aortic valve disease
is_a_string: HP:0001646 ! Abnormality of the aortic valve

children.name: Aortic regurgitation
is_a_string: HP:0001646 ! Abnormality of the aortic valve
children.defn: "An insufficiency of the aortic valve, leading to regurgitation (backward flow) of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Dysplastic aortic valve
is_a_string: HP:0001646 ! Abnormality of the aortic valve

children.name: Unicuspid aortic valve
is_a_string: HP:0001646 ! Abnormality of the aortic valve
children.defn: "The presence of an aortic valve with one instead of the normal three cusps (flaps)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:18480095, pmid:20329493]
"Any abnormality of the aortic valve." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormality of the atrioventricular valves
is_a_string: HP:0001654 ! Abnormality of the heart valves

children.name: Abnormality of the tricuspid valve
is_a_string: HP:0006705 ! Abnormality of the atrioventricular valves

children.name: Tricuspid valve prolapse
is_a_string: HP:0001702 ! Abnormality of the tricuspid valve
children.defn: "One or more of the leaflets (cusps) of the tricuspid valve bulges back into the right atrium upon contraction of the right ventricle." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tricuspid regurgitation
is_a_string: HP:0001702 ! Abnormality of the tricuspid valve
children.defn: "Failure of the tricuspid valve to close sufficiently upon contraction of the right ventricle, causing blood to regurgitate (flow backward) into the right atrium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ebstein's anomaly of the tricuspid valve
is_a_string: HP:0001702 ! Abnormality of the tricuspid valve
children.defn: "Ebstein's anomaly refers to an abnormally placed and deformed tricuspid valve characterized by apical displacement of the septal and posterior tricuspid valve leaflets, leading to atrialization of the right ventricle with a variable degree of malformation and displacement of the anterior leaflet." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tricuspid atresia
is_a_string: HP:0001702 ! Abnormality of the tricuspid valve
children.defn: "Failure to develop of the tricuspid valve and thus lack of the normal connection between the right atrium and the right ventricle." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Short chordae tendineae of the tricuspid valve
is_a_string: HP:0001702 ! Abnormality of the tricuspid valve
children.defn: "Abnormally short chordae tendineae of the tricuspid valve." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Imperforate tricuspid valve
is_a_string: HP:0001702 ! Abnormality of the tricuspid valve
children.defn: "An tricuspid valve that has failed to open (atretic)." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Tricuspid stenosis
is_a_string: HP:0001702 ! Abnormality of the tricuspid valve
children.defn: "A narrowing of the orifice of the tricuspid valve of the heart." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Hypoplastic tricuspid valve
is_a_string: HP:0001702 ! Abnormality of the tricuspid valve
children.defn: "Congenital defect characterized by underdevelopment of the tricuspid valve." [DDD:dbrown]
"An abnormality of the tricuspid valve." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Imperforate atrioventricular valve
is_a_string: HP:0006705 ! Abnormality of the atrioventricular valves
children.defn: "An atrioventricular valve that has failed to open (atretic)." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Abnormality of the mitral valve
is_a_string: HP:0006705 ! Abnormality of the atrioventricular valves

children.name: Short chordae tendineae of the mitral valve
is_a_string: HP:0001633 ! Abnormality of the mitral valve
children.defn: "Abnormally short chordae tendineae of the mitral valve." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Double orifice mitral valve
is_a_string: HP:0001633 ! Abnormality of the mitral valve
children.defn: "The left atrio-ventricular connection consists of two anatomically distinct orifices separated by accessory fibrous tissue." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson, pmid:20851840]

children.name: Mitral valve arcade
is_a_string: HP:0001633 ! Abnormality of the mitral valve
children.defn: "Anomalous mitral valve arcade is diagnosed b ased on the following features (1) An adequately sized mitral valve orifice; (2) short, thick, and poorly differentiated chordae with direct union of the papillary muscles to the anterior leaflet; (3) narrow or nearly nonexistent spaces between the abnormal chordae; and (4) greater differentiation of the chordae attached to the posterior papillary muscle." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:20404264]

children.name: Mitral stenosis
is_a_string: HP:0001633 ! Abnormality of the mitral valve

children.name: Supramitral ring
children.defn: "A congenital stenotic mitral valvular anomaly with a ring of tissue above the mitral valve." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Congenital mitral stenosis
children.defn: "Mitral stenosis with congenital onset." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Parachute mitral valve
children.defn: "Abnormality of the mitral valve apparatus, whereby chordae attach to a single papillary muscle or hypoplastic papillary muscles." [DDD:dbrown]
"Ab abnormal narrowing of the orifice of the mitral valve." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Mitral regurgitation
is_a_string: HP:0001633 ! Abnormality of the mitral valve

children.name: Cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet
children.defn: "Cleft in the anterior mitral valve leaflet not associated with an atrioventricular canal defect." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:6829465]

"An abnormality of the mitral valve characterized by insufficiency or incompetence of the mitral valve resulting in retrograde leaking of blood through the mitral valve upon ventricular contraction." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Mitral valve prolapse
is_a_string: HP:0001633 ! Abnormality of the mitral valve
