children.defn: "One or both of the leaflets (cusps) of the mitral valve bulges back into the left atrium upon contraction of the left ventricle." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Myxomatous mitral valve degeneration
is_a_string: HP:0001633 ! Abnormality of the mitral valve
children.defn: "Myxomatous mitral valve is defined as the presence of excess leaflet tissue and leaflet thickening greater than 5 mm, resulting in a prolapse greater than 2 mm into the left atrium on parasternal long axis view." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21143934]
"An abnormality of the mitral valve." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of an atrioventricular valve." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of a Cardiac valve." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the cardiac septa
is_a_string: HP:0002564 ! Malformation of the heart and great vessels

children.name: Atrioventricular canal defect
is_a_string: HP:0001671 ! Abnormality of the cardiac septa

children.name: Atrioventricular canal defect with right ventricle aorta and pulmonary atresia
children.defn: "An atrioventricular canal defect whereby the aorta arises from right ventricle instead of from the left ventricle combined with atresia of the pulmonic valve." [HPO:probinson, pmid:12632326]

children.name: Primum atrial septal defect
is_a_string: HP:0001631 ! Defect in the atrial septum
children.defn: "An ostium primum atrial septal defect is located in the most anterior and inferior aspect of the atrial septum. The ostium primum refers to an anterior and inferior opening (ostium) within the septum primum, which divides the rudimentary atrium during fetal development. The ostium primum is normally sealed by fusion of the superior and inferior endocardial cushions around 5 weeks' gestation. Ostium primum defects result from a failure of the fusion of the embryologic endocardial cushion and septum primum." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Complete atrioventricular canal defect
children.defn: "A congenital heart defect characteizred by a specific combination of heart defects with a common atrioventricular valve, primum atrial septal defect and inlet ventricular septal defect." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson, pmid:16722604]

children.name: Transitional atrioventricular canal defect
children.defn: "A specific combination of heart defects with a primum atrial septal defect, cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet, and an inlet ventricular septal defect. There are two valve annuli and two valve orifices." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Unbalanced atrioventricular canal defect
children.defn: "Anatomic features of unbalanced atrioventricular septal defect (AVSD) include varying amounts of ventricular hypoplasia, as well as malalignment of the atrioventricular junction. In complete AVSD, the common AV valve can be situated either equally over the right and left ventricles (balanced) or unequally over the ventricles (unbalanced)." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:20837915]

children.name: Intermediate atrioventricular canal defect
children.defn: "A specific combination of heart defects with a primum atrial septal defect, cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet, and inlet ventricular defect. There is one valve annulus and two valve orifices." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Partial atrioventricular canal defect
children.defn: "A specific combination of heart defects including a primum atrial septal defect and cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet. There is not an inlet ventricular septal defect present. There are two valve annuluses and two valve orifices." [DDD:dbrown]
"A defect of the atrioventricular septum of the heart." [HPO:probinson, pmid:12632326]

children.name: Abnormality of the atrial septum
is_a_string: HP:0001671 ! Abnormality of the cardiac septa

children.name: Atrial septal aneurysm
is_a_string: HP:0011994 ! Abnormality of the atrial septum
children.defn: "A bulging of  the interatrial septum towards one side. IN adults, atrial septal aneurysm can be defined as a protrusion of the aneurysm of >10 mm beyond the plane of the atrial septum as measured by transesophageal echocardiography." [HPO:probinson, pmid:7758185]

children.name: Defect in the atrial septum
is_a_string: HP:0011994 ! Abnormality of the atrial septum

children.name: Secundum atrial septal defect
is_a_string: HP:0001631 ! Defect in the atrial septum
children.defn: "A kind of atrial septum defect arising from an enlarged foramen ovale, inadequate growth of the septum secundum, or excessive absorption of the septum primum." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Sinus venosus atrial septal defect
is_a_string: HP:0001631 ! Defect in the atrial septum
children.defn: "An interatrial communication caused by a deficiency of the common wall between the superior vena cava (SVC) and the right-sided pulmonary veins. SVASD is commonly associated with anomalous pulmonary venous connection (APVC) of some or all of the pulmonary veins, which produces additional left-to-right shunting." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson, pmid:16172274]

children.name: Patent foramen ovale
is_a_string: HP:0001631 ! Defect in the atrial septum
children.defn: "Failure of the foramen ovale to seal postnatally, leaving a potential conduit between the left and right cardiac atria." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]
"Atrial septal defect (ASD) is a congenital abnormality of the interatrial septum that enables blood flow between the left and right atria via the interatrial septum." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the interatrial septum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital septal defect
is_a_string: HP:0001671 ! Abnormality of the cardiac septa

children.defn: "An anomaly of the intra-atrial or intraventricular septum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of cardiac atrium
is_a_string: HP:0002564 ! Malformation of the heart and great vessels

children.name: Cor triatriatrum
children.defn: "The presence of an additional membrane in the left or right cardiac atrium which results in the subdivision of the affected atrium (and thus in total three atria, whence the name)." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Common atrium
children.defn: "Complete absence of the interatrial septum with common atrioventricular valve and two atrioventricular connections." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the coronary sinus
Coronary sinus diverticulum
is_a_string: HP:0011642 ! Abnormality of the coronary sinus
children.defn: "A venous pouch within the left ventricular wall, with a neck opening into the coronary sinus." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:3138904]

children.name: Coronary sinus atrial septal defect
is_a_string: HP:0011642 ! Abnormality of the coronary sinus
children.defn: "An atrial septal defect characterized by a deficiency in the tissue separating the coronary sinus from the left atrium (LA). This results in partial or complete unroofing of the coronary sinus leading to a predominantly left-to-right shunt through the coronary sinus (LA to coronary sinus to right atrium [RA]). The orifice of the ostium is frequently large because of the increased flow. From the RA side, the defect is located at the level of the coronary sinus ostium and may also include some deficiency in atrial tissue around the ostium. From the LA side, the size can be variable depending on the degree of unroofing of the coronary sinus." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson, pmid:18806021]

"An abnormality of the coronary sinus, which is formed by the union of the great cardiac vein and the left marginal vein and terminates in the right atrium. The coronary sinus functions to o collect deoxygenated blood from the myocardium of the heart and drain it into the right atrium." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cor triatriatum dexter
children.defn: "A congenital anomaly with partitioning of the right atrium to form a triatrial heart caused by persistence of the right valve of the sinus venosus. Typically, the right atrial partition is due to exaggerated fetal eustachian and thebesian valves, which together form an incomplete septum across the lower part of the atrium. This septum may range from a reticulum to a substantial sheet of tissue." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson, pmid:17948095]
"An abnormality of a cardiac atrium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the myocardium
is_a_string: HP:0002564 ! Malformation of the heart and great vessels

children.name: Myocarditis
children.defn: "Inflammation of the myocardium." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21304213, pmid:22185868, pmid:22361396]

children.name: Cardiomyopathy
Restrictive cardiomyopathy
children.defn: "Restrictive left ventricular physiology is characterized by a pattern of ventricular filling in which increased stiffness of the myocardium causes ventricular pressure to rise precipitously with only small increases in volume, defined as restrictive ventricular physiology in the presence of normal or reduced diastolic volumes (of one or both ventricles), normal or reduced systolic volumes, and normal ventricular wall thickness." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17916581]

children.name: Noncompaction cardiomyopathy
Biventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy
children.defn: "Noncompaction cardiomyopathy that affects both ventricles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Right ventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy
children.defn: "A predominantly right ventricular variant of isolated noncompaction cardiomyopathy." [HPO:probinson, pmid:23921774]

children.name: Left ventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy
children.defn: "Left ventricular non-compaction (LVNC) is characterized by prominent left ventricular trabeculae and deep inter-trabecular recesses. The myocardial wall is often thickened with a thin, compacted epicardial layer and a thickened endocardial layer. In some patients, LVNC is associated with left ventricular dilatation and systolic dysfunction, which can be transient in neonates." [pmid:17916581]

"A type of cardiomyopathy characterized anatomically by deep trabeculations in the ventricular wall, which define recesses communicating with the main ventricular chamber." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15210614, pmid:24282766]

children.name: Right ventricular cardiomyopathy
children.defn: "Right ventricular dysfunction (global or regional) with functional and morphological right ventricular abnormalities, with or without left ventricular disease." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17916581]

children.name: Takotsubo cardiomyopathy
children.defn: "Transient left ventricular apical ballooning syndrome or takotsubo cardiomyopathy is characterized by transient regional systolic dysfunction involving the left ventricular apex and/or mid-ventricle in the absence of obstructive coronary disease on coronary angiography. Patients present with an abrupt onset of angina-like chest pain, and have diffuse T-wave inversion, sometimes preceded by ST-segment elevation, and mild cardiac enzyme elevation." [pmid:17916581]

children.name: Dilated cardiomyopathy
children.defn: "Dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) is defined by the presence of left ventricular dilatation and left ventricular systolic dysfunction in the absence of abnormal loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) or coronary artery disease sufficient to cause global systolic impairment. Right ventricular dilation and dysfunction may be present but are not necessary for the diagnosis." [pmid:17916581]

children.name: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
Concentric hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
children.defn: "Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an symmetrical and concentric pattern of hypertrophy." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Asymmetric septal hypertrophy
children.defn: "Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an asymmetrical pattern of hypertrophy, with a predilection for the interventricular septum and myocyte disarray." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17916581]

"Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is defined by the presence of increased ventricular wall thickness or mass in the absence of loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) sufficient to cause the observed abnormality." [pmid:17916581]

"A myocardial disorder in which the heart muscle is structurally and functionally abnormal, in the absence of coronary artery disease, hypertension, valvular disease and congenital heart disease sufficient to cause the observed myocardial abnormality." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17916581]

children.name: Abnormal anatomic location of the heart
is_a_string: HP:0002564 ! Malformation of the heart and great vessels

children.name: Ectopia cordis
is_a_string: HP:0004307 ! Abnormal anatomic location of the heart

children.name: Cervical ectopia cordis
children.defn: "A type of ectopia cordis with the heart partially in the cervical region and withouta defect of the sternum." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abdominal ectopia cordis
children.defn: "Displacement of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and into the abdomen." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Thoracoabdominal ectopia cordis
children.defn: "Congenital malformation of the ventral wall with partial or total evisceration of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and displacement partially into the abdominal cavity." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson, pmid:19479716]

children.name: Thoracic ectopia cordis
children.defn: "Congenital malformation of the thoracic wall with partial or total displacement of the heart outside the thoracic cavity. This feature is associated with sternal cleft or absence of the sternum." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thoracocervical ectopia cordis
children.defn: "A type of ectopia cordis with the heart partially in the cervical region with a defect of the superior portion of the sternum." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]
"Congenital malformation of the ventral wall with partial or total evisceration of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and through the defect in the ventral wall." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Abnormal direction of ventricular apex
is_a_string: HP:0004307 ! Abnormal anatomic location of the heart

children.name: Rightward direction of ventricular apex
is_a_string: HP:0011600 ! Abnormal direction of ventricular apex
children.defn: "Abnormal plane of direction of the heart from the base to the apex towards the right. Left sided is normal." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Midline direction of ventricular apex
is_a_string: HP:0011600 ! Abnormal direction of ventricular apex
children.defn: "Abnormal plane of direction of the heart from the base to the apex in the midline. Left sided is normal." [DDD:dbrown]
"Abnormal plane of direction of the heart from the base to the apex. Left sided is normal." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Mesocardia
is_a_string: HP:0004307 ! Abnormal anatomic location of the heart
children.defn: "Mesocardia is a abnormal location of the heart in which the heart is in a midline position and the longitudinal axis of the heart lies in the mid-sagittal plane." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Dextrocardia
is_a_string: HP:0004307 ! Abnormal anatomic location of the heart
children.defn: "The heart is located in the right hand sided hemithorax. That is, there is a left-right reversal (or \"mirror reflection\") of the anatomical location of the heart in which the heart is locate on the right side instead of the left." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:sdoelken]

"Congenital malformation of the heart or great vessels (i.e., the large blood vesslesentering and leaving the heart: aorta, the pulmonary arteries and veins, and the superior and inferior vena cava)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the endocardium
Endocarditis
Libman-Sacks lesions
children.defn: "Libman-Sacks valvular lesions are sterile fibrofibrinous vegetations that favor the left-sided heart valves and usually form on the ventricular surface of the mitral valve." [pmid:18421506]

children.name: Bacterial endocarditis
children.defn: "A bacterial infection of the endocardium, the inner layer of the heart, which usually involves the heart valves." [HPO:sdoelken]
"An inflammation of the endocardium, the inner layer of the heart, which usually involves the heart valves." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Endocardial fibrosis
children.defn: "The presence of excessive connective tissue in the endocardium." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the endocardium." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the heart." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of cardiovascular system physiology
is_a_string: HP:0001626 ! Abnormality of the cardiovascular system

children.name: Hypotension
is_a_string: HP:0011025 ! Abnormality of cardiovascular system physiology

children.name: Orthostatic hypotension
is_a_string: HP:0012332 ! Abnormal autonomic nervous system physiology

children.name: Orthostatic hypotension due to autonomic dysfunction

children.defn: "A form of hypotension characterized by a sudden fall in blood pressure that occurs when a person assumes a standing position." [HPO:probinson]
"Low Blood Pressure, vascular hypotension." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal echocardiogram
is_a_string: HP:0011025 ! Abnormality of cardiovascular system physiology

children.name: Regional left ventricular wall motion abnormality
children.defn: "An abnormal motion of a segment of the left ventricle during the cardiac cycle." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced ejection fraction
Severely reduced ejection fraction
children.defn: "A large reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at least 55 percent, and a moderate reduction is defined as less than 30 percent." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16376782]

children.name: Moderately reduced ejection fraction
children.defn: "A medium reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at least 55 percent, and a moderate reduction is defined as 30-44 percent." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16376782]

children.name: Mildly reduced ejection fraction
children.defn: "A small reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at least 55 percent, and a mild reduction is defined as 45-54 percent." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16376782]
"A diminution of the volumetric fraction of blood pumped out of the ventricle with each cardiac cycle." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality detectable by sonography of the heart (echocardiography)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Heart murmur
is_a_string: HP:0011025 ! Abnormality of cardiovascular system physiology
children.defn: "An extra or unusual sound heard during a heartbeat caused vibrations resulting from the flow of blood through the heart." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cardiogenic shock
is_a_string: HP:0011025 ! Abnormality of cardiovascular system physiology
children.defn: "Severely decreased cardiac output with evidence of inadequate end-organ perfusion (i.e., tissue hypoxia) in the presence of adequate intravascular volume." [pmid:24188221]

children.name: Abnormality of blood circulation
is_a_string: HP:0011025 ! Abnormality of cardiovascular system physiology

children.name: Internal hemorrhage
Joint hemorrhage
children.defn: "Hemorrhage occurring within a joint." [HPO:gcarletti]

children.name: Hemorrhage of the eye
Subconjunctival hemorrhage
children.defn: "Bleeding beneath the mucous membrane that lines the inner surface of the eyelid." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Hyphema
children.defn: "Bleeding in the anterior chamber of the eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Choroid hemorrhage
children.defn: "Hemorrhage from the vessels of the choroid." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Vitreous hemorrhage
is_a_string: HP:0004327 ! Abnormality of the vitreous humor
children.defn: "Bleeding within the vitreous compartment of the eye." [DDD:akelly]
"Bleeding from vessels of the various tissues of the eye." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Recurrent intrapulmonary hemorrhage
children.defn: "A recurrent hemorrhage occurring within the lung." [HPO:gcarletti]
"The presence of hemorrhage within the body." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of blood volume homeostasis
Hypovolemia
is_a_string: HP:0011104 ! Abnormality of blood volume homeostasis
children.defn: "An decrease in the amount of intravascular fluid, particularly in the volume of the circulating blood." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypervolemia
is_a_string: HP:0011104 ! Abnormality of blood volume homeostasis
children.defn: "An increase in the amount of intravascular fluid, particularly in the volume of the circulating blood." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality in the amount of volume occupied by intravascular blood." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of blood circulation." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypertension
is_a_string: HP:0011025 ! Abnormality of cardiovascular system physiology

children.name: Hypertension associated with pheochromocytoma
Positive regitine blocking test
children.defn: "A positive response to the regitine blocking test consisting of a substantial reduction in blood pressure following administration of regitine, indicative of the presence of increased levels of epinephrine and norepinephrine in the circulation, which is seen in pheochromocytoma-associated hypertension." [HPO:probinson]
"A type of hypertension associated with pheochromocytoma." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Elevated systolic blood pressure
children.defn: "Abnormal increase in systolic blood pressure." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Elevated diastolic blood pressure
children.defn: "Abnormal increase in diastolic blood pressure." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of chronic increased pressure in the systemic arterial system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cardiac shunt
is_a_string: HP:0011025 ! Abnormality of cardiovascular system physiology

children.name: Left-to-right shunt
children.defn: "Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the left side of the heart to the right." [HPO:mhaendel]

children.name: Right-to-left shunt
children.defn: "Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the right side of the heart to the left." [HPO:mhaendel]

children.name: Bidirectional shunt
children.defn: "Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from both right side of the heart to the left and vice versa." [HPO:mhaendel]
"Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal EKG
is_a_string: HP:0011025 ! Abnormality of cardiovascular system physiology

children.name: J wave
children.defn: "The J wave is a positive convex deflection that occurs at the junction of the QRS complex and ST segment, the J-point." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19561994]

children.name: Shortened PR interval
children.defn: "Reduced time for the  PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex). In adults, normal values are 120 to 200 ms long." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Prolonged QT interval
children.defn: "Increased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Shortened QT interval
children.defn: "Decreased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Prolonged QRS complex
children.defn: "Increased time for the complex comprised of the Q wave, R wave, and S wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).. In adults, normal values are 0.06 - 0.10 sec." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal ST segment
ST segment depression
children.defn: "An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located inferior to the isoelectric line." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: ST segment elevation
children.defn: "An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located superior to the isoelectric line." [HPO:probinson]

"An electrocardiographic anomaly of the ST segment, which is the segment that connects the QRS complex and the T wave. The ST segment normally has a duration of 80 to 120 ms, is flat and at the same level (isoelectric) as the PR and TP segment." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Prolonged PR interval
children.defn: "Increased time for the  PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: EKG: T-wave abnormalities
EKG: T-wave inversion
T-wave inversion in the right precordial leads

children.defn: "An inversion of the T-wave (which is normally positive)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: T-wave alternans
children.defn: "A periodic beat-to-beat variation in the amplitude or shape of the T wave in an EKG." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17592081]
"An abnormality of the T wave on the electrocardiogram, which mainly represents the repolarization of the ventricles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congestive heart failure
is_a_string: HP:0011025 ! Abnormality of cardiovascular system physiology

children.name: High-output congestive heart failure
children.defn: "A form of heart failure characterized by elevated cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure and hyperthyroidism, anemia, pregnancy, arteriovenous fistulae, and others." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Low-output congestive heart failure
children.defn: "A form of heart failure characterized by reduced cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure owing to ischemic heart disease, hypertension, cardiomyopathy, and other causes." [HPO:curators]

"The presence of an abnormality of cardiac function that is responsible for the failure of the heart to pump blood at a rate that is commensurate with the needs of the tissues or a state in which abnormally elevated filling pressures are required for the heart to do so. Heart failure is frequently related to a defect in myocardial contraction." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Arrhythmia
is_a_string: HP:0011025 ! Abnormality of cardiovascular system physiology

children.name: Palpitations
children.defn: "A sensation that the heart is pounding or racing, which is a non-specific sign but may be a manifestation of arrhythmia." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Heart block
Sinoatrial block
is_a_string: HP:0011702 ! Abnormal electrophysiology of sinoatrial node origin
children.defn: "Disturbance in the atrial activation that is caused by transient failure of impulse conduction from the sinoatrial node to the cardiac atria." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Sick sinus syndrome
is_a_string: HP:0011702 ! Abnormal electrophysiology of sinoatrial node origin

children.name: Bundle branch block
Right bundle branch block
children.defn: "A conduction block of the right branch of the bundle of His. This manifests as a prolongation of the QRS complex (greater than 0.12 s) with delayed activation of the right ventricle and terminal delay on the EKG." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Left bundle branch block
Left anterior fascicular block
children.defn: "Conduction block in the anterior division of the left bundle branch of the bundle of His." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Left postterior fascicular block
children.defn: "Conduction block in the posterior division of the left bundle branch of the bundle of His." [HPO:probinson]
"A conduction block of the left branch of the bundle of His. This manifests as a generalized disturbance of QRS morphology on EKG." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Trifascicular block
children.defn: "Abnormal conduction in all three divisions of the intraventricular conducting tissue." [DDD:dbrown]
"Block of conduction of electrical impulses along the Bundle of His or along one of its bundle branches." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Atrioventricular block
Third degree atrioventricular block
Complete heart block with narrow QRS complexes
Complete heart block with broad RS complexes

children.defn: "A form of  atrioventricular block  in which atrial impulse propagates to the ventricles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: First degree atrioventricular block
children.defn: "Delay of conduction through the atrioventricular node, which is manifested as prolongation of the PR interval in the electrocardiogram (EKG). All atrial impulses reach the ventricles." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Second degree atrioventricular block
Mobitz I atrioventricular block
children.defn: "Progressive PR interval prolongation with the subsequent occurrence of a single nonconducted P wave that results in a pause. The pause that follows the nonconducted impulse is less than fully compensatory (less than the sum of two normal sinus intervals)." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Mobitz II atrioventricular block
children.defn: "A type of second degree atrioventricular (AV) block characterized by sudden failure to conduct an impulse through the AV node without a preceding change in the PR interval." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

"An intermittent  atrioventricular block with failure of some atrial impulses to conduct to the ventricles, i.e., some but not all atrial impulses are conducted through the atrioventricular node and trigger ventricular contraction." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]
"Delayed or lack of conduction of atrial depolarizations through the atrioventricular node to the ventricles." [HPO:probinson]
"Impaired conduction of cardiac impulse occurring anywhere along the conduction pathway." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal electrophysiology of sinoatrial node origin
Sinus tachycardia
is_a_string: HP:0011702 ! Abnormal electrophysiology of sinoatrial node origin
children.defn: "Inappropriate sinus tachycardia is a nonparoxysmal tachyarrhythmia characterized by an increased resting heart rate (HR) and/or an exaggerated HR response to minimal exertion or a change in body posture. HR is constantly above the physiological range with no appropriate relation to metabolic or physiological demands." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15763524]

children.name: Sinus bradycardia
is_a_string: HP:0011702 ! Abnormal electrophysiology of sinoatrial node origin
children.defn: "Bradycardia related to a mean resting sinus rate of less than 50 beats per minute." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the sinoatrial (SA) node in the right atrium. THe SA node acts as the pacemaker of the heart." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ventricular preexcitation
Ventricular preexcitation with multiple accessory pathways
children.defn: "A form of ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of multiple accessory pathways for cardiac conduction." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome
children.defn: "A disorder of the cardiac conduction system of the heart characterized by ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of an abnormal accessory atrioventricular electrical conduction pathway." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality in which the cardiac ventricles depolarize too early as a result of an abnormality of cardiac conduction pathways such as an accessory pathway." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ventricular fibrillation
children.defn: "Uncontrolled contractions of muscles fibers in the left ventricle not producing contraction of the left ventricle. Ventricular fibrillation usually begins with a ventricular premature contraction and a short run of rapid ventricular tachycardia degenerating into uncoordinating ventricular fibrillations." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Torsade de pointes
children.defn: "A type of ventricular tachycardia characterized by polymorphioc QRS complexes that change in amplitue and cycle length, and thus have the appearance of oscillating around the baseline in the EKG." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ventricular extrasystoles
children.defn: "Premature ventricular contractions (PVC) or ventricular extrasystoles are premature contractions of the heart that arise in response to an impulse in the ventricles rather than the normal impulse from the sinoatrial (SA) node." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Tachycardia
Supraventricular tachycardia
Supraventricular tachycardia with an accessory connection mediated pathway
Supraventricular tachycardia with a concealed accessory connection
is_a_string: HP:0011688 ! Supraventricular tachycardia with an accessory connection mediated pathway

children.name: Supraventricular tachycardia with a concealed accessory pathway on the septum
is_a_string: HP:0011689 ! Supraventricular tachycardia with a concealed accessory connection

children.name: Supraventricular tachycardia with a concealed accessory pathway on the right free wall
is_a_string: HP:0011689 ! Supraventricular tachycardia with a concealed accessory connection

children.name: Supraventricular tachycardia with a concealed accessory pathway on the left free wall
is_a_string: HP:0011689 ! Supraventricular tachycardia with a concealed accessory connection

children.name: Permanent junctional reciprocating tachycardia
is_a_string: HP:0011689 ! Supraventricular tachycardia with a concealed accessory connection

children.name: Supraventricular tachycardia with a manifest accessory pathway
is_a_string: HP:0011688 ! Supraventricular tachycardia with an accessory connection mediated pathway

children.name: Supraventricular tachycardia with a manifest accessory pathway on the septum
is_a_string: HP:0011694 ! Supraventricular tachycardia with a manifest accessory pathway

children.name: Supraventricular tachycardia with a manifest accessory pathway on the right free wall
is_a_string: HP:0011694 ! Supraventricular tachycardia with a manifest accessory pathway

children.name: Supraventricular tachycardia with a manifest accessory pathway on the left free wall
is_a_string: HP:0011694 ! Supraventricular tachycardia with a manifest accessory pathway

children.name: AV nodal tachycardia
children.defn: "A type of supraventricular tachycardia that originates in the atrioventricular node." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Primary atrial arrhythmia
Atrial flutter
children.defn: "A type of atrial arrhythmia characterized by atrial rates of between 240 and 400 beats per minute and some degree of atrioventricular node conduction block. Typically, the ventricular rate is half the atrial rate. In the EKG; atrial flutter waves are observed as sawtooth-like atrial activity. Pathophysiologically, atrial flutter is a form of atrial reentry in which there is a premature electrical impulse creates a self-propagating circuit." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Atrial fibrillation
Permanent atrial fibrillation
children.defn: "AF that cannot be successfully terminated by cardioversion, and longstanding (more than 1 year) AF, where cardioversion is not indicated or has not been attempted, is termed permanent." [HPO:probinson, pmid:12860883]

children.name: Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation
children.defn: "Episodes of atrial fibrillation that typically last for several hours up to one day and terminate spontaneously." [HPO:probinson]

"An atrial arrhythmia characterized by disorganized atrial activity without discrete P waves on the surface EKG, but instead by an undulating baseline or more sharply circumscribed atrial deflections of varying amplitude an frequency ranging from 350 to 600 per minute." [HPO:probinson]
"A type of supraventricular tachycardia in which the atria are the principal site of electrophysiologic disturbance." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia
children.defn: "An episodic form of supraventricular tachycardia with abrupt onset and termination." [pmid:18025404]
"Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) is an abnormally increased heart rate (over 100 beats per minute at rest) with origin above the level of the ventricles." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ventricular flutter
children.defn: "A potentially lethal cardiac arrhythmia characterized by an extremely rapid, hemodynamically unstable ventricular tachycardia (150-300 beats/min) with a large oscillating sine-wave appearance." [HPO:probinson]
"A rapid heartrate that exceeds the range of the normal resting heartrate for age." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bradycardia
children.defn: "A slower than normal heart rate (in adults, slower than 60 beats per minute)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Palpitations (with pheochromocytoma)
is_a_string: HP:0001675 ! Rhythm disturbances associated with pheochromocytoma

children.name: Tachycardia (with pheochromocytoma)
is_a_string: HP:0001675 ! Rhythm disturbances associated with pheochromocytoma

children.name: Atrioventricular dissociation
Congenital atrioventricular dissociation
children.defn: "A form of atrioventricular (AV) dissociation (i.e., the atria and the ventricles are under the control of two separate pacemakers) with congenital onset." [HPO:probinson]

"Atrioventricular (AV) dissociation is present if the atria and the ventricles are under the control of two separate pacemakers.  AV dissociation can occur is the absence of a primary AV conduction disturbance." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Supraventricular arrhythmia
children.defn: "A type of arrhythmia that originates above the ventricles, whereby the electrical impulse propagates down the normal His Purkinje system similar to normal sinus rhythm." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Sudden cardiac death
children.defn: "The heart suddenly and unexpectedly stops beating resulting in death within a short time period (generally within 1 h of symptom onset)." [HPO:probinson]

"Any cardiac rhythm other than the normal sinus rhythm. Such a rhythm may be either of sinus or ectopic origin and either regular or irregular. An arrhythmia may be due to a disturbance in impulse formation or conduction or both." [DDD:dbrown, pmid:19063792]

children.name: Syncope
is_a_string: HP:0011025 ! Abnormality of cardiovascular system physiology

children.name: Carotid sinus syncope
children.defn: "An exaggerated response to carotid sinus baroreceptor stimulation resulting in syncope from transient diminished cerebral perfusion." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Vasovagal syncope
children.defn: "Loss of consciousness due to a reduction in blood pressure that is associated with an increase in vagal tone and peripheral vasodilation." [HPO:probinson, MeSH:D019462]

children.name: Orthostatic syncope
children.defn: "Syncope following a quick change in position from lying down to standing." [HPO:probinson]

"Syncope refers to a generalized weakness of muscles with loss of postural tone, inability to stand upright, and loss of consciousness. Once the patient is in a horizontal position, blood flow to the brain is no longer hindered by gravitation and consciousness is regained. Unconsciousness usually lasts for seconds to minutes. Headache and drowsiness (which usually follow seizures) do not follow a syncopal attack. Syncope results from a sudden impairment of brain metabolism usually due to a reduction in cerebral blood flow." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormal functionality of the cardiovascular system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the fetal cardiovascular system
is_a_string: HP:0001626 ! Abnormality of the cardiovascular system

children.name: Abnormality of ductus venosus blood flow
is_a_string: HP:0010948 ! Abnormality of the fetal cardiovascular system
children.defn: "An first-trimester prenatal ultrasound finding of abnormal blood flow in the ductus venosus." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16449256, pmid:21048453]

children.name: Persistent fetal circulation
is_a_string: HP:0010948 ! Abnormality of the fetal cardiovascular system
children.defn: "Systemic desaturation of a liveborn baby resulting from persistent pulmonary hypertension with a patent ductus arteriosus and patent foramen ovale, such that the circulation in postnatal life follows the fetal course." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Abnormality of umbilical vein blood flow
is_a_string: HP:0010948 ! Abnormality of the fetal cardiovascular system
HP:0011403 ! Abnormal umbilical cord blood vessels
children.defn: "An first-trimester prenatal ultrasound finding of abnormal blood flow in the umbilical vein." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Echogenic intracardiac focus
is_a_string: HP:0010948 ! Abnormality of the fetal cardiovascular system
children.defn: "A finding of a focus of increased echogenicity upon prenatal ultrasound examination of the fetus. The foci may be present in one or both ventricles. Echogenic intracardiac focus (EICF) is defined as a focus of echogenicity comparable to bone, in the region of the papillary muscle in either or both ventricles of the fetal heart." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16100637, pmid:9527573]

children.name: Single umbilical artery
is_a_string: HP:0010948 ! Abnormality of the fetal cardiovascular system
HP:0011403 ! Abnormal umbilical cord blood vessels
children.defn: "Single umbilical artery (SUA) is the absence of one of the two umbilical arteries surrounding the fetal bladder and in the fetal umbilical cord." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Persistent patent ductus venosus
is_a_string: HP:0010948 ! Abnormality of the fetal cardiovascular system
children.defn: "Persistence of blood flow through the ductus venosus for longer than the normal time after birth." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16449256]

children.name: Congenital portosystemic venous shunt
is_a_string: HP:0010948 ! Abnormality of the fetal cardiovascular system
children.defn: "A congenital defect of the vasculature such that there is a shunt (by-pass) of blood directly from the portal vein to the vena cava (i.e., the blood from the portal vein is not filtered through the liver)." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the fetal circulation  system or fetal echocardiogram." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]
"Any abnormality of the cardiovascular system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the eye
Abnormal eye physiology
Abnormality of eye movement
Abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit
Saccadic smooth pursuit
is_a_string: HP:0000617 ! Abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit
children.defn: "An abnormality of tracking eye movements in which smooth pursuit is interrupted by an abnormally high number of saccadic movements." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Impaired pursuit initiation and maintenance
is_a_string: HP:0000617 ! Abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit

children.name: Impaired smooth pursuit
is_a_string: HP:0000617 ! Abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit

children.name: Impaired horizontal smooth pursuit
children.defn: "An abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit characterized by an impairment of the ability to track horizontally moving objects." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absent smooth pursuit
children.defn: "A complete lack of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion." [HPO:probinson]
"An impairment of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Jerky ocular pursuit movements
is_a_string: HP:0000617 ! Abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit

children.defn: "An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impaired smooth-pursuit eye movements." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Oculomotor apraxia
children.defn: "Inability to follow objects visually with compensatory head movements, decreased smooth pursuit, and cancellation of the vestibulo-ocular reflex." [HPO:probinson, pmid:20615230]

children.name: Compensatory chin elevation
children.defn: "A tendency to hold the child elevated by about 20 to 30 degrees to compensate for a limitation of eye movement." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal conjugate eye movement
Impaired convergence
children.defn: "Reduced ability to turn the eyes inward  in order to focus on a nearby object." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Strabismus
Esotropia
children.defn: "A form of strabismus with one or both eyes turned inward ('crossed')." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Unilateral strabismus
children.defn: "A type of strabismus in which only one eye is affected. Unilateral strabismus is to be distinguished from alternating strabismus, in which either of the eyes 'squints' at different times." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Exotropia
children.defn: "A form of strabismus with one or both eyes deviated outward." [HPO:probinson]
"Strabismus (also known as squint) is a condition in which the eyes are not properly aligned with each other." [HPO:probinson]
"Any deviation from the normal motor coordination of the eyes that allows for bilateral fixation on a single object." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Impaired ocular adduction
children.defn: "Reduced ability to move the eye in the direction of the nose." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Duane anomaly
children.defn: "Duane anomaly is a congenital eye movement impairment with limitation of the ability to adduct or abduct the eye. When affected eyes are adducted (moved inwards towards the nose), the eyeball retracts and the palpebral fissure narrows." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Supranuclear gaze palsy
Horizontal supranuclear gaze palsy
children.defn: "A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a horizontal direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Vertical supranuclear gaze palsy
children.defn: "A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a vertical direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal." [HPO:probinson, pmid:20671861]

"A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a particular direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ophthalmoparesis
Setting-sun eye phenomenon
children.defn: "An ophthalmologic sign in young children resulting from upward-gaze paresis. In this condition, the eyes appear driven downward, the sclera may be seen between the upper eyelid and the iris, and part of the lower pupil may be covered by the lower eyelid." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17030938]

children.name: Internal ophthalmoplegia
children.defn: "Paralysis of the iris and ciliary apparatus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: External ophthalmoplegia
Recurrent external ophthalmoplegia
children.defn: "Alternating and recurrent weakness of the external ocular muscles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Restrictive external ophthalmoplegia
Restrictive partial external ophthalmoplegia
children.defn: "Fibrosis of only some of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position." [HPO:probinson]

"Fibrosis of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nonprogressive restrictive external ophthalmoplegia
children.defn: "Nonprogressive restriction of movement of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Progressive external ophthalmoplegia
children.defn: "Initial bilateral ptosis followed by limitation of eye movements in all directions and slowing of saccades." [HPO:probinson]
"Paralysis of the external ocular muscles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Oculomotor nerve palsy
is_a_string: HP:0001291 ! Abnormality of the cranial nerves
children.defn: "Reduced ability to control the movement of the eye associated with damage to the third cranial nerve (the oculomotor nerve)." [HPO:probinson]
"Ophthalmoplegia is a paralysis or weakness of one or more of the muscles that control eye movement." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormal involuntary eye movements
Paroxysmal involuntary eye movements
children.defn: "Sudden-onset episode of abnormal, involuntary eye movements." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nystagmus
Vertical nystagmus
Upbeat nystagmus
children.defn: "In primary position the Upbeat nystagmus beats upward. The associated oscillopsias are often very irritating, but the symptoms are usually transient." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21505601]

children.name: Downbeat nystagmus
children.defn: "Downbeat nystagmus is a type of fixation nystagmus with the fast phase beating in a downward direction. It generally increases when looking to the side and down and when lying prone." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21505601]

"Vertical nystagmus may present with either up-beating or down-beating eye movements or both. When present in the straight-ahead position of gaze it is referred to as upbeat nystagmus or downbeat nystagmus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Vestibular nystagmus
is_a_string: HP:0009591 ! Abnormality of the vestibulocochlear nerve
children.defn: "Nystagmus due to disturbance of the vestibular system; eye movements are rhythmic, with slow and fast components." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Nystagmus-induced head nodding
children.defn: "Head movements associated with nystagmus, that may represent an attempt to compensate for the involuntary eye movements and to improve vision." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Gaze-evoked nystagmus
Gaze-evoked horizontal nystagmus
children.defn: "Horizontal nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left." [HPO:curators]
"Nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Horizontal nystagmus
Congenital horizontal nystagmus
children.defn: "Horizontal nystagmus dating from or present at birth." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Horizontal pendular nystagmus
children.defn: "Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements of equal velocity." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Horizontal jerk nystagmus
children.defn: "Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements, in which the movement in one direction is faster than in the other." [HPO:probinson]
"Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Rotary nystagmus
children.defn: "A form of nystagmus in which the eyeball makes rotary motions around the axis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pendular nystagmus
Spasmus nutans
children.defn: "The combination of pendular nystagmus, head nodding, and torticollis." [HPO:probinson, pmid:7499100]

children.name: Seesaw nystagmus
children.defn: "Seesaw nystagmus is a type of pendular nystagmus where a half cycle consists of the elevation and intorsion of one eye, concurrently with the depression and extortion of the fellow eye. In the other half cycle, there is an inversion of the ocular movements." [HPO:probinson]
"Rhythmic, involuntary sinusoidal oscillations of one or both eyes. The waveform of pendular nystagmus may occur in any direction." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital nystagmus
children.defn: "Nystagmus dating from or present at birth." [HPO:curators]
"Rhythmic, involuntary oscillations of one or both eyes related to abnormality in fixation, conjugate gaze, or vestibular mechanisms." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Opsoclonus
children.defn: "Spontaneous, non-rhythmic, multi-directional, chaotic movements of the eyes, giving the appearance of agitation. There may be bursts of conjugate movement of the eyes in varying directions and of varying amplitude." [HPO:probinson]
"Anomalous movements of the eyes that occur without the subject wanting them to happen." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of ocular abduction
Impaired ocular abduction
children.defn: "An impaired ability of the eye to move in the outward direction (towards the side of the head)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Globe retraction and deviation on abduction

children.defn: "An abnormality involving the movement of the eye outwards." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of saccadic eye movements
Dysmetric saccades
is_a_string: HP:0000570 ! Abnormality of saccadic eye movements
children.defn: "The controller signal for saccadic eye movements has two components: the pulse that moves the eye rapidly from one point to the next, and the step that holds the eye in the new position. When both the pulse and the step are not the correct size, a dysmetric refixation eye movement results." [HPO:probinson, pmid:572501]

children.name: Slow saccadic eye movements
is_a_string: HP:0000570 ! Abnormality of saccadic eye movements

children.name: Slowed horizontal saccades
children.defn: "An abnormally slow velocity of horizontal saccadic eye movements." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormally slow velocity of the saccadic eye movements." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypometric saccades
is_a_string: HP:0000570 ! Abnormality of saccadic eye movements

children.name: Hypometric horizontal saccades
children.defn: "Saccadic undershoot of horizontal saccadic eye movements, i.e., a horizontal saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object." [HPO:probinson, pmid:572501]
"Saccadic undershoot, i.e., a saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object." [HPO:probinson, pmid:572501]

children.name: Hypermetric saccades
is_a_string: HP:0000570 ! Abnormality of saccadic eye movements
children.defn: "A saccade that overshoots the target with the dynamic saccade." [HPO:probinson, pmid:572501]
"An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impairment of fast (saccadic) eye movements." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality in voluntary or involuntary eye movements or their control." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lacrimation abnormality
Decreased lacrimation
Alacrima
children.defn: "Absence of tear secretion." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormally decreased lacrimation, that is, reduced ability to produce tears." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Increased lacrimation
children.defn: "Abnormally increased lacrimation, that is, excessive tearing (watering eye)." [DDD:ncarter, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Gustatory lacrimation
is_a_string: HP:0001291 ! Abnormality of the cranial nerves
children.defn: "Gustatory lacrimation results from an aberrant innervation of fibres from the seventh cranial nerve to the pterygopalatine ganglion which are destined originally for the submandibular ganglion. This aberrant innervation leads to uncontrollable tearing while eating or in anticipation of a meal." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Abnormality of tear production." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Glaucoma
Buphthalmos
children.defn: "Buphthalmos refers to a congenital open-angle glaucoma of the eye. The term buphthalmos (from Greek 'bous' or ox and 'ophthalmos' or eye) is descriptive of an enlarged eyeglobe resulting from increased intraocular pressure. The eyeglobe is especially prone to distension in newborns and infants because its collagen filaments are not as rigid as in adults and may easily be stretched." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Primary open angle glaucoma
children.defn: "A type of glaucoma with optic nerve damage in an eye with evidence of significant obstruction of the functional trabecular meshwork by the peripheral iris would be classified as having primary angle closure." [HPO:probinson, pmid:11815354]

children.name: Primary angle closure glaucoma
children.defn: "A type of glaucoma with optic nerve damage in an eye that does not have evidence of angle closure and in which there is no evidence of a secondary cause." [HPO:probinson, pmid:11815354]
"Glaucoma refers loss of retinal ganglion cells in a characteristic pattern of optic neuropathy usually associated with increased intraocular pressure." [HPO:probinson, pmid:11815354]

children.name: Ptosis
Unilateral ptosis
children.defn: "A unilateral form of ptosis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Progressive ptosis
children.defn: "A progressive form of ptosis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Horner syndrome
is_a_string: HP:0012332 ! Abnormal autonomic nervous system physiology

children.name: Congenital Horner syndrome
children.defn: "A type of Horner syndrome with congenital onset." [HPO:probinson]

"An abnormality resulting from a lesion of the sympathetic nervous system characterized by a combination of unilateral ptosis, miosis, and often ipsilateral hypohidrosis and conjunctival injection." [HPO:probinson]

"The upper eyelid margin is positioned 3 mm or more lower than usual and covers the superior portion of the iris (objective); or, the upper lid margin obscures at least part of the pupil (subjective)." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Abnormality of vision
Photophobia
children.defn: "Excessive sensitivity to light with the sensation of discomfort or pain in the eyes due to exposure to bright light." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Visual impairment
Blindness
Congenital blindness
children.defn: "Blindness with onset at birth." [HPO:probinson]
"Blindness is the condition of lacking visual perception due to physiological or neurological factors." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Hemianopsia
children.defn: "Partial or complete loss of vision in one half of the visual field of one or both eyes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hemianopic blurring of vision
children.defn: "Transient  hemianopsia associated with the aura phase of migraine." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Amaurosis fugax
children.defn: "A transient visual disturbance that is typically caused by a circulatory, ocular or neurological underlying condition." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Blurred vision
children.defn: "Lack of sharpness of vision resulting in the inability to see fine detail." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cortical visual impairment
children.defn: "A form of loss of vision caused by damage to the visual cortex rather than a defect in the eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Amblyopia
children.defn: "Reduced visual acuity that is uncorrectable by lenses in the absence of detectable anatomic defects in the eye or visual pathways." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Visual loss
Progressive visual loss
children.defn: "A reduction of previously attained ability to see." [HPO:probinson]
"Loss of visual acuity (implying that vision was better at a certain timepoint in live - otherwise the term is impaired vision or a subclass of that)." [HPO:sdoelken]

"Visual impairment (or vision impairment) is vision loss (of a person) to such a degree as to qualify as an additional support need through a significant limitation of visual capability resulting from either disease, trauma, or congenital or degenerative conditions that cannot be corrected by conventional means, such as refractive correction, medication, or surgery." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Peripheral visual field loss
children.defn: "Loss of peripheral vision with retention of central vision, resulting in a constricted circular tunnel-like field of vision." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Scotoma
Pericentral scotoma
children.defn: "A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) that surrounds the central fixation point." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Scintillating scotoma
children.defn: "A scintillating scotoma is a common visual aura that can preced a migraine, whereby a spot of flickering light near the center of the visual fields occurs. The spot prevents vision, and is thus termed scotoma. The scotoma can extend into one or more shimmering arcs of white or colored flashing lights." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Central scotoma
children.defn: "An area of depressed vision located at the point of fixation and that interferes with central vision." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Centrocecal scotoma
children.defn: "A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) located between the central point of fixation and the blind spot with a roughly horizontal oval shape." [HPO:probinson]
"Scotoma refers to an area or island of loss or impairment of visual acuity surrounded by a field of normal or relatively well-preserved vision." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Mouches volantes
is_a_string: HP:0004327 ! Abnormality of the vitreous humor
children.defn: "Deposits of various size, shape, consistency, refractive index, and motility within the eye's vitreous humour, which is normally transparent." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormality of vision evoked potentials
Reduced amplitude of pattern visual evoked potentials
is_a_string: HP:0000649 ! Abnormality of vision evoked potentials

children.name: Abnormality of pattern reversal visual evoked potentials
is_a_string: HP:0000649 ! Abnormality of vision evoked potentials

children.name: Abnormal flash visual evoked potentials
is_a_string: HP:0000649 ! Abnormality of vision evoked potentials

children.name: Enlarged flash visual evoked potentials
is_a_string: HP:0007928 ! Abnormal flash visual evoked potentials

children.defn: "Anomaly of the visual evoked potentials elicited by a flash stimulus, generally a flash of light subtending an angle of at least 20 degrees of the visual field and presented in a dimly lit room." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absence of visual evoked potentials
is_a_string: HP:0000649 ! Abnormality of vision evoked potentials

children.defn: "An anomaly of visually evoked potentials (VEP), which are electrical potentials, initiated by brief visual stimuli, which are recorded from the scalp overlying the visual cortex." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Night blindness
Adult-onset night blindness
children.defn: "Inability to see well at night or in poor light with onset in adulthood." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital stationary night blindness
children.defn: "A nonprogressive (i.e., stationary) form of difficulties with night blindness with congenital onset." [HPO:probinson]
"Inability to see well at night or in poor light." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Metamorphopsia
children.defn: "A visual anomaly in which images appear distorted. A grid of straight lines appears wavy and parts of the grid may appear blank." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hemeralopia
children.defn: "A visual defect characterized by the inability to see as clearly in bright light as in dim light. The word hemeralopia literally means day blindness." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of color vision
Dyschromatopsia
Dichromacy
Deuteranopia
children.defn: "Complete lack of the M photopigment, which is replaced with the L photopigment.  Affected individuals tend to confuse red and green." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Protanopia
children.defn: "Blue and green cones only; no functional red cones." [DDD:gblack]
"Individuals affected by dichromacy possess only two types of cones, instead of three." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Red-green dyschromatopsia
Deuteranomoly
children.defn: "A type of anomalous trichromacy associated with abnormal M photopigment, such that the absorption spectrum is shifted toward L wavelengths. Affected individuals have difficulties distinguishing between red and green." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Protanomaly
children.defn: "A type of anomalous trichromacy associated with defective long-wavelength-sensitive (L) cones, causing the sensitivity spectrum to be shifted toward medium wavelengths. This leads to difficulties especially in distinguishing red and green." [HPO:probinson]
"Difficulty with discriminating red and green hues." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Anomalous trichromacy
Tritanomaly
children.defn: "Difficulty distinguishing between yellow and blue, possible related to dysfunction of the S photopigment." [HPO:probinson]
"Individuals with anomalous trichromacy possess three types of cones, but one of the three types of cones has an abnormal spectral sensitivity compared to normal cones." [HPO:probinson]
"A form of colorblindness in which only two of the three fundamental colors can be distinguished due to a lack of one of the retinal cone pigments." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Monochromacy
Rod monochromacy
children.defn: "A condition where the retina contains no functional cone cells, so that in addition to the absence of color discrimination, vision in lights of normal intensity is difficult." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Cone monochromacy
Blue cone monochromacy
children.defn: "A form of monochromacy in which vision is derived from the remaining preserved blue (S) cones and rod photoreceptors." [HPO:probinson]
"The condition of having both rods and cones, but only a single kind of cone.  Affected individuals have good pattern vision in daylight, but cannot distinguish between colors." [DDD:ncarter]
"Complete color blindness, a complete inability to distinguish colors. Affected persons cannot perceive colors, but only shades of gray." [DDD:gblack]
"An anomaly in the ability to discriminate between or recognize colors." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of binocular vision
Diplopia
children.defn: "Diplopia is a condition in which a single object is perceived as two images, it is also known as double vision." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal stereopsis
children.defn: "Inability to make fine depth discriminations from parallax provided by the two eyes' different positions on the head." [DDD:gblack]
"An abnormality of binocular vision, that is of the ability to synthesize the visual inputs from both eyes to a single image with perception of depth." [DDD:ncarter]
"Abnormality of eyesight (visual perception)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal intraocular pressure
Asymmetry of intraocular pressure
children.defn: "A difference in the amount of intraocular pressure in the right and left eye." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly in the amount of force per unit area exerted by the intraocular fluid within the eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of refraction
Astigmatism
is_a_string: HP:0100691 ! Abnormality of the curvature of the cornea

children.name: Hyperopic astigmatism
children.defn: "A form of astigmatism in which one meridian is hyperopic while the one at a right angle to it has no refractive error." [HPO:probinson]
"Astigmatism describes a refractive error  characterized by a difference in the horizontal and vertical  curvature of the cornea." [DDD:ncarter, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Myopia
Severe Myopia
children.defn: "A severe form of myopia with greater than -6.00 diopters." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Congenital myopia
children.defn: "Myopia apparent at birth." [DDD:ncarter]
"An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects nearby clearly, while objects in the distance appear blurry." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypermetropia
High-grade hypermetropia
children.defn: "A severe form of hypermetropia with over +4.00 diopters." [DDD:ncarter]
"An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects in the distance clearly, while objects nearby appear blurry." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anisometropia
children.defn: "Inequality of refractive power of the two eyes." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality in the process of focusing of light by the eye in order to produce a sharp image on the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Inflammatory abnormality of the eye
Keratitis
is_a_string: HP:0100533 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the eye

children.name: Punctate keratitis
children.defn: "A type of keratitis characterized by inflammation in pinpoint areas of the corneal epithelium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Keratoconjunctivitis
Keratoconjunctivitis sicca
children.defn: "Dryness of the eye related to deficiency of the tear film components (aqueous, mucin, or lipid), lid surface abnormalities, or epithelial abnormalities. Keratoconjunctivitis sicca often results in a scratchy or sandy sensation (foreign body sensation) in the eyes, and may also be associated with itching, inability to produce tears, photosensitivity, redness, pain, and difficulty in moving the eyelids." [HPO:probinson]
"Inflammation of the cornea and conjunctiva." [HPO:probinson]
"Inflammation of the cornea." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Conjunctivitis
is_a_string: HP:0100533 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the eye

children.name: Chronic irritative conjunctivitis
children.defn: "A chronic irritative conjunctivitis, which commonly presents with general irritation and redness of the eyes, with a burning, dry, or foreign-body sensation of the eyes." [HPO:curators]
"Inflammation of the  conjunctiva." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Episcleritis
is_a_string: HP:0100533 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the eye
children.defn: "Inflammation of the episclera, a thin layer of tissue covering the white part (sclera) of the eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Scleritis
is_a_string: HP:0100533 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the eye
children.defn: "Inflammation of the sclera." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Uveitis
is_a_string: HP:0100533 ! Inflammatory abnormality of the eye

children.name: Nongranulomatous uveitis
children.defn: "A form of uveitis that is not associated with the formation of granulomas." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Panuveitis
children.defn: "Inflammation of the uveal tract in which inflammation affects the anterior chamber, vitreous, retina or choroid." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anterior uveitis
Iridocyclitis
children.defn: "A type of anterior uveitis, in which there is Inflammation of the iris and the ciliary body." [HPO:probinson]
"Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the anterior chamber." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Posterior uveitis
children.defn: "Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the retina or choroid." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Intermediate uveitis
children.defn: "Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the vitreous." [HPO:probinson]
"Inflammation of one or all portions of the uveal tract." [HPO:curators]
"Inflammation of the eye, parts of the eye or the periorbital region." [HPO:sdoelken]
"A functional anomaly of the eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal eye morphology
Abnormality of the nasolacrimal system
Dacrocystitis
is_a_string: HP:0000614 ! Abnormality of the nasolacrimal system
children.defn: "Inflammation of the nasolacrimal sac." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the lacrimal punctum
is_a_string: HP:0000614 ! Abnormality of the nasolacrimal system

children.name: Hypoplasia of the lacrimal puncta
is_a_string: HP:0011479 ! Abnormality of the lacrimal punctum
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the lacrimal puncta." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ectopic lacrimal punctum
is_a_string: HP:0011479 ! Abnormality of the lacrimal punctum
children.defn: "Positioning of a lacrimal punctum other than at the medial margins of the eyelid." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Absent lacrimal punctum
is_a_string: HP:0011479 ! Abnormality of the lacrimal punctum
children.defn: "No identifiable superior and/or inferior lacrimal punctum." [pmid:19125427]

children.name: Atretic lacrimal punctum
is_a_string: HP:0011479 ! Abnormality of the lacrimal punctum
children.defn: "Congenital absence or closure of the opening of the lacrimal punctum." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the lacrimal punctum, an opening on the eyelid close to the medial canthus that drains tears from the conjunctival sac into the lacrimal duct in the same eyelid." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the lacrimal gland
is_a_string: HP:0000614 ! Abnormality of the nasolacrimal system

children.name: Aplastic/hypoplastic lacrimal glands
is_a_string: HP:0011482 ! Abnormality of the lacrimal gland

children.name: Lacrimal gland hypoplasia
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lacrimal gland aplasia
children.defn: "A congenital defect of development characterized by absence of the lacrimal gland." [HPO:probinson]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Enlarged lacrimal glands
is_a_string: HP:0011482 ! Abnormality of the lacrimal gland
children.defn: "Abnormally big lacrimal glands." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormality of the lacrimal gland, i.e., of the almond-shaped gland that secretes the aqueous layer of the tear film for each eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the lacrimal duct
is_a_string: HP:0000614 ! Abnormality of the nasolacrimal system

children.name: Nasolacrimal duct obstruction
is_a_string: HP:0011481 ! Abnormality of the lacrimal duct

children.name: Lacrimal duct stenosis
children.defn: "Narrowing of a tear duct (lacrimal duct)." [HPO:probinson]
"Blockage of the  lacrimal duct." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Malformed lacrimal ducts
is_a_string: HP:0011481 ! Abnormality of the lacrimal duct

children.name: Lacrimal duct atresia
is_a_string: HP:0011481 ! Abnormality of the lacrimal duct
children.defn: "A developmental disorder of the lacrimal drainage system that most often affects the lacrimal ostium and resulting in non-opening of the nasolacrimal duct. It usually results from a non-canalization of the nasolacrimal duct." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lacrimal duct aplasia
is_a_string: HP:0011481 ! Abnormality of the lacrimal duct
children.defn: "A congenital defect resulting in absence of the lacrimal duct." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypoplastic lacrimal duct
is_a_string: HP:0011481 ! Abnormality of the lacrimal duct

children.defn: "An abnormality of the  lacrimal duct, a duct that drain tears from the conjunctiva, via the lacrimal puncta, into the lacrimal sac." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the nasolacrimal drainage system, which serves as a conduit for tear flow from the external eye to the nasal cavity." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Coloboma
Choroid coloboma
Chorioretinal coloboma
children.defn: "Absence of a region of the retina, retinal pigment epithelium, and choroid." [HPO:probinson]
"A congenital defect in which a portion of choroid is not developed and the corresponding region of the retina is atrophic." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Iris coloboma
Irido-fundal coloboma
children.defn: "The presence of a coloboma of iris, choroid and retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Iridoretinal coloboma
children.defn: "The presence of a coloboma affecting the iris and the retina." [HPO:probinson]
"A coloboma of the iris." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19369671]

children.name: Optic nerve coloboma
is_a_string: HP:0000587 ! Abnormality of the optic nerve
children.defn: "A cleft of the optic nerve that extends inferiorly." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16219745]

children.name: Retinal coloboma
Macular coloboma
children.defn: "A congenital defect of the macula distinct from coloboma associated with optic fissure closure defects." [DDD:gblack]
"A notch or cleft of the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lens coloboma
children.defn: "A sectoral indentation of the crystalline lens, usually due to zonular weakness or absence." [HPO:probinson]
"A developmental defect characterized by a cleft of some portion of the eye or ocular adnexa." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the globe
Abnormality of the posterior segment of the eye
Abnormality of the vitreous humor
is_a_string: HP:0004329 ! Abnormality of the posterior segment of the eye

children.name: Vitreitis
is_a_string: HP:0004327 ! Abnormality of the vitreous humor
children.defn: "Inflammation of the vitreous body." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Peripheral vitreous opacities
is_a_string: HP:0004327 ! Abnormality of the vitreous humor

children.name: Persistent hyperplastic primary vitreous
is_a_string: HP:0004327 ! Abnormality of the vitreous humor
children.defn: "A failure of regression of the hyaloid vessel, which supplies the primary vitreous during embryogenesis and normally regresses in the third trimester of pregnancy, leading to a particular form of posterior cataract. This condition is known as Persistent Hyperplastic Primary Vitreous (PHPV)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Vitreoretinal abnormalities
is_a_string: HP:0004327 ! Abnormality of the vitreous humor

children.name: Persistence of the hyaloid artery
is_a_string: HP:0004327 ! Abnormality of the vitreous humor
children.defn: "Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Amyloid deposition in the vitreous humor
is_a_string: HP:0004327 ! Abnormality of the vitreous humor

children.name: Vitreous detachment
is_a_string: HP:0004327 ! Abnormality of the vitreous humor

children.defn: "An anomaly of the vitreous body." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the fundus
is_a_string: HP:0004329 ! Abnormality of the posterior segment of the eye

children.name: Abnormality of the choroid
Choroidal degeneration
children.defn: "Degeneration of the choroid." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the choroid
Hypoplasia of choroid
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the choroid." [HPO:probinson]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the choroid." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Chorioretinal abnormality
Chorioretinal lacunae
children.defn: "Punched out lesions in the pigmented layer of the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Chorioretinitis
children.defn: "An inflammation of the choroid and retina." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]

children.name: Chorioretinal dysplasia
children.defn: "Abnormal development of the choroid and retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Chorioretinal atrophy
Peripapillary chorioretinal atrophy
children.defn: "Chorioretinal atrophy concentrated around the optic papilla (i.e., the optic nerve head)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pigmented paravenous chorioretinal atrophy
children.defn: "Bilaterally symmetrical chorioretinal atrophy, with accumulation of bone corpuscle pigmentation along the retinal veins." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15623792]
"Atrophy of the choroid and retinal layers of the fundus." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the choroid and retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Choroidal sclerosis
children.defn: "Choroidal sclerosis is a descriptive term applied to the ophthalmoscopic appearance of prominent white choroidal vessels in which the blood columns are not seen or are sheathed by white lines." [HPO:probinson, pmid:4694397]
"An abnormality of the choroid." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the optic nerve
Optic neuritis
is_a_string: HP:0000587 ! Abnormality of the optic nerve

children.name: Retrobulbar optic neuritis
children.defn: "Optic neuritis that occurs in the section of the optic nerve located behind the eyeball." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Inflammation of the optic nerve." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Marcus Gunn pupil
is_a_string: HP:0000587 ! Abnormality of the optic nerve

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the optic nerve
is_a_string: HP:0000587 ! Abnormality of the optic nerve

children.name: Optic disc hypoplasia
is_a_string: HP:0008058 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the optic nerve
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the optic disc, that is of the optic nerve head, where ganglion cell axons exit the eye to form the optic nerve." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Optic nerve hypoplasia
is_a_string: HP:0002977 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the central nervous system
HP:0008058 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the optic nerve

children.name: Septo-optic dysplasia
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the optic nerve and absence of the septum pellucidum." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Underdevelopment of the optic nerve." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Optic nerve aplasia
is_a_string: HP:0008058 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the optic nerve
