children.defn: "Congenital absence of the optic nerve." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Leber optic atrophy
is_a_string: HP:0000587 ! Abnormality of the optic nerve
children.defn: "Degeneration of retinal ganglion cells and their axons." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Optic neuropathy
is_a_string: HP:0000587 ! Abnormality of the optic nerve

children.name: Nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy
children.defn: "An acute condition characterized by sudden visual loss (usually discovered in the morning), optic disc edema  at onset, optic disc-related visual field defects. Nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy can be associated with flame hemorrhages on the swollen disc or nearby neuroretinal layer, and sometimes with nearby cotton-wool exudates." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17698200]

children.name: Abnormality of the optic disc
is_a_string: HP:0000587 ! Abnormality of the optic nerve

children.name: Optic disc pallor
is_a_string: HP:0012795 ! Abnormality of the optic disc

children.name: Temporal optic disc pallor
children.defn: "A pale yellow discoloration of the temporal (lateral) portion of the optic disc." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19668477]

children.name: Diffuse optic disc pallor
children.defn: "A pale yellow discoloration of the entire optic disc." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19668477]
"A pale yellow discoloration of the optic disk (the area of the optic nerve head in the retina). The optic disc normally has a pinkish hue with a central yellowish depression." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Papilledema
is_a_string: HP:0012795 ! Abnormality of the optic disc
children.defn: "Papilledema refers to edema (swelling) of the optic disc secondary to any factor which increases cerebral spinal fluid pressure." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Optic atrophy
is_a_string: HP:0012795 ! Abnormality of the optic disc

children.name: Optic atrophy from cranial nerve compression

children.defn: "Atrophy of the optic nerve. Optic atrophy results from the death of the retinal ganglion cell axons that comprise the optic nerve and manifesting as a pale optic nerve on fundoscopy." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Increased cup-to-disc ratio
is_a_string: HP:0012795 ! Abnormality of the optic disc
children.defn: "An elevation in the ratio of the diameter of the cup of the optic disc to the total diameter of the disc. The optic disc has an orange-pink rim with a pale centre (the cup) that does not contain neuroretinal tissue. An increase in this ratio therefoy may indicate a decrease in the quantity of healthy neuroretinal cells." [HPO:probinson, pmid:23557744]

children.name: Optic disc drusen
is_a_string: HP:0012795 ! Abnormality of the optic disc
children.defn: "Optic disc drusen are acellular, calcified deposits within the optic nerve head. Optic disc drusen are congenital and developmental anomalies of the optic nerve head, representing hyaline-containing bodies that, over time, appear as elevated, lumpy irregularities on the anterior portion of the optic nerve." [HPO:probinson, pmid:22787500, pmid:23658477]
"A morphological abnormality of the optic disc, i.e., of the portion of the optic nerve clinically visible on fundoscopic examination." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Optic nerve dysplasia
is_a_string: HP:0000587 ! Abnormality of the optic nerve
children.defn: "The presence of developmental dysplasia of the optic nerve." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Optic nerve compression
is_a_string: HP:0000587 ! Abnormality of the optic nerve

children.defn: "Abnormality of the optic nerve." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ocular albinism
children.defn: "An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation (reduced or absent) of the iris and retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the retina
Retinal hamartoma
children.defn: "A hamartoma (a benign, focal malformation consisting of a disorganized mixture of cells and tissues) of the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bony spicule pigmentary retinopathy
children.defn: "A term for the pigmented cells within the retina in retinitis pigmentosa because of their resemblance to the nucleated cells within the lacuna of bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Retinal dysplasia
children.defn: "The presence of developmental dysplasia of the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Retinopathy
children.defn: "Any noninflammatory disease of the retina. This nonspecific term is retained here because of its wide use in the literature, but if possible new annotations should indicate the precise type of retinal abnormality." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Angioid streaks of the retina
children.defn: "Bilateral, narrow, irregular lines inferior to the retina and emanating in a radiating fashion from the optic disc." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the macula
Abnormality of the fovea
Foveoschisis
children.defn: "Splitting of the retinal layers in the macula." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Foveal dystrophy
children.defn: "This term has been used as a general description of degeneration of the fovea. It is preferable to provide an exact phenotypic description." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Foveal hypopigmentation
children.defn: "Decreased amount of pigmentation in the fovea centralis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Foveal hyperpigmentation
children.defn: "Increased amount of pigmentation in the fovea centralis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fovea
Aplasia of the fovea
children.defn: "Congenital absence of the fovea." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypoplasia of the fovea
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the fovea centralis." [HPO:probinson]
"Congenital absence or underdevelopment of the fovea centralis." [HPO:probinson]

"An abnormality of the fovea centralis, the central area of the macula that mediates central, high resolution vision and contains the largest concentration of cone cells in the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Macular flecks
children.defn: "Pale often indistinct lesions of the macula." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Macular hole
children.defn: "A macular hole is a small break in the macula, located in the center of the retina." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Choroidal neovascularization of the macula
children.defn: "Choroidal neovascularization (CNV) is the creation of new blood vessels in the choroid layer of the eye." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Cherry red spot of the macula
children.defn: "Pallor of the perifoveal macula of the retina with appearance of a small circular reddish choroid shape as seen through the fovea centralis due to relative transparancy of the macula." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cystoid macular edema
children.defn: "Cystoid macular edema (CME) is any type of macular edema that involves cyst formation." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Macular hypoplasia
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the macula lutea." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Macular degeneration
Macular dystrophy
children.defn: "Macular dystrophy is a nonspecific term for premature retinal cell aging and cell death, generally confied to the macula in which no clear extrinsic cause is evident." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Age-related macular degeneration
children.defn: "Age-related macular degeneration (AMD) is a medical condition which usually affects older adults and results in a loss of vision in the center of the visual field (the macula) because of damage to the retina." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Cystoid macular degeneration
children.defn: "A form of macular degeneration characterized by the presence of multiple cysts in the macula." [HPO:probinson]
"Degeneration of the macula lutea." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Drusen
children.defn: "Drusen (singular, 'druse') are tiny yellow or white accumulations of extracellular material (lipofuscin) that build up in Bruch's membrane of the eye." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Macular schisis
children.defn: "Splitting of the retina in the macular region." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Vitelliform maculopathy
children.defn: "Vitelliform maculopathy is a sharply demarcated lesion caused by the accumulation of material, often lipofuscin in the subretinal space underlying the macula." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Epiretinal membrane
children.defn: "An epiretinal membrane is a thin sheet of fibrous tissue that can develop on the surface of the macular area of the retina and cause a disturbance in vision. An epiretinal membrane area can develop on the thin macular area of the retin. An epiretinal membrane is also sometimes called a macular pucker, premacular fibrosis, surface wrinkling retinopathy or cellophane maculopathy." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormality of macular pigmentation
Macular hyperpigmentation
children.defn: "Increased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Bull's eye maculopathy
children.defn: "Progressive maculopathy characterized by concentric regions of hyper- and hypo-pigmentation." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Macular retinal pigment epithelial mottling
children.defn: "Mottled (spotted or blotched with different shades) pigmentary abnormality of the macula lutea." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Macular hypopigmentation
children.defn: "Decreased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea." [DDD:ncarter]
"Abnormality of macular or foveal pigmentation." [DDD:ncarter]
"An abnormality of the macula lutea is an oval-shaped highly pigmented yellow spot near the center of the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Retinal exudate
Subretinal exudate
children.defn: "A type of retinal exudate located in the subretinal space between the sensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Intraretinal exudate
children.defn: "Retinal exudate within the retinal tissue itself." [HPO:probinson]

"Fluid which has escaped from retinal blood vessels with a high concentration of lipid, protein, and cellular debris with a typically bright, reflective, white or cream colored appearance on the surface of the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Retinal degeneration
Vitreoretinal degeneration
children.defn: "Gradual deterioration of the vitreous humor and retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Snowflake retinal degeneration
children.defn: "The appearance of yellow/white crystalline-like (hence the name) spots in the retina and thickening of the peripheral part of the vitreous." [DDD:ncarter]

"A deterioration of the retina. This nonspecific term is retained here because of its wide use in the literature, but if possible new annotations should indicate the precise type of retinal abnormality." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Retinal detachment
Tractional retinal detachment
children.defn: "A type of retinal detachment associated with traction exerted by fibrous or fibrovascular tissue. The fibrous tissue is visible in the vitreous and may be the result of injury, inflammation or neovascularization. If such membranes contract, they pull the sensory retina apart from the underlying retinal pigment epithelium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Rhegmatogenous retinal detachment
children.defn: "A type of retinal detachment associated with a retinal tear, that is, with a break in the retina that allows fluid to pass from the vitreous space into the subretinal space between the sensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Exudative retinal detachment
children.defn: "A type of retinal detachment associated with leakage of fluid (exudate) from under the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Retinal nonattachment
children.defn: "Failure of attachment of the retina during development." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21441919]
"Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Falciform retinal fold
children.defn: "An area of the retina that is buckled so that a sector-shaped sheet of retina lies in front of the normal retina. This feature is of congenital onset." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium
Abnormal retinal pigmentation
is_a_string: HP:0008051 ! Abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium

children.name: Retinitis pigmentosa
Retinitis pigmentosa inversa
children.defn: "A variant of retinitis pigmentosa characterized by areas of choroidal degeneration with pigment migration and bony spicule formation in the macular area. In contrast to more typical forms of RP, this anomaly destroys central vision, leaving peripheral vision intact." [pmid:9734800]
"Hereditary degeneration and atrophy of the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pigmentary retinal degeneration
is_a_string: HP:0008051 ! Abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium

children.name: Hypopigmentation of the fundus
is_a_string: HP:0008051 ! Abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium

children.name: Depigmented lesions of the retinal pigment epithelium
Patchy atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium
Achromatic retinal patches
children.defn: "Areas of the retina lacking pigmentation." [HPO:probinson]
"Decreased amount of pigmentation of the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Loss of retinal pigment epithelium
is_a_string: HP:0008051 ! Abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium

children.name: Hyperpigmentation of the fundus
is_a_string: HP:0008051 ! Abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium

children.name: Salt and pepper retinopathy
children.defn: "Mottling (Spots or blotches with different shades) of the retinal pigment epithelium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium
Multiple bilateral congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium
is_a_string: HP:0007649 ! Congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium
children.defn: "Sharply demarcated hyperpigmentation which is congenital." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Single isolated congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium
is_a_string: HP:0007649 ! Congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium
children.defn: "Sharply demarcated hyperpigmentation which is congenital found in around 3-5% of the population and of no functional significance." [DDD:gblack]
"Sharply demarcated, congenital hyperpigmentation of thr retinal pigment epithelium." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Butterfly retinal pigment epithelial dystrophy
children.defn: "Butterfly-shed retinal pigmentation at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium." [pmid:11934323]
"Increased amount of pigmentation of the retina." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Absent retinal pigment epithelium
is_a_string: HP:0008051 ! Abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium

children.defn: "An abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium. Much of the pigmentary change that occurs in diseases of the retina takes place in the RPE (which is pigmented) rather than in the retina (which is transparent). The main purpose of the RPE is to insulate and support the overlying neural retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Retinal neoplasm
Retinal astrocytic hamartoma
children.defn: "A glial tumor of the retinal nerve fiber layer arising from a retinal astrocyte." [pmid:20435268, pmid:23436975]

children.name: Retinoblastoma
children.defn: "A tumor of the eye originating from cells of the retina." [HPO:curators]
"The presence of a neoplasm of the retina." [CINEAS:asollie]

children.name: Lipemia retinalis
children.defn: "A creamy appearance of the retinal blood vessels that occurs when the concentration of lipids in the blood are extremely increased, with pale pink to milky white retinal vessels and altered pale reflexes from choroidal vasculature." [pmid:10379021, pmid:16120862]

children.name: Retinal perforation
Retinal hole
children.defn: "A small break in the retina." [HPO:probinson]
"A small hole through the whole thickness of the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal electroretinogram
Decreased electroretinogram (ERG) amplitude
children.defn: "Descreased amplitude of eletrical response upon electroretinography." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Decreased electrooculogram (EOG)
children.defn: "An abnormal reduction in amplitude of the signal opf electro-oculography (EOG), which is a technique for measuring the resting potential of the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal rod and cone electroretinograms
Absent rod-and cone-mediated responses on ERG
is_a_string: HP:0008323 ! Abnormal rod and cone electroretinograms
children.defn: "Absence of the combined rod-and-code response on electroretinogram." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the combined rod-and-code response on electroretinogram." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced amplitude of b-wave (ERG)
children.defn: "An abnormal reduction in the amplitude of the b-wave in electroretinography." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abolished electroretinogram (ERG)
children.defn: "Lack of any response to stimulation upon electroretinography." [HPO:probinson]
"Any abnormality of the electrical responses of various cell types in the retina as measured by electroretinography." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pseudopapilledema
children.defn: "Apparent optic disc swelling in the absence of increased intracranial pressure." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Retinal flecks
children.defn: "Presence of multiple yellowish-white lesions of various size and configuration on the retina not related to vascular lesions." [pmid:7952338]

children.name: Retinal lesions
children.defn: "Retinal lesions can occur due to multiple reasons for example as a result of decreased blood supply to the retina, angiomas in case of von Hipple-Lindau disease, disseminated bacterial and candidal infections, astrocytic hamartomas (so called phakomas) and many more." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Retinal calcification
children.defn: "Deposition of calcium salts in the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nonprogressive congenital retinal dystrophy
children.defn: "A form or retinal dystrophy that is present at birth and does not further progress." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia of the retina
children.defn: "A developmental defect characterized by absence of the retina." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the retina." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eye
Abnormality of the cornea
is_a_string: HP:0004328 ! Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eye

children.name: Decreased corneal sensation
children.defn: "Reduced ability of the cornea to respond to stimulation." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the curvature of the cornea
Flat cornea
is_a_string: HP:0100691 ! Abnormality of the curvature of the cornea
children.defn: "Cornea plana is an abnormally flat shape of the cornea such that the normal protrusion of the cornea from the sclera is missing. The reduced corneal curvature can lead to hyperopia, and a hazy corneal limbus and arcus lipoides may develop at an early age." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Increased corneal curvature
is_a_string: HP:0100691 ! Abnormality of the curvature of the cornea

children.name: Keratoconus
children.defn: "A cone-shaped deformity of the cornea." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Keratoglobus
children.defn: "Limbus-to-limbus corneal thinning, often greatest in the periphery, with globular protrusion of the cornea." [pmid:19667340]
"An increase in the degree of curvature of the cornea compared to normal." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Corneal opacity
Opacification of the corneal epithelium
Subepithelial corneal opacities
is_a_string: HP:0007727 ! Opacification of the corneal epithelium

children.defn: "Lack of transparency of the corneal epithelium." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Kayser-Fleischer ring
children.defn: "Grey-green or brownish-pigmented ring in the deep epithelial layers at the outer border of the cornea." [HPO:SKOEHLER]

children.name: Sclerocornea
children.defn: "A congenital anomaly in which a part or the whole of the cornea acquires the characteristics of sclera, resulting in clouding of the cornea." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Opacification of the corneal stroma
Punctate opacification of the cornea
is_a_string: HP:0007759 ! Opacification of the corneal stroma

children.name: Crystalline corneal dystrophy
is_a_string: HP:0007856 ! Punctate opacification of the cornea

children.defn: "Punctate opacification (reduced transparency) of the corneal stroma." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Central opacification of the cornea
is_a_string: HP:0007759 ! Opacification of the corneal stroma

children.name: Band keratopathy
is_a_string: HP:0011493 ! Central opacification of the cornea
children.defn: "An abnormality of the cornea characterized by the deposition of calcium in a band across the central cornea, leading to decreased vision, foreign body sensation, and ocular irritation." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Central posterior corneal opacity
is_a_string: HP:0011493 ! Central opacification of the cornea
children.defn: "Reduced transparency of the central posterior portion of the corneal stroma." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Central corneal dystrophy
is_a_string: HP:0011493 ! Central opacification of the cornea

children.defn: "Reduced transparency of the central portion of the corneal stroma." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Peripheral opacification of the cornea
is_a_string: HP:0007759 ! Opacification of the corneal stroma

children.name: Corneal arcus
is_a_string: HP:0008011 ! Peripheral opacification of the cornea
children.defn: "A hazy, grayish-white ring about 2 mm in width located close to but separated from the limbus (the corneoscleral junction). Corneal arcus generally occurs bilaterally, and is related to lipid deposition in the cornea. Corneal arcus can occur in elderly persons as a part of the aging process but may be associated with hypercholesterolemia in people under the age of 50 years." [HPO:curators]
"Reduced transparency of the peripheral region of the cornea." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Corneal crystals
is_a_string: HP:0007759 ! Opacification of the corneal stroma

children.name: Generalized opacification of the cornea
is_a_string: HP:0007759 ! Opacification of the corneal stroma

children.name: Nodular corneal dystrophy
is_a_string: HP:0011494 ! Generalized opacification of the cornea

children.defn: "Generalized reduced transparency of the stroma of the cornea." [DDD:gblack]
"Reduced transparency of the stroma of cornea." [DDD:gblack]
"A reduction of corneal clarity." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of corneal size
Microcornea
children.defn: "A congenital abnormality of the cornea in which the cornea and the anterior segment of the eye are smaller than normal. The horizontal diameter of the cornea does not reach 10 mm even in adulthood." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Megalocornea
children.defn: "An enlargement of the cornea with normal clarity and function. Megalocornea is diagnosed with a horizontal corneal diameter of 12 mm or more at birth or 13 mm or more after two years of age." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Corneal asymmetry
children.defn: "The presence of a size difference between the left and right cornea." [HPO:probinson]
"Any abnormality of the size or morphology of the cornea." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Epibulbar dermoid
children.defn: "An epibulbar dermoid is a benign tumor typically found at the junction of the cornea and sclera (limbal epibullar dermoid)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of corneal stroma
Prominent corneal nerve fibers
children.defn: "Abnormal prominence of the corneal nerve fibers." [DDD:ncarter, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Corneal stromal edema
children.defn: "Abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling of the stroma of cornea." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the stroma of cornea, also known as the substantia propria of cornea." [DDD:ncarter, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of corneal epithelium
Corneal ulceration
Herpetiform corneal ulceration
children.defn: "The presence of one or more dendritic corneal epithelial ulcers characterized by a treelike branching linear pattern with feathery edges and terminal bulbs. Herpetiform corneal ulcers can be identified by fluorescein staining." [HPO:probinson]
"Disruption of the epithelial layer of the cornea with involvement of the underlying stroma." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Corneal erosion
Recurrent corneal erosions
children.defn: "The presence of recurrent corneal epithelial erosions. Although most corneal epithelial defects heal quickly, some may show recurrent ulcerations." [HPO:curators]
"An erosion or abrasion of the cornea's outermost layer of epithelial cells." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Abnormality of the corneal epithelium, that is of the epithelial tissue that covers the front of the cornea." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Corneal neovascularization
children.defn: "Ingrowth of new blood vessels into the cornea." [DDD:ncarter, pmid:22898649]

children.name: Corneal dystrophy
Lattice corneal dystrophy
children.defn: "The presence of fine, branching linear opacities in Bowman's layer in the central area that may spread to the periphery in the clinical course. The deep corneal stroma may be involved but the process does not reach Descemet's membrane. Recurrent corneal erosion may occur. Histologic examination reveals amyloid deposits in the collagen fibers of the cornea." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Granular corneal dystrophy
children.defn: "The presence of central, fine, whitish granular lesions in the stroma of the cornea. This type of corneal dystrophy is usually asymptomatic and begins in childhood and shows a slow progression. Later in the course, the corneal epithelium and Bowman's layer may be affected. Histologically, the cornea shows a uniform deposition of hyaline material." [HPO:curators]
"An abnormality of the cornea that is characterized by opacity of one or parts of the cornea." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of corneal endothelium
Abnormal migration of corneal endothelium
Polymorphous posterior corneal dystrophy
is_a_string: HP:0011489 ! Abnormal migration of corneal endothelium
HP:0011491 ! Reduced number of corneal endothelial cells
children.defn: "This corneal dystrophy affects the posterior limiting membrane of the cornea and is characterized by polymorphous plaques of calcium deposits in the deep stromal layers of the cornea, and occasionally by vesicular lesions of the endothelium and edema of the deep corneal stroma." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormal migration of corneal endothelium." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Reduced number of corneal endothelial cells
children.defn: "A reduction in the number of corneal endothelial cells." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Abnormality of Descemet's membrane
Corneal guttata
children.defn: "Corneal guttata are droplet-like accumulations of non-banded collagen on the posterior surface of Descemet's membrane. The presence of focal thickenings of Descemet's membrane histologically named guttae. Cornea guttata can be easily diagnosed in vivo and ex vivo by means of specular microscopy as it gives dark areas where no endothelial cells are visible." [HPO:probinson, pmid:10611102, pmid:11222329]

children.name: Descemet Membrane Folds
children.defn: "Presence of folds in the Descement membrane, which is the basement membrane of the endothelial (inner) cell layer of the cornea. Descement membrane folds are generally a manifestation of inflammation or edema of the cornea." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormality of Descemet's membrane, which is the basement membrane of the corneal endothelium." [DDD:gblack]
"Abnormality of the corneal endothelium, that is, the single layer of cells on the inner surface of the cornea." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Abnormality of corneal thickness
Decreased corneal thickness
children.defn: "A decreased anteroposterior thickness of the cornea." [HPO:gblack]

children.name: Increased corneal thickness
children.defn: "A increased anteroposterior thickness of the cornea." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormal anteroposterior thickness of the cornea." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Decreased corneal reflex
children.defn: "An abnormally reduced response to stimulation of the cornea (by touch, foreign body, blowing air). The corneal reflex (also known as the blink reflex, normally results in an involuntary blinking of the eyelids." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Corneal perforation
children.defn: "A rupture of the cornea through which a portion of the iris protrudes." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Abnormality of the line of Schwalbe
Abnormally prominent line of Schwalbe
is_a_string: HP:0008048 ! Abnormality of the line of Schwalbe

children.name: Posterior embryotoxon
is_a_string: HP:0008048 ! Abnormality of the line of Schwalbe
children.defn: "A posterior embryotoxon is the presence of a prominent and anteriorly displaced line of Schwalbe." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the line of Schwalbe." [HPO:probinson]
"Any abnormality of the cornea, which is the transparent tissue at the front of the eye that covers the iris, pupil, and anterior chamber." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the iris
is_a_string: HP:0004328 ! Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eye

children.name: Abnormality of the pupil
Abnormal pupillary function
Miosis
Congenital miosis
children.defn: "Abnormal (non-physiological) constriction of the pupil of congenital onset." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormal (non-physiological) constriction of the pupil." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tonic pupil
children.defn: "An abnormality of the pupillary light reaction characterized by a marked slowing of the light reaction of usually just one pupil. The pupil tends to be relatively dilated, and there is reduced accommodation." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Mydriasis
Bilateral congenital mydriasis
children.defn: "Congenital abnormal dilation of the pupil on both sides." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormal dilatation of the iris." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Abnormal pupillary light reflex
Slow pupillary light response
children.defn: "Reduced velocity and acceleration in the pupillary light response." [pmid:974056, UNCL:tevangelista]
"An abnormality of the reflex that controls the diameter of the pupil, in response to the intensity of light that falls on the retina of the eye." [HPO:probinson]
"A functional abnormality of the pupil." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Polycoria
children.defn: "Multiple pupils." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Ectopia pupillae
children.defn: "A malposition of the pupil owing to a developmental defect of the iris." [DDD:gblack, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Persistent pupillary membrane
children.defn: "The presence of remnants of a fetal membrane that persist as strands of tissue crossing the pupil." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anisocoria
children.defn: "Anisocoria, or unequal pupil size, may represent a benign physiologic variant or a manifestation of disease." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Leukocoria
children.defn: "An abnormal white reflection from the pupil rather than the usual black reflection." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the pupil." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Iritis
children.defn: "Inflammation of the iris." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lisch nodules
children.defn: "The presence of pigmented, oval and dome-shaped raised hamartomatous nevi of the iris.." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Iris atrophy
children.defn: "Atrophy of the iris." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal iris pigmentation
Blue irides
children.defn: "A markedly blue coloration of the iris." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Heterochromia iridis
Central heterochromia
children.defn: "The presence of distinct colors in the central (pupillary) zone of the iris than in the mid-peripheral (ciliary) zone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lester's sign
children.defn: "A zone of darker pigmentation around the central part of the iris with a roughly cloverleaf or flower shape." [HPO:probinson]
"Heterochromia iridis is a difference in the color of the iris in the two eyes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Brushfield spots
children.defn: "The presence of whitish spots in a ring-like arrangement at the periphery of the iris." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Stellate iris
children.defn: "A lacy pattern or iris pigmentation that resembles the spokes of a bicycle wheel." [CINEAS:asollie]

children.name: Iris hypopigmentation
children.defn: "An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation of the iris." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Iris transillumination defect
children.defn: "Transmission of light through the iris as visualized upon slit lamp examination or infrared iris transillumination videography. The light passes through defects in the pigmentation of the iris." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19920562]

children.name: Iris pigment dispersion
children.defn: "Shedding of the pigment granules that normally adhere to the back of the iris into the aqueous humor." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormal pigmentation of the iris." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Iris cyst
children.defn: "An iris cyst is composed of a single cell layer of epithelium and is filled with fluid." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Iris nevus
children.defn: "A benign brown pigmented area over the iris representing proliferation of melanocyte cells in the stromal layer of the iris. An iris nevus can be flat or occasionally slightly elevated." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Iris melanoma
children.defn: "Malignant tumor of melanocytes affecting the iris." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the iris
is_a_string: HP:0008062 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the anterior segment of the eye

children.name: Aniridia
Partial aniridia
children.defn: "Sectoral aplasia of the iris." [DDD:gblack]
"Congenital absence of the iris." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypoplasia of the iris
Hypoplastic iris stroma
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the stroma of iris." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypoplasia of the iris dilator muscle
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the dilatator pupillae." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Rieger anomaly
children.defn: "A congenital malformation of the anterior segment characterized by iridicorneal malformation, glaucoma, iris stroma hypoplasia, posterior embryotoxon, and corneal opacities." [HPO:probinson]
"Congenital underdevelopment of the iris." [HPO:probinson]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the iris." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Iridodonesis
children.defn: "Tremulousness of the iris on movement of the eye, occurring in subluxation of the lens." [HPO:sdoelken]
"An abnormality of the iris, which is the pigmented muscular tissue between the cornea and the lens, that is perforated by an opening called the pupil." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pseudoexfoliation
is_a_string: HP:0004328 ! Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eye
children.defn: "Deposition of fibrillar material that can be found on all anterior segment structures bathed by aqueous humor." [HPO:probinson, pmid:23157966]

children.name: Abnormality of the anterior chamber
is_a_string: HP:0004328 ! Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eye

children.name: Anterior segment dysgenesis
is_a_string: HP:0000593 ! Abnormality of the anterior chamber

children.name: Peters anomaly
children.defn: "A form of anterior segment dysgenesis in which abnormal cleavage of the anterior chamber occurs. Peters anomaly is characterized by central, paracentral, or complete corneal opacity." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Axenfeld anomaly
children.defn: "Axenfeld's anomaly is a bilateral disorder characterized by a prominent, anteriorly displaced Schwalbe's line (posterior embryotoxon) and peripheral iris strands which span the anterior chamber angle to attach to Schwalbe's line." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormal development (dysgenesis) of the anterior segment of the eye globe. These structures are mainly of mesenchymal origin." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Anterior chamber synechiae
is_a_string: HP:0000593 ! Abnormality of the anterior chamber

children.name: Anterior synechiae of the anterior chamber
children.defn: "Adhesions between the iris and the cornea." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Posterior synechiae of the anterior chamber
children.defn: "Adhesions between the iris and the lens." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Deep anterior chamber
is_a_string: HP:0000593 ! Abnormality of the anterior chamber
children.defn: "Increased depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is increased." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absent anterior eye chamber
is_a_string: HP:0000593 ! Abnormality of the anterior chamber

children.name: Shallow anterior chamber
is_a_string: HP:0000593 ! Abnormality of the anterior chamber

children.name: Slitlike anterior chamber angles in children

children.defn: "Reduced depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is decreased." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Corneolenticular adhesion
is_a_string: HP:0000593 ! Abnormality of the anterior chamber
children.defn: "Developmental abnormality in which the lens and cornea are not separated." [DDD:ncarter]

children.name: Abnormality of the trabecular meshwork
is_a_string: HP:0000593 ! Abnormality of the anterior chamber

children.name: Pigment deposition in the trabecular meshwork
is_a_string: HP:0012630 ! Abnormality of the trabecular meshwork
children.defn: "Accumulation of abnormal amounts of pigment within the trabecular meshwork." [HPO:probinson]

"An anomaly of the trabecular meshwork, which is the porelike structure surrounding the entire circumference of the anterior chamber at the base of the cornea and near the ciliary body. The trabecular mesh work is responsible for draining the aqueous humor into the canal of Schlemm." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormality of the anterior chamber, which is the space in the eye that is behind the cornea and in front of the iris." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the lens
is_a_string: HP:0004328 ! Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eye

children.name: Abnormality of lens shape
Lentiglobus
children.defn: "Exaggerated curvature of the lens of the eye, producing an anterior or posterior spherical bulging." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Lenticonus
Anterior lenticonus
children.defn: "A conical projection of the anterior surface of the lens, occurring as a developmental anomaly." [DDD:gblack]

children.name: Posterior lenticonus
children.defn: "A conical projection of the posterior surface of the lens, occurring as a developmental anomaly." [DDD:gblack]
"A conical projection of the anterior or posterior surface of the lens, occurring as a developmental anomaly." [DDD:ncarter]
"An abnormal shape of the lens." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cataract
Presenile cataracts
children.defn: "Presenile cataract is a kind of cataract that occurs in early adulthood, that is, at an age that is younger than usual." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17030721]

children.name: Progressive cataract
children.defn: "A kind of cataract that progresses with age." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital cataract
Congenital nuclear cataract
children.defn: "A type of congenital cataract in which the opacities are confined to a small central area within the embryonic or fetal nuclei of the Iens. The remaining lens is clear." [HPO:probinson]
"A congenital cataract." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Total cataract
children.defn: "A Congenital cataract characterized by an opacity of all the fibers of a lens." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Zonular cataract
Lamellar cataract
Lamellar pulverulent cataract
children.defn: "A Lamellar cataract with a pulverulent (punctate, \"dust-like\" opacities) appearance." [HPO:probinson]

"A congenital cataract in which opacity is limited to layers of the lens external to the nucleus (i.e., the perinuclear region), i.e., between the nuclear and cortical layers of the lens." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Punctate cataract
Cerulean cataract
children.defn: "Cerulean cataracts are a kind of congenital cataract having peripheral bluish and white opacifications in concentric layers with occasional central lesions arranged radially. Although the opacities may be observed during fetal development and childhood, usually visual acuity is only mildly reduced until adulthood, when lens extraction is generally necessary." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19496508, pmid:9158139]

children.name: Nuclear pulverulent cataract
children.defn: "A type of nuclear cataract involving congenital pulverulent disc-like opacity of the embryonal and fetal nucleus." [HPO:probinson, pmid:10634616]

children.name: Pulverulent Cataract
Cortical pulverulent cataract
children.defn: "A type of cataract characterized by punctate, dust-like opacities within the cortical region of the lens." [HPO:probinson]
"A kind of congenital cataract that is characterized by a hollow sphere of punctate opacities involving the fetal nucleus and that usually occurs bilaterally." [HPO:probinson, HPO:vkumar]
"A type of cataract with punctate opacities of the lens." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nuclear cataract
Diffuse nuclear cataract
children.defn: "Opacity of the entire lens nucleus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aculeiform cataract
children.defn: "A kind of nuclear cataract characterized by fiberglasslike or needlelike crystals projecting in different directions, through or close to the axial region of the lens." [HPO:probinson, pmid:9718335]

children.name: Triangular nuclear cataract
children.defn: "A nuclear cataract with a triangular form." [HPO:probinson, pmid:18483562]

"A nuclear cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the lens nucleus. That is, a nuclear cataract is one that is located in the center of the lens. The nucleus tends to darken changing from clear to yellow and sometimes brown." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Cortical cataract
Anterior cortical cataract
children.defn: "A cataract that affects the anterior part of the cortex of the lens." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Posterior cortical cataract
Dense posterior cortical cataract
children.defn: "A type of posterior cortical cataract characterized by dense lenticular opacities." [HPO:probinson]
"A cataract that affects the posterior part of the cortex of the lens." [HPO:probinson]
"A cataract which affects the layer of the lens surrounding the nucleus, i.e., the lens cortex. It is identified by its unique wedge or spoke appearance." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Coralliform cataract
children.defn: "A 'coral-like' pattern of opacity in the lens of the eye. That is, a cataract with an irregular, stellate form." [HPO:probinson, HPO:vkumar]

children.name: Sutural cataract
Posterior Y-sutural cataract
children.defn: "A type of sutural cataract in which the opacity follows the posterior Y suture." [HPO:probinson]
"A type of congenital cataract in which the opacity follows the anterior or posterior Y suture." [HPO:probinson]
"Zonular cataracts are defined to be cataracts that affect specific regions of the lens." [HPO:probinson, HPO:vkumar, pmid:18035564]

children.name: Age-related cataract
Age-related cortical cataract
children.defn: "A type of age-related cataract that primarily affects the cortex of the lens." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15708105]

children.name: Age-related nuclear cataract
children.defn: "A type of age-related cataract that primarily affects the nucleus of the lens." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15708105]

children.name: Age-related posterior subcapsular cataract
children.defn: "A type of age-related cataract consisting of granular opacities occurring mainly in the central posterior cortex just under the posterior capsule." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15708105]
"A type of cataract (opacification of the lens) that forms during the course of aging." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15708105]

children.name: Capsular cataract
Posterior capsular cataract
children.defn: "A cataract which is found in the back outer layer of the lens. This type often develops more rapidly." [HPO:sdoelken]
"A cataract that affects the capsule of the lens." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Juvenile cataract
children.defn: "A type of cataract that is not apparent at birth but that arises in childhood or adolescence." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Membranous cataract
children.defn: "A form of cataract in which the lens substance has shrunk, leaving a collapsed, flattened capsule with little or no cortex or epithelium on the lens." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17539799]

children.name: Polar cataract
Subcapsular cataract
Anterior subcapsular cataract
children.defn: "A type of cataract affecting the Anterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the Lens capsule." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Posterior subcapsular cataract
Iridescent posterior subcapsular cataract
children.defn: "A type of posterior subcapsular cataract characterized by an iridescent color." [HPO:probinson, pmid:7826272]
"A type of cataract affecting the posterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the Lens capsule." [HPO:probinson]
"A cataract that affects the region of the lens directly beneath the capsule of the lens." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Posterior polar cataract
children.defn: "A polar cataract that affects the posterior pole of the lens." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anterior polar cataract
Anterior pyramidal cataract
children.defn: "A type of anterior polar cataract which projects as a conical opacity into the anterior chamber." [HPO:probinson]
"A polar cataract that affects the anterior pole of the lens." [HPO:probinson]
"A type of Congenital cataract in which the opacities occupy the subcapsular cortex at the anterior or posterior pole of the lens." [HPO:probinson]
"A cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the crystalline lens of the eye or in its capsule." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ectopia lentis
Lens luxation
children.defn: "Complete dislocation of the lens of the eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lens subluxation
Superior lens subluxation
children.defn: "Partial dislocation of the lens in a superior direction." [HPO:probinson, pmid:5087595]

children.name: Inferior lens subluxation
children.defn: "Partial displacement of the lens in the inferior direction." [HPO:probinson]
"Partial dislocation of the lens of the eye." [HPO:probinson]

"Dislocation or malposition of the crystalline lens of the eye. A partial displacement (or dislocation) of the lens is described as a subluxation of the lens, while a complete displacement is termed luxation of the lens. A complete displacement occurs if the lens is completely outside the patellar fossa of the lens, either in the anterior chamber, in the vitreous, or directly on the retina. If the lens is partially displaced but still contained within the lens space, then it is termed subluxation." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Phacodonesis
children.defn: "Tremulousness (trembling) of the lens of the eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the lens
is_a_string: HP:0008062 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the anterior segment of the eye

children.name: Microphakia
children.defn: "Abnormal smallness of the lens." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital primary aphakia
children.defn: "A developmental defect resulting in congenital absence of the crystalline lens." [HPO:probinson]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the lens." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the lens." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the anterior segment of the eye
is_a_string: HP:0004328 ! Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eye

children.name: Anterior segment of eye aplasia
is_a_string: HP:0008062 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the anterior segment of the eye

children.defn: "Absence or underdevelopment of the anterior segment of the eye." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the anterior segment of the eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the suspensory ligament of lens
children.defn: "An anomaly of the suspensory ligament of lens, also known as the ciliary zonule. These ligaments represent a series of fibers connecting the ciliary body and lens of the eye, holding the lens in place." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the uvea
Hypoplasia of the ciliary body
is_a_string: HP:0012776 ! Abnormality of the ciliary body
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the ciliary body." [HPO:probinson]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the uvea, the pigmented middle layer of the eye consisting of the iris and ciliary body together with the choroid." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the sclera
Blue sclerae
children.defn: "An abnormal bluish coloration of the sclera." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the sclera." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Phthisis bulbi
children.defn: "Atrophy of the eyeball with blindness and decreased intraocular pressure due to end-stage intraocular disease." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Spontaneous rupture of the globe
children.defn: "Rupture of the eyeball not due to trauma." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the uvea
Abnormality of the ciliary body
Ciliary body melanoma
is_a_string: HP:0012776 ! Abnormality of the ciliary body
children.defn: "Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the ciliary body." [HPO:probinson]
"A structural anomaly of the ciliary body (FMA:58295)." [CINEAS:asollie]
"An abnormality of the uvea, the vascular layer of the eyeball." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly of the eyeball." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the conjunctiva
Bitot spots of the conjunctiva
children.defn: "Keratinization of the bulbar conjunctiva near the limbus (corneoscleral junction), resulting in a raised spot." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Chemosis
children.defn: "Edema (swelling) of the bulbar conjunctiva." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Conjunctival whitish salt-like deposits
children.defn: "The presence of whitish deposits in the  conjunctiva resembling salt. May be related to calcinosis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Conjunctival hamartoma
children.defn: "A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) of the conjunctiva." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Conjunctival amyloidosis
children.defn: "A form of amyloidosis that affects the conjunctiva." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Conjunctival nodule
children.defn: "Presence of nodules in the  conjunctiva of the eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Conjunctival lipoma
children.defn: "A lipoma (a benign tumor composed of adipose tissue) located in the conjunctiva." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the conjunctiva." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Hamartoma of the eye
children.defn: "A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) which can originate from any tissue of the eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Neoplasm of the eye
Intraocular melanoma
Choroidal melanoma
children.defn: "Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the choroid. The classic appearance of choroidal melanoma is a pigmented dome-shaped or collar button-shaped tumor with an associated exudative retinal detachment. Choroidal melanoma is usually pigmented, but can be variably pigmented and even amelanotic (non-pigmented)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:22557869]
"A malignant melanoma originating within the eye. The tumor originates from the melanocytes in the uvea (which comprises the iris, ciliary body, and choroid)." [HPO:curators]
"The presence of a neoplasm of the eye." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the extraocular muscles
Congenital extraocular muscle anomaly
is_a_string: HP:0008049 ! Abnormality of the extraocular muscles
children.defn: "Congenital abnormality of the extraocular muscles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital fibrosis of extraocular muscles
is_a_string: HP:0008049 ! Abnormality of the extraocular muscles
children.defn: "Congenital non-progressive ophthalmoplegia with multiple extraocular muscle restrictions. Typically, there is ptosis and variable degrees of restriction of horizontal and vertical eye movements." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Levator palpebrae superioris atrophy
is_a_string: HP:0008049 ! Abnormality of the extraocular muscles
children.defn: "Atrophy of the levator palpebrae superioris, the extraocular muscle that  elevates the superior eyelid." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Superior rectus atrophy
is_a_string: HP:0008049 ! Abnormality of the extraocular muscles
children.defn: "Atrophy of the superior rectus, the extraocular muscle whose primary function is to elevate the globe." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absent extraocular muscles
is_a_string: HP:0008049 ! Abnormality of the extraocular muscles
children.defn: "Congenital absence of the extraocular muscles." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of an extraocular muscle." [HPO:probinson]
"A structural anomaly of the eye." [HPO:probinson]
"Any abnormality of the eye, including location, spacing, and intraocular abnormalities." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the lower limb
Abnormality of lower-limb metaphyses
is_a_string: HP:0002814 ! Abnormality of the lower limb

children.name: Broad tibial metaphyses
is_a_string: HP:0006491 ! Abnormality of the tibial metaphysis

children.name: Peg-like central prominence of distal tibial metaphyses
is_a_string: HP:0006491 ! Abnormality of the tibial metaphysis

children.name: Abnormality of the femoral metaphysis
Broad femoral metaphyses
is_a_string: HP:0006489 ! Abnormality of the femoral metaphysis

children.name: Metaphyseal abnormalities of distal and proximal femurs
is_a_string: HP:0006489 ! Abnormality of the femoral metaphysis

children.name: Wide distal femoral metaphysis
is_a_string: HP:0006489 ! Abnormality of the femoral metaphysis
children.defn: "Increased width of the distal part of the shaft (metaphysis) of the femur." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Flared femoral metaphysis
is_a_string: HP:0006489 ! Abnormality of the femoral metaphysis

children.name: Irregular proximal femoral metaphyses
is_a_string: HP:0003366 ! Abnormality of the femoral neck or head region
HP:0006489 ! Abnormality of the femoral metaphysis

children.name: Wide proximal femoral metaphysis
is_a_string: HP:0006489 ! Abnormality of the femoral metaphysis
children.defn: "Increased width of the proximal part of the shaft (metaphysis) of the femur." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly of the femoral metaphysis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the foot
is_a_string: HP:0002814 ! Abnormality of the lower limb

children.name: Broad foot
children.defn: "A foot for which the measured width is above the 95th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately wide for its length." [pmid:19125433]

children.name: Pes planus
children.defn: "A foot where the plantar arch is in contact with the ground or floor when the individual is standing; or, in a patient lying supine, a foot where the arch is in contact with the surface of a flat board pressed against the sole of the foot by the examiner with a pressure similar to that expected from weight bearing; or, the height of the arch is reduced." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125433]

children.name: Pes cavus
Progressive pes cavus
children.defn: "The development of Pes cavus that is progressive with age." [HPO:probinson]

"The presence of an unusually high plantar arch. Also called high instep, pes cavus refers to a distinctly hollow form of the sole of the foot when it is bearing weight." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125433]

children.name: Abnormal foot bone ossification
Abnormal metatarsal ossification
is_a_string: HP:0001832 ! Abnormality of the metatarsal bones

children.name: Nonossified fifth metatarsal
children.defn: "The presence of a fifth metatarsal bone that has not undergone ossification at an age when ossification is usually visible." [HPO:probinson]

"Any abnormal process of ossification of the metatarsal bones, which normally are each ossified from two centers: one for the body, and one for the head (metatarsal II,III,IV, and V) and one for the body and one for the base (metatarsal I). The ossification process begins in the center of the body about the ninth week, and extends toward either extremity. The center for the base of the first metatarsal appears about the third year, and the centers for the heads of the other bones between the fifth and eighth years. They join the bodies between the eighteenth and twentieth years." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal tarsal ossification
is_a_string: HP:0001850 ! Abnormality of the tarsal bones

children.name: Advanced tarsal ossification
children.defn: "Precocious (accelerated) maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Delayed tarsal ossification
Delayed calcaneal ossification
children.defn: "Delayed maturation and calcification of the calcaneus." [HPO:probinson]
"Delayed maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Delayed talus ossification
children.defn: "Delayed maturation and calcification of the talus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tarsal stippling
children.defn: "The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more tarsal bones." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Irregular tarsal ossification
children.defn: "Defective ossification in an irregular pattern of the seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the skeleton of foot." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Absent foot
is_a_string: HP:0006494 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the feet

children.name: Absent metatarsal bone
Absent first metatarsal

children.name: Absent fifth metatarsal
children.defn: "A developmental abnormality characterized by the absence of the fifth metatarsal bone." [HPO:probinson]
"A developmental abnormality characterized by the absence (aplasia) of a metatarsal bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Short metatarsal
is_a_string: HP:0040066 ! Abnormal morphology of bones of the lower limbs

children.name: Short first metatarsal
is_a_string: HP:0010054 ! Abnormality of the first metatarsal bone
children.defn: "Short first metatarsal bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Short fifth metatarsal
is_a_string: HP:0008089 ! Abnormality of the fifth metatarsal bone

children.name: Short second metatarsal
is_a_string: HP:0040034 ! Abnormality of the second metatarsal bone
children.defn: "Short (hypoplastic) second metatarsal bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Short third metatarsal
is_a_string: HP:0010672 ! Abnormality of the third metatarsal bone
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the Third metatarsal bone leading to a short (hypoplastic) third metatarsal bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Short fourth metatarsal
is_a_string: HP:0040035 ! Abnormality of the fourth metatarsal bone
children.defn: "Short fourth metatarsal bone." [HPO:probinson]
"Diminished length of a metatarsal bone, with resultant proximal displacement of the associated toe." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125433]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the metatarsal bones." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Partial absence of foot
is_a_string: HP:0006494 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the feet
children.defn: "An incomplete absence of the foot, with no bony elements distal to the tarsals, but with preservation of some or all of the tarsals." [eom:6a2c173d3d7e3219, pmid:19125433]

children.name: Lower limb peromelia
is_a_string: HP:0006494 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the feet
children.defn: "Peromelia affecting only the lower limbs.  That is, the distal parts of the leg are missing leading to stump formation." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Aplasia of the tarsal bones

children.defn: "Absence of the tarsal bones." [HPO:curators]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the tarsal bones." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Short foot
is_a_string: HP:0006494 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the feet
children.defn: "A measured foot length that is more than 2 SD below the mean for a newborn of 27 - 41 weeks gestation, or foot that is less than the 3rd centile for individuals from birth to 16 years of age (objective). Alternatively, a foot that appears disproportionately short (subjective)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125433]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of toe
is_a_string: HP:0006494 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the feet

children.name: Small toe
children.defn: "Significant reduction in both length and girth of the toe compared to the contralateral toe, or alternatively, compared to a typical toe size for an age-matched individual." [eom:4d06c726e63758c5, pmid:19125433]

children.name: Absent toe
Partial absence of toe
children.defn: "The absence of a phalangeal segment of a toe or hallux." [pmid:19125433]

children.name: Foot asymmetry
children.defn: "A difference in size or shape between the left and right foot." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Osteomyelitis or necrosis, distal, due to sensory neuropathy (feet)
Abnormality of dorsoventral patterning of the limbs
children.defn: "An abnormality resulting from a defect or disruption of dorsoventral patterning that normally happens during early development of the limbs. A disruption of the normal development of the dorsoventral axis may lead to a variable spectrum of different phenotypic abnormalities that may affect the nails and or palmar and dorsal side of the hands and/or feet, ultimately changing the normal dorsoventral appearance of the affected limbs." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Structural foot deformity
children.defn: "A foot deformity resulting due to an abnormality affecting the bones of the foot (as well as muscle and soft tissue). In contrast if only the muscle and soft tissue are affected the term positional foot deformity applies." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Narrow foot
children.defn: "A foot for which the measured width is below the 5th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately narrow for its length." [pmid:19125433]

children.name: Positional foot deformity
Talipes
Talipes equinovarus
Bilateral talipes equinovarus
children.defn: "Bilateral clubfoot deformity (see HP:0001762)." [HPO:probinson]

"Talipes equinovarus (also called clubfoot) typically has four main components: inversion and adduction of the forefoot; inversion of the heel and hindfoot; equinus (limitation of extension) of the ankle and subtalar joint; and internal rotation of the leg." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Talipes calcaneovarus
children.defn: "A congenital deformity characterized by a dorsiflexed, inverted, and adducted foot, i.e., a combination of talipes calcaneus and talipes varus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Talipes calcaneovalgus
children.defn: "Talipes calcaneovalgus is a flexible foot deformity (as opposed to a rigid congenital vertical talus foot deformity) that can either present as a positional or structural foot deformity depending on severity and/or causality. The axis of calcaneovalgus deformity is in the tibiotalar joint, where the foot is positioned in extreme hyperextension. On inspection, the foot has an \"up and out\" appearance, with the dorsal forefoot practically touching the anterior aspect of the ankle and lower leg." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Talipes equinovalgus
children.defn: "A deformity of foot and ankle in which the foot is bent down and outwards." [HPO:probinson]
"A deformity of foot and ankle that has different subtypes that are talipes equinovarus, talipes equinovalgus, talipes calcaneovarus and talipes calcaneovalgus." [HPO:sdoelken]
"A foot deformity resulting due to an abnormality affecting the muscle and soft tissue. In contrast if the bones of the foot are affected the term structural foot deformity applies." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Duplication involving bones of the feet
is_a_string: HP:0040069 ! Abnormality of lower limb bone

children.name: Foot polydactyly
is_a_string: HP:0009136 ! Duplication involving bones of the feet

children.name: Preaxial foot polydactyly
Polysyndactyly of hallux
children.defn: "Combined syndactyly and polydactyly of the great toe." [HPO:probinson]
"Duplication of all or part of the first ray." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125433]

children.name: Ectopic accesory toe-like appendage
children.defn: "In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the fibular side of the foot, next top the little toe), preaxial (on the tibial side of the foot, next to the big toe) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between big and little toe), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes refered to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200)." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Postaxial foot polydactyly
Postaxial polysyndactyly of foot
children.defn: "Combined syndactyly and polydactyly of the foot on the lateral side (i.e., on the side of the little toe)." [HPO:probinson]

"Polydactyly of the foot most commonly refers to the presence of six toes on one foot. Postaxial polydactyly affects the lateral ray and the duplication may range from a well-formed articulated digit to a rudimentary digit." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Mesoaxial foot polydactyly
children.defn: "The presence of a supernumerary toe (not a hallux) involving the third or fourth metatarsal with associated osseous syndactyly." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Mirror image foot polydactyly
children.defn: "Mirror image duplication of digits affecting the feet." [HPO:sdoelken]
"A kind of polydactyly characterized by the presence of a supernumerary toe or toes." [HPO:probinson]

children.defn: "A two-part calcaneus, a finding that probably results from delayed coalescence of two primary calcaneal centers of ossification." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Calcaneovalgus deformity
children.defn: "This is a postural deformity in which the foot is positioned up against the tibia. The heel (calcaneus) is positioned downward (that is, the ankle is flexed upward), and the heel is turned outward (valgus)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Equinus calcaneus
children.defn: "Abnormal plantar flexion of the calcaneus relative to the longitudinal axis of the tibia. This results in the angle between the long axis of the tibia and the long axis of the heel bone (calcaneus) being greater than 90 degrees." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Prominent calcaneus
children.defn: "Protruding heel bone, or calcaneus." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]
"An abnormality of the calcaneus, also known as the heel bone, one of the or heel bone, one of the components of the tarsus of the foot which make up the heel." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Osteoporotic tarsals

children.defn: "Reduction in bone mineral density affecting any or all of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones." [HPO:probinson]

"This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density of the tarsal bones, which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of toe
Tapered toe
children.defn: "The gradual reduction in girth of the digit from proximal to distal." [pmid:19125433]

children.name: Slender toe
children.defn: "Digits are disproportionately narrow (reduced girth) for the hand/foot size or build of the individual." [pmid:19125433]

children.name: Splayed toes
children.defn: "Divergence of digits along the anteroposterior axis (in the plane of the sole)." [pmid:19125433]

children.name: Hammertoe
children.defn: "Hyperextension of the metatarsal-phalangeal joint with hyperflexion of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint." [pmid:19125433]

children.name: Overlapping toe
children.defn: "Describes a foot digit resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the foot is at rest." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19125433]

children.name: Abnormality of the hallux

children.name: Hallux valgus

children.name: Hallux varus
children.defn: "Medial deviation of the great toe owing to a deformity of the great toe joint causing the hallux to deviate medially." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Wide capital femoral epiphyses
is_a_string: HP:0010574 ! Abnormality of the epiphysis of the femoral head
children.defn: "Abnormally wide morphology of the proximal epiphysis of the femur." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Avascular necrosis of the capital femoral epiphysis
is_a_string: HP:0010574 ! Abnormality of the epiphysis of the femoral head
children.defn: "Avascular necrosis of the proximal epiphysis of the femur occurring in growing children and caused by an interruption of the blood supply to the head of the femur close to the hip joint. The necrosis is characteristically associated with flattening of the femoral head, for which reason the term coxa plana has been used to refer to this feature in the medical literature." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Proximal femoral epiphysiolysis
is_a_string: HP:0010574 ! Abnormality of the epiphysis of the femoral head
children.defn: "Slipped capital femoral epiphysis is defined as a posterior and inferior slippage of the proximal epiphysis of the femur onto the metaphysis (femoral neck), occurring through the physeal plate during the early adolescent growth spurt." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Enlargement of the proximal femoral epiphysis
is_a_string: HP:0010574 ! Abnormality of the epiphysis of the femoral head
children.defn: "An abnormal enlargement of the proximal epiphysis of the femur." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Flat capital femoral epiphysis
is_a_string: HP:0010574 ! Abnormality of the epiphysis of the femoral head
children.defn: "An abnormal flattening of the proximal epiphysis of the femur." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cone-shaped capital femoral epiphysis
is_a_string: HP:0010574 ! Abnormality of the epiphysis of the femoral head
children.defn: "A cone-shaped deformity of the proximal epiphysis of the femur." [HPO:probinson]
"Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the femur." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Dumbbell-shaped femur
children.defn: "The femur is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses." [HPO:probinson]

is_a_string: HP:0003367 ! Abnormality of the femoral neck
children.defn: "Coxa vara includes all forms of decrease of the femoral neck shaft angle (the angle between the neck and the shaft of the femur) to less than 120 degrees." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Excessive femoral anteversion
children.defn: "An increased degree of  femoral version, which is defined as the angular difference between axis of femoral neck and transcondylar axis of the knee. Thus, femoral anteversion is an inward twisting of the femur that causes the knees and feet to turn inward." [HPO:probinson, ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]

children.name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
is_a_string: HP:0010245 ! Abnormality of the epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
children.defn: "In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits). The epiphysis of the first metacarpal is localized at the proximal end (as seen in the proximal phalanges of the other digits), whereas the epiphyses of the other metacarpal bones are located at the distal end. This term applies if the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is in any way abnormal, referring to age and gender depending norms, as seen on x-rays." [HPO:curators]

children.defn: "Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand. Note that this includes the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits)." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Pseudoepiphyses of hand bones
is_a_string: HP:0005924 ! Abnormality of the epiphyses of the hand

children.name: Pseudoepiphyses of the metacarpals
children.defn: "A pseudoepiphysis is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis. The normal metacarpal epiphyses are located at the distal ends of the metacarpal bones. Accessory epiphyses (which are also known as pseudoepiphyses) can also occasionally be observed at the proximal ends of the metacarpals, usually involving the 2nd metacarpal bone." [HPO:doelkens]

children.name: Abnormality of metacarpal epiphyses

HP:0005924 ! Abnormality of the epiphyses of the hand

children.name: Triangular epiphyses of the metacarpals
children.defn: "A triangular appearance of the epiphyses of the metacarpals. Thess epiphyses are located at the distal end of the metacarpals." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Enlarged metacarpal epiphyses
children.defn: "Abnormally large size of the metaphyseal epiphyses." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Broad metacarpal epiphyses
children.defn: "Increased side-to-side width of the metacarpal epiphyses." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ivory epiphyses of the metacarpals
children.defn: "Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the metacarpals, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Irregular epiphyses of the metacarpals
is_a_string: HP:0003842 ! Irregular epiphyses of the upper limbs
children.defn: "Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphyses of the metacarpals." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Epiphyseal stippling of the metacarpals
children.defn: "The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the metacarpals." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Small epiphyses of the metacarpals
children.defn: "Abnormally small size of the epiphyses located at the distal end of the metacarpals in respect to age-dependent norms." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Absent metacarpal epiphyses
children.defn: "Absence of the epiphyses of the metacarpal bones, which are normally located at the distal ends of the metacarpals." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Cone-shaped metacarpal epiphyses
children.defn: "A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the metacarpal bones, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphyses are located at the distal ends of the metacarpal bones." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Fragmentation of the metacarpal epiphyses

children.defn: "Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses of the metacarpals." [HPO:curators]

"A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also refered to as Hyperphalangism." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Bifid proximal phalanx of the thumb
is_a_string: HP:0009613 ! Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
HP:0009944 ! Partial duplication of thumb phalanx
HP:0010005 ! Partial duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand
children.defn: "This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is partially duplicated. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits." [HPO:probinson]

HP:0010004 ! Partial duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand

"A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the thumb. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Complete duplication of proximal phalanx of the thumb
is_a_string: HP:0009613 ! Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
HP:0009943 ! Complete duplication of thumb phalanx
HP:0010002 ! Complete duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand
children.defn: "Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. On x-ray two separate bones appear side to side. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits." [HPO:probinson]

"A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the thumb. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also refered to as Hyperphalangism." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb
