is_a_string: HP:0001197 ! Abnormality of prenatal development or birth

children.name: Toxemia of pregnancy
Eclampsia
children.defn: "An acute and life-threatening complication of pregnancy, which is characterized by the appearance of tonic-clonic seizures, usually in a patient who had developed pre-eclampsia. Eclampsia includes seizures and coma that happen during pregnancy but are not due to preexisting or organic brain disorders." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Maternal hypertension
children.defn: "Increased blood pressure during a pregnancy." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Preeclampsia
children.defn: "Pregnancy-induced hypertension in association with significant amounts of protein in the urine." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Pregnancy-induced toxic reactions of the mother that can be as harmless as slight Maternal hypertension or as life threatening as Ecplamsia." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Maternal teratogenic exposure
children.defn: "A medical history of exposure of the mother of a child or fetus to a teratogenic substance during pregnancy." [DDD:hfirth]

children.name: Hyperemesis gravidarum
children.defn: "Excessive vomiting in early pregnancy, leading to the loss of 5% or more of body weight." [HPO:probinson, OMIM:603373]

children.name: Maternal virilization in pregnancy
children.defn: "Virilization (deepening of  voice, facial hirsutism and scalp hair loss) with onset during pregnancy (usually towards the end of the first trimester) and regression several months post-partum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Maternal autoimmune disease
Maternal anticardiolipin antibody positive
children.defn: "The presence of circulating autoantibodies to anticardiolipin in the mother." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432, pmid:1495720, pmid:9722063]
"A medical history of a fetus or child born to a mother with an autoimmune disease." [DDD:hfirth]

children.name: Abnormal maternal serum screening
Low maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein
children.defn: "An abnormally low concentration of serum alpha-fetoprotein as compared to normal values for gestational-age." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Low maternal serum estriol
children.defn: "An abnormally high concentration of serum conjugated estriol as compared to normal values for gestational-age." [pmid:19038077]

children.name: High maternal serum chorionic gonadotropin
children.defn: "An abnormally high concentration of maternal serum human chorionic gonadotropin as compared to normal values for gestational-age." [DDD:hfirth, pmid:2447576]

children.name: High maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein
children.defn: "An abnormally high concentration of serum alpha-fetoprotein as compared to normal values for gestational-age." [DDD:hfirth]

children.name: Low maternal serum PAPP-A
children.defn: "An abnormally low concentration of serum PAPP-A (pregnancy associated plasma protein A), as compared to normal values for gestational-age." [DDD:hfirth, pmid:19038077]

children.name: Low maternal serum chorionic gonadotropin
children.defn: "An abnormally low concentration of maternal serum human chorionic gonadotropin as compared to normal values for gestational-age." [DDD:hfirth, pmid:2447576]
"An abnormally elevated or decreased level of a maternal serum marker analytes used in screening for aneuploidy." [DDD:hfirth, pmid:19038077]

children.name: Skewed maternal X inactivation
children.defn: "A deviation from equal (50%) inactivation of each parental X chromosome in maternal cells." [HPO:probinson, pmid:18097476]

children.name: Abnormal delivery
is_a_string: HP:0001197 ! Abnormality of prenatal development or birth

children.name: Breech presentation
Incomplete breech presentation
children.defn: "A kind of breech presentation in which one or both hips are extended and one or both of the fetus' feet are pointing down and entering the birth canal." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Complete breech presentation
children.defn: "A kind of breech presentation in which the hips are flexed and the knees are flexed." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Frank breech presentation
children.defn: "A kind of breech presentation in which the hips are flexed and the knees are extended." [HPO:curators]
"A position of the fetus at delivery in which the fetus enters the birth canal with the buttocks or feet first." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Spontaneous abortion
Recurrent spontaneous abortion
children.defn: "Repeated episodes of abortion (Expulsion of the product of fertilization before completing the term of gestation) without deliberate interference." [HPO:probinson]
"A pregnancy that ends at a stage in which the fetus is incapable of surviving on its own, defined as the spontaneous loss of a fetus before the 20th week of pregnancy." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Premature rupture of membranes
premature birth following premature rupture of fetal membranes

children.defn: "Premature rupture of membranes (PROM) is a condition which occurs in pregnancy when the amniotic sac ruptures more than an hour before the onset of labor." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Nuchal cord
children.defn: "A complication of pregnancy and delivery in which the umbilical cord wraps around the fetal neck once or multiple times." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cephalohematoma
children.defn: "Hemorrhage between the skull and periosteum of a newborn resulting from rupture of blood vessels that cross the periosteum." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]

children.name: Shoulder dystocia
children.defn: "Shoulder dystocia occurs when the fetal anterior shoulder impacts against the maternal symphysis following delivery of the vertex." [pmid:15086043]

children.name: Ventouse delivery
children.defn: "Delivery of newborn by means of a ventouse, a vacuum device used to assist the delivery of a baby when the second stage of labour has not progressed adequately." [DDD:hfirth]
"An abnormality of the birth process." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the fetus or the birth of the fetus, excluding structural abnormalities." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues
Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology
is_a_string: HP:0001871 ! Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues

children.name: Abnormality of cells of the granulocytic lineage
is_a_string: HP:0005561 ! Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology

children.name: Abnormal number of granulocyte precursors
is_a_string: HP:0012135 ! Abnormality of cells of the granulocytic lineage

children.name: Granulocytic hyperplasia
is_a_string: HP:0012137 ! Abnormal number of granulocyte precursors

children.name: Granulocytic hypoplasia
is_a_string: HP:0012137 ! Abnormal number of granulocyte precursors
children.defn: "Decreased number of granulocyte precursors in the bone marrow." [HPO:akelly]

children.name: Dysplastic granulopoesis
is_a_string: HP:0012135 ! Abnormality of cells of the granulocytic lineage

children.defn: "An anomaly of cells involved in  the formation of a granulocytes, that is, of the granulocytopoietic cell." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Abnormality of cells of the erythroid lineage
is_a_string: HP:0005561 ! Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology

children.name: Dysplastic erythropoesis
is_a_string: HP:0012130 ! Abnormality of cells of the erythroid lineage

children.name: Abnormal number of erythroid precursors
is_a_string: HP:0012130 ! Abnormality of cells of the erythroid lineage

children.name: Erythroid hypoplasia
is_a_string: HP:0012131 ! Abnormal number of erythroid precursors
children.defn: "Decreased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is,  erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Erythroid hyperplasia
is_a_string: HP:0012131 ! Abnormal number of erythroid precursors
children.defn: "Increased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is,  erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Pure red cell aplasia
is_a_string: HP:0012131 ! Abnormal number of erythroid precursors
children.defn: "A type of anemia resuting from suppression of erythropoiesis with little or no abnormality of leukocyte or platelet production. Erythroblasts are virtually absent in bone marrow; however, leukocyte and platelet production show little or no reduction." [HPO:probinson]
"A deviation from the normal count of erythroid precursor cells, that is,  erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Abnormality of erythrocytes
is_a_string: HP:0001871 ! Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues
HP:0012130 ! Abnormality of cells of the erythroid lineage

children.name: Abnormal hemoglobin
Reduced hemoglobin A
children.defn: "Hemoglobin A (HbA) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin beta chains. HbA is normally the main adult hemoglobin, representing about 96-98 percent of all hemoglobin. This term represents a decreased in the proportion of HbA below this limit, and can be seen in various forms of thalassemia." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Methemoglobinemia
children.defn: "Abnormally increased levels of Methemoglobinemia in the blood. In this form of hemoglobin, there is an oxidized ferric iron (Fe +3) rather than the reduced ferrous form (Fe 2+) that is normally found in hemoglobin. Methemoglobin has a reduced affinity for oxygen, resulting in a reduced ability to release oxygen to tissues." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hemoglobin H
children.defn: "Hemoglobin H (HbH) contains four beta-globin chains. It is normally not present at all in blood, but may make up about 1-40 percent of all hemoglobin in HbH disease, a subform of alpha thalassemia." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21345100]

children.name: Hemoglobin Barts
children.defn: "Normal adult hemoglobin is composed of two chains each of alpha and beta globin. Hb Barts (Hemoglobin Barts) is a tetramer with four gamma globin chains, and is essentially pathognomonic for one or another form of alpha thalassemia. Hb Barts has an extremely high affinity for oxygen, resulting in almost no oxygen delivery to the tissues." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Imbalanced hemoglobin synthesis
Reduced alpha/beta synthesis ratio
children.defn: "A reduction in the ratio of production of alpha globin to that of beta globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of alpha thalassemia." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced beta/alpha synthesis ratio
children.defn: "A reduction in the ratio of production of beta globin to that of alpha globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of beta thalassemia." [HPO:probinson, pmid:1060068]

"Normal hemoglobin synthesis is characterized by production of equal amounts of alpha and beta globins. This term refers to a deviation from this pattern and is the main characteristic of the various forms of thalassemia." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Persistence of hemoglobin F
children.defn: "Hemoglobin F (HbF) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin gamma chains. It is the main form of hemoglobin in the fetus during the last seven months of intrauterine  development and in the half year of postnatal life. In adults it normally makes up less than one percent of all hemoglobiin. This term refers to an increase in HbF above this limit. In beta thalassemia major, it may represent over 90 percent of all hemoglobin, and in beta thalassemia minor it may make up between 0.5 to 4 percent." [HPO:probinson]
"Anomaly in the level or the function of hemoglobin, the oxygen-carrying protein of erythrocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anisocytosis
children.defn: "Abnormally increased variability in the size of erythrocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Blood group antigen abnormality
Absence of Lutheran antigen on erythrocytes
children.defn: "Absence of the Lutheran antigen (a type I integral membrane glycoprotein) from the surface of red blood cells." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of an erythrocyte cell surface molecule." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Increased hemoglobin oxygen affinity
children.defn: "An abnormal increase in the binding affinity of hemoglobin for oxygen." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of reticulocytes
Reticulocytopenia
children.defn: "A reduced number of reticulocytes in the peripheral blood." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reticulocytosis
children.defn: "An elevation in the number of reticulocytes (immature erythrocytes) in the peripheral blood circulation." [HPO:probinson]
"A reticulocyte abnormality." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Poikilocytosis
Sickled erythrocytes
children.defn: "An irreversible distortion of the morphology of an erythrocyte such that the cells are elongated and curved, resembling the blade of a sickle (the hand-held agricultural tool traditionally used to harvest grains)." []

children.name: Schistocytosis
children.defn: "The presence of an abnormal number of fragmented red blood cells (schistocytes) in the blood." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pyropoikilocytosis
children.defn: "A form of severe hemolytic anemia characterized by erythrocyte morphology reminiscent of that seen in patients after a thermal burn." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16304353]

children.name: Red blood cell keratocytosis
children.defn: "A form of poikilocytosis in which the abnormally shaped erythrocytes have notches that results in projections that look like horns." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Spherocytosis
Microspherocytosis
children.defn: "The presence of erythrocytes that are sphere-shaped and reduced in size." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of erythrocytes that are sphere-shaped." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anisopoikilocytosis
children.defn: "A type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence in the blood of erythrocytes of varying sizes and abnormal shapes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Elliptocytosis
children.defn: "The presence of elliptical, cigar-shaped erythrocytes on peripheral blood smear." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16304353]

children.name: Stomatocytosis
children.defn: "The presence of erythrocytes with a mouth-shaped (stoma) area of central pallor on peripheral blood smear." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16304353]

children.name: Acanthocytosis
children.defn: "Acanthocytosis is a type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence of spikes on the cell surface. The cells have an irregular shaped resembling many-pointed stars." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of abnormally shaped erythrocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Erythrocyte macrocytosis
children.defn: "Larger than normal size of erythrocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anemia
Anemia due to reduced life span of red cells
Increased red cell sickling tendency
is_a_string: HP:0011895 ! Anemia due to reduced life span of red cells

children.name: Hemolytic anemia
is_a_string: HP:0011895 ! Anemia due to reduced life span of red cells

children.name: Chronic hemolytic anemia
children.defn: "An chronic form of hemolytic anemia." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Heinz body anemia
children.defn: "Anemia characterized by abnormal intracellular inclusions, composed of denatured hemoglobin, found on the membrane of red blood cells." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Drug-sensitive hemolytic anemia
children.defn: "A form of hemolytic anemia that is triggered by ingestion of certain drugs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Fava bean-induced hemolytic anemia
children.defn: "A kind of hemolytic anemia that is induced by the ingestion of fava beans." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Increased red cell hemolysis by shear stress
Coombs-positive hemolytic anemia
children.defn: "A type of hemolytic anemia in which the Coombs test is positive." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Episodic hemolytic anemia
children.defn: "A form of hemolytic anemia that occurs in repeated episodes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital hemolytic anemia
children.defn: "A form of hemolytic anemia with congenital onset." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Exercise-induced hemolysis
children.defn: "A form of hemolytic anemia that can be triggered by exertion." [HPO:probinson]
"A type of anemia caused by premature destruction of red blood cells (hemolysis)." [HPO:probinson]
"A type of anemia related to a reduction in the average life span of red blood cells in the peripheral circulation, which is normally around 120 days." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Anemia of inadequate production
Hypochromic anemia
Hypochromic microcytic anemia
children.defn: "A type of anemia characterized by an abnormally low concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes and lower than normal size of the erythrocytes." [HPO:probinson]
"A type of anemia characterized by an abnormally low concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Microcytic anemia
Normochromic microcytic anemia
children.defn: "A type of anemia characterized by an normal concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes and lower than normal size of the erythrocytes." [HPO:probinson]
"A kind of anemia in which the volume of the red blood cells is reduced." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Macrocytic anemia
Hyperchromic macrocytic anemia
children.defn: "A type of anemia cahracterized by abnormally large erythrocytes with abnormally high amounts of haemoglobin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Megaloblastic anemia
Folate-responsive megaloblastic anemia
children.defn: "A type of megaloblastic anemia (i.e., anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal) that improves upon the administration of folate." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thiamine-responsive megaloblastic anemia
children.defn: "A type of megaloblastic anemia (i.e., anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal) that improves upon the administration of thiamine." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Folate-unresponsive megaloblastic anemia
children.defn: "A type of megaloblastic anemia that does not improve upon administration of folate. Since vitamin B12 acts by promoting recycling of folate, administration of vitamin B12 also does not improve this type of anemia." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pyrimidine-responsive megaloblastic anemia
children.defn: "A type of megaloblastic anemia that improves upon administration of pyrimidine supplements such as uridylic acid and cytidylic acid." [HPO:probinson]
"Anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal (megaloblasts)." [HPO:probinson]
"A type of anemia characterized by increased size of erythrocytes with increased mean corpuscular volume (MCV) and increased mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19202968]

children.name: Normocytic anemia
children.defn: "A kind of anemia in which the volume of the red blood cells is normal." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypoplastic anemia
Congenital hypoplastic anemia
children.defn: "A type of hypoplastic anemia with congenital onset." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Normocytic hypoplastic anemia
children.defn: "A type of hypoplastic anemia in which the erythrocytes have a normal cell volume (the mean corpuscular volume is within normal limits)." [HPO:probinson]
"Anemia with varying degrees of erythrocytic hypoplasia without leukopenia or thrombocytopenia." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Sideroblastic anemia
Pyridoxine-responsive sideroblastic anemia
children.defn: "A type of sideroblastic anemia that is alleviated by pyridoxine (vitamin B-6) treatment." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Refractory sideroblastic anemia
children.defn: "A type of sideroblastic anemia that is not responsive to treatment." [HPO:probinson]

"Sideroblastic anemia results from a defect in the incorporation of iron into the heme molecule. A sideroblast is an erythroblast that has stainable deposits of iron in cytoplasm (this can be demonstrated by Prussian blue staining)." [HPO:probinson]
"A kind of anemia characterized by inadequate production of erythrocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Transient erythroblastopenia
children.defn: "A transient reduction in the number of erythroblasts in the circulation." [HPO:probinson]
"A reduction in erythrocytes volume or hemoglobin concentration." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Polycythemia
Increased red blood cell mass
children.defn: "The presence of an increased mass of red blood cells in the circulation." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Increased hematocrit
children.defn: "An increase in the volume of packed erythrocytes in a blood specimen." [HPO:probinson]
"Polycythemia is diagnosed if the red blood cell count, the hemoglobin level, and the red blood cell volume all exceed the upper limits of normal." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of erythrocytes (red-blood cells)." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly of erythroid lineage cells, that is, of the erythropoietic cells in the lineage leading to and including erythrocytes." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Abnormality of cells of the megakaryocyte lineage
is_a_string: HP:0005561 ! Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology

children.name: Megakaryocytopenia
is_a_string: HP:0012143 ! Abnormality of cells of the megakaryocyte lineage
children.defn: "A reduced count of megakaryocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Increased megakaryocyte count
is_a_string: HP:0012143 ! Abnormality of cells of the megakaryocyte lineage
children.defn: "Increased megakaryocyte number, i.e., of platelet precursor cells, present in the bone marrow." [HPO:probinson]
"Anomaly of megakaryocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of cells of the lymphoid lineage
is_a_string: HP:0005561 ! Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology
children.defn: "An anomaly of cells that originate from the lymphoid lineage restricted progenitor cell." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of cells of the monocyte/macrophage lineage
is_a_string: HP:0005561 ! Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology

children.name: Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow
is_a_string: HP:0005561 ! Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology

children.name: Megaloblastic bone marrow
is_a_string: HP:0012145 ! Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow
children.defn: "Abnormal increased number of megaloblasts in the bone marrow." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bone marrow hypocellularity
is_a_string: HP:0012145 ! Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow
children.defn: "A reduced number of hematopoietic cells present in the bone marrow." [DDD:wouwehand, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Myelofibrosis
is_a_string: HP:0012145 ! Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow
children.defn: "Replacement of bone marrow by fibrous tissue." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pancytopenia
is_a_string: HP:0012145 ! Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow

children.name: Aplastic anemia
children.defn: "Aplastic anemia is defined as pancytopenia with a hypocellular marrow." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21239768]
"An abnormal reduction in numbers of all blood cell types (red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of bone marrow stromal cells
is_a_string: HP:0005561 ! Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology

children.defn: "An anomaly of the form or number of cells in the bone marrow." [DDD:wouwehand, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Extramedullary hematopoiesis
is_a_string: HP:0001871 ! Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues
children.defn: "The process of hematopoiesis occurring outside of the bone marrow (in the liver, thymus, and spleen) in the postnatal organisms." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal thrombosis
is_a_string: HP:0001871 ! Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues

children.name: Venous thrombosis
Deep venous thrombosis
Recurrent deep vein thrombosis
children.defn: "Repeated episodes of the formation of a blot clot in a deep vein." [HPO:probinson]
"Formation of a blot clot in a deep vein. The clot often blocks blood flow, causing swelling and pain. The deep veins of the leg are most often affected." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thrombophlebitis
Superficial thrombophlebitis
children.defn: "Inflammation of a superficial vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Recurrent thrombophlebitis
children.defn: "Repeated episodes of inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein)." [HPO:probinson]
"Inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cerebral venous thrombosis
children.defn: "Formation of a blood clot (thrombus) inside a cerebral vein, causing the obstruction of blood flow." [HPO:probinson]
"Formation of a blood clot (thrombus) inside a vein, causing the obstruction of blood flow." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Disseminated intravascular coagulation
Chronic disseminated intravascular coagulation
children.defn: "A chronic form of disseminated intravascular coagulation in which a persistent weak or intermittent activating stimulus is present and destruction and production of coagulation factors and platelets are balanced." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Acute disseminated intravascular coagulation
children.defn: "An acute form of disseminated intravascular coagulation. Acute DIC can occur following sudden exposure of blood to procoagulants, with the compensatory hemostatic mechanisms becoming overwhelmed." [HPO:probinson]

"Disseminated intravascular coagulation is characterized by the widespread activation of coagulation, which results in the intravascular formation of fibrin and ultimately thrombotic occlusion of small and midsize vessels." [HPO:probinson, pmid:10451465, pmid:11816725]

children.name: Arterial thrombosis
children.defn: "The formation of a blood clot inside an artery." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thromboembolism
Recurrent thromboembolism
children.defn: "Repeated episodes of obstruction of blood flow due to an embolus, i.e., blood clot that has traveled from its point of origin within the blood stream." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thromboembolic stroke
children.defn: "A cerebrovascular accident (stroke) that occurs because of thromboembolism." [HPO:probinson]

"The formation of a blood clot inside a blood vessel that subsequently travels through the blood stream from the site where it formed to another location in the body, generally leading to vascular occlusion at the distant site." [HPO:probinson]
"Venous or arterial thrombosis (formation of blood clots) of spontaneous nature and which cannot be fully explained by acquired risk (e.g. atherosclerosis)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of thrombocytes
is_a_string: HP:0001871 ! Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues

children.name: Abnormal platelet function
Impaired platelet aggregation
Impaired thromboxane A2 agonist-induced platelet aggregation
children.defn: "Abnormal response to thromboxane as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of thromboxane A2 receptor agonists." [DDD:wouwehand]

children.name: Impaired epinephrine-induced platelet aggregation
children.defn: "Abnormal response to epinephrine as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of epinephrine." [DDD:wouwehand]

children.name: Impaired thrombin-induced platelet aggregation
children.defn: "Abnormal response to thrombin or thrombin mimetics as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of thrombin (or thrombin mimetics)." [DDD:wouwehand]

children.name: Impaired ristocetin-induced platelet aggregation
is_a_string: HP:0012146 ! Abnormality of von Willebrand factor
children.defn: "Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ristocetin." [DDD:wouwehand]

children.name: Impaired ADP-induced platelet aggregation
children.defn: "Abnormal platelet response to ADP as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ADP." [HPO:probinson, pmid:11413156]

children.name: Impaired collagen-induced platelet aggregation
children.defn: "Abnormal response to  collagen or collagen-mimetics as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition  collagen or collagen-mimetics." [DDD:kfreson]

children.name: Impaired arachidonic acid-induced platelet aggregation
children.defn: "Abnormal response to arachidonic acid as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of arachidonic acid." [DDD:wouwehand]

"An abnormality in the rate and degree to which platelets aggregate after the addition of an agonist that stimulates platelet clumping. Platelet aggregation is measured using aggregometer to measure the optical density of platelet-rich plasma, whereby platelet aggregation causes the plasma to become more transparent." [DDD:wouwehand]

children.name: Impaired platelet adhesion
children.defn: "An abnormality of adhesion of thrombocytes. Normally, platelets adhere to collagen in the vascular subendothelium within seconds of injury via a receptor made up of glycoprotein Ia and IIa and GPVI and to vWF via receptor GPIb/IX/V. The adherent platelets then release granules that lead to platelet activation and aggregation." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal platelet membrane protein expression
Decreased platelet glycoprotein Ib-IX-V
is_a_string: HP:0011878 ! Abnormal platelet membrane protein expression
children.defn: "Decreased cell membrane concentration of the glycoprotein complex Ib-IX-V." [DDD:wouwehand, pmid:10605725]

children.name: Decreased platelet P2Y12 receptor
is_a_string: HP:0011878 ! Abnormal platelet membrane protein expression
children.defn: "Decreased cell membrane concentration of P2Y12 receptor." [DDD:wouwehand, pmid:14755328]

children.name: Decreased platelet glycoprotein VI
is_a_string: HP:0011878 ! Abnormal platelet membrane protein expression
children.defn: "Decreased cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein  VI." [DDD:wouwehand]

children.name: Decreased platelet glycoprotein IIb-IIIa
is_a_string: HP:0011878 ! Abnormal platelet membrane protein expression
children.defn: "Decreased cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein  IIb-IIIa." [DDD:ouwehand]
"Presence of reduced amount of a membrane protein on the cell membrane of platelets. This feature is typically measured by flow cytometry." [DDD:wouwehand]
"Any anomaly in the function of thrombocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal platelet count
Thrombocytopenia
Amegakaryocytic thrombocytopenia
children.defn: "Thrombocytopenia related to lack of or severe reduction in the count of megakaryocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Intermittent thrombocytopenia
children.defn: "Reduced platelet count that occurs sporadically, i.e., it comes and goes." [HPO:probinson, pmid:8384898]

children.name: Heparin-induced thrombocytopenia
children.defn: "Low platelet count following administration of unfractionated or (less commonly) low-molecular weight heparin." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16928996]

children.name: Post-transfusion thrombocytopenia
children.defn: "Sudden onset of thrombocytopenia (reduced platelet count) within 5-10 days of the transfusion of blood products. The clinical presentation is post-transfusion purpura (PTP), wigth severe thrmbocytopenia, epistaxis, and hemorrhages." [DDD:kfreeson]

children.name: Neonatal alloimmune thrombocytopenia
children.defn: "Low platelet count associated with maternal platelet-specific alloantibodies." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital thrombocytopenia
children.defn: "Thrombocytopenia with congenital onset." [HPO:probinson]
"A reduction in the number of circulating thrombocytes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thrombocytosis
children.defn: "Increased numbers of platelets in the peripheral blood." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormal number of platelets per volume of blood. In a healthy adult, a normal platelet count is between 150,000 and 450,000 per microliter of blood." [DDD:kfreson]

children.name: Abnormal platelet volume
Increased mean platelet volume
Giant platelets
children.defn: "Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers. The term giant platelet is used when the platelet is larger than the size of the average red cell in the field. (Description adapted from College of American Pathologists, Hematology Manual, 1998)." [HPO:probinson]
"Average platelet volume above the upper limit of the normal reference interval." [DDD:wouwehand]

children.name: Decreased mean platelet volume
children.defn: "Average platelet volume below the lower limit of the normal reference interval." [DDD:wouwehand]

"Anomalous size of platelets. Most normal sized platelets are 1.5 to 3 micrometers in diameter. Large platelets are 4 to 7 micrometers. Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal platelet morphology
Abnormal surface-connected open canalicular system
children.defn: "An anomaly of the invaginations of the surface membrane that form the open canalicular system (OCS). The OCS serve as the pathway for transport of substances into the cells and as conduits for the discharge of alpha granule products secreted during the platelet release reaction." [HPO:probinson, pmid:1760557]

children.name: Abnormal platelet granules
Abnormal alpha granules
Abnormal number of alpha granules
Absence of alpha granules
is_a_string: HP:0012528 ! Abnormal number of alpha granules
children.defn: "A lack of platelet alpha granules." [HPO:probinson, pmid:3877532]
"A deviation from the normal count of alpha granules per thrombocyte." [DDD:wouwehand]

children.name: Abnormal alpha granule distribution
children.defn: "An anomalous location and arrangement of platelet alpha granules." [DDD:wouwehand]

children.name: Abnormal alpha granule content
children.defn: "A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain hemostatic proteins such as fibrinogen, von Willebrand factor, and growth factors such as platelet-derived growth factor." [HPO:probinson]

"Defective structure, size or content of alpha granules, platelet organelles that contain several growth factors destined for release during platelet activation at sites of vessel wall injury." [DDD:wouwehand, pmid:8467233]

children.name: Abnormal dense granules
Abnormal dense granule content
children.defn: "A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain adenosine triphosphate (ATP), adenosine diphosphate (ADP), serotonin, calcium, and pyrophosphate, which are secreted when platelets are activated." [DDD:wouwehand]

children.name: Abnormal number of dense granules
children.defn: "A deviation from the normal count of dense granules per thrombocyte." [DDD:wouwehand]

"Defective structure, size or content of dense granules, platelet organelles that  contain granules proaggregatory factors such as adenosine diphosphate (ADP), adenosine triphosphate (ATP), ionized calcium , histamine and serotonin." [DDD:wouwehand]
"An anomaly of alpha or dense granules or platelet lysosomes." [DDD:wouwehand, pmid:18041654]

children.name: Abnormal platelet shape
children.defn: "A deviation from the normal discoid platelet shape." [DD:WHO]

children.name: Abnormal dense tubular system
children.defn: "An anomaly of the intracellular membrane complexes known as the dense tubular system." [DDD:wouwehand, pmid:1322202]
"An anomaly in platelet form, ultrastructure, or intracellular organelles." [DDD:kfreson]

children.name: Prolonged bleeding time
children.defn: "Prolongation of the time taken for a standardized skin cut of fixed depth and length to stop bleeding." [DDD:mumford]
"An abnormality of platelets." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal bleeding
is_a_string: HP:0001871 ! Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues

children.name: Excessive bleeding after a venipuncture
children.defn: "An abnormal high amount of bleeding following the procedure of taking a blood sample." [HPO:cmiller]

children.name: Excessive bleeding from superficial cuts
children.defn: "An abnormally increased degree of bleeding following a superfical injury to the surface of the skin." [HPO:cmiller]

children.name: Bleeding with minor or no trauma
children.defn: "Significant bleeding or hemorrhage without significant precipitating factor." [DDD:kfreson]

children.name: Prolonged bleeding following procedure
Prolonged bleeding following circumcision
children.defn: "Bleeding that persists for a longer than usual time following circumcision." []

children.name: Post-partum hemorrhage
children.defn: "Significant maternal haemorrhage/blood loss following deilvery of a child." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Prolonged bleeding after surgery
children.defn: "Bleeding that persists longer than the normal time following a surgical procedure." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Prolonged bleeding after dental extraction
children.defn: "Prolonged bleeding post dental extraction sufficient to require medical intervention." [HPO:probinson, WWW:wouwehand]
"Prolonged or protracted bleeding following an invasive procedure or intervention." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Abnormal umbilical stump bleeding
children.defn: "Abnormal bleeding of the umbilical stump following separation of the cord at approximately 7-10 days after birth." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Bleeding requiring red cell transfusion
children.defn: "Bleeding sufficiently severe as to require red cell transfusion (WHO Grade 3 or 4)." [DDD:akelly]
"An abnormal susceptibility to bleeding, often referred to as a bleeding diathesis. A bleeding diathesis may be related to vascular, platelet and coagulation defects." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of coagulation
is_a_string: HP:0001871 ! Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues

children.name: Prolonged whole-blood clotting time
children.defn: "An abnormal prolongation (delay) in the time required by whole blood to produce a visible clot." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Prolonged partial thromboplastin time
children.defn: "Increased time to coagulation in the partial thromboplastin time (PTT) test, a measure of the intrinsic and common coagulation pathways. Phospholipid, and activator, and calcium are mixed into an anticoagulated plasma sample, and the time is measured until a thrombus forms." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypercoagulability
children.defn: "An abnormality of coagulation associated with an increased risk of thrombosis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the coagulation cascade
Abnormality of the extrinsic pathway
is_a_string: HP:0003256 ! Abnormality of the coagulation cascade

children.name: Reduced factor VII activity
is_a_string: HP:0010988 ! Abnormality of the extrinsic pathway
children.defn: "Reduced activity of coagulation factor VII. Factor VII is part of the extrinsic coagulation pathway, which is initiated at the site of injury in response to the release of tissue factor (fIII). Tissue factor and activated factor VII catalyze the activation of factor X." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the extrinsic pathway (also known as the tissue factor pathway) of the coagulation cascade." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the intrinsic pathway
is_a_string: HP:0003256 ! Abnormality of the coagulation cascade

children.name: Reduced factor IX activity
is_a_string: HP:0010989 ! Abnormality of the intrinsic pathway
children.defn: "Decreased activity of coagulation factor IX. Factor IX, which itself is activated by factor Xa or factor VIIa to form factor IXa, activates factor X into factor Xa." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced factor VIII activity
is_a_string: HP:0010989 ! Abnormality of the intrinsic pathway
children.defn: "Reduced activity of coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in  the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced factor XII activity
is_a_string: HP:0010989 ! Abnormality of the intrinsic pathway
children.defn: "Decreased activity of coagulation factor XII. Factor XII (fXII) is part of the intrinsic coagulation pathway and binds to exposed collagen at site of vessel wall injury, activated by high-MW kininogen and kallikrein, thereby initiating the coagulation cascade." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced factor XI activity
is_a_string: HP:0010989 ! Abnormality of the intrinsic pathway
children.defn: "Decreased activity of coagulation factor XI. Factor XI, also known as plasma thromboplastin antecedent, is a serine proteinase that activates factor IX." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the intrinsic pathway (also known as the contact activation pathway) of the coagulation cascade." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Resistance to activated protein C
is_a_string: HP:0003256 ! Abnormality of the coagulation cascade
children.defn: "Poor anticoagulant response to activated protein C. A plasma is termed 'APC resistant' when the addition of exogenous APC fails to prolong its clotting time in an activated partial thromboplastin time assay." [HPO:probinson, pmid:14976057]

children.name: Reduced protein S activity
is_a_string: HP:0003256 ! Abnormality of the coagulation cascade
children.defn: "An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein S. Protein S is a cofactor of protein C." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced protein C activity
is_a_string: HP:0003256 ! Abnormality of the coagulation cascade
children.defn: "An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein C. Protein C is activated to protein Ca by thrombin bound to thrombomodulin. Activated protein C degrades factors VIIIa and Va." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of von Willebrand factor
is_a_string: HP:0003256 ! Abnormality of the coagulation cascade

children.name: Enhanced ristocetin cofactor assay activity
is_a_string: HP:0012146 ! Abnormality of von Willebrand factor
children.defn: "Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by increased aggregation of platelets upon addition of low-dose ristocetin to platelet-rich plasma." [HPO:cmiller]

children.name: Abnormal von Willebrand Factor multimer distribution
is_a_string: HP:0012146 ! Abnormality of von Willebrand factor

children.name: Absence of intermediate von Willibrand factor multimers
is_a_string: HP:0030131 ! Abnormal von Willebrand Factor multimer distribution
children.defn: "Lack of intermediate von Willebrand Factor multimers on gel electrophoresis." [HPO:cmiller]

children.name: Total absence von Willebrand Factor multimers
is_a_string: HP:0030131 ! Abnormal von Willebrand Factor multimer distribution
children.defn: "Complete bsence of all von Willebrand factor multimers." [HPO:cmiller]

children.name: Abnormal presence of ultra-large von Willebrand Factor multimers
is_a_string: HP:0030131 ! Abnormal von Willebrand Factor multimer distribution
children.defn: "Detection of abnormal ultra-large von Willebrand factor multimers." [HPO:cmiller, pmid:11756169]

children.name: Absence of large von Willibrand factor multimers
is_a_string: HP:0030131 ! Abnormal von Willebrand Factor multimer distribution
children.defn: "Absence of large von Willebrand Factor multimers on gel electrophoresis." [HPO:cmiller]
"Deviation from the normal von Willebrand Factor multimer pattern." [HPO:cmiller]

children.name: Impaired von Willibrand factor collagen binding activity
is_a_string: HP:0012146 ! Abnormality of von Willebrand factor
children.defn: "Reduced ability of von Willibrand factor (vWF) to bind collagen. Abnormal response to collagen as manifested by reduced or lacking ability of plasma von WIllebrand Factor to bind collagen. An ELISA-based assay is typically used; the test is sensitive to loss of von Willebrand Factor high molecular weight multimers." [HPO:cmiller, pmid:18809794]

children.name: Reduced von Willebrand factor activity
is_a_string: HP:0012146 ! Abnormality of von Willebrand factor
children.defn: "Decreased activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19694940]

children.name: Impaired ristocetin cofactor assay activity
is_a_string: HP:0012146 ! Abnormality of von Willebrand factor
children.defn: "Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ristocetin to platelet-poor plasma." [HPO:cmiller]

children.name: Reduced quantity of Von Willebrand factor
is_a_string: HP:0012146 ! Abnormality of von Willebrand factor
children.defn: "Decreased quantity of von Willebrand factor." [DDD:akelly]
"Decreased quantity or activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Reduced antithrombin III activity
is_a_string: HP:0003256 ! Abnormality of the coagulation cascade
children.defn: "An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of antithrombin-III." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the common coagulation pathway
is_a_string: HP:0003256 ! Abnormality of the coagulation cascade

children.name: Abnormality of circulating fibrinogen
is_a_string: HP:0010990 ! Abnormality of the common coagulation pathway

children.name: Dysfibrinogenemia
children.defn: "Qualitatively abnormal fibrinogen." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Hyperfibrinogenemia
children.defn: "Increased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Hypofibrinogenemia
children.defn: "Decreased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the level of activity of circulating fibrinogen." [DDD:akelly]

children.name: Elevated factor V activity
is_a_string: HP:0010990 ! Abnormality of the common coagulation pathway
children.defn: "Increased activity of coagulation factor V, Factor V, which is activated to factor Va by means of minute amounts of thrombin (and inactivated by larger amounts of thrombin). Activated factor V (fVa)  is a cofactor in the formation of the prothrombinase complex." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced factor V activity
is_a_string: HP:0010990 ! Abnormality of the common coagulation pathway
children.defn: "Decreased activity of coagulation factor V, Factor V, which is activated to factor Va by means of minute amounts of thrombin (and inactivated by larger amounts of thrombin). Activated factor V (fVa)  is a cofactor in the formation of the prothrombinase complex." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced factor XIII activity
is_a_string: HP:0010990 ! Abnormality of the common coagulation pathway
children.defn: "Decreased activity of coagulation factor XIII (also known as fibrin stabilizing factor). Activated Factor XIII cross-links fibrin polymers solidifying the clot." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced factor X activity
is_a_string: HP:0010990 ! Abnormality of the common coagulation pathway

children.name: Factor X activation deficiency
children.defn: "Reduced ability to transform factor X into its activated form factor Xa." [HPO:probinson]

"Reduced activity of coagulation factor X. The extrinsic and intrinsic pathways converge at factor X (fX). The extrinsic pathway activates fX by means of d factor VII with its cofactor, tissue factor. The intrinsic pathway activates fX by means of the tenase complex (Ca2+ and factors VIIIa, IXa and X) on the surface of activated platelets. Factor Xa in turn activates prothrombin (factor II) to thrombin (factor IIa)." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of blood coagulation, common pathway." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of prothrombin
is_a_string: HP:0003256 ! Abnormality of the coagulation cascade

children.name: Reduced prothrombin activity
children.defn: "Decreased activity of coagulation factor II, which is also known as prothrombin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Prolonged prothrombin time
children.defn: "Increased time to coagulation in the prothrombin time test, which is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced prothrombin consumption
children.defn: "The prothrombin consumption test measures the formation of intrinsic thromboplastin by determining the residual serum prothrombin after blood clotting is complete. If there is a defect in the process, less prothrombin will be converted to thrombin than normal (less prothrombin is consumed). This test may be abnormal with conditions including deficiency of factors VIII or IX, with circulating anticoagulants, thrombocytopenia." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly of clotting factor II, which is known as prothrombin, a vitamin K-dependent proenzyme that functions in the blood coagulation cascade." [HPO:probinson]

"An abnormality of the coagulation cascade, which is comprised of the contact activation pathway (also known as the intrinsic pathway) and the tissue factor pathway (also known as the extrinsic pathway) as well as cofactors and regulators." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the process of blood coagulation. That is, altered ability or inability of the blood to clot." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the hematopoietic system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the nervous system
Abnormality of nervous system morphology
is_a_string: HP:0000707 ! Abnormality of the nervous system

children.name: Morphological abnormality of the central nervous system
is_a_string: HP:0012639 ! Abnormality of nervous system morphology

children.name: Abnormal CNS myelination
is_a_string: HP:0002011 ! Morphological abnormality of the central nervous system

children.name: Delayed CNS myelination
children.defn: "Delayed myelination in the central nervous system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Leukodystrophy
children.defn: "Leukodystrophy refers to deterioration of white matter of the brain resulting from degeneration of myelin sheaths in the CNS. Their basic defect is directly related to the synthesis and maintenance of myelin membranes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: CNS hypomyelination
Cerebral hypomyelination
children.defn: "Reduced amount of myelin in the nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis in the white matter of the central nervous system." [HPO:probinson]
"Reduced amount of myelin in the central nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: CNS demyelination
Severe demyelination of the white matter
children.defn: "A severe loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Spinal cord posterior columns myelin loss
is_a_string: HP:0002143 ! Abnormality of the spinal cord

children.name: Patchy demyelination of subcortical white matter
children.defn: "Patchy loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Diffuse demyelination of the cerebral white matter
children.defn: "A diffuse loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system." [HPO:probinson]
"A loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cerebral dysmyelination
children.defn: "Defective structure and function of myelin sheaths of the white matter of the brain." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: CNS hypermyelination
children.defn: "Increased amount of myelin in the central nervous system." [UToronto:htrang]
"An abnormality of myelination of nerves in the central nervous system." [DDD:fmuntoni]

children.name: Abnormality of the spinal cord
is_a_string: HP:0002011 ! Morphological abnormality of the central nervous system

children.name: Tethered cord
is_a_string: HP:0002143 ! Abnormality of the spinal cord
children.defn: "During normal embryological development, the spinal cord first occupies the entire length of the vertebral column but goes on to assume a position at the level of L1 due to differential growth of the conus medullaris and the vertebral column. The filum terminale is a slender, threadlike structure that remains after the normal regression of the distal embryonic spinal cord and attaches the spinal cord to the coccyx. A tethered cord results if there is a thickened rope-like filum terminale which anchors the cord at the level of L2 or below, potentially causing neurologic signs owing to abnormal tension on the spinal cord." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Spinal cord lesions
is_a_string: HP:0002143 ! Abnormality of the spinal cord

children.name: Triplomyelia
children.defn: "Triplication of the spinal cord - extremely rare." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Hydromyelia
children.defn: "Dilation of central canal from incomplete fusion of the posterior columns or persistence of the primitive large canal of the embryo." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Amyelia
children.defn: "Congenital absence of the spinal cord." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Diplomyelia
children.defn: "Duplication of the spinal cord." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Diastomatomyelia
children.defn: "Coexistence of two hemicords, at variable levels, causing splaying of the posterior vertebral elements. Results in neurological deficits in lower limb or perineum." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Syringomyelia
children.defn: "Dilated, glial-lined cavity in spinal cord. This cavity does not communicate with the central canal, and usually is between the dorsal columns unilaterally or bilaterally along the side of the cord." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts
is_a_string: HP:0002143 ! Abnormality of the spinal cord

children.name: Spinocerebellar tract degeneration
is_a_string: HP:0003133 ! Abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts

children.name: Spinocerebellar tract disease in lower limbs

children.defn: "An abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts, a set of axonal fibers originating in the spinal cord and terminating in the ipsilateral cerebellum. The spinocerebellar tract convey information to the cerebellum about limb and joint position (proprioception). They comprise the ventral spinocerebellar tract (FMA:72642), the anterior spinocerebellar tract (FMA:72642), and the posterior spinocerebellar tract (FMA:72641)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Myelitis
is_a_string: HP:0002143 ! Abnormality of the spinal cord
children.defn: "Inflammation of the spinal cord." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the dorsal column of the spinal cord
is_a_string: HP:0002143 ! Abnormality of the spinal cord

children.name: Dorsal column degeneration
is_a_string: HP:0011397 ! Abnormality of the dorsal column of the spinal cord

children.name: Pallor of dorsal columns of the spinal cord
is_a_string: HP:0011397 ! Abnormality of the dorsal column of the spinal cord

children.defn: "An abnormality of the dorsal columns, i.e., of the dorsal portion of the gray substance of the spinal cord. The dorsal column consists of the fasciculus gracilis and fasciculus cuneatus and itself is part of the dorsal funiculus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Spinal cord compression
is_a_string: HP:0002143 ! Abnormality of the spinal cord

children.name: Cervical cord compression
children.defn: "Compression of the spinal cord in the cervical region, generally manifested by paresthesias and numbness, weakness, difficulty walking, abnormalities of coordination, and neck pain or stiffness." [HPO:probinson]
"External mechanical compression of the spinal cord." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Myelopathy
is_a_string: HP:0002143 ! Abnormality of the spinal cord

children.name: Long-tract signs
is_a_string: HP:0002143 ! Abnormality of the spinal cord

children.name: Abnormality of the spinal meninges
is_a_string: HP:0002143 ! Abnormality of the spinal cord

children.name: Dural ectasia
is_a_string: HP:0010303 ! Abnormality of the spinal meninges
children.defn: "A widening or ballooning of the dural sac surrounding the spinal cord usually at the lumbosacral level." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Spinal meningeal diverticulum
is_a_string: HP:0010303 ! Abnormality of the spinal meninges
children.defn: "An outpouching of the spinal meninges." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormality of the spinal dura mater
is_a_string: HP:0010303 ! Abnormality of the spinal meninges
HP:0010652 ! Abnormality of the dura mater
children.defn: "An abnormality of the spinal dura mater, which is the outermost of the three layers of the meninges surrounding the spinal cord." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Spinalarachnoid cyst
is_a_string: HP:0010303 ! Abnormality of the spinal meninges
children.defn: "Presence of arachnoid cysts of the spinal canal extradurally in the epidural space." [HPO:probinson]
"Any abnormality of the spinal meninges, the system of membranes (dura mater, the arachnoid mater, and the pia mater) which envelops the spinal cord." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Spinal dysraphism
is_a_string: HP:0000925 ! Abnormality of the vertebral column
HP:0002143 ! Abnormality of the spinal cord
HP:0045005 ! Abnormality of neural tube closure

children.name: Spina bifida
Spina bifida occulta
spina bifida occulta at S1
children.defn: "The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of S1 with intact overlying skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Spina bifida occulta at L5
children.defn: "The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of the vertebra L5 with intact overlying skin." [HPO:probinson]
"The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of a vertebral body with intact overlying skin." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Meningocele
Myelomeningocele
children.defn: "Protrusion of the meninges and portions of the spinal cord through a defect of the vertebral column." [HPO:probinson]
"Protrusion of the meninges through a defect of the vertebral column." [HPO:sdoelken]

"Incomplete closure of the embryonic neural tube, whereby some vertebral arches remain unfused and open. The mildest form is spina bifida occulta, followed by meningocele and meningomyelocele." [HPO:curators]
"A heterogeneous group of congenital spinal anomalies that result from defective closure of the neural tube early in fetal life." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Atrophy/Degeneration involving the spinal cord
is_a_string: HP:0002143 ! Abnormality of the spinal cord
HP:0007367 ! Atrophy/Degeneration affecting the central nervous system

children.name: Atrophy of the spinal cord
is_a_string: HP:0007344 ! Atrophy/Degeneration involving the spinal cord

children.name: Cervical spinal cord atrophy
is_a_string: HP:0006827 ! Atrophy of the spinal cord
children.defn: "Atrophy of the cervical segment of the spinal cord." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the spinal cord (myelon)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of neuronal migration
is_a_string: HP:0002011 ! Morphological abnormality of the central nervous system

children.name: Abnormal cortical gyration
is_a_string: HP:0002538 ! Abnormality of the cerebral cortex

children.name: Cortical gyral simplification
children.defn: "An abnormal reduction of the number and complexity of the pattern of gyrations of the cerebral cortex." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Lissencephaly
Type II lissencephaly
children.defn: "A form of lissencephaly characterized by an uneven cortical surface with a so called 'cobblestone' appearace. There are no distinguishable cortical layers." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Focal lissencephaly
children.defn: "A congenital absence of the convolutions of the cerebral cortex and a poorly formed sylvian fissure that affects a particular part of the cortex." [KI:phemming]

children.name: Type I lissencephaly
children.defn: "A form of lissencephaly in which the cortex is thickened and has four more or less disorganized layers rather than six normal layers resulting from incomplete neuronal migration during brain development." [HPO:probinson]
"A congenital absence of the convolutions of the cerebral cortex and a poorly formed sylvian fissure." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Macrogyria
children.defn: "Increased size of cerebral gyri, often associated with a moderate reduction in the number of sulci of the cerebrum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pachygyria
children.defn: "A congenital abnormality of the cerebral hemisphere chacterized by unusually thick gyrations (convolutions) of the cerebral cortex." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Polymicrogyria
Frontoparietal polymicrogyria
children.defn: "An excessive number of small gyri (convolutions) on the surface of the brain in the frontoparietal region." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Unilateral polymicrogyria
children.defn: "Excessive number of small gyri (convolutions) on the surface of one side of the brain." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Perisylvian polymicrogyria
children.defn: "An excessive number of small gyri (convolutions) on the surface of the brain in the region surrounding the sylvian fissures." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15159468]
"A congenital abnormality of the cerebral hemisphere characterized by an excessive number of small gyri (convolutions) on the surface of the brain." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the gyri (i.e., the ridges) of the cerebral cortex of the brain." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Gray matter heterotopias
Periventricular gray matter heterotopia
children.defn: "A form of gray matter heterotopia were the mislocalized gray matter is typically located periventricularly, also sometimes called subependymal heterotopia. Periventricular means beside the ventricles. This is by far the most common location for heterotopia. Subependymal heterotopia present in a wide array of variations. There can be a small single node or a large number of nodes, can exist on either or both sides of the brain at any point along the higher ventricle margins, can be small or large, single or multiple, and can form a small node or a large wavy or curved mass." [HPO:probinson]

"Gray matter heterotopia is a neurological disorder caused by clumps of grey matter being located in the wrong part of the brain. It is characterized as a type of cortical malformation. The neurons in heterotopia may appear to be normal, except for their mislocation; nuclear studies have shown glucose metabolism equal to that of normally positioned gray matter. The condition causes a variety of symptoms, but usually includes some degree of epilepsy or recurring seizures, and often affects the brain's ability to function on higher levels. Symptoms range from nonexistent to profound, in which case heterotopia can result in severe seizure disorder, loss of motor skills, and mental retardation." [DDD:ssisodiya, HPO:curators]
"An abnormality resulting from an anomaly of neuronal migration, i.e., of the process by which neurons travel from their origin to their final position in the brain." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the meninges
is_a_string: HP:0002011 ! Morphological abnormality of the central nervous system

children.name: Meningeal calcification
children.defn: "Calcium deposition affecting the Meninges." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormality of the arachnoid mater
Arachnoid cyst
is_a_string: HP:0100700 ! Abnormality of the arachnoid mater

children.name: Suprasellar arachnoid cyst
children.defn: "An arachnoid cyst that progressively enlarges from an abnormality in the membrane of Liliequist or in the interpeduncular cistern, and typically, expands from the prepontine space, displacing the floor of the third ventricle upwards, the pituitary stalk and optic chiasm upwards and forwards, and the mammillary bodies upwards and backwards." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21586175]

children.name: Intraventricular arachnoid cyst
children.defn: "An arachnoid cyst located within the ventricular system." [HPO:probinson, pmid:8951893]

children.name: Cerebellopontine angle arachnoid cyst
children.defn: "An arachnoid cyst located at the margin of the cerebellum and pons." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]
"An extra-parenchymal and intra-arachnoidal collection of fluid with a composition similar to that of cerebrospinal fluid." [HPO:sdoelken]
"An abnormality of the Arachnoid mater." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormality of the pia mater
children.defn: "An abnormality of the Pia mater." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormality of the dura mater
Abnormality of the falx cerebri
is_a_string: HP:0010652 ! Abnormality of the dura mater

children.name: Aplasia of the falx cerebri
is_a_string: HP:0010653 ! Abnormality of the falx cerebri
children.defn: "A developmental defect characterized by aplasia of the Falx cerebri." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Calcification of falx cerebri
is_a_string: HP:0010653 ! Abnormality of the falx cerebri
children.defn: "The presence of calcium deposition in the falx cerebri." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the Falx cerebri." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the Dura mater." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the Meninges, including any abnormality of the Dura mater, the Arachnoid mater, and the Pia mater." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid
is_a_string: HP:0002011 ! Morphological abnormality of the central nervous system

children.name: Hydrocephalus
is_a_string: HP:0002118 ! Abnormality of the cerebral ventricles
HP:0002921 ! Abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid

children.name: Communicating hydrocephalus
children.defn: "A form of hydrocephalus in which there is no visible obstruction to the flow of the cerebrospinal fluid between the ventricles and subarachnoid space." [eMedicine:1135286, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Noncommunicating hydrocephalus
children.defn: "A form of hydrocephalus in which the flow of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) within the cerebral ventricular system or in the outlets of the CSF to the arachnoid space is obstructed." [eMedicine:1135286, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Normal pressure hydrocephalus
children.defn: "A form of hydrocephalus characterized by enlarged cerebral ventricles and normal cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) pressure upon lumbar puncture." [eMedicine:1135286, HPO:probinson]

"Hydrocephalus is an active distension of the ventricular system of the brain resulting from inadequate passage of CSF from its point of production within the cerebral ventricles to its point of absorption into the systemic circulation." [HPO:probinson, pmid:18211712, pmid:19410151]

children.name: Extra-axial cerebrospinal fluid accumulation
is_a_string: HP:0002921 ! Abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid
children.defn: "An increased amount of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in the subarachnoid space." [HPO:probinson, pmid:22327705, pmid:23838695]

children.name: Increased CSF protein
is_a_string: HP:0002921 ! Abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid

children.name: Hypoglycorrhachia

children.name: CSF pleocytosis

"An increased lymphocyte count in the cerebrospinal fluid." [KI:phemming]

children.name: CSF polymorphonuclear pleocytosis

children.name: Increased CSF interferon alpha

children.defn: "Hemiballismus is a rare movement disorder that is caused primarily by damage to various areas in the basal ganglia. Hemiballismus is usually characterized by involuntary flinging motions of the extremities. The movements are often violent and have wide amplitudes of motion. They are continuous and random and can involve proximal and/or distal muscles on one side of the body, while some cases even include the facial muscles. The more a patient is active, the more the movements increase. With relaxation comes a decrease in movements." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.defn: "A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MIR) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem." [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: T2 hypointense brainstem
is_a_string: HP:0012747 ! Abnormal brainstem MRI signal intensity
children.defn: "A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MIR) of the brainstem. This term refers to a diffuse hypointensity affecting the entire brainstem." [UToronto:htrang]
"A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MIR) of the brainstem." [UToronto:htrang]

is_a_string: HP:0007367 ! Atrophy/Degeneration affecting the central nervous system

children.name: Abnormality of the pons
Hypoplasia of the ventral pons
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the ventral portion of the pons." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypoplasia of the pons
Olivopontocerebellar hypoplasia
children.defn: "Hypoplasia of the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus." [HPO:probinson]
"Underdevelopment of the pons." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the superior cerebellar peduncle
is_a_string: HP:0011931 ! Abnormality of the cerebellar peduncle

children.name: Thickened superior cerebellar peduncle
is_a_string: HP:0011932 ! Abnormality of the superior cerebellar peduncle

children.name: Elongated superior cerebellar peduncle
is_a_string: HP:0011932 ! Abnormality of the superior cerebellar peduncle
children.defn: "Increased length of the superior cerebellar peduncle." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly of the superior cerebellar peduncle." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the pons." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the brainstem
is_a_string: HP:0002977 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the central nervous system

children.name: Hypoplasia of the brainstem
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the brainstem." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the medulla oblongata
Olivary degeneration
is_a_string: HP:0011441 ! Abnormality of the medulla oblongata
children.defn: "Degeneration of the olivary bodies, prominent oval structures in the medulla oblongata." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the medulla oblongata, the lower half of the brainstem." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Enlarged brainstem
children.defn: "Abnormal increase in size of the brainstem." [UToronto:htrang]

children.name: Abnormality of the brainstem white matter
Abnormality of the cerebellar peduncle
is_a_string: HP:0012501 ! Abnormality of the brainstem white matter
children.defn: "An anomaly of the cerebellar peduncles. The superior, middle, and inferior cerebellar peduncles emerge from the cerebellum. The superior cerebellar penduncles connect the cerebellum to the midbrain, the middle cerebellar peduncles connect the cerebellum to the pons, and the inferior cerebellar peduncle connects the medulla spinalis and medulla oblongata with the cerebellum." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly of the white matter of brainstem." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Kinked brainstem
children.defn: "A kinked appearance of the brainstem, i.e., an exaggerated flexure." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16301726]

children.name: Brainstem dysplasia
children.defn: "A developmental structural anomaly of the stalk-like part of the brain that comprises the midbrain (aka mesencephalon), the pons (aka pons Varolii), and the medulla oblongata, and connects the cerebral hemispheres with the cervical spinal cord." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly of the brainstem." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Holoprosencephaly
Alobar holoprosencephaly
children.defn: "A type of holoprosencephaly characterized by the presence of a single ventricle and no separation of the cerebral hemisphere. The single midline ventricle is often greatly enlarged." [gc:hpe]

children.name: Lobar holoprosencephaly
children.defn: "A type of holoprosencephaly in which most of the right and left cerebral hemispheres and lateral ventricles are separated but the most rostral aspect of the telencephalon, the frontal lobes, are fused, especially ventrally." [gc:hpe]

children.name: Semilobar holoprosencephaly
children.defn: "A type of holoprosencephaly in which the left and right frontal and parietal lobes are fused and the interhemispheric fissure is only present posteriorly." [gc:hpe]
"Holoprosencephaly is a structural anomaly of the brain in which the developing forebrain fails to divide into two separate hemispheres and ventricles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Kernicterus
children.defn: "Damage to cerebral nuclei caused in infants by highly increased levels of unconjugated bilirubin. The basal ganglia and brainstem nuclei could be shown to have a yellow staining historically in infants who died of kernicterus, that is, kernicterus is strictly speaking a pathological diagnosis. The presence of kernicterus may be inferred in infants with characteristic acute or chronic bilirubin-induced neurological dysfunction." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of hindbrain morphology
Abnormality of the metencephalon
Poorly formed metencephalon
children.defn: "A morphological abnormality of the metencephalon." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the cerebellum
Dense calcifications in the cerebellar dentate nucleus
is_a_string: HP:0100321 ! Abnormality of the dentate nucleus

children.name: Arnold-Chiari malformation
Arnold-Chiari type I malformation
children.defn: "Arnold-Chiari type I malformation refers to a relatively mild degree of herniation of the posteroinferior region of the cerebellum (the cerebellar tonsils) into the cervical canal with little or no displacement of the fourth ventricle." [HPO:curators]

"Arnold-Chiari malformation consists of a downward displacement of the cerebellar tonsils and the medulla through the foramen magnum, sometimes causing hydrocephalus as a result of obstruction of CSF outflow." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormality of the cerebellar vermis
Disorganization of the anterior cerebellar vermis
is_a_string: HP:0002334 ! Abnormality of the cerebellar vermis

children.name: Loss of Purkinje cells in the cerebellar vermis
is_a_string: HP:0002334 ! Abnormality of the cerebellar vermis

children.name: Dysgenesis of the cerebellar vermis
is_a_string: HP:0002334 ! Abnormality of the cerebellar vermis
children.defn: "Defective development of the vermis of cerebellum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cerebellar vermis atrophy
is_a_string: HP:0002334 ! Abnormality of the cerebellar vermis
children.defn: "Wasting (atrophy) of the vermis of cerebellum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the  cerebellar vermis

children.name: Cerebellar vermis hypoplasia
is_a_string: HP:0006817 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the  cerebellar vermis

children.name: Inferior vermis hypoplasia
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the inferior portion of the vermis of cerebellum." [HPO:probinson, pmid:16580298]
"Underdevelopment of the vermis of cerebellum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Partial absence of cerebellar vermis
is_a_string: HP:0006817 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the  cerebellar vermis
children.defn: "Congenital absence of a part of the vermis of cerebellum." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Agenesis of cerebellar vermis
is_a_string: HP:0006817 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the  cerebellar vermis
children.defn: "Congenital absence of the vermis of cerebellum." [HPO:probinson]
