children.defn: "Reduced ability to use nonverbal behavior for communication, such as eye-to-eye gaze, facial expression, body posture, and gestures." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Impaired ability to form peer relationships

children.defn: "Difficulty in social interactions related to an impairment of characteristics such as eye contact, smiling, appropriate facial expressions, and body postures and characterized by difficulty in forming peer relationships and forming friendships." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Overfriendliness
children.defn: "A form of hypersociability that presents as mostly inappropriate people-orientation and friendliness towards others on an inadequate level which might go as far as being dangerous considering for example young children following strangers without restriction." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Shyness
children.defn: "Discomfort and partial inhibition of the usual forms of behavior when in the presence of others." [MeSH:D012792]
"An abnormality of  actions or reactions of a person taking place during interactions with others." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Stereotypic behavior
Stereotypical body rocking
children.defn: "Habitual repetitive movement of the body." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Stereotypical hand wringing
children.defn: "Habitual clasping and squeeezing of the hands." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Recurrent hand flapping
children.defn: "A type of stereotypic behavior in which the affected individual repeatedly waves the hands up and down." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Punding
children.defn: "Punding is a stereotypical motor behavior characterized by an intense fascination with repetitive, excessive and non-goal oriented handling, and examining of objects." [ICM:PCaroppo, pmid:15077237, pmid:25452726]

children.name: Eye poking
children.defn: "Repetitive pressing, poking, and/or rubbing in the eyes." [HPO:probinson, pmid:8881355]

"A repetitive behaviour that does not serve an observable goal. In general the movements are not aimed at the environment, but at the person itself. Stereotypical behaviour is seen especially in children with sensory, intellectual and/or cognitive handicaps." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Mania
children.defn: "A state of abnormally elevated or irritable mood, arousal, and or energy levels." [PMID:15104084]

children.name: Autistic behavior
Autism
children.defn: "Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by impaired social interaction and communication, and by restricted and repetitive behavior. Autism begins in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV)." [DDD:hvfirth]

children.name: Restrictive behavior
children.defn: "Behavior characterized by an abnormal limitation to few interests and activities." [HPO:probinson]

"A disorder beginning in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV)." [DSM-IV:299.00, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Obsessive-compulsive behavior
Obsessive-compulsive trait
children.defn: "The presence of one or more obsessive-compulsive personality traits. Obsessions refer to persistent intrusive thoughts, and compulsions to intrusive behaviors, which the affected person experiences as involuntary, senseless, or repugnant." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Collectionism
children.defn: "Excessive or pathological tendency to save and collect possessions." []
"Recurrent obsessions or compulsions that are severe enough to be time consuming (i.e., they take more than 1 hour a day) or cause marked distress or significant impairment (DSM-IV)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal eating behavior
Sweet craving
children.defn: "Excessive desire to eat sweet foods." [ICM:PCaroppo]

children.name: Polyphagia
children.defn: "A neurological anomaly with gross overeating associated with an abnormally strong desire or need to eat." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pica
children.defn: "An appetite for and the persistent ingestion of non-food substances such as clay. In order to diagnose pica, this behavior must have persisted over a period of at least one month." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Oral aversion
children.defn: "Reluctance or refusal of a child to be breastfed or eat, manifested as gagging, vomiting, turning head away from food, or avoidance of sensation in or around the mouth (i.e. toothbrushing or face-washing)." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]

children.name: Bulimia
children.defn: "A form of anomalous eating behavior characterized by binge eating is followed by self-induced vomiting or other compensatory behavior intended to prevent weight gain (purging, fasting or exercising or a combination of these)." [HPO:probinson, pmid:23346610]

children.name: Salt craving
children.defn: "An excessive desire to eat salt (sodium chloride) or salty foods." []
"Abnormal eating habit with excessive or insufficient consumption of food or any other abnormal pattern of food consumption." []

children.name: Psychosis
children.defn: "A condition characterized by changes of personality and thought patterns often accompanied by hallucinations and delusional beliefs." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormal drinking behavior
Polydipsia
children.defn: "Excessive thirst manifested by excessive fluid intake." []
"Abnormal consumption of fluids with excessive or insufficient consumption of fluid or any other abnormal pattern of fluid consumption." []
"An abnormality of mental functioning including various affective, behavioural, cognitive and perceptual abnormalities." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cataplexy
is_a_string: HP:0012638 ! Abnormality of nervous system physiology
children.defn: "A sudden and transient episode of bilateral loss of muscle tone, often triggered by emotions." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21931493, pmid:22249574]

children.name: Headache
is_a_string: HP:0012638 ! Abnormality of nervous system physiology

children.name: Occipital neuralgia
children.defn: "A distinct type of headache characterized by piercing, throbbing, or electric-shock-like chronic pain in the upper neck, back of the head, and behind the ears, usually on one side." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21569290]

children.name: Migraine
Migraine with aura
children.defn: "A type of migraine in which there is an aura characterized by focal neurological phenomena that usually proceed, but may accompany or occur in the absence of, the headache. The symptoms of an aura may include fully reversible visual, sensory, and speech symptoms but not motor weakness. Visual symptoms may include flickering lights, spots and lines and/or loss of vision and/or unilateral sensory symptoms such as paresthesias or numbness. At least one of the symptoms of an aura develops gradually over 5 or more minutes and/or different symptoms occur in succession." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15304572]

children.name: Migraine without aura
children.defn: "Repeated headache attacks lasting 4-72 h fulfilling at least two of the following criteria: 1) unilateral location, 2) pulsating quality, 3) moderate or severe pain intensity, and 4) aggravation by or causing avoidance of routine physical activity such as climbing stairs. Headache attacks are commonly accompanied by nausea, vomiting, photophobia, or phonophobia." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15304572]
"Migraine is a chronic neurological disorder characterized by episodic attacks of headache and associated symptoms." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15304572]

children.name: Hypnic headache
children.defn: "A headache disorder that occurs exclusively at night, waking the affected individual from sleep." [HPO:probinson, pmid:20585827, pmid:23832130]

children.name: Tension-type headache
children.defn: "A type of headache that last hours with continuous pain of mild or moderate intensity, bilateral location, a pressing/tightening (non-pulsating) quality and that is not aggravated by routine physical activity such as walking or climbing stairs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cluster headache
children.defn: "A type of headache characterized by repeated attacks of unilateral pain lasting 15 to 180 minutes and associated with local autonomic signs." [HPO:probinson, pmid:21912573]
"Cephalgia, or pain sensed in various parts of the head, not confined to the area of distribution of any nerve." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15304572]

children.name: Seizures
is_a_string: HP:0012638 ! Abnormality of nervous system physiology

children.name: Epileptic spasms
Infantile spasms
children.defn: "Infantile spasms represent a subset of \"epileptic spasms\". Infantile Spasms are epileptic spasms starting in the first year of life (infancy)." [HPO:ihelbig]

"A sudden flexion, extension or mixed extension-flexion of predominantly proximal and truncal muscles which is usually more sustained than a myoclonic movement but not as sustained as a tonic seizure." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Febrile seizures
Simple febrile seizures
children.defn: "Febrile seizures with generalized tonic-clonic semiology, duration less than 15 minutes, and without recurrence within the next 24 hours." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Complex febrile seizures
children.defn: "Febrile seizures with focal semiology, duration of more than 15 minutes, or occurring in a cluster of 2 or more convulsions within 24 hours." [HPO:jalbers]

"Febrile seizures are convulsions induced by a fever in infants or small children and are generally characterized by loss of consciousness and tonic-clonic movements. Most febrile seizures last a minute or two." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Status epilepticus
Obtundation status
children.defn: "Atypical absence lasting for more than 30 minutes." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Epilepsia partialis continua
children.defn: "A form of partial status epilepticus with simple motor manifestations that are maintained for over one hour, with clonic activity restricted to one body part and recurring at fairly regular intervals." [UToronto:htrang]
"Seizures lasting for more than 30 minutes or longer or multiple seizures repeated frequently without regaining consciousness between seizures." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Dialeptic seizures
Focal seizures with impairment of consciousness or awareness
children.defn: "A partial seizure characterized by impairment or loss of consciousness." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Absence seizures
Atypical absence seizures
children.defn: "Absence seizures characterized by insidious begin and end and often prolonged duration, accompanied by slow spike-wave discharges on EEG." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Typical absence seizures
Early onset absence seizures
children.defn: "Typical absence seizures starting before the age of 4 years." [HPO:ihelbig]
"Typical absences are brief for seconds generalized epileptic seizures of abrupt onset and abrupt termination with impairment of consciousness." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Absence seizures with special features
Myoclonic absences
is_a_string: HP:0011148 ! Absence seizures with special features
children.defn: "Absence seizures that are additionally characterized by rhythmic bilateral myoclonias of the arms and shoulders synchronous with EEG discharges, with additional tonic components of the arms." [HPO:ihelbig]

children.name: Absence seizures with eyelid myoclonia
is_a_string: HP:0011148 ! Absence seizures with special features
children.defn: "Absence seizures that are additionally characterized by eyelid myoclonia." [HPO:jalbers]
"Absence seizures that are characterized by additional motor phenomena such as eyelid myoclonias or myoclonic seizure of the upper limbs." [HPO:jalbers, pmid:20196795]
"Recurrent absence seizures are generalized seizures and are characterized by a loss of consciousness, thus, are a form of dialeptic seizures." [HPO:probinson]
"Seizures characterized by impaired consciousness." [HPO:ihelbig]

children.name: Symptomatic seizures
children.defn: "A seizure that occurs in the context of a brain insult (systemic, toxic, or metabolic) and may not recur when the underlying cause has been removed or the acute phase has elapsed." [pmid:18184148]

children.name: Generalized seizures
Generalized clonic seizures
children.defn: "Seizures with regularly repetitive myoclonus, involving the same muscle groups, at a frequency of about 2-3 c/sec." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Generalized tonic-clonic seizures
Generalized tonic-clonic seizures on awakening
children.defn: "Generalized tonic-clonic seizures on awakening are a form of Generalized tonic-clonic seizures that occur upon awaking." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Photosensitive tonic-clonic seizures
children.defn: "Generalized tonic-clonic seizures that are triggered by flashing or flickering light." [HPO:probinson]

"Generalized tonic-clonic seizures are generalized seizures with bilateral symmetrical tonic contraction then bilateral clonic contractions of somatic muscles usually associated with autonomic phenomena." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Generalized myoclonic seizures
Myoclonic atonic seizures
children.defn: "Seizures with sudden loss or diminution of muscle tone with a preceding myoclonic or tonic event lasting one to two seconds or more, involving head, trunk, jaw or limb musculature." [HPO:jalbers]
"Seizures with sudden, brief (< 100 msec) involuntary single or multiple contraction(s) of muscles(s) or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal)." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Generalized tonic seizures
children.defn: "Generalized seizures with sustained increase in muscle contraction lasting a few seconds to minutes." [HPO:jalbers, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Atonic seizures
children.defn: "Seizures characterized by a sudden loss or diminution of muscle tone, which may be fragmentary, confined to a segment (limb, jaw, head), or massive, leading to a slumping to the ground ." [HPO:jalbers, HPO:probinson]
"Seizures of with initial involvement of both cerebral hemispheres." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Focal seizures
Focal autonomic seizures
Focal autonomic seizures with altered responsiveness
children.defn: "An autonomic seizure with altered responsiveness." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Focal autonomic seizures without altered responsiveness
children.defn: "An autonomic seizure without altered responsiveness." [HPO:jalbers]

"Focal seizures with an objectively documented and distinct alteration of autonomic nervous system function involving cardiovascular, pupillary, gastrointestinal, sudomotor, vasomotor and thermoregularity functions." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Auras
Auditory auras
children.defn: "Auras with sensations of buzzing, drumming sounds or single tones." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Epigastric auras
children.defn: "Auras with abdominal discomfort including nausea, emptiness, tightness, churning, butterflies, malaise, pain, and hunger; sensation may rise to chest or throat. Some phenomena may reflect ictal autonomic dysfunction." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Olfactory Auras
children.defn: "Auras with sensation of odor, usually disagreeable." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Gustatory auras
children.defn: "Auras with taste sensations including acidic, bitter, salty , sweet or metallic tastes." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Somatosensory auras
children.defn: "Auras with sensation of tingling, numbness, electric shock sensations, pain, sense of movement, or desire to move." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Psychic auras
children.defn: "Auras with affective, mnemonic or composite perceptual phenomena including illusory or composite hallucinatory events." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Visual auras
children.defn: "Auras with sensation of flashing or flickering lights, spots, simple patterns, scotomata, or amaurosis." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Vegetative auras
children.defn: "A sensation consistent with involvement of the autonomic nervous system, including cardiovascular, gastrointestinal, sudomotor, vasomotor and thermoregulatory functions." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Experiential auras
Hallucinatory auras
children.defn: "Auras with creation of composite perceptions without corresponding external stimuli involving visual, auditory, somatosensory, olfactory and/or gustatory phenomena." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Mnemonic auras
Jamais vu
children.defn: "A subjective feeling that an experience which has occurred before is being experienced for the first time." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Deja vu
children.defn: "A subjective feeling that an experience which is occurring for the first time has been experienced before." [HPO:probinson]
"Auras which reflect ictal dysmnesia such as: feelings as familiarity (d??j??-vu) and unfamiliarity (jamais-vu)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Affective auras
children.defn: "Affective auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Illusory auras
children.defn: "Auras with an alteration of actual percepts involving the visual, auditory, somatosensory, olfactory or gustatory systems." [HPO:probinson]

"Affective, mnemonic or composite perceptual auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context." [HPO:probinson]
"Subjective ictal phenomena that, in a given patient, may precede observable seizures; if alone, constitute a if alone, constitute a simple partial seizure." [DDD:ssisodiya, HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Focal motor seizures
Hemifacial seizures
children.defn: "Focal clonic seizures affecting one side of the face." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Focal tonic seizures
Versive seizures
children.defn: "Tonic seizures with a sustained, forced conjugate ocular, cephalic and/or truncal rotation or lateral deviation from the midline." [HPO:jalbers]
"Seizures with sustained increase in muscle contraction in parts of the body lasting a few seconds to minutes." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Eyelid myoclonias
children.defn: "Focal seizure with eyelid myoclonia, not eyelid myoclonias in the context of absence seizures." [HPO:ihelbig]

children.name: Dacrystic seizures
children.defn: "A type of seizure characterized by crying or an outburst of crying as a major feature." [HPO:probinson, pmid:993803]

children.name: Gelastic seizures
children.defn: "A type of seizure characterized by laughing or an outburst of laughing as a major feature." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypokinetic seizures
children.defn: "Seizures with a decrease in amplitude and/or rate or arrest of ongoing motor activity." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Hyperkinetic seizures
children.defn: "Seizures with increase in rate of ongoing movements or inappropriately rapid performance of a movement involving predominantly proximal limb or axial muscles producing irregular sequential ballistic movements, such as pedaling, pelvic thrashing, rocking movements." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Bilateral convulsive seizures
children.defn: "Bilateral convulsive seizures are focal seizure with secondary bilateral motor phenomena, not primary generalized seizures." [HPO:probinson]
"Focal seizures involving musculature in any form." [HPO:jalbers]

children.name: Focal seizures without impairment of consciousness or awareness
children.defn: "A partial seizure in which consciousness is maintained." [HPO:probinson]
"Seizures of which initial semiology indicates, or is consistent with, initial activation of only part of one cerebral hemisphere." [HPO:jalbers]

"Seizures are an intermittent abnormality of the central nervous system due to a sudden, excessive, disorderly discharge of cerebral neurons and characterized clinically by some combination of disturbance of sensation, loss of consciousness, impairment of psychic function, or convulsive movements. The term epilepsy is used to describe chronic, recurrent seizures." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal brain positron emission tomography
is_a_string: HP:0012638 ! Abnormality of nervous system physiology

children.name: Abnormal brain FDG positron emission tomography
is_a_string: HP:0012657 ! Abnormal brain positron emission tomography

children.name: Parietal hypometabolism in FDG PET
is_a_string: HP:0012658 ! Abnormal brain FDG positron emission tomography
children.defn: "Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose  (FDG) in the parietal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan." [HPO:probinson, pmid:15073255]

children.name: Hypothalamic hypometabolism in FDG PET
is_a_string: HP:0012658 ! Abnormal brain FDG positron emission tomography
children.defn: "Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose  (FDG) in the hypothalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thalamic hypometabolism in FDG PET
is_a_string: HP:0012658 ! Abnormal brain FDG positron emission tomography
children.defn: "Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose  (FDG) in the thalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Prefrontal hypometabolism in FDG PET
is_a_string: HP:0012658 ! Abnormal brain FDG positron emission tomography
children.defn: "Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose  (FDG) in the prefrontal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan." [HPO:probinson, pmid:23585882]

"An anomaly detectable in [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) positron emission tomography (PET) brain scans. Glucose uptake measured with FDG-PET is a marker of neuronal metabolic activity." [HPO:probinson]

"A functional brain anomaly detectable by positron emission tomography (PET). PET scanning is a method for functional brain imaging, and its measurements reflect the amount of brain activity in the various regions of the brain." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Encephalopathy
is_a_string: HP:0012638 ! Abnormality of nervous system physiology

children.name: Hypoglycemic encephalopathy
children.defn: "Brain damage related to a lowering of blood glucose below a critical level (around 30 mg/dl), which may lead to confusion, lethargy and delirium followed by seizures and coma. Prolonged hypoglycemia may lead to irreversible brain damage." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hepatic encephalopathy
children.defn: "Central nervous system dysfunction in association with liver failure and characterized clinically (depending on degree of severity) by lethargy, confusion, nystagmus, decorticate posturing, spasticity, and bilateral Babinski reflexes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Infantile encephalopathy
children.defn: "Encephalopathy with onset in the infantile period." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Necrotizing encephalopathy
children.defn: "A type of encephalopathy (brain disease, damage, or malfunction accompanied by an altered mental state) that is characterized by evidence of necrosis of brain tissue." [KI:phemming, pmid:23705127]

children.name: Recurrent encephalopathy
children.defn: "Recurrent episodes of brain dysfunction that may be triggered by factors such as metabolic disturbances or infections." [HPO:probinson]
"Encephalopathy is a term that means brain disease, damage, or malfunction. In general, encephalopathy is manifested by an altered mental state." [HPO:probinson, KI:phemming]

children.name: Abnormality of central motor function
is_a_string: HP:0012638 ! Abnormality of nervous system physiology

children.name: Upper motor neuron dysfunction
is_a_string: HP:0011442 ! Abnormality of central motor function

children.name: Abnormal pyramidal signs
Babinski sign
children.defn: "Upturning of the big toe (and sometimes fanning of the other toes) in response to stimulation of the sole of the foot. If the Babinski sign is present it can indicate damage to the corticospinal tract." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Gordon reflex
children.defn: "Dorsal extension of the big toe, sometimes accompanied by fanning of the other toes, elicited by compressing the calf muscles (a normal response is no movement of the big toe)." [pmid:18637037, UKT:rschuele]

children.name: Oppenheim reflex
children.defn: "Dorsiflexion of the big toe, sometimes accompanied by fanning of the other toes, elicited by stroking along the medial side of the tibia (the normal response would be no movement of the big toe)." [UKB:tklockgether]

children.name: Chaddock reflex
children.defn: "A diagnostic reflex elicited by stimulation of the skin over the surface of the lateral malleolus of the foot. The Chaddock refelx is present if there is extension of one or more or all of the toes with or without fanning of them when the external inframalleolar skin is stimulated. The Chaddock sign, similar to the Babinski sign, is taken to be an indication of disease of the spinocortical (pyramidal) tract." [HPO:probinson]
"Functional neurological abnormalities related to dysfunction of the pyramidal tract." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Weakness due to upper motor neuron dysfunction
Hemiplegia/hemiparesis
is_a_string: HP:0010549 ! Weakness due to upper motor neuron dysfunction

children.name: Hemiplegia
Episodic hemiplegia
children.defn: "Transient episodes of weakness of the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body." [HPO:probinson]
"Paralysis (complete loss of muscle function) in the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Hemiparesis
children.defn: "Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to an incomplete loss of strength." [HPO:probinson, UKB:tklockgether]

"Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Paraplegia/paraparesis
is_a_string: HP:0010549 ! Weakness due to upper motor neuron dysfunction

children.name: Paraparesis
children.defn: "Weakness or partial paralysis in the lower limbs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Paraplegia
children.defn: "Severe or complete weakness of both lower extremities with sparing of the upper extremities." [HPO:probinson]

"Weakness of both lower extremities with sparing of the upper extremities. Paraplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas paraparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Tetraplegia/tetraparesis
is_a_string: HP:0010549 ! Weakness due to upper motor neuron dysfunction

children.name: Tetraplegia
Episodic quadriplegia
children.defn: "Intermittent episodes of paralysis of all four limbs." [HPO:probinson]

"Paralysis of all four limbs, and trunk of the body below the level of an associated injury to the spinal cord. The etiology of quadriplegia is similar to that of paraplegia except that the lesion is in the cervical spinal cord rather than in the thoracic or lumbar segments of the spinal cord." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tetraparesis
children.defn: "Weakness of all four limbs." [HPO:probinson]
"Loss of strength in all four limbs. Tetraplegia refers to a complete loss of strength, whereas Tetraparesis refers to an incomplete loss of strength." []

"Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Paralysis due to lesions of the principle motor tracts is related to a lesion in the corticospinal, corticobulbar or brainstem descending (subcorticospinal) neurons." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hyperreflexia
children.defn: "Hyperreflexia is the presence of hyperactive stretch reflexes of the muscles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Corticospinal tract disease in lower limbs

children.defn: "A functional anomaly of the upper motor neuron. The upper motor neurons are neurons of the primary motor cortex which project to the brainstem and spinal chord via the corticonuclear, corticobulbar and corticospinal (pyramidal) tracts. They are involved in control of voluntary movements.\nDysfunction leads to weakness, impairment of fine motor movements,  spasticity, hyperreflexia and abnormal pyramidal signs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of central motor conduction
is_a_string: HP:0011442 ! Abnormality of central motor function
children.defn: "Any anomaly of the conduction of motor nerve impulses in the central nervous system." [HPO:probinson, pmid:3572430]

children.name: Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function
is_a_string: HP:0011442 ! Abnormality of central motor function

children.name: Exaggerated startle response
is_a_string: HP:0002071 ! Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function
children.defn: "An exaggerated startle reaction in response to a sudden unexpected visual or acoustic stimulus, or a quick movement near the face." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Progressive extrapyramidal movement disorder
is_a_string: HP:0002071 ! Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function

children.name: Extrapyramidal muscular rigidity
is_a_string: HP:0002071 ! Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function

children.name: Progressive extrapyramidal muscular rigidity
children.defn: "A progressive degree of muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement)." [HPO:probinson]
"Muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Parkinsonism
is_a_string: HP:0002071 ! Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function

children.name: Parkinsonism with favorable response to dopaminergic medication

children.defn: "Characteristic neurologic anomaly resulting form degeneration of dopamine-generating cells in the substantia nigra, a region of the midbrain, characterized clinically by shaking, rigidity, slowness of movement and difficulty with walking and gait." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bradykinesia
is_a_string: HP:0002071 ! Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function
children.defn: "Bradykinesia literally means slow movement, and is used clinically to denote a slowness in the execution of movement (in contrast to hypokinesia, which is used to refer to slowness in the initiation of movement)." [HPO:probinson]

"A neurological condition related to lesions of the basal ganglia leading to typical abnormalities including akinesia (inability to initiate changes in activity and perform volitional movements rapidly and easily), muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement), chorea (widespread arrhythmic movements of a forcible, rapid, jerky, and restless nature), athetosis (inability to sustain the muscles of the fingers, toes, or other group of muscles in a fixed position), and akathisia (inability to remain motionless)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of coordination
is_a_string: HP:0011442 ! Abnormality of central motor function

children.name: Slurred speech
children.defn: "Abnormal coordination of muscles involved in speech." [DDD:fmunitoni]

children.name: Clumsiness
children.defn: "Lack of physical coordination resulting in an abnormal tendency to drop items or bump into objects." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Paralysis
is_a_string: HP:0011442 ! Abnormality of central motor function

children.name: Periodic paralysis
Periodic hyperkalemic paralysis
children.defn: "Episodes of muscle weakness associated with elevated levels of potassium in the blood." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Periodic hypokalemic paresis
children.defn: "Episodes of muscle weakness associated with reduced levels of potassium in the blood." [HPO:probinson]
"Episodes of muscle weakness." [HPO:probinson]

"Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Motor paralysis results from deficits of the upper motor neurons (corticospinal, corticobulbar, or subcorticospinal). Motor paralysis is often accompanied by an impairment in the facility of movement." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Rigidity
is_a_string: HP:0011442 ! Abnormality of central motor function

children.name: Decorticate rigidity
children.defn: "A type of rigidity in which the arms are in flexion and adduction and the legs are extended. This signifies a lesion in the cerebral white matter, internal capsules, or thalamus." [HPO:probinson]

"Continuous involuntary sustained muscle contraction. When an affected muscle is passively stretched, the degree of resistance remains constant regardless of the rate at which the muscle is stretched. This feature helps to distinguish rigidity from muscle spasticity." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly of the control or production of movement in the central nervous system." [HPO:probinson]
"A functional anomaly of the nervous system." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the nervous system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the breast
Hypoplastic areola
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the areola, the circular area of pigmented skin surrounding the nipple." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the breasts
Breast hypoplasia
Bilateral breast hypoplasia
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the breast on both sides." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Unilateral breast hypoplasia
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the breast on one side only." [HPO:probinson]
"Underdevelopment of the breast." [HPO:probinson]
"Absence or underdevelopment of the breasts." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Breast hypertrophy
children.defn: "The presence of hypertrophy of the breast." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Asymmetry of the breasts
children.defn: "The presence of asymmetrical breasts." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Gynecomastia
children.defn: "Abnormal development of large mammary glands in males resulting in breast enlargement." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the nipple
Supernumerary nipple
children.defn: "Presence of more than two nipples." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Wide intermamillary distance
children.defn: "A larger than usual distance between the left and right nipple." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Inverted nipples
children.defn: "The presence of nipples that instead of pointing outward are retracted inwards." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Hypoplastic nipples
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the nipple." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Low-set nipples
children.defn: "Placement of the nipples at a lower than normal location." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the nipple." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Galactorrhea
children.defn: "Spontaneous flow of milk from the breast, unassociated with childbirth or nursing." [HPO:sdoelken]
"An abnormality of the breast." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the respiratory system
Abnormal respiratory system morphology
is_a_string: HP:0002086 ! Abnormality of the respiratory system

children.name: Abnormal respiratory epithelium morphology
Abnormal respiratory motile cilium morphology
Abnormal axonemal organization of respiratory motile cilia
is_a_string: HP:0005938 ! Abnormal respiratory motile cilium morphology
children.defn: "Abnormal arrangement of the structures of the axoneme, which is the cytoskeletal structure that forms the inner core of the motile cilium and displays a canonical 9 + 2 microtubular pattern of motile cilia studded with dynein arms." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19606528]

children.name: Dynein arm defect of respiratory motile cilia
is_a_string: HP:0005938 ! Abnormal respiratory motile cilium morphology

children.name: Absent/shortened dynein arms
is_a_string: HP:0012255 ! Dynein arm defect of respiratory motile cilia

children.name: Absent outer dynein arms
Absent inner and outer dynein arms
children.defn: "Complete absence of the dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, that is, absence of the inner and the outer dynein arms, which normally are situated inside and outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19606528]

"Absence of the outer dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19606528]

children.name: Absent inner dynein arms
children.defn: "Absence of the outer dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated within the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19606528]
"An anomaly of the dynein arms of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19606528]

children.name: Abnormal central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
is_a_string: HP:0005938 ! Abnormal respiratory motile cilium morphology
children.defn: "A structural anomaly of the two central microtubules of motile cilia with a 9+2 microtubuluar configuration." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19200523]

children.name: Absent respiratory ciliary axoneme radial spokes
is_a_string: HP:0005938 ! Abnormal respiratory motile cilium morphology
children.defn: "Absence of the radial spokes of the axoneme of the respiratoy cilium." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19606528]

children.name: Absent central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
is_a_string: HP:0005938 ! Abnormal respiratory motile cilium morphology
children.defn: "Absence of the two central microtubules of motile cilia with a 9+2 microtubuluar configuration." [HPO:probinson]

"Abnormal arrangement of the structures of the axoneme, which is the cytoskeletal structure that forms the inner core of the motile cilium and displays a canonical 9 + 2 microtubular pattern of motile cilia studded with dynein arms." [HPO:probinson, MP:0011050]

"Any structural anomaly of the pseudostratified ciliated epithelium that lines much of the conducting portion of the airway, including part of the nasal cavity and larynx, the trachea, and bronchi." [HPO:probinson, MP:0010942]

children.name: Abnormality of pulmonary situs
Pulmonary situs ambiguus
Pulmonary situs ambiguus with bilateral morphologic left lungs
children.defn: "An abnormality of the pulmonary situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the morphological right and left lungs, in which both lungs have the morphology of a left lung." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Pulmonary situs ambiguus with bilateral morphologic right lungs
children.defn: "An abnormality of the pulmonary situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the morphological right and left lungs, in which both lungs have the morphology of a right lungs." [DDD:dbrown, HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the pulmonary situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the morphological right and left lungs, in which the morphology of both left and right lungs is the same." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Pulmonary situs inversus
children.defn: "Mirror image arrangement of the mainstem bronchi with the right pulmonary artery posterior to the right upper lobe bronchus and the left pulmonary artery anterior to the left upper lobe bronchus." [DDD:dbrown]

"An abnormality of the pulmonary situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the morphological right and left lungs, which is defined by characteristics such as the number of lobes per lung and the relationship of the pulmonary arteries to their bronchi." [DDD:dbrown]

children.name: Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract
Abnormality of the tracheobronchial system
is_a_string: HP:0002087 ! Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract

children.name: Abnormality of the trachea
is_a_string: HP:0005607 ! Abnormality of the tracheobronchial system

children.name: Tracheomegaly
Tracheobronchmegaly
children.defn: "Marked widening of the trachea and major bronchi that may be predispose to chronic respiratory tract infection." [HPO:probinson]
"Marked widening of the trachea." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tracheobronchomalacia
children.defn: "Weakness of the cartilage in the trachea and the bronchi, resulting in a floppy (non-rigid) airway. Affected persons may have difficulties to maintain patency of the airways." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tracheal atresia
children.defn: "A congenital absence or considerable underdevelopment of the trachea such that communication between the larynx proximally and the alveoli of the lungs distally is lacking." [HPO:probinson, pmid:9776081]

children.name: Tracheal calcification
children.defn: "Calcification (abnormal deposits of calcium) in the tracheal tissues." [HPO:probinson, pmid:18663210]
"An anomaly of the trachea." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tracheobronchial leiomyomatosis
is_a_string: HP:0005607 ! Abnormality of the tracheobronchial system

children.name: Abnormality of the bronchi
is_a_string: HP:0005607 ! Abnormality of the tracheobronchial system

children.name: Bronchomegaly
children.defn: "Marked widening of the major bronchi that may be predispose to chronic respiratory tract infection." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bronchiectasis
children.defn: "Persistent abnormal dilatation of the bronchi owing to localized and irreversible destruction and widening of the large airways." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the set of bronchi." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the larynx
is_a_string: HP:0002087 ! Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract

children.name: Laryngeal obstruction
children.defn: "Blockage of the upper airway at the level of the larynx often accompanied by respiratory distress." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Laryngeal hypoplasia
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the larynx (FMA:55097)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Laryngomalacia
children.defn: "Laryngomalacia is a congenital abnormality of the laryngeal cartilage in which the cartilage is floppy and prolapses over the larynx during inspiration." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Laryngeal stenosis
children.defn: "Stricture or narrowing of the larynx that may be associated with symptoms of respiratory difficulty depending on the degree of laryngeal narrowing." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Laryngeal cyst
children.defn: "Presence of a cyst (sac-like structure) located in the larynx." [HPO:probinson, pmid:24040590]

children.name: Laryngeal stridor
children.defn: "An abnormal high-pitched noisy sound, occurring during inhalation or exhalation caused by the incomplete obstruction in the throat." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the vocal cords
Vocal cord paralysis
is_a_string: HP:0008777 ! Abnormality of the vocal cords

children.name: Vocal cord paralysis (caused by tumor impingement)
Unilateral vocal cord paralysis
children.defn: "A loss of the ability to move the vocal fold on one side." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Biilateral vocal cord paralysis
children.defn: "A loss of the ability to move the vocal fold on both sides." [HPO:probinson]
"A loss of the ability to move the vocal folds." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Vocal cord paresis
is_a_string: HP:0008777 ! Abnormality of the vocal cords

children.name: Unilateral vocal cord paresis
children.defn: "Decreased strength of the vocal fold on one side." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bilateral vocal cord paresis
children.defn: "Decreased strength of the vocal fold on both sides." [HPO:probinson]
"Decreased strength of the vocal folds." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bowing of the vocal cords
is_a_string: HP:0008777 ! Abnormality of the vocal cords
children.defn: "Bowing (abnormal curvature) of the vocal folds." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Imperfect vocal cord adduction
is_a_string: HP:0008777 ! Abnormality of the vocal cords

children.defn: "An abnormality of the vocal cord." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Laryngeal cleft
children.defn: "Presence of a gap in the posterior laryngotracheal wall with a continuity between the larynx and the esopahagus." [HPO:probinson, pmid:17178945]

children.name: Laryngeal cartilage malformation
children.defn: "A malformation of the laryngeal cartilage." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Laryngeal web
children.defn: "A membrane-like structure that extends across the laryngeal lumen close to the level of the vocal cords." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anteroposteriorly shortened larynx
children.defn: "Abnormal shortening of the larynx in the anteroposterior (front to back) axis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the epiglottis
Bifid epiglottis
children.defn: "A midline anterior-posterior cleft of the epiglottis that involves at least two-thirds of the epiglottic leaf. It is a useful feature for clinical diagnosis because it appears to be very rare in syndromes other than Pallister-Hall-Syndrome and is also rare as an isolated malformation." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the Epiglottis
Hypoplasia of the epiglottis
children.defn: "Hypoplasia of the epiglottis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia of the epiglottis
children.defn: "Absence of the epiglottis." [HPO:probinson]
"This term applies if the Epiglottis is absent or hypoplastic." [HPO:curators]
"An abnormality of the epiglottis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Laryngeal atresia
children.defn: "Congenital absence of the lumen of the larynx." [eMedicine:837630, HPO:probinson, pmid:17715321]

children.name: Laryngeal calcification
children.defn: "Calcification (abnormal deposits of calcium) in the laryngeal tissues." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cartilaginous ossification of larynx
children.defn: "Ossification affecting the set of cartilages of larynx." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the aryepiglottic fold
children.defn: "An abnormality of the aryepiglottic fold." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the larynx." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Upper airway obstruction
is_a_string: HP:0002087 ! Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract

children.name: Episodic upper airway obstruction
children.defn: "Intermittent episodes of increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway." [HPO:probinson]
"Increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the upper respiratory tract." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the lung
Atelectasis
children.defn: "Collapse of part of a lung associated with absence of inflation (air) of that part." [HPPO:probinson]

children.name: Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation of the lung
children.defn: "Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation (CCAM) can be diagnosed prenatally if ultrasound shows a cystic or solid lung tumor. A CCAM does not have systemic arterial blood supply (in contrast to bronchopulmonary sequenstration). It is a cystic area within the lung that originates from abnormal embryogenesis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pulmonary fibrosis
children.defn: "Replacement of normal lung tissues are progressively replaced by fibroblasts and collagen." [DDD:tkuijpers, HPO:probinson]

children.name: Diffuse reticular or finely nodular infiltrations
Interstitial pulmonary disease
Bronchiolitis obliterans
children.defn: "Inflammation and fibrosis of the bronchioles leading to partial or complete obstruction of these airways." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia
children.defn: "Bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia (BOOP) is and interstitial lung abnormalitiy characterized  histopathologically by plugs of granulation tissue lying within small airways, alveolar ducts, and alveoli and by chronic inflammatory cell infiltration in alveolar walls. Patients with BOOP generally present with subacute illness, including shortness of breath, fever, malaise, and weight loss." [DDD:tkuijpers, HPO:probinson, pmid:20858818]
"Abnormality of the lung parenchyma extending to the pulmonary interstitium and leading to diffuse pulmonary fibrosis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Alveolar proteinosis
children.defn: "Abnormal accumulation of surfactant-like, periodic acid-schiff-positive lipoproteinaceous material in macrophages within the alveolar spaces and distal bronchioles. This results in gas exchange impairment leading to dyspnea and alveolar infiltrates." [HPO:probinson, pmid:22891182]

children.name: Respiratory insufficiency
Dyspnea
Paroxysmal dyspnea
children.defn: "A sudden attack of dyspnea that occurs while the affected person is at rest." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Orthopnea
children.defn: "A sensation of breathlessness in the recumbent position, relieved by sitting or standing." [UToronto:htrang]
"Difficult or labored breathing." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Respiratory insufficiency due to defective ciliary clearance
is_a_string: HP:0012261 ! Abnormal respiratory motile cilium physiology

children.name: Ventilator dependence with inability to wean
is_a_string: HP:0004887 ! Respiratory failure requiring assisted ventilation

children.name: Neonatal respiratory distress
Neonatal asphyxia
children.defn: "Respiratory failure in the newborn." [HPO:probinson]
"Respiratory difficulty as newborn." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Respiratory failure
children.defn: "A severe form of respiratory insufficiency characterized by inadequate gas exchange such that the levels of oxygen or carbon dioxide cannot be maintained within normal limits." [HPO:probinson]
"Failure to adequately provide oxygen to cells of the body and to remove excess carbon dioxide." [HPO:probinson, MeSH:D012131]

children.name: Bronchogenic cyst
children.defn: "A rare congenital cystic lesion of the lungs in the mediastinum." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Bilateral lung agenesis
children.defn: "Bilateral lack of development of the lungs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Respiratory tract infection
Pneumonia
Aspiration pneumonia
Acute aspiration pneumonia
children.defn: "An acute episode of pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Recurrent aspiration pneumonia
children.defn: "Increased susceptibility to aspiration pneumonia, defined as pneumonia due to breathing in foreign material, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of aspiration pneumonia." [HPO:probinson]
"Pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract." [HPO:probinson]
"Inflammation of any part of the lung parenchyma." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bronchitis
Acute bronchitis
children.defn: "Inflammation of the large airways of the lung with rapid onset and short course usually associated with cough, mucus production, shortness of breath, wheezing, and chest tightness." [HPO:probinson]
"Inflammation of the large airways in the lung including any part of the bronchi from the primary bronchi to the tertiary bronchi." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Acute respiratory tract infection
Bronchiolitis
children.defn: "Inflammation of the bronchioles." [DDD:tkuijpers]

children.name: Acute infectious pneumonia
children.defn: "Acute inflammation of the lung due to an infection." [DDD:tkuijpers]
"An acute infection of the upper or lower respiratory tract." [DDD:tkuijpers]
"An infection of the upper or lower respiratory tract." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Chronic lung disease
children.defn: "According to the definitions of the American and British Thoracic Societies, including pulmonary functional tests, X-rays, and CT scans for items such as fibrosis, bronchiectasis, bullae, emphysema, nodular or lymphomatous abnormalities." [IMM:tkuijpers]

children.name: Abnormality of the pleura
Hemothorax
children.defn: "The presence of blood in the pleural space." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pleural effusion
Exudative pleural effusion
children.defn: "A type of pleural effusion with a exudate (extravascular fluid that has exuded out of a tissue or its capillaries due to injury or inflammation). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH." [DDD:tkuijpers, HPO:probinson, pmid:16623208]

children.name: Transudative pleural effusion
children.defn: "A type of pleural effusion with a transudate (extravascular fluid with low protein content and a low specific gravity). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH." [DDD:tkuijpers, HPO:probinson, pmid:16623208]

children.name: Chylothorax
children.defn: "Accumulation of excessive amounts of lymphatic fluid (chyle) in the pleural cavity." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Pleural empyema
children.defn: "Accumulation of pus in the pleural cavity." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of an excessive amount of fluid in the pleural cavity." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pleuritis
children.defn: "Inflammation of the pleura." [HPO:sdoelken]
"An abnormality of the pulmonary pleura, the thin, transparent membrane which covers the lungs and lines the inside of the chest walls." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal lung lobation
Bilateral trilobed lungs
children.defn: "Both lungs have three lobes. Normally, the left lung has two lobes, whereas the right lung has three lobes." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pulmonary sequestration
Intrapulmonary sequestration
children.defn: "A type of pulmonary sequestration that occurs within the visceral pleura of normal lung tissue, usually without communication with the tracheobronchial tree." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Extrapulmonary sequestrum
children.defn: "A type of pulmonary sequestration that is completely enclosed in its own pleural sac, occurring above, within, or below the diaphragm, and without communication with the tracheobronchial tree." [HPO:probinson]

"The presence of a piece lung tissue which is not attached to the pulmonary blood supply and does not communicate with the other lung tissue (not connected to the standard bronchial airways and not performing a function in respiration)." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Defects in the formation of pulmonary lobules." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pneumothorax
Spontaneous pneumothorax
Spontaneous neonatal pneumothorax
children.defn: "Pneumothorax occurring neonatally without traumatic injury to the chest or lung." [HPO:probinson]
"Pneumothorax occurring without traumatic injury to the chest or lung." [HPO:probinson]
"Accumulation of air in the pleural cavity leading to a partially or completely collapsed lung." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hemoptysis
children.defn: "Coughing up (expectoration) of blood or blood-streaked sputum from the larynx, trachea, bronchi, or lungs." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bronchopulmonary sequestration
Extralobar sequestration
children.defn: "A kind of bronchopulmonary sequestration that is completely discrete from the normal lung and is surrounded by separate pleura." [HPO:probinson, pmid:20610189]

children.name: Intralobar sequestration
children.defn: "A kind of bronchopulmonary sequestration that is incorporated into the normal surrounding lung." [HPO:probinson, pmid:20610189]
"The presence of microscopic cystic masses of nonfunctioning pulmonary tissue that lack an obvious communication with the tracheobronchial tree." [HPO:probinson, pmid:20610189]

children.name: Obstructive lung disease
Chronic obstructive airway disease from birth

children.defn: "Obstruction of conducting airways of the lung." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the lung." [HPO:probinson]
"A structural anomaly of the respiratoy system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Functional respiratory abnormality
is_a_string: HP:0002086 ! Abnormality of the respiratory system

children.name: Abnormal blood gas level
Hypoxemia
children.defn: "An abnormally low level of blood oxygen." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hyperoxemia
children.defn: "An abnormally high level of blood oxygen." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypercapnia
children.defn: "Abnormally elevated blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypocapnia
children.defn: "Abnormally reduced blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the partial pressure of oxygen or carbon dioxide in the arterial blood." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Reduced vital capacity
children.defn: "An abnormal reduction on the vital capacity, which is defined as the total lung capacity (volume of air in the lungs at maximal inflation) less the residual volume (i.e., volume of air in the lungs following maximal exhalation) of the lung." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal pattern of respiration
Paradoxical respiration
children.defn: "Breathing movements in which the chest wall moves in on inspiration and out on expiration, in reverse of the normal movements. It may be seen in children with respiratory distress of any cause, which leads to indrawing of the intercostal spaces during inspiration. Patients with chronic airways obstruction also show indrawing of the lower ribs during inspiration, due to the distorted action of a depressed and flattened diaphragm. Crush injuries of the chest, with fractured ribs and sternum, can lead to a severe degree of paradoxical breathing." [HPO:tevangelista]

children.name: Hypoventilation
children.defn: "A reduction in the amount of air transported into the pulmonary alveoli by breathing, leading to hypercapnia (increase in the partial pressure of carbon dioxide)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hyperventilation
intermittent hyperventilation
children.defn: "Episodic hyperventilation." [HPO:probinson]

"Hyperventilation refers to an increased pulmonary ventilation rate that is faster than necessary for the exchange of gases. Hyperventilation can result from increased frequency of breathing, an increased tidal volume, or both, and leads to an excess intake of oxygen and the blowing off of carbon dioxide." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tachypnea
Episodic tachypnea
children.defn: "Episodes of very rapid breathing." [HPO:probinson]
"Very rapid breathing." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Apnea
Apneic episodes in infancy
children.defn: "Recurrent episodes of apnea occurring during infancy." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Apneic episodes precipitated by illness, fatigue, stress
children.defn: "Recurrent episodes of apnea that are precipitated by factors such as illness, fatigue, or stress." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Central apnea
children.defn: "Apnea resulting from depression of the respiratory centers in the medulla oblongata. There is a lack of respiratory effort rather than obstruction of airflow." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Sudden episodic apnea
children.defn: "Recurrent bouts of sudden, severe apnea that may be life-threatening." [HPO:probinson]

"Lack of breathing with no movement of the respiratory muscles and no exchange of air in the lungs. This term refers to a disposition to have recurrent episodes of apnea rather than to a single event." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Irregular respiration
children.defn: "Uneven rhythm of breathing." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cheyne-Stokes respiration
children.defn: "An abnormal pattern of respiration characterized by cycles of respiration that are increasingly deeper then shallower with possible periods of apnea. Affected patients may display a 10 to 20 second episode of hypoventilation or apnea, followed by respiration of increased depth and frequency over the course of about one minute. The cycle repeats every 45 seconds to 3 minutes." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly of the rhythm or depth of breathing." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aspiration
children.defn: "Inspiration of a foreign object into the airway." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cough
children.defn: "A sudden, audible expulsion of air from the lungs through a partially closed glottis, preceded by inhalation." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Decreased sensitivity to hypoxemia
children.defn: "Reduced tendency to respond to a reduced concentration of oxygen in the blood by increasing respiration." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal respiratory motile cilium physiology
Abnormal ciliary motility
is_a_string: HP:0012261 ! Abnormal respiratory motile cilium physiology

children.name: Ciliary dyskinesia
children.defn: "A deviation from the normally well coordinated pattern of intracellular and intercellular synchrony of motile cilia. Dyskinetic cilia usually beat out of synchrony relative to neighboring cilia." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19606528]

"Any anomaly of the normal motility of motile cilia. Evaluation of ciliary beat frequency and ciliary beat pattern requires high-speed videomicroscopy of freshly obtained ciliary biopsies that are maintained in culture media under controlled conditions." [HPO:probinson, pmid:19606528, pmid:20301301]
"Any functional anomaly of the respiratory motile cilia." [HPO:probinson, MP:0011055]

children.name: Stridor
Inspiratory stridor
children.defn: "Inspiratory stridor is a high pitched sound upon inspiration that is generally related to laryngeal abnormalities." [HPO:curators]
"Stridor is a high pitched sound resulting from turbulent air flow in the upper airway." [HPO:curators]
"An abnormality of the respiratory system, which include the airways, lungs, and the respiratory muscles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the skeletal system
Ectopic calcification
is_a_string: HP:0000924 ! Abnormality of the skeletal system

children.name: Intervertebral disk calcification
is_a_string: HP:0005108 ! Abnormality of the intervertebral disk
children.defn: "The presence of abnormal calcium deposition of the intervertebral disk." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Epiphyseal stippling
Calcaneal epiphyseal stippling
children.defn: "The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the calcaneus." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Neonatal epiphyseal stippling
children.defn: "The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more epiphyses during the neonatal period." [HPO:probinson]
"The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more epiphyses (FMA:24012)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Punctate vertebral calcifications
children.defn: "The presence of punctiform calcification of the bone of the vertebral bodies." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Costal cartilage calcification
children.defn: "Calcification of the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage found at the anterior ends of the ribs which serve to prolong the ribs forward and contribute to the elasticity of the walls of the thorax." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Progressive calcification of costochondral cartilage
is_a_string: HP:0000919 ! Abnormality of the costochondral junction

children.name: Calcific stippling
children.defn: "An abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) pattern of calcifications in soft tissues within or surrounding bones (as observed on radiographs)." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Anterior rib punctate calcifications
children.defn: "Deposition of calcium salts in point-like foci within the anterior portion of one or more ribs." [HPO:probinson]
"Deposition of calcium salts in a tissue or location in which calcification does not normally occur." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of skeletal morphology
is_a_string: HP:0000924 ! Abnormality of the skeletal system

children.name: Skeletal dysplasia
Spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia
children.defn: "A disorder of bone growth affecting the vertebrae and the ends of the long bones (epiphyses)." [HPO:probinson]
"A general term describing features characterized by abnormal development of bones and connective tissues." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal axial skeleton morphology
Supernumerary bones of the axial skeleton
Supernumerary vertebrae
is_a_string: HP:0009144 ! Supernumerary bones of the axial skeleton

children.name: Supernumerary ribs
is_a_string: HP:0009144 ! Supernumerary bones of the axial skeleton

children.name: Cervical ribs
children.defn: "A supernumerary rib developing from an abnormal enlargement of the costal element of the C7 vertebra." [HPO:probinson, MeSH:D057070]

children.name: Abnormal sternal ossification
Decreased number of sternal ossification centers
children.defn: "A less than normal number of sternal ossification centers. The sternum is initially formed from bilateral sternal plates that chondrify and begin to fuse with ribs at 10 weeks gestational age. Ossification starts in the manubrium and upper part of the sternal body at the 6th month, in the middle of the sternal body at the 7th month, in the lower part of the body during the 1st postnatal year and in the xiphoid process between years 5 and 18. The number of ossification centers vary up to six, and it is the ossification centers that are visualized by prenatal ultrasound. This term describes a reduction in the number of ossification centers compared with age-related norms." [HPO:probinson, pmid:10204210]

children.name: Abnormal vertebral ossification
Delayed ossification of vertebral epiphysis
children.defn: "A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more vertebrae." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Supernumerary vertebral ossification centers
children.defn: "Three ossification sites are present in typical vertebral bodies (C3-L5): a single ossification center in the vertebral body, and one each in the two neural arches. This term applies if there are additional vertebral ossification centers present during the development and maturation of the spine." [HPO:probinson]

Poorly ossified vertebrae
is_a_string: HP:0004599 ! Absent or minimally ossified vertebral bodies

children.name: Poorly ossified cervical vertebrae

"Decreased ossification of the vertebral bodies." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Unossified vertebral bodies
is_a_string: HP:0004599 ! Absent or minimally ossified vertebral bodies

children.name: Absent in utero ossification of vertebral bodies

children.name: Absent ossification of thoracic vertebral bodies

children.name: Vertebral hyperostosis
children.defn: "Excessive growth of the bones of the vertebral bodies." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Vertebral fusion
Posterior fusion of lumbosacral vertebrae
children.defn: "Bony fusion of the posterior part of the L5 vertebral body with the sacrum." [pmid:5443339]

children.name: Fused thoracic vertebrae
children.defn: "A congenital anomaly characterized by a joining (fusion) of two or more thoracic vertebral bodies with one another." []

children.name: Fused cervical vertebrae
Cervical vertebral fusion (C2/C3)
children.defn: "Fusion of cervical vertebrae at C2 and C3, caused by a failure in the normal segmentation or division of the cervical vertebrae during the early weeks of fetal development, leading to a short neck with a low hairline at the back of the head, and restricted mobility of the upper spine." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cervical vertebrae fusion (C5/C6)
children.defn: "Fusion of the C5 and C6 cervical vertebrae." [HPO:probinson]
"A congenital anomaly characterized by a joining (fusion) of two or more cervical vertebral bodies with one another." []

children.name: Sacralization of the fifth lumbar vertebra
children.defn: "A congenital anomaly, in which the transverse process of the last lumbar vertebra (L5) fuses to the sacrum on one side or both, or to ilium, or both." [UToronto:bgallinger]

children.name: Fused lumbar vertebrae
children.defn: "A congenital anomaly characterized by a joining (fusion) of two or more lumbar vertebral bodies with one another." []
"A developmental defect leading to the union of two adjacent vertebrae." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lumbar hemivertebrae

children.name: Narrow vertebral interpedicular distance

children.defn: "A reduction of the distance between thoracolumbar vertebral pedicles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Lower thoracic interpediculate narrowness
children.defn: "A reduction of the distance between the lower thoracic vertebral pedicles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Caudal interpedicular narrowing
Lumbar interpedicular narrowing
children.defn: "Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between lumbar vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column." [HPO:probinson]

"Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column. Note that normally, the interpedicular distances get progressively wider as one proceeds down the spine." [HPO:probinson]

"A reduction of the distance between vertebral pedicles, which are the two short, thick processes, which project backward, one on either side, from the upper part of the vertebral body, at the junction of its posterior and lateral surfaces." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Widened interpedicular distance
children.defn: "An increase in the distance between vertebral pedicles, which are the two short, thick processes, which project backward, one on either side, from the upper part of the vertebral body, at the junction of its posterior and lateral surfaces." [UToronto:htrang]
"A morphological abnormality of the vertebral arch, i.e., of the  posterior part of a vertebra." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Anterior beaking of lower thoracic vertebrae

children.name: Anterior beaking of thoracic vertebrae
children.defn: "Anterior tongue-like protrusions of thoracic vertebral bodies." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Schmorl's node
children.defn: "A Schmorl???s node is the herniation of nucleus pulposus through the cartilaginous and bony end plate into the body of the adjacent vertebra. " []

children.name: Morbus Scheuermann
children.defn: "A developmental growth retardation of the vertebral end plates that may lead to secondary destruction of the vertebral end plates and protrusion of the nucleus pulposus into the vertebral body (so called Schmorl's nodes as seen on x-rays)." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Vertebral body sclerosis
children.defn: "Increase in bone density of the vertebral body." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of one or more of the vertebrae." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Diaphyseal sclerosis
is_a_string: HP:0006392 ! Increased density of long bones

children.name: Diaphyseal cortical sclerosis
children.defn: "An elevation in bone density of the cortex of one or more diaphyses. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity." [HPO:probinson]
"An elevation in bone density in one or more diaphyses. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormal increase in the bone density of the long bones." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Overtubulated long bones
is_a_string: HP:0011314 ! Abnormality of long bone morphology
children.defn: "Overconstriction, or narrowness of the diaphysis and metaphysis of long bones." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Broad long bones

children.defn: "Increased cross-section (diameter) of the long bones. Note that widening may primarily affect specific regions of long bones (e.g., diaphysis or metaphysis), but this should be coded separately." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Slender long bone
is_a_string: HP:0011314 ! Abnormality of long bone morphology

children.name: Slender long bones with narrow diaphyses
children.defn: "Reduced diameter of a long bone with a more pronounced reduction of the diameter of the diaphysis of the long bones." [HPO:probinson]
"Reduced diameter of a long bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Pseudoarthrosis
is_a_string: HP:0011314 ! Abnormality of long bone morphology
children.defn: "A pathologic entity characterized by a developmental defect in a long bone leading to bending and pathologic fracture, with inability to form a normal bony callus with subsequent fibrous nonunion, leading to the pseudarthrosis (or \"false joint\")." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thickened cortex of long bones

children.name: Cortically dense long tubular bones

children.defn: "Increased density of the compact bone of long bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cortical thickening of long bone diaphyses

children.defn: "Abnormal thickening of the cortex of the diaphyseal region of long bones." [HPO:curators]
"Abnormal thickening of the cortex of long bones." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormality of the medullary cavity of the long bones
is_a_string: HP:0011314 ! Abnormality of long bone morphology

children.name: Stenosis of the medullary cavity of the long bones
is_a_string: HP:0100253 ! Abnormality of the medullary cavity of the long bones

children.defn: "An abnormality of the medullary cavity (medulla, innermost part), which is the central cavity of bone shafts where red bone marrow and/or yellow bone marrow (adipose tissue) is stored." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Protuberances at ends of long bones
is_a_string: HP:0011314 ! Abnormality of long bone morphology
children.defn: "The presence of multiple protuberances (bulges, or knobs) at the ends of the long bones." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Crumpled long bones
is_a_string: HP:0011314 ! Abnormality of long bone morphology
children.defn: "An crumpled radiographic appearance of the long bones, as is the long bone had been crushed together producing irregularities. This feature is the result of multiple fractures and repeated rounds of ineffective healing, as can be seen for instance in severe forms of osteogenesis imperfecta." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Fractures of the long bones
is_a_string: HP:0011314 ! Abnormality of long bone morphology
children.defn: "An increased tendency to fractures of the long bones (Mainly, the femur, tibia, fibula,humerus, radius, and ulna)." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Periosteal thickening of long tubular bones
is_a_string: HP:0011314 ! Abnormality of long bone morphology
children.defn: "Thickening of the periosteum of long bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the epiphyses

children.defn: "Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Flattened epiphyses

children.name: Splayed epiphyses
children.defn: "Flaring (widening) of the epiphysis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Delayed phalangeal epiphyseal ossification
children.defn: "Delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more phalanx." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Cone-shaped epiphysis
Cone-shaped epiphyses fused within their metaphyses

children.defn: "Cone-shaped epiphyses (also known as coned epiphyses) are epiphyses that invaginate into cupped metaphyses. That is, the epiphysis has a cone-shaped distal extension resulting from increased growth of the central portion of the epiphysis relative to its periphery." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion
Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in hand
children.defn: "Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the hand, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in foot
children.defn: "Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the foot, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in tibia
children.defn: "Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the tibia, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in fibula
children.defn: "Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the fibula, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in radius
children.defn: "Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the radius, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in ulna
children.defn: "Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the ulna, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone." [HPO:probinson]

"Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at each end of a long bone, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone." [HPO:probinson, pmid:12624140]

"Increased size of epiphyses." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Irregular epiphyses

children.name: Ivory epiphyses
children.defn: "Sclerosis of the epiphyses, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Small epiphyses
children.defn: "Reduction in the size or volume of epiphyses." [HPO:probinson]

"An anomaly of epiphysis, which is the expanded articular end of a long bone that developes from a secondary ossification center, and which during the period of growth is either entirely cartilaginous or is separated from the shaft by a cartilaginous disk." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Short long bones

children.defn: "One or more abnormally short long bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal diaphysis morphology

children.defn: "An abnormality of the structure or form of the diaphysis, i.e., of the main or mid-section (shaft) of a long bone." [HPO:probinson]
