children.name: Pelvic asymmetry
is_a_string: HP:0002644 ! Abnormality of pelvic girdle bone morphology
children.defn: "Pelvic asymmetry refers to asymmetric positioning of landmarks on the two sides of the pelvis and may have a structural or functional etiology." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Limited hip movement
is_a_string: HP:0002644 ! Abnormality of pelvic girdle bone morphology

children.name: Limited hip extension
children.defn: "Limitation of the extension of the hip, i.e., decreased ability to straighten the hip joint and thereby increase the angle between torso and thigh; moving the thigh or top of the pelvis backward." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Decreased hip abduction
children.defn: "Reduced ability to move the femur  outward to the side." [HPO:probinson]
"A decreased ability to move the femur at the hip joint associated with a decreased range of motion of the hip." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the pelvis
is_a_string: HP:0002644 ! Abnormality of pelvic girdle bone morphology

children.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the pubic bone
is_a_string: HP:0003172 ! Abnormality of the pubic bones

children.name: Hypoplastic pubic bones
is_a_string: HP:0009104 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the pubic bone

children.name: Hypoplastic ischiopubic rami
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the ischiopubic ramus, which is comprised of the inferior pubic ramus and the inferior ramus of the ischium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplastic pubic bones
is_a_string: HP:0009104 ! Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the pubic bone

children.defn: "Absence or underdevelopment of the pubic bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hypoplastic pelvis
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the bony pelvis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal pelvis bone ossification
is_a_string: HP:0002644 ! Abnormality of pelvic girdle bone morphology

children.name: Abnormal ossification of the pubic bone
is_a_string: HP:0003172 ! Abnormality of the pubic bones

children.name: Incomplete ossification of pubis
is_a_string: HP:0009105 ! Abnormal ossification of the pubic bone
children.defn: "Failure to complete ossification (maturation and calcification) of the pubic bone." []

children.name: Delayed ossification of pubic rami
is_a_string: HP:0009105 ! Abnormal ossification of the pubic bone
children.defn: "Delayed maturation and calcification of the rami (branches) of the pubic bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Delayed pubic bone ossification
is_a_string: HP:0009105 ! Abnormal ossification of the pubic bone
children.defn: "Delayed maturation and calcification of the pubic bone." [HPO:probinson]
"Abnormal ossification (bone tissue formation) affecting the pubic bone, also known as the pubis." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the bony pelvis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Large pelvis
is_a_string: HP:0002644 ! Abnormality of pelvic girdle bone morphology
children.defn: "The presence of an abnormally large pelvis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Narrow pelvis
is_a_string: HP:0002644 ! Abnormality of pelvic girdle bone morphology
children.defn: "Reduced side to side width of the pelvis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the hip bone
is_a_string: HP:0002644 ! Abnormality of pelvic girdle bone morphology

children.name: Abnormality of the pubic bones
is_a_string: HP:0003272 ! Abnormality of the hip bone

children.name: Narrow foramen obturatorium
is_a_string: HP:0003172 ! Abnormality of the pubic bones
children.defn: "Decreased width of the foramen obturatorium. The foramen obturatorium (also known as the obturator foramen) is a hole located between the ischium and pubis bones of the pelvis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Wide pubic symphysis
is_a_string: HP:0003172 ! Abnormality of the pubic bones
children.defn: "Abnormally increased width of the pubic symphysis is the midline cartilaginous joint uniting the superior rami of the left and right pubic bones." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the ischium
is_a_string: HP:0003272 ! Abnormality of the hip bone

children.name: Hypoplastic ischia
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Broad ischia
children.defn: "Increased width of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone." [HPO:probinson]
"An anomaly of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the ilium
is_a_string: HP:0003272 ! Abnormality of the hip bone

children.name: Squared iliac bones
children.defn: "A shift from the normally round (convex) appearance of the iliac wing towards a square-like appearance." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of the wing of the ilium
Hypoplastic iliac wings
is_a_string: HP:0011867 ! Abnormality of the wing of the ilium
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the ilium ala." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Narrow iliac wings
is_a_string: HP:0011867 ! Abnormality of the wing of the ilium
children.defn: "Decreased width of the wing (or ala) of the ilium (which is the large expanded portion which bounds the greater pelvis laterally)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Flared iliac wings
is_a_string: HP:0011867 ! Abnormality of the wing of the ilium
children.defn: "Widening of the ilium ala, that is of the wing of the ilium, combined with external rotation, leading to a flared appearance of the iliac wing." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: High iliac wings
is_a_string: HP:0011867 ! Abnormality of the wing of the ilium
children.defn: "Increased height of the wing (or ala) of the ilium (which is the large expanded portion which bounds the greater pelvis laterally)." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Large iliac wings
is_a_string: HP:0011867 ! Abnormality of the wing of the ilium
children.defn: "Increased size of the ilium ala." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Dysplastic iliac wings
is_a_string: HP:0011867 ! Abnormality of the wing of the ilium

children.name: Constricted iliac wings
is_a_string: HP:0011867 ! Abnormality of the wing of the ilium

children.defn: "An anomaly of the ilium ala. This is the large expanded portion of the ilum which bounds the greater pelvis laterally." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Irregular iliac crest
Iliac crest serration
children.defn: "Irregularities of the iliac crest that produce the appearance of a lace border around it." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Iliac horns
children.defn: "Horn-like malformations of the iliac crests with symmetrical bilateral central posterior iliac processes. A characteristic finding in the Nail-Patella syndrome. Iliac horns are visible on X-ray and may be palpable, but are asymptomatic." [HPO:curators]
"Irregularity of the iliac crest, which is the superior border of the wing of the ilium." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Hypoplastic ilia
Hypoplastic iliac body
children.defn: "Underdevelopment of the body of ilium." [HPO:probinson]
"Underdevelopment of the ilium." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the ilium, the largest and uppermost bone of the pelvis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Arthralgia of the hip
is_a_string: HP:0003272 ! Abnormality of the hip bone
children.defn: "Joint pain affecting the hip." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hip dysplasia
is_a_string: HP:0003272 ! Abnormality of the hip bone
children.defn: "The presence of developmental dysplasia of the hip." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Coxa magna
is_a_string: HP:0003272 ! Abnormality of the hip bone
children.defn: "Widening of the femoral head and neck." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the hip bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Square pelvis
is_a_string: HP:0002644 ! Abnormality of pelvic girdle bone morphology
children.defn: "An abnormally squared appearance of the bony pelvis, a normally rounded or basin-shaped structure." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the bony pelvic girdle, which is a ring of bones connecting the vertebral column to the femurs." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the appendicular skeletal system, consisting of the of the limbs, shoulder and pelvic girdles." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal joint morphology
Arthralgia
children.defn: "Joint pain." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Joint dislocation
Multiple joint dislocation
children.defn: "Dislocation of many joints." [HPO:probinson]
"Displacement or malalignment of joints." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Abnormality of joint mobility
Limitation of joint mobility
Joint stiffness
Generalized morning stiffness
children.defn: "A sensation of stiffness in the joints that occurs following waking up in the morning." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Stiff interphalangeal joints
children.defn: "Interphalangeal joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in the interphalangeal joints when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity." [HPO:curators]
"Joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in a joint or joints when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity. Joint stiffness typically subsides over time." [HPO:probinson]
"A reduction in the freedom of movement of one or more joints." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Joint hypermobility
Hypermobility of interphalangeal joints
children.defn: "The ability of the interphalangeal joints to move beyond their normal range of motion." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Hyperextensible hand joints
Hyperextensible thumb
children.defn: "The ability of the thumb joints to move beyond their normal range of motion." [HPO:curators]
"The ability of the joints of the hand to move beyond their normal range of motion." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Joint laxity
children.defn: "Lack of stability of a joint." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hyperextensibility at elbow
children.defn: "The ability of the elbow joint to move beyond its normal range of motion." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Generalized joint laxity
children.defn: "Joint hypermobility (ability of a joint to move beyond its normal range of motion) affecting many or all joints of the body." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Hyperextensibility at wrists
children.defn: "The ability of the wrist joints to move beyond their normal range of motion." [HPO:curators]
"The ability of a joint to move beyond its normal range of motion." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Synostosis of joints
Synostosis of carpals/tarsals
children.defn: "The carpus consists of the scaphoid, lunate, triquetal, pisiform, captitate, hamate, trapezoid, and trapezium bones. The tarsus consists of the talus, calcaneus, navicular, cuboid, cuneiform, and navicular bones. This term applies if there is any fusion among the bones of the carpus or tarsus." [HPO:sdoelken]
"The abnormal fusion of neighboring bones across a joint." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality in the range and ease of motion of joints across their normal range." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Enlarged joints
children.defn: "Increase in size of one or more joints." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Osteochondrosis dissecans
children.defn: "A joint disorder caused by blood deprivation in the subchondral bone causing the subchondral bone to die in a process called avascular necrosis. The bone is then reabsorbed by the body, leaving the articular cartilage it supported prone to damage. The result is fragmentation (dissection) of both cartilage and bone, and the free movement of these osteochondral fragments within the joint space, causing pain and further damage." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Arthritis
Rheumatoid arthritis
children.defn: "Inflammatory changes in the synovial membranes and articular structures with widespread fibrinoid degeneration of the collagen fibers in mesenchymal tissues, as well as atrophy and rarefaction of bony structures." [HPO:probinson]
"Inflammation of a joint." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormal structure or form of the joints, i.e., one or more of the articulations where two bones join." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal bone structure
Abnormal cortical bone morphology
Thin bony cortex
children.defn: "Abnormal thinning of the cortical region of bones." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Pseudo-fractures
children.defn: "A band of bone material of decreased density forming alongside the surface of the cortical bone with thickening of the periosteum. Callus formation in the affected area is common and gives the appearance of a false fracture." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Cortical irregularity
children.defn: "An abnormal irregularity of cortical bone." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Cortical sclerosis
children.defn: "Sclerosis (abnormal hardening) of cortical bone, characterized by increased radiodensity." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Thickened cortex of bones
children.defn: "An Abnormality of cortical bone leading to an abnormal thickness of the cortex of affected bones." [HPO:sdoelken]
"An abnormality of compact bone (also known as cortical bone), which forms the dense surface of bones." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormality of bone mineral density
Patchy changes of bone mineral density
is_a_string: HP:0004348 ! Abnormality of bone mineral density

children.name: Patchy reduction of bone mineral density
is_a_string: HP:0010658 ! Patchy changes of bone mineral density
children.defn: "Patchy (irregular) reduction in bone density. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Patchy variation in bone mineral density
is_a_string: HP:0010658 ! Patchy changes of bone mineral density
children.defn: "Patchy (irregular) changes in bone mineral density with patches of bone showing an increased density side to side with patches that are affected by reduction of mineral density. This is sometimes referred to as a moth-eaten appearance on x-rays." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Patchy osteosclerosis
is_a_string: HP:0010658 ! Patchy changes of bone mineral density
children.defn: "Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays." [HPO:curators]

"Patchy (irregular) changes in bone mineral density. These changes can either be patchy reduction or increase of mineral density as seen on x-rays. Depending on the pathomechanism and the underlying disease, these changes can either appear solely as reduction or increase or as a combination of both (patches of bone showing an increased density while others are affected by reduction of mineral density)." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Reduced bone mineral density
is_a_string: HP:0004348 ! Abnormality of bone mineral density

children.name: Osteopenia
children.defn: "Osteopenia refers to a reduction in bone mineral density (BMD) below normal peak BMD but not low enough to be classified as osteoporosis. According to the WHO, osteopenia is characterized by a value of BMD more than 1 standard deviation below the young adult mean, but less than 2 standard deviations below this value." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Osteoporosis
Severe osteoporosis
children.defn: "Severe degree of osteoporosis." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Moderate generalized osteoporosis
children.defn: "Moderate osteoporosis." [HPO:curators]

"Osteoporosis is a systemic skeletal disease characterized by low bone density and microarchitectural deterioration of bone tissue with a consequent increase in bone fragility. According to the WHO, osteoporosis is characterized by a value of BMD 2.5 standard deviations or more below the young adult mean." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Osteomalacia
children.defn: "Osteomalacia is a general term for bone weakness owing to a defect in mineralization of the protein framework known as osteoid. This defective mineralization is mainly caused by lack in vitamin D. Osteomalacia in children is known as rickets." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Generalized bone demineralization
children.defn: "A generalized decrease in bone mineral density." [HPO:curators]
"A reduction of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Increased bone mineral density
is_a_string: HP:0004348 ! Abnormality of bone mineral density

children.name: Osteopetrosis
children.defn: "Abnormally increased formation of dense trabecular bone tissue. Despite the increased density of bone tissue, osteopetrotic bones tend to be more fracture-prone than normal." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Sclerosis of foot bone
children.defn: "An elevation in bone density in one or more foot bones. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Increased bone density with cystic changes
Sclerosis of hand bone
Patchy sclerosis of hand bones
is_a_string: HP:0004281 ! Irregular sclerosis of hand bones

children.name: Sclerotic foci in hand bones
is_a_string: HP:0004281 ! Irregular sclerosis of hand bones

children.name: Sclerosis of hand bones with transverse striations
is_a_string: HP:0004281 ! Irregular sclerosis of hand bones

children.defn: "Osteosclerosis affecting one or more bones of the hand." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Generalized osteosclerosis
children.defn: "An abnormal increase of bone mineral density with generalized involvement of the skeleton." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: increased spinal bone density
children.defn: "Increased bone density affecting the bones of the spine (vertebral column)." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Osteopoikilosis
children.defn: "Osteopoikilosis is a benign, asymptomatic sclerotic dysplasia of the bones. It affects both male and female and may be seen at any age. Radiographically sclerotic circular or ovoid lesions are usually symmetrically distributed in a periarticular location. Lesions can increase or decrease in size and number in serial radiographs or even disappear and do not have increased bone radiotracer uptake." [HPO:sdoelken]

"An abnormal increase of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones which is often refered to as osteosclerosis. Osteosclerosis can be detected on radiological examination as an increased whiteness (density) of affected bones." [HPO:probinson]

"This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone. Changes may affect all bones of the organism, just certain bones or only parts of bones and include decreased mineralisation as may be seen in osteoporosis or increased mineralisation and or ossification as in osteopetrosis, exostoses or any kind of atopic calicfications of different origin and distribution. The overall amount of mineralization of the bone-organ can be measured as the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones, usually measured by densitometry of the lumbar spine or hip. The measurements are usually reported as g/cm3 or as a Z-score (the number of standard deviations above or below the mean for the patient's age and sex). Note that measurement with this method does not reflect local changes in other bones, and as such might not be correct with regard the hole bone-organ." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Osteolysis
children.defn: "Osteolysis refers to the destruction of bone through bone resorption with removal or loss of calcium." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal bone ossification
Abnormal enchondral ossification
Abnormal epiphyseal ossification
children.defn: "An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of an epiphysis." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Calcific stippling of infantile cartilaginous skeleton

children.defn: "An abnormality of the process of endochondral ossification, which is a type of replacement ossification in which bone tissue replaces cartilage." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ectopic ossification
Soft-tissue ossification around the shoulders
children.defn: "Formation of calcified tissue in the soft tissues surrounding the shoulder." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ectopic ossification in ligament tissue
children.defn: "Formation of abnormal bony tissue within ligament tissue." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ectopic ossification in tendon tissue
children.defn: "Formation of abnormal bony tissue within tendon tissue." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Ectopic ossification in muscle tissue
children.defn: "Formation of abnormal bony tissue within muscle tissue." [HPO:probinson]
"Formation of abnormal, extraskeletal bony tissue, i.e., the presence of bone in soft tissue where bone normally does not exist." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal intramembranous ossification
children.defn: "An anomaly in the process of intramembranous ossification by which flat bones (cranial bones of the skull, i.e., the frontal, perietal, occipital, and temporal bones, and the clavicles) are formed." [HPO:probinson]
"Any anomaly in the formation of bone or of a bony substance, or the conversion of fibrous tissue or of cartilage into bone or a bony substance." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal bone collagen fibril morphology
Type 1 collagen overmodification
is_a_string: HP:0011862 ! Abnormal bone collagen fibril morphology

children.defn: "Any structural anomaly of the connective tissue bundles in the extracellular matrix of bone tissue that are composed of collagen, and play a role in tissue strength and elasticity." [HPO:probinson, MP:0011642]

children.name: Abnormal trabecular bone morphology
children.defn: "Abnormal structure or form of trabecular bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Bone cyst
Cystic angiomatosis of bone
children.defn: "Disseminated multifocal hemangiomatous or lymphangiomatous lesions of the skeleton. The lesions are lytic, well-defined, round or oval lesions within the medullary cavity, and they have an intact cortex, and manifest variable peripheral sclerosis and may exhibit endosteal scalloping." [HPO:probinson, pmid:11930062]

children.name: Aneurysmal bone cyst
children.defn: "Radiographic features include a dilated, radiolucent lesion typically located eccentrically within the metaphyseal portion of the bone, with fluid levels visible on magnetic resonance imaging." [HPO:probinson, pmid:22474093, pmid:7863874]

children.name: Multiple bony cystic lesions
children.defn: "Presence of multiple cystic changes in multiple ares or multiple bones." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Unicameral bone cyst
children.defn: "A benign fluid filled simple cyst of bone filled with serous fluid." [HPO:probinson]
"A fluid filled cavity that develops with a bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Fibrous dysplasia of the bones
Monostotic fibrous dysplasia
is_a_string: HP:0010734 ! Fibrous dysplasia of the bones
children.defn: "Fibrous dysplasia of the bones were lesions are localized in only one bone." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia
is_a_string: HP:0010734 ! Fibrous dysplasia of the bones
children.defn: "Fibrous dysplasia of the bones were lesions are localized in many bones throughout of the body. Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia is a cardinal feature of McCune-Albright syndrome." [HPO:sdoelken]

"Tumor-like growths that consist of replacement of the medullary bone with fibrous tissue, causing the expansion and weakening of the areas of bone involved. Especially when involving the skull or facial bones, the lesions can cause externally visible deformities. The skull is often, but not necessarily, affected, and any other bone or bones may be involved. Fibrous dysplasia can either effect isolated bones (Monostotic fibrous dysplasia) or also generalized all bones of the body (Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia)." [HPO:sdoelken]
"Any anomaly in the composite material or the layered arrangement of the bony skeleton." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal cartilage morphology
Chondritis
children.defn: "Inflammation of cartilage." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Abnormal cartilage collagen
children.defn: "Abnormal morphology of collagen fibers in cartilage. In cartilage, collagen II, actually a collagen II:IX:XI heterofibril, is by far the most important type of collagen. A number of abnormalities may be appreciated by electron micrography or biochemical investigations, including sparse collagen fibers in the cartilage matrix." [HPO:probinson, pmid:11879535, pmid:7757081, pmid:9468540]
"Any abnormality of cartilage." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Hyperostosis
children.defn: "Excessive growth or abnormal thickening of bone tissue." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving the skeleton
children.defn: "Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of one or more components of the skeleton." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormal tendon morphology
Digital flexor tenosynovitis
children.defn: "Inflammation of the flexor digitorum tendon, often associated with the Kanavel signs: (i) finger held in slight flexion, (ii) fusiform swelling, (iii) tenderness along the flexor tendon sheath, and (iv) pain with passive extension of the digit." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Tendon rupture
children.defn: "Breakage (tear) of a tendon." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the structure or form of the tendons, also often called sinews." [HPO:sdoelken]
"An abnormality of the form, structure, or size of the skeletal system." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of skeletal physiology
is_a_string: HP:0000924 ! Abnormality of the skeletal system

children.name: Increased susceptibility to fractures
Pathologic fracture
children.defn: "A pathologic fracture occurs when a bone breaks in an area that is weakened secondary to another disease process such as tumor, infection, and certain inherited bone disorders. A pathologic fracture can occur without a degree of trauma required to cause fracture in healthy bone." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Recurrent fractures
children.defn: "The repeated occurence of bone fractures (implying an abnormally increased tendency for fracture)." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Painless fractures due to injury
children.defn: "An increased tendency to fractures following trauma, with fractures occurring without pain." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Bowing of limbs due to multiple fractures
children.defn: "Curvature of the shafts of the long bones due to multiple fractures." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Multiple prenatal fractures
children.defn: "The presence of bone fractures in the prenatal period that are diagnosed at birth or before." [HPO:curators]
"An abnormally increased tendency to fractures of bones caused by an abnormal reduction in bone strength that is generally associated with an increased risk of fracture." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Bone pain
children.defn: "An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to bone." []

children.name: Osteomyelitis
osteomyelitis leading to amputation due to slow healing fractures

children.defn: "An infection of bone." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Aseptic necrosis
Juvenile aseptic necrosis
children.defn: "Juvenile aseptic necrosis comprises a group of orthopedic diseases characterized by interruption of the blood supply of a bone, followed by localized bony necrosis most often of the epiphyses of bones of children or teenagers." [HPO:sdoelken]
"A disease where there is cellular death (necrosis) of bone components due to interruption of the blood supply." [HPO:sdoelken]

children.name: Limb pain
Upper limb pain
children.defn: "An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the arm." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]

children.name: Lower limb pain
children.defn: "An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the leg." [ORCID:0000-0001-5208-3432]
"Chronic pain in the limbs with no clear focal etiology." [HPO:probinson]

children.name: Abnormality of skeletal maturation
Delayed skeletal maturation
Dysharmonic delayed bone age
children.defn: "A type of dysharmonic skeletal maturation in which there is a delay in skeletal maturation whose degree differs markedly in different bones." [HPO:probinson]

"A decreased rate of skeletal maturation. Delayed skeletal maturation can be diagnosed on the basis of an estimation of the bone age from radiographs of specific bones in the human body." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Accelerated skeletal maturation
Dysharmonic accelerated bone age
children.defn: "A type of dysharmonic skeletal maturation in which there is an acceleration in skeletal maturation whose degree differs markedly in different bones." [HPO:probinson]

"An abnormally increased rate of skeletal maturation. Accelerated skeletal maturation can be diagnosed on the basis of an estimation of the bone age from radiographs of specific bones in the human body." [HPO:curators]

children.name: Dysharmonic bone age
children.defn: "Different levels of maturation of different bones." [HPO:probinson]

"The bones of the skeleton undergo a series of characteristic changes in size, shape, and calcification from fetal life until puberty. An abnormality of this process can include delayed or accelerated skeletal maturation, or deviation of some, but not all bones from the expected patterns of maturation." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the function of the skeletal system." [HPO:probinson]
"An abnormality of the skeletal system." [HPO:probinson]
